text: Author Karen Tyrrell has again produced another book for children that teach lessons while highly engaging them from start to finish. In this work Jo-Kin Battles the IT preteens will immerse themselves in this action, stimulating their creativity and imaginations. Discover how 11-year-old Josh Atkins "Jo-Kin", referred to as Super Geek at school, was able to live his dream in competing and be nominated for the job of a Super Space kid among 11 participants.As a former educator I can see so many life themes woven throughout this book that make it a perfect practical time where life values can be instilled. Preteens will learn the value of pursuing goals and putting forth great effort to achieve them. Samuel Jones, another participant chosen, though too judged by his exteriors, will prove to also have skill and intelligence – important ingredients for success. As Josh and Sam master their training they learn how to work as team players which will prove necessary as their mission would be to protect planet earth from alien forces.Children, especially males will enjoy the battles Jo-Kin and Sam become engaged in. "The droid crab slipped on banana goo and smashed into the wall. Exploding into a cool flash of green and gold light. Yay!"  As they defeat the I-bots and CritBots they would also in counter and ate leg octopus, flying lizards, and one eyed monster – all before the climax battle of defeating the "IT" that captured captain Astra on planet OhMaa.While children discover if Jo-Kin and Sam can complete this mission successfully they will have lost themselves in this world, enjoying the action-packed science-fiction taking them from one mission to the next. Award-winning author and teacher, Karen Tyrrell makes her home in Brisbane Australia. In this book and her three other books, she empowers children to be resilient. Tyrrell also offers writing workshops and storytelling, while speaking on TV/radio and writing for magazines.In what I consider to be her best book yet, I give it five stars for the page turning action and interest it will generate among children.

Darryl Perry, in his book A Rebel's Journey, will take the reader into his rationale as to why he feels the way he does about various aspects surrounding multiple issues. Referred to as a libertarian, his views and sense of right and wrong would take on a new dimension during his high school years. He shares how his eyes would become open and today the reader can get a glimpse of his ideologies as it relates to:– Drugs  – Purchasing of goods– Taxation.  – Death penalty– Immigration  – EducationRegarding drugs for example he states the following: "While I do not condone the abuse of any substance, I do not believe that jailing people who use a substance that can be misused is a good way to discourage use or abuse of said substance… I long for the day in which all substances are as legal as tomatoes".He believes governments should not force you to fund its schools, roads, post offices or other government function. "My solution to operating a government without taxation is to have said government rely on voluntary contributions, just as privately run businesses and charities do!"Perry is against the death penalty believing that innocent people have been executed which makes state-funded capital punishment immoral. His view on marriage is that if two people wish to get married and either partner desires to bring another person into the relationship they should be allowed to do so. He invites immigration believing people should be allowed to live where they so choose.The author would also like for government to be removed from the educational equation. "Public schools do not exist to educate children, rather the schools exist to mold children into replicas of one another".In the several jobs and places he has lived he refers to himself as a "news junkie"and has been an advocate and activist for peace and liberty.Because of his refusal to comply with laws this award-winning author found himself in court several times. Today he leads a busy life also as a publisher, radio/TV host and regular contributor to several weekly and monthly newspapers. He can be found hosting several podcasts as well. The reader will better understand the reasoning he explains for each topic in this book. It will verify why he gladly admits to his "rebel journey "

This is a very short book by Devin Blue that aims at helping one analyze their life in order to change and re-order areas for greater success. He believes the starting point is having empathy whereby we treat others the way we would appreciate being treated. This book is introspective and honesty is essential for diagnosing maladies and then exchanging one's current value system for a more efficient set of standards.Blue stresses the necessity of ridding oneself of toxic relationships. He believes once values are adjusted that real friends will remain that have the same value set. To help the reader there will be a section entitled pitfalls in one's values worth considering. The importance of being authentic when relating to others is heavily stressed. He feels we should accept ourselves for who we are, what God created us to become, and to live out that gift. "… For every second, minute, and hour you pretend to be someone who you aren't you're wasting away the very life that was gifted to you".There will be an action plan you can follow to implement your new value system at the end of the book.Author Devin Blue lives today to encourage and inspire others. A product of a dysfunctional home his research and mission extends towards bettering the lives of others. Though informative, I didn't feel it had the depth and range of content to award it five stars. This book can easily be ready in 30 minutes.

This memoir is written with excellent detail encompassing four decades from age 17 in 1972 to present day. Where the challenge comes in for the reader is the painstaking reality of the physical and emotional suffering this young man endured while fighting through his deteriorating condition. Nearly overnight at age 17 Brian Steele would go from the pinnacle to the pit beginning with a kidney infection that would end his ability to play sports. Worst however would be his diagnosis of progressive glomerulonephritis taking him repeatedly to the hospital, away from his schooling and facing the uncertainties of his future.This "hard to stomach "depiction of his medical treatments and effects it had on his body will allow the reader to wonder, page after page, how long this would endure and the fate of his condition. He encountered the trauma on his ward of half the patients passing away during one night. "The following morning at daylight the curtains of all of us patients that were still alive were closed and the bodies removed… Those of us that were left could see how few of the beds remained occupied… No one spoke for a considerable time..."With refusal to give up however, he would start a business out of his home and become self-sufficient financially. His condition would continually worsen until survival hung on the balance. Discover what miracle would await him and how he determinedly reclaimed his life, piece by piece.This miraculous story reaches the pinnacle of a heart's will to survive and thrive. With so much in between these pages, this book is a must read for those that especially enjoy success stories. It's real, raw, and highly transparent in all he shares. I rate this book as 5 stars without question and highly recommend it to others.

This book is for both Christian and non-Christian as it presents the realities of how sex outside of marriage comes with a heavy price tag. Author, Minister and founder of International Prophetic Shifters prayer Ministries, Inc, Virgil Postell comes with a mandate from the Lord to expose witchcraft and explain how it is used to manipulate others into sexual sins.If you have had sexual relations with others and seemed to lose your thoughts and identity you may be under the curse of manipulative witchcraft. This book also is good for ministry leaders for helping to equip others from the snares of the enemy. Having intercourse outside of marriage, Postell shares, opens one up to demonic influence, transferring ungodly thoughts and bending ones will. When that relationship has long ended individual still struggle with dreams and soul ties they cannot shake off.The author understands experientially how this works as he previously was under the domain of sexual sins. It was through prayer and fasting then he became free and today desires to help others gain their true freedom in Christ. "I became desperate to be free from it all and I had to walk out of it and I knew the only one that could bring me out of this mess I have gotten myself in was God". There are many today in the body of Christ that need the understanding and deliverance strategies presented in this book. Minister Postell holds no punches at getting out this message. Ungodly transfers in the bedroom, he knows, will render one's ministry ineffective.The dangers behind sexual sins and the ways to be free will be revealed. He presents hope that with God nothing is impossible. There are a lot of Scriptures and Biblical examples used that help even those young in the Lord to understand. This Florida native has set many free from the sins of the past and desires this resource to help you or others you may know in need.The content is excellent but I give it four stars rather than five because of many grammatical errors. The errors however still render the book to be quite understandable. I encourage all to check out the other books by this author.

This book by Billy Witt is one whereby the body of Christ, including church leadership need to take a moment to reflect and contemplate as to whether or not their lives are measuring up to the plum line of God's word. Witt exhorts us to be a "doer "of the word and not just a "hearer". In clear, concise language with several scriptures he exhorts the reader to pray, repent, and obey the Lord's commands.In the busyness of life it can be easy for pastors especially to be neglectful in their intimate relationship with Christ while doing "church things "that divide one's heart. He encourages us to move from the elementary teachings of Christ to seeking the Holy Spirit for revelation of the word. Be encouraged to know we have a defense from temptations as he declares, "when we submit to Him and fully trust Him, obeying His commands, the Spirit will empower us to withstand even the most tempting of carnal fleshly sins". Trace the chronological events through the eyes of the apostle John leading up to the rapture. Billy with presents the realities of how the prophets of old suffered persecution for speaking the truth and following God's commands. We likewise, he states, will suffer for his name sake.You'll gain inspiration to share the importance of the Holy Spirit with others while being empowered to live a life that pleases God. This book should be read with humility where one examines their heart and motives. There are plenty of scriptures that solidify each of the points presented. Author Billy Witt has a passion to study the word of God and participate in small group fellowship.

Though this is not a long book it is a very resource full work. It gives one the awareness and techniques, if applied, to change one's mindset and therefore change circumstances. Here author Alex Altman states the essence of this book: "with the techniques in this book, you'll begin to accept yourself, and even love yourself by reconditioning your thought patterns". Self esteem, he declares, comes from within – how you see yourself and to help the reader he has a self-esteem assessment to determine areas of strength needed.He clarifies the distinctions between confidence and self-esteem. Where confidence comes from your belief in being able to do something well, self-esteem is how you feel about yourself. Gain strategies of learning to let go of negative things aimed toward you while controlling your self talk. These proven principles, Including goalsetting will help you achieve more in life, resulting in a greater self-esteem. A higher self-esteem, he declares, will also help you to bounce back from adversities.If you are stuck thinking about things you cannot change or feel immobilized by life, this resource will jumpstart you toward a better tomorrow. At the end of the book, as a free bonus, Altman will provide a free four-day confidence course. Paragraph I recommend this book because it:– Realistically identifies factors of low self-esteem– Provides ways to remedy the situation– Gives course actions that can exchange a defeated life into a life of success

I will say first off that this book is geared to those that are hungry for more of God's presence. The material contained has been tested by author Michael Van Vlymen and he shares his experiences and keys to tapping into the supernatural like never before. In focusing on the eternal unseen, he points out in 2 Corinthians 4:18 a whole dimension of the Spirit can be grasped.Learn how to cultivate a lifestyle of worship, praying in tongue's, and waiting on the Lord by sitting before Him in silence. These are habits that must be practiced regularly. The author believes it is vital to establish the atmosphere over your home by pleading the blood of Jesus and anointing your home with oil. He recommends praise music often and saturating homes and families in prayer.I was amazed at all that can be unveiled in the spirit realm when one puts these principles to practice. Although a deep desire to hear from God to experience sounds, smells, feelings, and visitations are needed, that is not all. Van Vlymen also talks about spiritual veils that cover our eyes created by sins, fears, traumas, doubt, and other things. We must put a guard over our thoughts and keep them pure and clean so that clear channels are open to receiving all from God.This is not a book to just read. Rather, it will only be effective if the strategies are worked at. Along with this book are other works by this author that will enhance your Christian walk. Author Michael Van Vlymen is also a speaker with passion to share the supernatural things of God with others.

Although this is a short book it is very informative and offering information regarding the characteristics, strategies, and helps both parents and teachers can incorporate. Author C N Alfred describes dyslexia: "Dyslexia is described as a reading disability caused by genetic and environmental factors, that has a lot to do with reading troubles, even if the person is intelligent". By actively reading with a child or student a strategy is offered that will be beneficial with devoting only 10 minutes a day.Using clay or other tangible models, he shares, are helpful to students and great challenges arise when students try to follow instructions. Here are other areas covered that will be beneficial.– Strategies to help a child spell– Publishers/book stores that have high interest low reading ages– Homework tips– Classroom accommodations for teachers– fonts specifically made for dyslexicsThis resource will be helpful and I recommend it to others for greater awareness of the challenges, an understanding of what to expect, and tools to assist parents and teachers.

I found this e-book to be quite informative in bringing clarity to the Old Testament books. It is written in a way that locks events into a more understood dimension, while not losing the reader to excessive detail. To help with understanding each book there are charts, pictures, and outlines that can be used along side ones Bible. Author, Bible teacher, and Dean Paul D. Weaver has used his scholarly ability in producing this excellent resource.I enjoyed writing in my Bible word meanings, dates, and other things that this book brought to my attention. Though I have been a Christian for over 30 years there was still much I did not know in the Old Testament. It is written scholarly in that, while key information was presented, it was done in a fashion that even new Christians could grasp.This is not a work to rush through but to allow oneself to immerse  in the quality of information presented, possibly with one's Bible alongside. Each book has predictable categories covered including:– Title– Author– Documentary hypothesis– Recipients– Date and place– Purpose– Message– TheologyThis will be a resource one can refer to over and over. It includes archaeological discoveries throughout with an easy to find table with links in the front of the book. For the quality of content and easy readability I give this work a five star rating.

Soldier On by Rosemarie Naramore is a very well-developed inspirational romance novel filled with an array of situations and emotions that ultimately will please your heart. Twin brothers Ethan and Mitch Lawless, though identical in looks, would be drastically different in temperament and lifestyle. Ethan, a ten-year army soldier would receive a letter from Dennis Williams who stated by Mitch walking out of his sister's marriage that both Mitch and Ethan turned their back on the family. Ethan would begin taking steps to help out the situation.With Mitch having abandoned Heidi and his now four-year-old daughter Chloe, Ethan would find their whereabouts and begin a friendship with the family. Ethan, responsible, well liked, and an esteemed soldier would be unlike his brother Mitch who dropped out of school, used drugs, and couldn't hold down a job. Throughout this encounter with Ethan will be a desire for Mitch to grant Heidi a divorce she well deserved. Mitch's refusal to do so will also be intermingled with the reality of Heidi's brother Dennis who has cancer and is the only true support she has to rely on.Dennis and Ethan's bond would quickly develop as they both served as soldiers. Discover a brothers incredible love for his sister in a moving plot where also Ethan demonstrates excessive loyalty when his irresponsible brother Mitch walked away when Chloe was an infant.Throughout this page turning book will be the truth exposed on issues that aid in the healing process. It is a story that models redemption and how the love of God can turn hard situations around for the good. Talented author Naramore seems to have a way to help the reader bond with the main characters and feel up close in the mist of the happenings.I highly recommend this five-star book and encourage the reader to check her other great works. Award-winning author Rosemary Naramore resides in the Pacific Northwest and is living her dream of fiction writing covering a variety of genres. Three words stand out in reflection to this book: intense, heartwarming, and redemptive.

This inspirational novel will warm your heart and allow you to see how God can take that devastating things and cause Divine reversals to those that love him. Set in rural Oklahoma Janie Hunt, Who recently graduated from Sterling college with a full scholarship, is now traveling with Habitats for Humanity with a heart to make a difference in her world. A product of emotional abuse from both parents and siblings that had nothing to do with her, Janie's refuge would come from her friend Becky while in high school, a Christian pastors daughter that treated her with kindness and eventually led her to the Lord.As Janie leads alongside a group of workers that are building a new house for elderly Mrs. Welch, Bradley will be among the group of local volunteers. Jamie comes to realize he is looking at her but she discovers that he is not a Christian and that it would not be in her best interest to get involved. Find out how this encounter plays out during her brief stay in Oklahoma and perhaps why in the Christian life there is no coincidence.I enjoyed the plot happenings but I give it four stars instead of five because I felt with more time invested that the plot could've been richer and that the transitions of happenings could've been better developed. Overall however it is a solid good read with clean Christian romance that I recommend to others.

This informative book by Keith Dorricott will be beneficial to new and mature Christians as it comprehensively takes the reader into six ages the Lord has prepared for mankind. From before the foundation of the world until we rule and reign with him after Satan is permanently bound, Scriptures will be highlighted and meaning extracted so all can see God's purpose and plan through the ages. Dorricott reveals that when God created time He created ages referred to as dispensations, which mark out the ways God dealt with people.With the first three ages occurring in Genesis you will discover how sin through Adam required a redeemer and how, through sin the age of conscience emerged. With Adam and the entire human race experiencing death, Satan would attempt to wipe out God's plan. As the age of human rule took place God's judgment would scatter nationalities and tongues when God was excluded in a unifying effort. As the age of promise follows 400 years through Abraham, Isaac, Jacob and his sons, the promise of future blessings needed to be coupled with faith. From Isaac would come Israel resulting in Christ.Learn how, in the age of the law( age of the prophets) because of the entrance of sin, priests were needed and King Saul given because God was rejected as King. Laws too were initiated for greater responsibility and accountability. In the age of Grace the body of Christ, the church, is introduced where the gospel is available to both Jew and Gentile. Mercy based on the work of Christ allows us entrance into the sanctuary of heaven by the Holy Spirit.Gain greater clarity on the coming of the Son of God to carry out judgments before He binds Satan and sets up his kingdom on earth. It will give you a panoramic view of God's working's and his need to implement each of these ages. Bible teachers will find this resource very helpful. I give this book a five star rating for the clarity of concepts and informative material presented. I encourage you to also check out his other resources.Keith is a retired Vice-Chairman of a Canadian bank and now teaches and serves others in churches.

This satisfying book has followed her first in the series entitled The Mad House on Sutton Place.  In a time of separation and later divorce Meredith "Merrie" Dixon will find herself in the Sutton Place apartment rooming with Lulu and eventually assimilating Lulu's eccentric friends into her life.  The book begins with Merrie's engagement to Myron Schwartz who is a blind wealthy lawyer.  Tagging too close for comfort will be detective McDougal who loves her and seizes opportunity to be with her.Lulu, an ex black hooker that stands for 4'10" in contrast to redheaded Merrie at 5'10", will find yet another lover Howard "Snookems" vanish only this fifth one not from divorce but from murder.  Discover how Merrie and "the gang" find themselves in near death situations trying to solve this case.  Lulu's discoveries following a letter postmarked to her from Snookems before his death will place her with possessions in which mobsters and drug dealers will stalk her and Merrie.Merrie's  pregnancy with Myron's baby will elate him and he will choose the risky operation in hopes of a better future.  Vacillating throughout this book will be the murder case and who all comes into play as suspects along with the planned out future for Merrie, her baby and Myron. In dramatic hilarious fashion discover how "loss" could actually turn into "millions".Having read both books, in this work her characters felt like family friends.  Great character development makes each of them stand out in their unique "eccentric "identity that the reader will grow to love.  Author Barbara Bixon that writes under the name A.R. Alan,  has a humorous flair to her writing and each of her novels will entertain you from start to finish.  With 11 novels to her credit, the experiences through career and travel have enabled her to imaginatively expand on characters.  A storyteller at heart, this talented author, I hope will attract increasing followers as her books are definitely five-star entertaining quality.

If you were attracted to the title and perhaps the history of this fine author I will say with surety that this work will not disappoint!! It is a book for the serious of heart and desiring to draw closer to God and reap the benefits of communion and a greater anointing.  Author A.W. Tozer holds nothing back in his straightforward way of revealing how sin, self, and pride are stumbling blocks preventing true union with God.In each of these chapters the reader will gain greater clarity on how to pursue God and follow hard after Him. His illustration of the Old Testament tabernacle will relay how the interior journey of the soul goes from sin to God's presence. The many sins of "self" will need to be brought to the cross, he states before the veil of true communion can take place. "Self is the opaque veil that hides the face of God from us. We must confess, forsake, repudiate the self life and then reckon it crucified ".As you discover how a defective faith can result in spiritual numbness, too will be the revelation of how obedience can give Inward revelation and acute perception, enabling us to experience God as one pure in heart. Programs and church attendance can still leave one inwardly bankrupt. Tozer exhorts us to get still to wait on God to hear him speak to our hearts. Accept His full Lordship and give forth complete submission. "We will acquire a new view point and mindset and a new power will begin to surprise us".This book, quite frankly, will revolutionize your life if you determine wholeheartedly to be a "doer"and not just a "hearer". These are simple, yet profound principles upon which any believer can follow if they choose to do so. I give this book a five star rating for the quality content and to the point principles. Allow it to change your life forever.

In this classic book Confidence in God in Times of Danger I have better understood the providence of God as reflected in the book of Esther and in the everyday lives of Christians today. Author Alexander Carson (1776 to 1844) shares the following: "From this book the believer may learn to place unbounded confidence in the care of his God and the utmost danger, and to look to the Lord of omnipotence for deliverance when there is no apparent means of escape".The reader will discover throughout history how God uses both evil and good men to achieve His purposes providentially and how there is no danger from which the Lord cannot rescue his people.  He exhorts us to look for God's plan that may have been prepared before hand when we are engulfed on every side. In considering evil for example Carson shares how God raised up Haman to bring his people into danger as well as Esther to deliver them.  As you better understand God's work in the transactions of man you will grow to trust him for provision, protection and the blessings of life.Carson argues rightfully as well as to why the book of Esther should not be rejected just because it does not express the name of God and is not quoted by the New Testament. This solid book is excellent for those in Christian service and for those maturing in Christ. The points of emphasis are heartwarming and will allow the reader to trust God in another dimension.I highly recommend this five-star book to others. Author Alexander Carson was an Irish Baptist pastor, leading scholar, and prolific writer. This classic book is one you do not want to miss out on.

Praying Genesis by Elmer Towns is a uniquely written book that has an extremely interesting plot and great readability. In a book read like prayers to God, it takes the accuracy of the happenings and brings clarity to the text as never before. This is also written in a way where it reveals the events that play out like a movie to one's imagination.Incorporated into prayers, as a sample of what to expect in chapter 2. "You, Lord God, put the man – Adam – in the garden to cultivate and care for it. You, Lord God, gave Adam this positive command, 'you may eat of the fruit of every tree in the garden'. You also, Lord God, gave him a negative warning. 'Don't eat of the fruit of the tree of knowledge of good and evil because you'll begin dying and ultimately die, the day you eat of it'".This is an excellent book for those also new in Christ and who find the Bible challenging in understanding key points and phrases. Though a Bible reader for several years, I also gained clarity in concepts and Genesis came alive as never before. At the end of each section will be a segment called "My time to pray "where main points previously read are emphasized in prayers to the Lord.Dr. Elmer Towns has written over 125 biblical books while also serving as a seminar lecturer. Added to his scholarly credit is his cofounding of Liberty University in 1971 and in 1995, a recipient of the coveted Gold Medallion Book Award.  Currently he serves as Dean of the B.R.Lakin School of Religion and professor of theology and New Testament.

In Thomas Drago's Queensboro (crow creek) The reader will encounter horror at its finest with well-developed characters and a plot that is sure to keep you on the edge of your seat. When fourth-grader Ashley Smith gets kidnapped at the bus stop by Schreck, a creepy looking gravedigger, a search gets underway spearheaded by sheriff Brad Gleason. In the nearby woods a "deathworm" will appear killing some in the town. It would be in the form of a pasty segmented body that secreted mucus with no eyes. As it launched on victims it would drain their blood.Mrs.Scott, who runs the town's sawmill would witness the kidnapping which leads authorities to Queensborough were evil Margaret Ganis resides. Here she runs a medical research laboratory Carolina EnTech. A sample of Ganis character is that she killed her sisters by mixing anti-freeze with sweet tea.When the reader enters Schreck's world they will witness coffins and an intravenous machine with colored hypodermic needles. This blood draining device will reveal Shrek's happenings as will the whereabouts of Ashley Smith. This book is not for the faint of heart as Margaret Ganis's heart and motives gets exposed, more deaths occur, and the action keeps you on your toes.If you enjoy horror, this is a page turning book. North Carolina's Thomas Drago teaches English and drama and is a member of the horror writers Association. As he adds to his collection of works, more great thrillers are sure to appear.

Author Erik Sabistan is a passionate aviator that has survived a critical mission in Afghanistan and today lives to tell us in Dustoff 7-3 as a Medevac Air Mission Commander.  In his job to deliver soldiers into combat aboard Blackhawks and pick up wounded fighters he shares "In the Dust Off business where lives are always on the line, one of the hardest things for flight crews to do is to suppress their emotions  and stay focused on flying and saving lives."Eric Sabistan's love for the military came from his grandfather who was a World War II veteran. It was after the 9/11 terrorist attack that killed 3,000 people that prompted him to join the army with the dream of becoming a helicopter pilot. He was determined to fly in combat despite the deaths and injuries of friends that flew. In Operation Hammer Down for example, discover how the Taliban fighters pop up all over the caves and tunnels and how he had to alternate race track patterns with figure eights to avoid becoming predictable. In Watapur Valley Sergeant Julia Bringloe would hang from the cable connected to the helicopter  and in the ultimate rescue of 14 soldiers, incurred a fractured leg and black and blue marks from bumping into trees and scraping through obstacles.In this up close narrative account, Sabiston knew all the army aviators were soldiers like those fighting in the valley. "When we flew a mission and a fellow soldier died before we arrived it was as if a part of us died also". It was this settled purpose that allowed him and others to persevere when rockets were detonating close by.  Though mission was accomplished it would leave them completely exhausted – mentally and physically.If you are interested in action-packed, high adrenaline like missions this is a book for you! And it reaches more than a mission; rather, it is a test of the human soul to persevere.  A hero to many, yet modest and unassuming,Sabiston has prevailed over the most dangerous operations in Afghanistan.  His heart as a soldier has extended to speaking engagements nationwide professing faith, and spurning others to surpass insurmountable obstacles.  He instructs upcoming aviators to fly in the UH-60 Blackhawk helicopter.  I highly recommend this book to others.

The book's setting in 1936 Madrid will initially find Alicia Carter enjoying the benefits of her wealthy father's Sherry business as he sends her to the university.  Intelligence and a seemingly track for a good future will come to a halt and find her literally on the run after her Lindy Hop dance contest with Pablo.  As Jose offers to give Alicia a ride home he will pull a knife on her and attempt to rape her. Quick witted, she manages to pull out her revolver from her purse and kill him.  Her escape and disposal of José and his car will not remain private for long as she battles with guilt and reveals to Father Antonio the happening. "I couldn't get absolution from the priest and I'm not sure how reading the Bible will help me ".With the country and political turmoil, and her parents getting arrested and shot she will meet Alphonse Alvarez, a famous piano player and seek his love and security. Fierce fighting in a war torn area, many deaths will follow and Alicia will find herself running for her life. "I walk away with a heavy heart. I'm alone again and I'm scared". Author Fran Connor will display details taking the reader into the heart and soul of Alicia and how she finds herself using every facet of brilliance to escape situation after situation. It's a story of survival and search for love and belonging.
Decent case for the money but it has very strong burnt plastic odor.  Hopefully the smell will fade over time but 3 days in it still stinks.

I got these for my wife.  She loves to garden but has bad arthritis in her hands.  These shears don't help much.  Because the blades are long, leverage is not working in your favor.  Even for me, I can't cut much but a small twig with these and the blades are too large for fine pruning.  They will make great shop shears but for gardening, they aren't the best choice.Pros:SharpAppear to be strongCome apart easily for cleaningCons:Uncomfortable to use handlesHard to squeeze
Best hex tool for the money.  Strong.  Doesn't easily strip.  Perfect size for helicopter repairs.
Reasonably good claritySoft foam frame for pinning notesStrong magnetic backing holds mirror securelyNo risk of sharp broken glass as this is not made of glass
These add a nice grip and texture but they slide around easily.  They can be trimmed to provide a custom fit.

These towels are great for a variety of cleaning tasks.  They come in 3 styles and you get 2 of each.  The scour are the most aggressive, scrub are in the middle and polish are soft.  All 3 type are soft on one side with the more agressive finish on the other side.  Below are some of the suggested usesScour are the most aggressive and they are great for tough cleaning tasks where you need more than a towel or sponge but still can't use a Scotchbrite or steel wool pad.Uses:-Cleaning smooth top stoves-Cleaning bugs off the windshield-Cleaning tough dirt off mirrors or glass-Cleaning eggs or cheese off a non-stick panScrub are like a corduroy type with stripes of a stiffer material between soft microfiber.Uses:-Cleaning Corian counter tops-Cleaning bugs, mud or tar off of painted surfaces such as your car-Washing a dirty car-Cleaning windshield wiper blades-Cleaning dashboards and other interior surfaces in your car-Cleaning dirty windowsPolish are standard microfiber cloths.  They are very soft and dense.Uses:-Finish cleaning or drying of windows to a non-streak finish-Waxing your car-Cleaning delicate sufaces like LCD TV or computer screens-Any other cleaning or drying job where delicate surfaces are involvedThe quality of these towels seems good, although I have not washed them yet.  Be sure not to use fabric softener or dryer sheets as these will cause streaking when using the towels.

I compared this to my Magna Cart that I bought a few years ago and has an identical weight rating.  This hand truck seems like it may be a little stronger but it is also larger and heavier.  Folded, it is 30" long, 5" longer than the Magna Cart although both are 40" long when the handle is telescoped.  The additional weight of the Heininger is due to the tubular steel construction versus the rectangular aluminum construction of the Magna Cart.  The Heininger appears to be stronger but I did not do any torture testing, just using my foot to put pressure on the base plate and the Heininger flexed less than the other truck.  As a note, the Magna Cart I compared this to is no longer made.  The new MC is very similar to the Heininger.Overall, this is a well made hand truck.

This looks like a well made machine.  It is simple to use with dedicated buttons for Espresso, Lungo (Regular Coffee), or hot water.  It also has a button for steaming and another to run a cleaning cycle.  It has indicator lights on the front for the various functions, including low water, empty coffee grounds, no coffee and a general warning light.The 43 page manual makes this machine look complicated but it's not and it includes a 4 page quick start guide to get you started pretty quickly.  The first time start-up is a bit of a pain but I've never had one of these before so they may all require the same priming and rinsing.First, you fill the machine with water, run an Espresso cycle to prime it.  Then run the coffee cycle 3 times.  Next, run the steam wand until it runs dry.  Then refill the machine with water and coffee and brew 3-5 cups of coffee and discard.  Refill with water again and now you are good to go.Once the machine is setup as above, you just press the button you want for Espresso, coffee or hot water and wait 30-40 seconds and you have a cup of coffee!  You can also do 2 cups at a time by putting 2 cups on the tray and pressing either button twice consecutively.  It doesn't really save any time because it runs 2 cycles consecutively but you don't have to babysit it.  Let's face it, 60-80 seconds for 2 cups of coffee if pretty darn fast!  The drip tray is quite large so if you forgot to put a cup under the spout, you would not have a mess on the counter.  In fact, I'd guess the tray would hold at least 2 full cups of coffee before overflowing and it has a red indicator that pops up to tell you the tray is full.The steamer is powerful.  Be sure to use a big enough container and don't let the wand come all the way out of the froth or you'll get a bath.  If you've ever frothed milk, you know this already.  Basic daily cleaning is easy.  Just slide out the drip tray, empty the grounds cup, empty the tray of water, wipe the bottom tray grill, remove the steam wand and wash it.  It took only a minute or two to do all this by hand.  The tray grill is dishwasher safe but everything else must be washed by hand.  The the machine runs a rinse cycle after you stop using it.  This is normal.  The water runs into the tray so you should wait until the rinse cycle completes before emptying the tray.The machine is rather large.  It is 8W x 13H x 17½D.  That includes the right angle power cord in the back so you will need some counter space to accommodate it.Here's what I don't like.  First, you can only use coffee beans.  There is no way to add ground coffee.  Why is this a big deal?  Suppose you like regular coffee but your wife likes decaf?  This machine can't accommodate that.  You would have to add just enough coffee to make your cup (I'm not sure how much that is.) then get the remaining beans out of the grinder and do the same for her.  Many other machines have a provision to add ground coffee so you could make a cup of decaf then go back to regular coffee.  Also, the manual says that you cannot use flavored coffees as they will clog up the machine.  That's not a big deal for me but it may be for you.  One last thing is that you cannot program the standby time. It is preset at 30 minutes. I'd like to be able to set it for longer, perhaps an hour. Most machines in this price range allow this.While I haven't done the weekly cleaning or monthly cleaning, they look to be a bit of a pain.  Also, every 250 cups, you must descale using a special solution.  I'm disappointed that Philips did not include even a sample size of descaling solution in the box, considering this machine costs $600.  Philips, if you are reading this, please consider including a small bottle of descaling solution; even if it is only enough to descale one time.  The manual says that descaling takes 35 minutes.  It goes on to say that if not done, the machine will eventually stop working and the damage is not covered under warranty.Overall, I like the machine.  It makes a good cup of coffee, espresso or cappuccino.  You can adjust the grinder to your liking to control the strength of the coffee.  It does require more maintenance than your basic coffee maker though.  Whether it stays or goes will depend on how difficult the weekly/monthly cleaning are and if my wife will put up with the lost counter space.  After seeing her reaction to the cappuccino I made her tonight, I think it may be staying...Update: I learned that I can program the cup size dispensed by holding either size cup button. It flashes and starts dispensing. Then press again to make it stop. After that, the new cup size is memorized.  A word of caution is the more water you use, the weaker the coffee will be.  You could experiment with the grinding fineness to compensate for this.  As I mentioned, this machine is so fast you can just press the button twice rapidly and it will run two consecutive brewing sequences which won't affect coffee strength.Update after a month of use:The weekly cleaning of this machine is much easier than the manual made it seem.  It took all of 10 minutes and I was proceeding slowly.I've found a few quirks with this machine that concern me.  First, there is a cup inside that holds the used grounds.  They are compressed into small hockey pucks.  When the cup becomes full, you get a warning light on the display and the machine will not function until you empty the cup.  It's a great idea but here's the problem.  On several occasions, the light has come on with only 2 pucks in the cup.  So that means only 2 cups of coffee had been made since the cup was empty.  The light should not come on as the cup is nowhere near full.  It's a minor inconvenience and the light has reset after emptying the cup.  Often times just opening and closing the drawer clears the error.Here is a more serious issue.  When frothing milk, there is a delay when activating or deactivating the steamer.  I understand the delay for steaming to begin as the water must be heated and the pump takes some time to develop pressure.  That's not a problem.  The problem is you have the same delay when you press the button to stop the steam.  The delay is long enough that even if you stop steaming with the milk level 2" below the bottom of the container, it will run long enough to overflow.  This means you have a mess but more importantly, you have scalding milk spilling all over your hands.  This is a poor design in my opinion, especially for a machine this expensive.  A friend of mine has a competing machine (D brand) and you can stop the steam instantly, which is the way it should be.  I dropped the rating to 3 stars because of this.  Even after using the machine for a month, I still overflow the milk when frothing.  It is easier to do than not and you could easily burn yourself in the process.

This is an excellent clip.  It opens easily and has a slide lock to prevent it opening accidentally.  I have found this to be more versatile than a QD swivel because it works with a variety of weapons.  You can also clip it to a QD swivel if your weapon has a QD socket.  When doing the latter, the GG&G Angular Push Button Quick Detach Sling Swivel works really well as it prevents the clip sliding side to side.

This case is super thin.  It is not a high quality leather case but it does offer decent protection and has the magnet to turn the display on and off automatically when you open or close the cover.  It also can hold the tablet at an angle for easy viewing.  If you want a cheap case, this is a decent one but again, don't expect high end.

I was really excited to get the third book in the Hawthorne Brothers series...three brothers who ALL meet and have relationships with the three daughters of the woman their father is engaged to. Sounds unlikely, but suspending reality and just enjoying the story is the key and Colleen Masters is good at writing these romances with bite.I really liked this one quite a bit and was really happy with the way it ended and wrapped up in a plausible way. It was full of sweet romance, some funny moments, catty jealous women and sisters who bonded to find their true happiness, despite a selfish mother.I received a free copy of this book for an honest review.**** 4 **** "we were all meant to be a happy family" stars

OMG!!! What an absolutely thrilling third book in this series...it left me just dying for more and after reading the sneak peek into Saint’s book at the end…I am ready!This book is Lyn and Luke’s (Knight) story and the whole rest of the gang is along for the bumpy ride. Lies, betrayals, a family’s dark and dirty secrets revealed and some unbelievable twists that I did not see coming but were just (oh wow) crazy and yet everything really made perfect sense after all was said and done and was just brilliantly woven together.This special kindle edition that I got for only 99 cents was ALL THREE of the books in the Anathema MC series and let me tell you, it was well worth the two days I spent reading them all. Although the author says that you can read Knight without having read the first two books, I highly recommend you do anyway…so much happens in the first two books (Rose and Thorne/Brew and Martini) that it only enhances the experience so much more.This is a fantastic biker series that focuses on family and their messed up relationships as much as it does the politics and danger of three clubs fighting for control while making and then breaking alliances and truces that will ultimately lead to extreme violence and bloodshed. I loved every gory and at times steamy minute of this trilogy and you should grab it while you have the chance to score them at this really discounted price.***** 5 ***** “a father’s betrayal, a daughter’s love and breaking down the walls” stars

This was an interesting and mysterious start to what promises to be a wild ride. I'm not sure what exactly is going on between Jordan Mills and Hunter Savage's parents...but it's no good and left me wondering exactly WHAT mission he was given and why his seduction plans were obviously done for suspicious reasons.A chick who can ride and fix motorcycles with the best of them and a pushy sexy man who gets what he wants (but follows his family's orders) are the ones who will probably change the way things are supposed to go down and as much fun as it was to read their verbal sparring, I was left with way more questions than answers.This is a debut series from a new author and although there were quite a few small issues that I found in this prequel that threw me off and made the story a tad unbelievable, it looks like it will be exciting and action packed and I look forward to finding out what is really going on.I received a free copy of this book for an honest review.**** 3.5 **** "family ties and lustful thoughts" stars

I liked Michael and Holly's book...not as much as I loved Ava and Mercy...but it was full of tension, violence, slow moving romance (the way it should be) and a complicated relationship between two people who had more in common than they ever knew.Holly was a victim of severe abuse and running away/hiding from her abusers and falling into the arms of Michael (the one who gets bad things done for the club) was her shaky plan to freedom. It took a lot of trust and strength to beat the odds but if anyone could do it, it would be this vulnerable but willing-to-learn waitress and her silent but deadly biker.I liked how the story played out and am looking forward to the next books but felt this one was a bit too repetitive and wordy...it could have been cut down and would still have been a great book without losing any of the impact of the hard storyline. Still worth reading because this series is seriously awesome.**** 4 **** "an evil worse than anyone could imagine" stars

Poetic, beautifully descriptive, sensitive, honest and truthful...and I'm describing a biker book...about a 1% club...and yes, I am serious.This book was originally released in 4 parts and I bought all of them before the author published it in one book...and I am so glad I read them!Ava is the daughter of the VP of the Lean Dogs MC and when he is about to be bumped up to President and she returns home for the celebration and to go to grad school with her preppy new boyfriend in tow, all hell is about to break loose. Her old love and the one who she ran from heartbroken to go away to college, is back and things are about to get really complicated. Some club wars and persecution by the town mayor are only a couple of issues to be faced by this family of bikers and in this first book we are given the detailed and rich history of all of the important players in this family driven saga.I have read so many biker romances that I have lost count...and while they are mostly enjoyable and some I have come to love so much I re-read them...this new one is different. Lauren Gilley manages to combine a lot of facts about MC life, descriptions of people and places, and a scorching love story that began when Ava was a little girl and her forbidden lover Mercy was a young prospect.Beautifully told but keeping the nasty, violent and sexy grit you come to expect from a book about outlaws.***** 5 ***** "lie down with dogs and you don't always come up with fleas" stars

It's hard to say "I really liked it" when a book is so wrong and dirty and hits so many triggers that I hardly know where to begin reviewing it...and I should have known better having read Mary Palmerin's work before...so yeah, read the warnings and some of the lower rated reviews before you read this one (full disclosure and all that).The synopsis does not even begin to give a clue as to the depth of depravity contained in this novel and even though it is actually beautifully written and almost sounds like poetry in some parts, it is very hard to digest and I had to set it down and go do something else a few times before I could finish it.I also wish the authors had put in the description that it was going to end on a cliffhanger and was not a complete story (being Red Market #1 does not necessarily mean it is a continuation series so I was a bit upset) and after surviving this depressing and bloody mess of heartbreak, I'm not sure I can go through it all again in another book.Mind blown and still reeling after what I just read...I think I need to read some sweet fluffy romance now to make it all better =)**** 4 **** "life should never be this twisted and perverse" stars

I just couldn't resist...a long biker romance book with an HEA and only 99 cents...what's not to love?Hawk was SO bossy...sexy hot but alpha to the max...and he sure met his match with Cara, a lawyer who has a mind for business but a body for pleasure. And it was definitely Hawk's pleasure as he made it his mission to have her for himself...in all ways possible.A serial rapist/killer, a rival MC, a snobby family and a mysterious knack for always getting in bad situations all play parts in this really engrossing new biker book about two opposites who find they have more in common than they first thought. It was chock full of steamy kink and so much sex I was sweating bullets at one point...but the story was thrilling, the supporting characters interesting enough to carry on with more books in the series and all in all well worth the small price for a whole day of reading.If you love bikers as much as I do then you will want to grab this one while it is still less than a buck!**** 4 **** "you can't judge a man by his leathers" stars

I love Boomer and PPP...they are the perfect match...both of them suffering from their own form of PTSD and attempting to heal themselves while putting those around them at risk for the fallout.Pamela is protecting those dearest to her heart while trying to find some form of "normal" peace in her life, but her scars (both internal and external) are sometimes too painful to live with...while Boomer lives with guilt and the shame of not being able to protect his "brother-in-arms" as he lives his life flying by the seat of his pants. When these two broken down souls come together in their misery, it is both gut wrenching and wonderful to watch and my heart was breaking for both of them as I read this book.I love these Hellions so much and just marvel at Camaron's ability to write such serious and universal issues in her books that so many readers can relate to...while also giving us an exciting and sexy biker romance with a ton of awesome characters.A must read addition to the Hellions series as this author never disappoints and her stories stick with you for a long time!I received a free copy of this book for an honest review.***** 5 ***** "life is never simple but it can be if you trust" stars

I am a big fan of Nora Flite's books and as usual, this one pulled me in right from the start and then kept me interested until the very end.It was not quite what I expected...Abell and Nix made a hotter than hot couple and their sexual encounters were so erotic...but the twist in the story was slightly unreal and then to have more reveals later on just turned the book from an intriguing mystery to a so-so romantic drama. I have also read several books with a similar storyline as well but it is still worth the read (if only to enjoy those extremely steamy loves scenes and the HEA surprise ending) and this author writes her sexual tension SO well.If you are a fan of Flite's work, you will definitely want to add this one to your library.I received a free copy of this book for an honest review.**** 4 **** "keeping the family and money in sight" stars

Got this as my one free loaner with Amazon Prime and unlike some months when I regretted using my one freebie on a waste of time, I really loved this one so much.It was emotionally deep and made me sad and heartbroken for what Jackson and Emily went through...espeically when you love and lose something that "fits" and makes your life complete.Forget that he was in an MC and she was young and inexperienced in that lifestyle...they worked and were happier and more fulfilled than most "traditional" couples...so when betrayal strikes and they are ripped apart just as things get deeply bonded, it was tragic and gutting.I liked the feelings that were brought to the surface as I read this one and although it was not what I am used to reading in a biker romance (and I have read hundreds of them!)...it was completely satisfying and well worth my time. Get it and I'd even suggest the Selected Sinners box set because all the books in the series so far were really quite good.***** 5 ***** "Yes sir and please wait for me" stars

WOW…what an amazing deal!! I read each of these books and they were all 5 star reads for me…so I will quickly run down each one.DRAW: Cord, Chase and Creed Gentry were like the unholy trinity of wild bad boy triplets growing up in their small town...the girls lusted after them, the town feared them and they were completely abused and discarded like old furniture by their own parents.Saylor was a sweet, too-trusting young woman who had a history with these boys (Cord took something very precious from her one day and it haunted her when she left to start a new life) but nothing could have prepared her for the abuse she would suffer from an unlikely person who was NOT one of the low-life Gentry men, but someone she should have been able to trust.When Saylor escapes and runs back to the safety of her cousin and BFF Bray, she is forced to confront the demons from her past and in that hell she finds out that the love of her life is standing right in front of her. I really liked the believability factor in this book...no insta-love, they had mature reactions to traumatic situations and I especially liked how a very serious problem that could have had a horrible impact on many characters, was resolved in an awesome conclusion.RISK: Where do I even begin to express how much I loved this book...it was dark, beautiful, heart-breaking and hit home with me on so many levels.When I first met the Gentry triplets (Cord, Creed and Chase) in Draw, they were everything a girl could want (or really shouldn't want) in a boyfriend. They were like a sexy bad-boy tag-team of muscles and brawn all rolled into a package of heat...you want one Gentry boy, you get them all...a package deal for any girl lucky enough to have a night of no-strings fun. To quote the author they were " head-turning triplets that hatched somewhere in the desert and then descended upon humanity like a plague of testosterone"...LOL...I couldn't have said it any better! This was Creed and Truly’s story and both of them suffered from childhoods lacking in nurturing and loving parents, so it was understandable to me that they acted out (Creed in violence and sexual escapades and Truly with her own string of men and various relationships that went nowhere).I found myself so engrossed in their emotionally charged stories that I was brought to tears more than a few times, and it was hard to just read this book without tensing up and fearing the results of what obstacles lay ahead for them. A life and death situation threatens the happiness and future of the brothers as well as the women they love, and when all is said and done, the risk for what "could be" in the future outweighs the present predicament they must all fight through to the end.GAME: Cora Brent's storytelling has taken on a more mature tone with this book...don't get me wrong, it is still funny as hell in parts, steamy and sexy beyond belief (the Vegas elevator and hotel room scenes will stick with me for a while) and has that playful, fast-paced banter that makes reading her books so addictive. It also touches on the subject of addiction...which comes in many forms, from sex to drugs to gambling and how some people are born with addiction in their make-up, while others are able to overcome the urges and not be affected by hereditary or their environment growing up. Chase desperately wished for a relationship with his mother, while Stephanie lost her father to a lifestyle he could not control. I loved that both Chase and Stephanie were complex and interesting individuals...one could be dirty and lustful in one breath and then sweet and honorable in the next, while the other was emotionally fragile yet so loyal and loving at the same time and together they were exactly what each other needed and a strong force to be reckoned with.FALL: We first met Jenny in Promise Me (Defiant MC book #2) when she was rescued from the cult and brought to her sister for safe keeping. Jenny was only 16 in that book and was sent to live with her brother in California where she went to school and was given a chance to somewhat "heal" from her injuries, both emotional and physical. When Fall begins, Jenny is 19 and finds herself stranded at a bar, garnering the unwanted attention of some creeps, when Declan Gentry swoops in to save the day.Deck is a dark and dreamy bad-boy with a heart of gold...just as you should not judge a book by its cover...you also can not judge this man by his outward appearance.I loved Deck...ever since he took on the role of protector to his triplet cousins both growing up and even more so now that they are all settled with the loves of their lives at 23 years old. I really loved the patience and care taken to develop their relationship over time...there was no wham bam jump in the sack for these two...although OMG the foreplay and flirtatious teasing between Deck and Jenny was mega watt HOT and when they finally realize their feelings for each other (and seal the deal), it was truly explosive passion.We learn a whole lot more about the Gentry triplets heartbreaking childhood as well as some dropped bombs of possible big secrets that could impact the future...but for now, enjoy this really sweet and sexy and emotionally charged romance with cameos from some much beloved characters from the Gentry Boys and Defiant MC series.HOLD: Finally…enjoy a sneak peek into more of Cord and Saylor as they keep the romance alive after becoming parents to two adorable girls. It’s funny, sweet, sexy and reminds us that under the tats and tough guy exterior, Cord is a loving husband and father. I can’t wait to read the whole book when it releases!***** 5 ***** “a delicious 4-pack of sexy men and their loves” stars

We first met Kellan in Slade's book and man oh man has he ever grown up since then and literally become a lady killer...he attacks them after every fight with his killer weapon and let me tell you, it was extremely steamy and heat filled to read those scenes!Enter Parker Jones...reporter and the sweet woman who will be enough to bring this killer to his knees (and senses) and when it all goes down, it was exciting and playful and yet really really dangerous as well.There is a lot of intrigue and behind the scenes action, life threatening danger and passion when Parker sets out to get her story, get her justice and get her man.Politics and the slick world of underground fighting go hand in hand in this story of getting back what you lost, fighting for the rights of those who served and were left hanging and finding the one who can both rock your world and keep you level headed and calm.I really liked this new book a lot and although there are times where it gets a little preachy, it was worth the read and brings some important issues to light.***** 4.5 ***** "fighting for justice and freedom" stars

"Killer", the first book in this box set duo was a thriller about a womanizing husband who is murdered and the plot thickens as his wife is blamed for it. Did she do it or was she the pawn in a scheme by someone else? This prequel was sexy, suspenseful and had so many twists that I wasn't sure who to believe. The end was a surprise and it opens up the door for the next book in the series. A delicious taste of what will be a great revenge mystery. There was plenty of nasty and just wrong revenge in “Stalker”, but it wasn't quite as explosive as I thought it would be. The methods used by Phoenix/Miles to capture and break down Vanessa were cruel, degrading and at times hotter than hell...but, without spoiling the book for anyone else, there was a complete reversal at one point and the ending was not as dark as I thought it might turn out to be.Both of these characters had terrible and unusual childhoods (just because Vanessa came from money didn't mean she was treated well) and although Miles was the one who everyone thought was dangerous and a "killer"...Vanessa was forced into some pretty abusive and illegal situations herself leading me to wonder who the real bad guy was in this story.I think the two of them were fairly suited to each other and their childhood relationship and history made for some interesting revelations once Phoenix had her in his clutches.If you like twisted psychological thrillers with a lot of kinky sex and emotional trauma, then this is the one for you!I received a free copy of this book in exchange for an honest review.***** 4.5 ***** “two damaged souls make a right choice” stars

I think this is my favorite book of the series. In the first book we get a teenage Kyle and all the drama of growing up too fast and wanting to reach for the stars (with a very nave outlook). In the second book, we get Kyle and her bandmates on their first train wreck of a tour, dealing with pervy men and unscrupulous management who are only looking out for their own wants and needs. By the time we get to On the Rocks, Kyle is having to re-evaluate her whole life and career and basically start from scratch. Clawing your way back up to the top of the pile is never easy when it seems like everyone wants to see you fall down and there is not many people left in your corner to help anymore.But Kyle is not a quitter, far from it and it is only when she sets out to start a new band and attempts to leave all the haters behind, does she find peace in her life again.CJ has been off and on in her life, both as mentor and BF, but it broke my heart the way he made her feel and their unstable relationship was sad to watch as Kyle fought for discovery and to grow up.What I really loved about this book was the message and how no matter how much a person might mess up their life and how far they fall, the human spirit is stronger than we realize and watching this young woman's journey from her teenage angry self to the successful rockstar she becomes, was exhilarating and inspiring to watch.This book features some "guest stars" from Jamison's Bullet series and plenty of heavy metal action for those music lovers out there...not to mention a trip to Vegas where you know...what happens in Vegas...I especially loved how she ended the book...the last chapters and wrap up of everyone's stories was perfect and humorous (as there is always a lot of humor in between the drama in her books) and I felt satisfied that all ended as it should have.I received a free copy of this book for an honest review.***** 5 ***** "awesome heavy metal rocking and loving" stars

I got this one for free and it sounded good and for the most part it was ok...just too many things that were unrealistic and would never happen in real life.The idea was a good one...an undercover agent pretending to be the old lady of a biker who was working to bring down a criminal leader and his club...but all of the coincidences, the "training" to be a biker chick, the all day tattoo session...it just seemed impossible to buy, so I was just thrown off of the story. The almost instant falling in love and ending was more of a fairytale than a serious MC romance, but some readers might enjoy that type of thing...I just read too many books that I have become picky about plotlines that are rushed or too unrealistic...but that's just my opinion.Sex was steamy, lots of emotional turmoil and some raunchy club action.**** 3.5 **** "falling in love for a second time" stars

This was a very fast read...one of those books that just keeps on moving and keeps you involved with the story and the characters. I have to say I was at first not sure how I would feel about this story since it is another one of many biker books where a rich guy is stalking a young woman and she is forced to run away to either her father or brother's club for protection...but after getting past that issue, I really appreciated that the characters behaved in a more mature way and kept things real.When Piper reaches out to her step-brother for help, he doesn't throw her into a bad situation nor does she get treated like a club whore (good so far) and when Kix arrives on the scene to merge the clubs, he turns out to be a bigger/better man than how he could have been written.Piper is surprisingly strong and fearless when it comes to Kix and the author didn't milk the whole "poor damaged girl" thing which gets annoying when you've read it too many times.A short novella with a few predictable moments but well written and a pretty entertaining plot that left me wanting more...wish it had been longer with a bit more details.I received a free copy of this book for an honest review.**** 4 **** "no place left to run and hide" stars

I've had this book for a while now and finally got to read it! Intense and scary at times...then oh so sexy and sweet...yes sweetness with a tough alpha male edge to it as a mystery is solved and a bond is formed that will last a lifetime.Fathers and sons, mothers and daughters, lovers and EX-lovers...what a wicked and wonderful web this author weaves and apart from the violent and unexpected tragedies, there is a strong sense of family love and loyalty with a strong resolution and all kinds of feels.I enjoyed this one with just a few small annoyances but will read the rest in the series one day as well.**** 4 **** "poetic justice and a mother's hatred" stars

I read so many biker books that they sometimes become a big blur...but I really enjoyed this one quite a bit. It was different with the heroine being from New Zealand and yet it had a similar feel to other books I have read before.The plot was complicated and full of so many characters, I had to pay attention to keep all the friends and family members straight...but the action and thrilling romance was enjoyable to read...violent, bloody and then turning steamy in a flash.There were a few editing issues and the book was very long and drawn out in parts, but it was a good effort and so full of surprises that it definitely was not boring to read. I got it when it was a freebie so it was a steal and I would like to read the next book in the series one day.**** 4 **** "escaping danger and finding peace" stars

I really liked the exciting way this book started...it was intense and you just knew this tough chick was going to get herself into trouble driving this truck full of goods...and she did. When she is taken by a rival club, it could have been much worse than it was...but enter the hot alpha second in command...and you just knew how it would end.Unfortunately after that awesome beginning, things took a turn into unbelievable and almost silly directions...too much happened and was described that would never happen in a real MC and made all the characters look and sound too wishy washy.The insta-love between Daniela and Julian was hard to swallow..and then when the crazy cheating EX shows up and she goes crazy calling him "the love of her life"...it just got to be too much.The romance and sex scenes were hot and the chase sequences were so well described, I felt like I was watching an action film and found myself holding my breath.It was just OK for me (I read way too many biker books so I am very picky) and was free at the time I got it so I don't feel like I lost anything.**** 3.5 **** "choose a side and stick to it" stars

Oh my ...just when I think I've had enough and decide to get off the "stepbrother train", Sabrina Paige goes and writes one that is so naughty, so deliciously wicked and funny at the same time (while pulling a bit on the old heartstrings) that I just HAD to read it.The blurb is over the top drama...Prince Albie is so full of himself that I couldn't help but snort as I was reading his arrogant dialogue...and yet it was so witty and playful with a crapload of steamy foreplay and dirty games, that it left me in a constant state of arousal (much like the characters) and that is a good thing when reading a romance novel. I can't say this book was all just erotica (although it was certainly chock full of it) because there were also some important lessons learned between mothers/daughters and fathers/sons about what really matters most in life and love...and it's not always about wearing that gold crown.If you want to have a fabulously raunchy good read and can just leave your logic checked at the door, please pick up and enjoy this romp through Vegas and the imaginary land of Kings and Queens and a badboy prince who found his perfect (albeit reluctant) princess...and you will be guaranteed a pleasurable time. I LOVED every minute of it.***** 5 ***** "a fantasy every little girl wants to come true" stars

I have read a lot of this author's books...they are always so sexy and steamy but filled with such passion and longing that they make you really feel everything.Who hasn't secretly wanted to "go there" with a BFF who just happens to be a sexy player and irresistable to women...one of the big reasons a lot of women "can't" be friends with a man...but when Alex is given a chance to get close, close, closer with his beautiful childhood friend Tripp, he wonders if it won't be the biggest mistake ever made.I really liked this one...so much angst and emotions spilling over the sexual tension and when things happened (just the way we knew it would) it was like fireworks and left me feeling like "I" had been ravaged by Alex. Whew!!Read at your own risk...grab a cold drink and enjoy some quiet "private" time with this book. It touches on a lot of different issues that come up between family and friendships, as well as making some interesting points about the battle between love, lust and real life.**** 4 **** "this might not be a good idea" stars

I really like Nicole James as a biker romance writer...she gets to the heart of what makes things tick between men and women...the excitement of the chase, capture and domination.I have read four of the five Evil Dead MC books so far and have enjoyed them all very much...although I maybe didn't love this one as much as I hoped I would. I think it had to do with too much back and forth and after a while, all the makeup sex and falling into bed after walking away got to be too repetitive and it was frustrating to read. Despite those issues, I read it in one sitting and will definitely continue to read her books because I really love her stories (even when they make me angry) and they are filled with as much emotion and deep family love as some of the best romance novels.Wolf was a complex and hard-headed man fighting to keep his freedom and not be tied down...Crystal was a tough sweetheart who loved as fiercely as she fought for herself and the two of them together were a perfect match...if only they both believed in themselves. Both had internal and external scars from their lives (before the book is through) and it was inspiring to watch as they battled their demons.A must-have must-read for Nicole James fans and biker book readers in general.**** 4 **** "covering the scars of life" stars

I gave three of the four books in this series 5 stars so I would say it was pretty much a success in terms of how I like my biker books to be. I was a huge fan of the MC Sinners series, so of course I was thrilled to get a new one from this author and for the most part these guys and their women were just as entertaining, sexy and tough as the first biker club.Each book focus was on a specific couple but with other stories mixing in to give some history for the next book. I really liked that each one was unique and the plots very different from other books (a female prison guard/biker, a slave worker/biker etc.) so I never felt like I was reading something I had seen before.A wonderful collection for biker romance readers and especially if you are a Bella Jewel fan and love series that are very family centered.***** 5 ***** "love, lust, life and happiness" stars

I read the first three books in this series on their own but picked up the box set when it was on sale so I could read the final one (and have the set for my collection). I have always been a big fan of Jewel's work and although I enjoyed the Jokers' Wrath series, it just didn't have the impact or as much heart as her MC Sinners series did for me.Pip and Tyke always had that sweet big brother/little sister kind of vibe (for him at least) and no girl could ask for a better "brother" to comfort, protect and just generally be a shoulder to cry on. Both of them have gone through tragic and life altering events and all was well until it wasn't anymore...until being friends wasn't enough for Pip anymore...until they crossed lines that they didn't realize were meant to be crossed.I found Desolation to be a bit drawn out in parts and then a bit too quick (I would have liked for everyone's storylines to have been given a more complete end) but for the most part it was good and Pip's story ended the way I had hoped it would.A must have series for Bella Jewel fans despite the small issues.**** 4 **** "healing each other over time" stars

I like my biker books with a more realistic edge to them...but this one was a little bit too real and hit close to home as well.It was sad, heartbreaking and at times so funny...in that sit-com "what's going to happen NOW?" kind of way...but mainly just bikers and their wives dealing with what ordinary folk go through post-partem.It was ok and touched on a lot of real life issues, but if you're looking for more hardcore biker club action, you won't find it here, but rather just family drama and Nix dealing with Kadence's depression and self-esteem problems.A must read for anyone who is reading this series though.**** 4 **** "and baby makes four plus a whole lot of trouble" stars

My King, my Queen, shifters and vampires and dwarfs...oh my! Mary Martel has created a new world in which vampires wear sunglasses, stink to high heaven and humans mate with shifters to preserve a dying breed.When college student/waitress Shayne opens her door one night to a dark and dangerous stranger, her life is forever turned upside down. Powers she never understood, a destiny she never knew she had and a delicious smelling man who sweeps her off her feet and takes her on the road to heaven and hell...only to bring her right back to her altered reality, is the new book from Mary Martel, that is quite a change....or shift...from her rough and tough biker series.It was interesting and inventive and while at first I though I was just reading a cool college romance about a witty young woman with bite, I quickly realized this was much more and when the magic happens, it got very interesting and creepy.Although this is not my usual choice of book and honestly, I only read very few fantasy/paranormal novels, it kept my attention from the first chapter and I just had to keep reading to find out how it all would end.A wonderfully creative, at times gruesome, but mystical and delicious fantasy that will leave you wanting more.I received a free copy of this book for an honest review.***** 5 ***** "one day she will be his Queen" stars

I love KA books...I really do. Hop was an interesting guy from book one and Lanie was a sad, misguided girl...but the drama was so thick and heavy in this one that it was exhausting to read at times and became a tad repetitive.
