The back and forth got to be too much and the constant change of heart (from BOTH of them) gave me whiplash...but that being said, I still enjoyed the hell out of this addition to the series (not as much as I loved the original Motorcycle Man or Own the Wind) but with reservations.The plot was complex and twisted up and nothing was what it seemed, as Hop and Lanie both fought to overcome the demons from their own troubled pasts before they could make a go of being together in a permanent relationship.It was funny at times (Lord those Chaos men are bossy!) and sexy as well as being full of rich family history and tackled the issues that always cause problems between men and women (as well as parents and their kids).Get it while it's on sale...this price is lowest that I've ever seen it and worth the read.**** 4 **** "melting the ice inside with fire " stars

I loved this book. Period. It took about 50% in before any real sex happened and when it did (after all of that steamy foreplay and verbal sparring and emotional turmoil) it was just beautiful and actually made me cry a bit.Elizabeth's story was painful and heartbreaking but she met the man who would be her savior and he was the one who taught her strength (all while she was giving it right back to him).Declan and Dax were twins who complemented each other perfectly...brains and muscle meet sweet and romantic...and I just adored their relationships both with each other as well as with Elizabeth.This was one of those romances that balanced real life with fantasy and sweet with spice just perfectly. I absolutely enjoyed every minute reading and didn't want it to end...but was really glad that it did in such a perfect way. My favorite book from this author so far.***** 5 ***** "getting dirty and falling in love" stars

I really enjoyed this new biker romance quite a bit...the author has greatly improved her storytelling since her Desperado series and although I really enjoy reading all kinds of books with alpha male badboys, bikers are my favorite. In the first book, fathers and daughters who share a tragic past and who have strained relationships because of those issues, are always tough to read about, but I was very pleased with the progression of how they mended their fences and how the violent events surrounding Maggie's return home brought them back together. Jase is that kind of tough guy with a heart of gold and inside the muscular and sexy exterior is a teddy bear who just wants to be appreciated and loved.The second book is about Will who is Jase's closest "brother" in the MC and he would do anything for him and his club. But when Will becomes a loner and goes outside of the club's rules because of a tragic fire that took away his only family and hope, it takes him to the bar which now sits in that sacred spot. A matter of being in the wrong place at the right time has him getting involved with the cartel in a dangerous game to protect the new bar owner's family and especially the delicate Eva, who brings out both the softness and ugliness inside Will's hardened heart.I really enjoyed this next installment of this new biker series and although they have some of the characters appearing in each one, they can be read on their own without losing any enjoyment.Steamy, intense, violent and heart-warming all at the same time with an awesome ending.These two books are a deal in this box set and I would recommend grabbing them while the price is low.**** 4 **** "coming home and getting back what you lost" stars

I read a lot of MC books and although this one had some good points, I'm on the fence about it. It was obvious that it was written with a lot of English slangs/terms and although I don't mind the fact it takes place in the UK, I wasn't a fan of the whole pregnant woman taken as payment for a debt and what happens to Heather when she gets to the MC was just not my cup of tea (an 8 month pregnant woman forced to dance/strip to pay a debt?)Blade is a hottie with a softer side and he takes her as his own to protect her and her baby but what goes on after the birth and the twist at the end with cliffhanger was just something that made me shake my head and roll my eyes. I was going to read the next book to see what happens but the price was raised up overnight so I won't be buying it just yet.An ok read for those who might like a different type of biker book but for me (who has read hundreds of them) it just wasn't realistic enough.**** 3.5 **** "he takes them both as his own" stars

Whew! This was a LONG one...and it was really good but so long that at times it just dragged on with way too much detail...although now that I am finished I understand that the author wanted to paint a crystal clear picture of the lives (past and present) of these four individuals.Ysabelle, Sebastian, Julia and Olivia...all of them had very different but complex personalities, lives and yet they all had so much to do with each other that it was an interesting mix of life experiences, emotional ties and fate that brought them all together.I think the storyline itself was well thought out and it was extremely deep at times (as well as very steamy and erotic) but I would have liked to see a bit less and maybe edited for some of the less than necessary background that weighed down the book and didn't really do anything to move the story along.It is a freebie right now so I'd get it while you can but be prepared for a very long (over 500 pages) read that is as sexy as it is heartbreaking and hard to stomach at times. I am interested in Madam's book which I will probably read next in the near future.**** 4 **** "you were meant to be mine all along" stars

Incandescent was a 5 star book for me and when we met Holly and Sy in that first book, I became instantly intrigued as to what their story was all about.Affliction gives you all the scoop and more, as we discover why Sy is so closed up, shut down and appearing to be cold and mean on the outside...and what really happened between him and Holly.When he and Holly get together, and Holly has to deal with the tragedy of her own loss after she and Kadence were kidnapped and injured, things get really real and through it all we see two people suffering with personal tragedy and nightmares.I mostly really liked this sequel with the exception of a few issues that bothered me (no condoms and bad reactions to a woman's personal tragedy) but for the rest of the story, I was happy to see the BFF's get their HEAs and some bad guys get their punishment.Looking forward to Jesse's book next.**** 4 **** "for the love of the children" stars

A pretty good short novella with a lot of heart and some extremely steamy romance...wow!Chelsea and Freak made the perfect couple and even though he was a little bit on the "freaky" side with his sexual games and dominant play, it was an enjoyable read with a serious and emotional family drama thrown into the mix.A really good intense freebie that is well worth the read for romance readers everywhere.**** 4 **** "they made perfect sense together" stars

This was a really hot and short piece of erotica...a prequel to the book Freak Out but honestly, you can just read Freak Out since the first 4 chapters are actually the prequel (I figured that out when I immediately jumped into the next book and thought I had the wrong file).A sexy, dark dude named Freak and Chelsea, the office girl who works in her Uncle's garage, have a moment in a broom closet that turns into an obsession for both of them and ends just when things are getting good.Both books are free right now.**** 4 **** "this could be the start of something real good" stars

I picked up this one based on all the great reviews and the fact it hit #1 in the kindle store...and of course I like to support male authors as well.It started off hard hitting and sexy with a danger beneath the surface that makes the story fit the title. As Faith needs to escape her abusive and mean-hearted BF who is the head of a ruthless biker club, she lands in the lap of Jackson, who tells her that he will take everything she has to give for his protection and to be warned that it will not be pretty.What started off as an exciting and intriguing twist on the bad boy biker train, became a sweet and almost melodramatic romance when Jackson returns to Faith after accomplishing what he set out to do...protect her from her past.Don't get me wrong, it was an entertaining and fun book to read, but it just was not as hard hitting as advertised and ended up being a pretty gentle story about getting back what you left behind and making things right...a father and son forming a strong bond and giving up your old badboy ways for the love of a good woman.A good deal at 99 cents and pretty romantic for having been written by a male's perspective.**** 4 **** "you can't judge a book (or a man) by the cover" stars

This book was almost everything I love in a good biker book...a ton of club action, strong alpha males, women who rule by being soft and tender and a whole lot of sexy romance. I especially loved the whole threesome aspect (I have read a couple other biker series that focused on threesomes and I love it!) and this particular one (Ares, 2Piece and Avery) was really emotionally satisfying while being hot hot hot as well.The storyline was very complicated and was a matter of history from the past coming back to bite the club in the behind...but it was easy to follow and left some questions yet to be answered, in my opinion. I really want to read Twist's story now, because he and Sadie are really an interesting match and both of them have pasts to deal with.Get this one while it's on sale and if you love an action packed biker book with a different twist on the romance (MMF), then you will love this one.**** 4 **** "they make a pretty hot threesome" stars

What a deal! For a limited time this edition contained Outlaw's Kiss and Never Love an Outlaw...two of Nicole Snow's biker bad boy books in one kindle file.As with all of her other books, we get the story of a "badboy" biker who changes after he gets involved with a beautiful, innocent young woman who is caught up in a life she never asked for or imagined in her wildest dreams.Skin and Megan made an interesting couple...sweet and gentle at times but when they become intimate, it all turns raw and gritty and naughty as hell. Keeping her safe from her abusive pimp and the other MC who would destroy what little humanity she has left, becomes Skin's mission (as well as keeping her for himself) while he is forced to look out for his own club and their best interests.I liked this one well enough as well as the bonus Outlaw's Kiss (which I had already read and reviewed a while ago) and recommend you grab it while it is 2 for 1.**** 4 **** "keeping the good girl safe" stars

I absolutely adore everything about Claire C. Riley's writing...it is always as magical and horrifyingly beautiful as it is deeply disturbing and utterly romantic in a "what if life was as much of a fantasy as this" way. If Romeo and Juliet had been witches, this might have been their story...a black witch and a white witch coven and the two young people who fall in love against all reason and not without serious consequences.When Sarah goes home for her grandmother's funeral, she is walking into her possible death scene..and who she discovers hidden away in her grandmother's cottage is a shocking slice of the past come back to haunt her and leaves her more determined to gain what power she feels entitled to before she and her house guest disappear.I loved the imagery in this book, the magic (of course) and the emotional pull of a woman who feels betrayed by those she should be able to trust...and all because she dared to love someone forbidden.It was as scary and intense as it was sweet and full of hope for a better future. This first book leaves the reader anxious for more and wondering where this all will lead and what on earth is in store for Sarah and Peter next. I can't wait to feel more of the magic!I received a free copy for an honest review.***** 5 ***** "meant to be together come heaven or hell" stars

Drew and Charity have come a long way from the teens they were in earlier books and from the time Drew set Charity free to fly on her own and achieve more than what her life had allowed her to be at that turbulent time with her stripper mother.When trouble at CRISIS calls her back home to help with a difficult case that becomes more of a personal mission instead, she reunites with that boy now turned into an even more gorgeous man, and together she and Drew take down an insidious enemy while rekindling what they had given up.I really admire this author's ability to draw us in and make us care for her characters...the long Heaven Hill history and family sagas keep on showing how much these people care for each other and I especially appeciated how maturely Charity and Drew behaved (even when Charity was being humiliated by a club whore and Drew was forced to hear the truth of what Charity had gone through as a teen). Wonderful and romantic sequel with some exciting action.I am looking forward to Mandy and Dalton's story now (that man needed a swift kick in the butt!) and the small cliffie we were left with is the start of some more major drama for the couple.I received a free copy of this book for an honest review.**** 4 **** "coming home and still being free" stars

I love my bikers rough and tough and I love my MM reads passionate but naughty...and with Layla Wolfe's Bent Zealots series, you get it all.Harte and Bond made an explosive combination...both dealing with issues of their own but finding an undeniable chemistry together that has raw, dirty sex written all over it.Wolfe does not write flowery, sweet, pretty romance...she writes in your face raunchy and realistic...gay men are a different breed in and out of the bedroom and so a fair warning that this is not for the prudish or easily shocked reader.I love the mix of family relationships ( a father and son on the outs from betrayal), a young trans teen who has to deal with the harsh realities of how society sees him and the MC's own problems with crooked  law enforcement and it all intertwines to make an exciting action packed twisted biker romance book.Be sure to read the first two books in the series first though, so you know the history of all the players...this is an awesome MM series with bite.I received a free copy of this book for an honest review.***** 4.5 ***** "coming out and coming together" stars

Young love is always so sweet and intense, but being gay and closeted because of your ethnicity can be even tougher and makes it near impossible to follow through with your desires.This is the case in this new romance from Lily Lamb and she writes with the knowledge of the Turkish culture...the music, the food and especially the attitudes of the people and specifically the parents of the adorable, virginal Ilhan. John is the hunky caretaker/maintenance man in his apartment complex who he has been watching lustfully from afar, and it was only a matter of time before the games and glances became touches, kisses and a relationship. Of course there's still the matter of Ilhan's old-fashioned, conservative parents and what will happen when they discover the big secret their son is hiding?I loved this sweet and very sexy new book...it was very interesting to read about all the Turkish customs and the food descriptions just made me hungry...not to mention the hotter than hell sex these two shared!A great second book full of family, honest conversation about coming out and romance.***** 5 ***** "coming out with a bang" stars

A great combination of a murder/suspense/thriller with a steamy/romantic erotica filled love story.Two young people who have lost their parents to tragedy, hiding out at the beach and discovering they have way more in common than they first thought, become a force to be reckoned with and hit the road in search of answers and hopefully solutions.I read this one in an afternoon and although there was a fair amount of repetitive sex scenes and I thought the characters acted and sounded much older than 19 and 21, it was enjoyable and a quick, fast paced read.It's on sale for 99 cents right now and was well worth the price for the entertainment value.Lots of violent action, explicit sexual scenes and some interesting twists.**** 4 **** "growing up and saving a life" stars

As with the first two books in this series, I loved Shades and Skylar's story...it was so thrilling and the romance was steamy hot and complicated.There were so many twists and secrets revealed in Skylar's life from past to present and when she gets herself involved with another MC and has to run back home for protection, she ends up turning Shades life upside down and bringing danger and drama home to the ones she loves.A figure from her past comes back into her life to make things even more complicated and I really can't say too much more without spoiling all the surprises, but I'll just say that Nicole James has kept up her five star book streak with me and I can't wait to read the next in the series.Excellent MC series for those who want a lot of romance, family drama and exciting club action in their biker books.***** 5 ***** "coming home to where she belongs" stars

A cop and an escort on the run...loved the blurb and really liked the exciting plot as well. It sounds like a simple enough idea but in true Skye Warren form, she always makes her stories dark with some interesting twists and the steamy romance is always in the forefront.Luke (the cop) and Philip (the former lover) make an interesting contrast to each other and Shelly is torn between the man who once wanted her but feels betrayed and the one she desperately wants but feels like she can't have because of their differences.It was really good and fun to read but just too short...I wanted more Luke and Shelly and even to know what happens with Philip's story later on.**** 4 **** "can a bad girl change her ways?" stars

I read Rage and Wrath's books in this series and really enjoyed this MC and their strong men and women. Thrash is a very different type of book but really good in its own way...as Thrash is a very internally sensitive man with an eye for art and a need for a strong woman who is much more cultured than what he gets around the club.Nora is a "starving artist" who has rich, abusive (and racist) parents and when she meets Thrash at a showing of her work, and he buys a painting of hers while flirting outrageously, she has no clue he is a biker and what big changes her life is about to take after meeting him.Revenge is big in Thrash's world and what Nora is asked to do after just having begun a relationship with Thrash is more than most women would be able to handle...but Nora is stronger than most women and in the end she proves herself worthy of being an ol' lady.A good and entertaining, intense addition to the series with a bit more depth and a satisfying ending that was a long time coming.**** 4 **** "beauty is where you find it" stars

I read the first book in this series last year and was blown away with how dark and painful it was to read...my heart literally hurt for Anna. I hadn't read any of the other books though so I was glad the complete set was on KU so I could read the rest of them and find out how it all ends.To say I was left shocked is an understatement...this book was so raw and at times very ugly that I had to keep putting it down, taking a break and then going back to it. Maybe I'm a glutton for punishment, but I just had to know all the secrets about who/what Anna really was and if Jack and Devin would get what they both deserved in the end.This was a brutal saga of immortals, humans...a paranormal fantasy with extreme BDSM content...nothing like I have ever read before and honestly, I'm not sure I have the stomach to read it again. Heed the warnings because they are no joke...this one will mess with your mind and make you cringe while reading but like an engrossing horror movie, you won't be able to turn away.**** 4 **** "painful, heartbreaking and victorious" stars

I pretty much just devour everything this woman writes and no matter what the genre I just know it will be awesome. I took Born Savages with me on vacation to read "in case I had a quiet moment" and go figure, it ended up completely taking me away from my trip because all I wanted to do was read it all day long until I was finished.A theatrical family...all pretty much drama queens in one way or another...and what happens when these five siblings reunite for a reality show, is the basic storyline for this book but with so much more depth and flashbacks to a time that was both joyful and depressing. Monty, Ren, Ava, Spence and Bree are as close as brothers and sisters can be (when you live with extremely dysfunctional and abusive parental figures) and the damages done from a childhood full of high expectations and low self-esteem is far reaching as they come together for a second chance (each for their own reasons) at love, life and hopefully, some healing. Enter Oscar/OZ, a once "almost Savage" and now working as a guide for caving expeditions...his forbidden romance and explosive past with Ren will return years later to shake up the family and bring even more drama to what proves to be a wild family reunion.I am a huge reality show junkie, so I just LOVED the storyline in this book and I was not disappointed with the outcome at all.Cora Brent's narratives were bitingly sarcastic, witty, crazy/funny sometimes and right on the mark as far as family dramas go where guilt and anger fuel the fires in the relationships. Lita is pure evil and what I would consider the "mom from hell" and her character was written in such a way that you want to forgive every wrongdoing of each child and applaud them all for just surviving.If you enjoyed the masterpiece that was Unruly, you will surely love Born Savages (a clever play on their family name and title of the show) and I know that I am desperately wanting the next book in the series which I hope will be about bad boy big brother Monty.I received a free copy of this book for an honest review.***** 5 ***** "the family that hates together, loves together" stars

OMG...Clarissa Wild has really gone to the ultra-dark side with this new one...geez...I could barely catch my breath. From the very beginning it was a race to the finish with so much adrenaline pumping through the story that I was worn out by the time I got to the end. Secrets, lies, betrayals both from ruthless parents to their children and lovers to lovers, made this story emotional and very personal for the characters.A young woman taken captive and forced to endure days of torture (both physical and psychological) at the hands of a surprising enemy whose motives are very personal, makes this a very hard to read and uncomfortable tale and believe me when I say, the violence is extremely graphic and the sexual games steamy as much as they are painful. It is very hard to say too much about what happens without spoiling the twists and surprises (except I did figure out what the big secret was partway through) but let me just say that this one is very complicated and takes family loyalty and respect to a whole new level.Not for the sensitive reader or those who don't like scenes of abuse/non-con sexual contact/extreme bloody violence.I received a free copy in exchange for an honest review.**** 4 **** "breaking each other down just to be whole again" stars

After the quick ending of the first book, I am so glad this novella was released that explains what happened between the end of that book and the epilogue.Zeke and Patience are still suffering from the after effects of their dysfunctional and horrible childhoods and in attempting to "deal" with her issues on her own, Patience turns to the wrong type of "help" sending herself into a downward spiral of addiction.Zeke has a hard time keeping his explosive temper in check and before there is that HEA, they have to both hit rock bottom first.Good follow-up to their love story and makes what they have much sweeter as a result.**** 4 **** "after tragedy comes the sunshine" stars

I like a good rock book and although this was the start of a series about the Blow Hole Boys...it was more about the beginning and the relationship between Patience and Zeke.Both of these characters were abuse victims (both emotional and physical) and what happens to them on their journey past their terrible childhoods and towards a brighter future together, is the main portion of this first book. It had some very tense and upsetting, violent moments and the scenes with Patience and her dad were horrific but after the initial main "meat" of the story, things were wrapped up fairly fast and the ending was a bit too quick (in my opinion) after ALL we had to experience before we got to the ending.I am about to start the next one in the series, so looking forward to that one as well.**** 4 **** "things a daddy should never do to his child" stars

This was quite a long and interesting book...full of mystery, suspense, darkness and a whole lot of steamy goodness as well. Nobody in this story was completely light or dark, good or bad...everyone had flaws, virtues and secrets being kept from the ones they loved and in the end (when all is revealed), we were able to see that life can go on and you can be fulfilled despite your own self-destructive ways.I really enjoyed this book (although it seemed to take forever to read) and although I found Juliette to be at times very frustrating, Vi an absolute brat and Killian a despicable jerk...I still came to love them all by the end of the book and hope to maybe get another one featuring Vi or even Arlo (because I think he needs redemption and I am curious what became of him afterwards).Get it while it's on sale and enjoy the depraved and dark ride through their world.***** 4.5 ***** "the more you push, the more I pull" stars

Wow...this was one jam-packed crazy mess of a sequel and it was just as thrilling and sexy as the first book.Scar and Emery are still on the run and keep getting caught up in one bad situation after another...and it gets to the point of not knowing who to trust anymore.There were a lot of plot developments and twists in this book with many secrets revealed and many yet to come to light.Very violent, graphic sex and abuse towards women and a lot of "brothers" double-crossing each other...what an unbelievable and exciting continuation of a story that is not yet even close to being resolved. Guess I have to wait for the next installment to get more answers.**** 4 **** "so much at stake to gain and lose" stars

I read Rewind first and so it was good to already know the history of Harley and Ryder's parents before starting this one. That being said, you could still read Unstoppable and enjoy it (since they do explain how the kids came to be born at the same time and why they were so close) but it adds a bit to know that history does repeat itself somewhat. That issue is the only part of the book that bothered me (that and another secret we find out near the end) but for the most part, it was an intense story of friendship, family ties and coming-of-age with the poignant pain of survivng abusive relationships and rape.Be prepared for an extremely emotional and at times really hard to read book but know that life is not always pretty and love and the truth can sometimes be triumphant in the long run.**** 4 **** "meant to be forever" stars

I got this freebie and yes, it was dirty, raunchy, violent and crass but I still liked it and read it in one sitting. I was pretty much figuring out how things would go down as they happened though (and kind of rolling my eyes at the fact that a professional hitman didn't recognize his mark even with hair color changed) but putting that aside, I enjoyed it for what it was...a fantasy of a revenge story with two damaged individuals who needed the pain and kink to get off in their dangerous and unhappy lives.I am mildly curious to see how it will all end...but will wait until the rest of the series goes on sale to find out.**** 3.5 **** "there is no mercy among killers" stars

OHHH man...I loved this first book in the Stripped series a lot. True, it was about Honor and not Clara (although both of their stories are explained and elaborated on quite well) but since she was the older sister when they escaped and thus, the one most likely to have her story told first, I really appreciated it and was not disappointed.The mysterious Ivan, his bouncer Blue and the other girls were all very intriguing...but none more so than the darkly dangerous and sexy as hell Kip. I was on the edge of my seat every scene he was in and it took me quite a while to figure out what he was doing and who he really was and by then, like with Honor/Honey...it was way too late to get away from him and instead, I just hung on for the backlash.I was very pleased with how things were resolved as well and can't wait to read the rest of the books in this series. Another mind-blower from Skye Warren.**** 4 **** "loved the way he and she lied" stars

A really good, slightly dark and mysterious prequel to the Stripped series and if it's anything like Warren's other books, I just know we are in for a really sexy thrill ride when we get into the rest of the stories.Not very long but with enough "meaty content" to set up what's sure to be an exciting "on-the-run" saga for these two sisters.**** 4 **** "time to get tough girls" stars

Oh my that was hot!! Strippers and bikers...and a biker who is a stripper...yes please and thank you! I really loved this one in the series and it looks like they are just getting better as I go.The story of Kinkaid, his grandpa and Sadie, the girl he grew up with as his best buddy, was honest, heartbreaking, sexy and fun. There was plenty of witty bantering and sexual tension between Kink and Sadie with a big helping of funny wisdom from grandpa as well.I liked the storyline, the history and the way everything turned out!**** 4 **** "Magic Mike on a bike" stars
These tiny designer gift pouches are just gorgeous! The colors are bright and they will make gift giving so much more fun =)Came from China but were beautifully made.***** 5 ***** "gorgeous stars"

These small bottles were perfect for giveaways...I just added lotions and decals on the front as gifts. The caps stay on tight and the bottles are strong plastic so they don't crush!***** 5 ***** "perfect size and shape" stars

These little decals were perfect for my shower stall floor. It was really slippery until I applied two packages of these in a pattern on the floor and now they work great. So far they have stayed put and are still colorful and clean. Love them! Just wish they came in larger size and different shapes!**** 4 **** "making my shower safer" stars

I have actually read all 6 of the books in this series and they all were 5 star reads for me...and the fact that the first four are in this discounted box set is a really good deal for those who are just starting this awesome biker series.All of the characters are very complex and richly described with fantastic storylines and some really big surprises are to be discovered (especially when you get into the final books).You will definitely want to buy the final two books after getting through this set as the cliffhangers at the end of each one make you want to immediately jump into the next one!Lots of steamy sex, plenty of club action and some deeply moving family drama make up The Kingsmen MC series and I know my biker book reading friends will love them all.***** 5 ***** "family by blood or by choice makes no difference" stars

I have read several books in this series and although Breaking Beauty had some interesting ideas, it just wasn't what I was expecting and not enough "biker" for my taste. It was different to get an inside view of the "secret" gambling rooms in Vegas and what "card counting" is all about but there were just too many "coincidences" and surprise reveals at the end to make it very believable.Romy and Bryson made a HOT couple for sure but so much of the story was filled with such sleazy characters, it made my skin crawl.As always, I do enjoy these biker romances from Celia Loren, but this one was not one of my favorites.**** 3.5 **** "getting away with the con" stars

Once again M.N. Forgy has told a story of love, lust, hatred, passion and regret all tied up in an awesome biker family package.When Dani bravely comes back to face her father and Shadow she is ready to take whatever they have to dish out (or so she thinks), since anything is better than dealing with her lying, back-stabbing mother. What happens to her when she returns to the fold is heartbreaking, violent but ultimately shows what she's really made of and how strong her connection really is to both her dad and her man.This one was chock full of romance, hot sex, club action and some really twisted family drama and I loved every second of it.I can't wait to see what this author has up her sleeve for future books.***** 4.5 ***** "coming home to where you belong" stars

I've had this series on my wishlist for a while now and as soon as this book went on sale I had to grab it! I really liked it for the most part despite a few issues (editing errors, changing POV from one sentence to the next with no warning) and although the sequence of events was a bit rushed and at times unrealistic, I really liked the couple of Ashton and Ethan "Trigger".The action in this MC romance was more about protecting Ashton from her abusive husband and his bodyguards and less about the actual MC business that most biker books deal with. I did also notice that all the women (from the club whores to the old ladies) were extremely nice...no nasty, crazy catfights and that was different as well. The Sacred Hearts seemed to be more about family and their brotherhood in arms and less about illegal or criminal activities (with the exception of getting revenge).If you like a biker book with more romance and focused on relationships and not the club per se...then this book is for you. Don't be surprised if you start humming the soundtrack to Les Mis after reading though...lol!**** 4 **** "a broken princess and her white knight" stars

I was pulled in by the blurb, then captivated by the first few chapters of this dark, psychological romance and then had to force myself to skip some long drawn out portions to get to the good stuff.There was an interesting dystopian/futuristic world feel to this story but I got bored with a lot of the over-explained inner dialogue of the main characters Tate/Viper and Autumn...and it just seemed to take too much effort to get to their actual relationship.Maybe I'm just too jaded and have read so many dark, gritty slave/Master books that I expect a lot from my reads (sometimes they are too similar), but it was still good and I did read until the very (not surprising) end. If you like a romance that is very full of mental games to go along with the physical ones, then you will probably like this book and right now it is 99 cents so it's a deal.**** 3.5 **** "she is his because she wants to be" stars

A really short but very sexy and steamy start to a new MC romance series with an interesting story and some thrilling secrets yet to be revealed.I usually don't like when an author releases short sections and forces you to buy them all when they make up one normal length book...ends up costing way more than one book...so I will hold off getting the next 4 in the series unless she releases them all as one book.It was really good and well written, but at less than 80 pages there was not enough time to give us more history and character development.I enjoyed it and devoured it in one sitting.**** 4 **** "Harleys are made for riding long and hard" stars

I got this free MC "romance" and for the most part it was good...fast paced and mostly steamy but with a heavy dose of reality as it dealt with physical and emotional abuse in a relationship (and not between the biker and the girl).I found the heroine Sydney to be a little annoying with her back and forth behavior with the abusive BF and especially having her family be bikers, she should have been tougher and more street smart. Cade was the at first, unattainable hot biker who was there to defend her most of the time, but dealing with his own family issues left him vulnerable to sabotage by another woman and all kinds of misunderstandings happen before things get straightened out.Plenty of sex, violence and a cautionary tale for women to be careful who they wish for...sometimes the baddest boys look like your harmless next door neighbor.**** 3.5 **** "love is not supposed to be painful" stars

Well I can't even express how great this book was and how awesome and deliciously wrong it was all at the same time!A woman who is in the wrong place at the wrong time with her addicted gambler BF when the bookie comes collecting his debt and the man who she will ultimately come to despise and hate with all her being...while falling in love with him.There were so many complex characters and interwoven storylines in this one and it was fantastic and such an exciting read I barely stopped until it was finished...but OMG that cliffhanger ending! I knew it was coming but hoped everyone would be clever enough to prevent it, but oh yeah...now it will be a race to the end to find out who will come out of this alive and how many more secrets are yet to be revealed.**** 4 **** "hating her captor but loving the broken man" stars

I found this book by accident but that blurb pulled me in...nothing sexier than a hot, dangerous modern day pirate and a woman who was caught in the wrong place at the wrong time. It was exciting, passionate and full of interesting facts about illegal artifacts and smuggling which gave the story an almost realistic feel to it, but filled with a lot of sexual tension as well. I felt like the whole Dom/slave thing was unneccesary though (it just didn't feel right for some reason) and it was the only issue I had with the book that made it less enjoyable. Nick was much more than he was portrayed to be and Ellie was not quite "forced" to submit in the way the description leads us to believe.I really enjoyed the intrigue, romance and unexpected twists to the story and would definitely want to read more form this author.**** 4 **** "he owns the biggest treasure of them all" stars

This was a very interesting stepbrother romance with a slightly different twist. In this case Slade was a total bad boy who used his stepsister as revenge against his own father...but then left home to become...gasp...a doctor.You would think that becoming a healer and taking an oath to take care of people would change the manwhore...but nope, that would be too easy.When stepsister Iris is forced to put their shady and very steamy past behind her for a greater good and sets out to find him, the only person she believes is able to save her younger brother's life, will Slade's feelings for her be enough to convince him to help or will he prove himself to be the biggest jerk in the world.I really enjoyed this fast paced and biting story about a childish grudge gone bad and the far reaching consequences of one man's selfish actions. It was as emotionally sad as it was sexually charged...Slade and Iris had an off-the-charts chemistry and I was very pleased with the end result of their mutual desire to set things right.I received a free copy of this book for an honest review.**** 4 **** "to forgive, forget and heal yourself" stars

Well, it's toilet paper, so there's not a ton to say about it. Here's the good and the bad.Good:1. It's definitely thick and strong. I was even able to wet it and use it to clean something without it turning to mush.2. The package will last quite some time.Bad:1. It's not soft at all.2. I felt like the roll ran out fast.3. The fact that it didn't turn to mush when I got it wet might be an issue for septic systems.

I received this item free in return for an honest review.  I have nothing to gain by giving it an unearned positive review.  That said, I am very pleased.  I’m not a big griller, but have been using the gloves in place of my old oven mitts in the kitchen.  I really like them.  They do a great job of keeping the heat out, they are much thinner than my old ones which makes it easy to maneuver items in the oven, and when I stick my thumb in something I’m cooking (which happens regularly), I can just rinse them off.My advice to the seller would be to market these in two ways.  The first would be as they are where they are sold as a set along with other grill items.  The second way would be to sell just the gloves for use in the oven.

Overall, I’m not too impressed with these headphones.Pros:1. They have a microphone which a lot of over ear headphones don’t have.2. They are relatively inexpensive.3. They are small, so they would fit smaller heads or children better than some other headphones.Cons:1. They’re gaudy.  I mean really gaudy.2. The sound quality is mediocre.3. While they are relatively inexpensive, I have purchased $15 over the hear headphones that had much better sound.These might be something I would recommend for a child who really doesn’t care about sound quality.  They should fit a child well too.  For an adult looking for a nice set of headphones, keep looking.

I have had great luck with Amazon Basic cables in the past and the same is true with this one.  I’ve been using it a few weeks with no issues.  The plug is small enough that it works well even with cases.  I love the length.  I’ve got it plugged into a power strip under my bed and can easily have devices plugged in still use them without feeling tethered.

I picked this up for my 15 year old daughter because she loves Hello Kitty.  She’s been using it for a few weeks now and really likes it.  Quality wise, it is comparable to any three ring binder.  She likes it because it stays closed, but she says it is much easier and quicker to get into than a zip up binder.  She is using it at school and hauling it back and forth daily in a backpack.  So far, it is holding up well.  The print is very cute and nicer than I expected from the stock photos.

I received this item free in exchange for an honest review.  I was not paid for a positive review and there is no benefit for me in giving a positive or negative review.With that said, I feel like this item has a lot of pros and a few cons.Pros:1. The whole concept of the characters on the cards coming to life is cute (a bit of a Skylanders rip off, but that’s okay).2. Most boys in the intended 5-8 age range love Ninja Turtles, so they're drawn without the feel of an educational toy so much.3. The graphics were excellent for a LeapPad device.4. The different games you can play with he app and cards were appropriate for the 5-8 age range it is marketed to.5. The device stores the cards after they’re scanned (since they will get lost of mangled).Cons:1. The last thing most kids need is a game that requires a card deck.  They’re forever strung all over the bedroom, folded up, lost, etc.2. The technology (setting up the cards and scanning) may be difficult for younger kids and might require adults to help a lot.Overall, it is a cute concept, but I’d like to see something more durable than a card stack being used and I feel like the whole concept needs to be used in the games for older kids who are able to understand the technology needed to play the game independently.  With that said, I still gave it five stars because the good greatly outweighs the bad on this game.

I received this item free in exchange for an honest review.  I was not paid for a positive review and there is no benefit for me in giving a positive or negative review.With that said, I feel like this item has a lot of pros and a few cons.Pros:1. The whole concept of the characters on the cards coming to life is cute (a bit of a Skylanders rip off, but that’s okay).3. The graphics were excellent for a LeapPad device.4. The different games you can play with he app and cards were appropriate for the 4-7 age range it is marketed to (although many 7 year olds might find it below their academic level).5. The device stores the cards after they’re scanned (since they will get lost of mangled).Cons:1. The last thing most kids need is a game that requires a card deck.  They’re forever strung all over the bedroom, folded up, lost, etc.2. The technology (setting up the cards and scanning) may be difficult for younger kids and might require adults to help a lot.Overall, it is a cute concept, but I’d like to see something more durable than a card stack being used and I feel like the whole concept needs to be used in the games for older kids who are able to understand the technology needed to play the game independently.  With that said, I still gave it five stars because the good greatly outweighs the bad on this game.

I'll admit, I stopped using Hefty bags a few years ago due to all the issues I had with them tearing. I was a bit hesitant to pick these up, but since they were free in exchange for an honest review, I figured I had nothing to lose.Well, I'm happy to say that I was pleasantly surprised. The quality of these is very good. They are nice and thick and don't tear even when I crammed more things in them than I really should have. They also stood up to pointy corners which can take down even high quality bags.I'm now rethinking my stance against Hefty and maybe I'll try their kitchen bags again.

I received these earrings and have, so far, been very pleased.Pros:1. The size is perfect.  Not too big, but not too small.2. The Amazon price (currently about sixteen dollars) is very reasonable.  They are absolutely not eighty dollar earrings which is what Amazon shows as the MSRP right now.3. They are sterling silver and stamped 925 on the back.4. My ears tend to be a bit sensitive, but I’ve not had any issues at all with sensitivity to these.5. They are lightweight and don’t pull on the earlobes at all.6. They are hooks, but come with the little rubber backs so they don’t fall out of  your ears and get lost.I really haven’t found any cons.  I read one review that described them as “machine stamped”.  I actually pulled the earring out of my ear and looked at it after reading that and I don’t feel that they looked stamped at all.  They’re not $100 earrings, but for the price, I’m very pleased.

Maybe I’m just very childish, but I’m in love with the Ugglys Pets in general.  This truck was my first introduction to them and we have since bought four other packs of animals/homes.Pros:1. It is the perfect level of potty humor for the recommended age range.  With both of my kids, farts, poop, burps, etc. were/are hilarious between the ages of about 4 and 10.  Oh, who am I kidding, they’re still hilarious.2. The truck creates and activity to do with the little Ugglys Pets that otherwise could be kind of boring just sitting around.  The truck gives them more play value.3. There are quite a few different vulgar sounds, so it isn’t the same two or three things over and over.4. It is very durable and well made.Cons:1. It is kind of loud.  I would have loved a volume button.2. I wish it came with more than one pet.  It really needs at least two.  Of course, there are around 100 more you can buy separately!Overall, I really do like this toy.  For boys, it is something different.  (For girls it kind of reminded me of Littlest Pet Shop.)  I’ve already bought my soon to be 6 year old nephew a truck and pets for his birthday.  My sister will love me!

I've been using this product for a few days and am very pleased. It is easy to use, doesn't weigh down my hair, tames any minor frizz ones, and leaves my hair looking shiny and healthy. No complaints here!

I received this item free in exchange for an honest review.  I was not paid for a positive review and there is no benefit for me in giving a positive or negative review.With that said, I feel like this item has a lot of pros and cons.  Many of the cons would go away if the age range shifted to older kids.Pros:1. The whole concept of the characters on the cards coming to life is cute (a bit of a Skylanders rip off, but that’s okay).2. My kids loved the Paw Patrol theme because the characters are recognizable and well loved already.3. The graphics were excellent for a LeapPad device.4. The actual math was age appropriate for 3-5 year olds.5. The device stores the cards after they’re scanned (since they will get lost of mangled).Cons:1. The last thing any 3 year old needs is a game that requires a card deck.  They’re forever strung all over the bedroom, folded up, lost, etc.2. While some of the math was appropriate for a 3 year old, the technology really wasn’t.  It most definitely requires a parent helping (usually while the kid cries because you’ve taken his toy away).  Things like getting the photo of the card was too technologically advanced for a 3 year old.  A child on the older end of the age range probably would be fine with it.Overall, it is a cute concept, but I’d like to see something more durable than a card stack being used and I feel like the whole concept needs to be used in the games for older kids who are able to understand the technology needed to play the game independently.  I dinged one star for the age range issue and gave it four stars because the educational value, graphics, and games are very good.

I have really enjoyed this book. I will say, there have been times when I felt like it was getting slow or I had read 50 pages and really not progressed in the story, but as soon as I thought that, something big would happen and suck me back in.This isn't the kind of story where it goes on and on and then everything wraps up in the last 30 pages. There are big events happening throughout the story. I kept thinking I knew who the killer was, but I was wrong in the end.I did ding one star due to the lulls in the story line, but it's still a book is recommend.

I’m not brand loyal when it comes to dishwasher detergent, so I’ve used quite a few brands over the years.  In general, I find them to all be about the same.  This product claims to provide maximum shine, ultimate clean, and no need to pre-rinse.• Did it make my dishes shine?  Yes.  Do other detergents?  Yes.• Did it clean the dishes?  Yes.  Do other detergents?  Yes.• Did it eliminate the need to pre-rinse?  No.  Do other detergents?  No.  (Let’s face it, when there are Spaghetti-O’s flinging around in the dishwasher, they’re going to get stuck to everything if you don’t rinse them off first.)I do want to add, I don’t live in a house with hard water.  My review might be completely different if I did.  I have lived with hard water and know the layer of film that creates.  It might be that I would have a different opinion of I were dealing with that.Overall, I feel this is a good dishwasher detergent, but I didn’t find it superior to the other cheaper options on the market.

I have three cats and this was a total flop with all three. First off, the flashing light in the ball was dead on arrival.  I removed the battery tab and nothing happened.  I searched for directions to see if there was more I needed to do and there were none in or on the box.  As for the cats, one actually got up and walked away when it was placed in front of him and the other two were completely oblivious. They didn't want to sit on the "lounger" (which is just cardboard for scratching) and were actually more interested in the box.  Maybe others will have better luck, but ours didn't work out of the box and we were 0 for 3 with the cats.

Let me preface by saying, I’m not a camper, therefore, I’m not a sleeping bag connoisseur.  My son has been complaining that we never go camping, so for his 8th birthday, I bought him a tent (a real camping tent) so he could camp in the back yard.  Well, of course, he needed a sleeping bag, so when I had the chance to pick this up and review it, I jumped on it.Overall, I’m pleased with the sleeping bag for our use.  I have no idea if it will really keep you warm in 20 degree weather or not though because my son won’t be camping in the back yard when it’s that cold.  The sleeping bag is very comfortable.  It is well padded which is a must for sleeping on the ground.  The construction is amazing and will definitely hold up for years to come.A few things I didn’t like were that it was very difficult to put away.  Luckily, I just have to get it from the back yard into the house, but if I were backpacking, this would be a huge issue.  Once rolled back up, there is no way to tie it shut, so that is a struggle.  It comes with a bag, but I quickly gave up on getting it back in the bag.  So, we wrapped a bungee cord around it and put it in the closet.  I just don’t understand why a $75 sleeping bag wouldn’t have a way to tie it closed.As a whole, it is a very good sleeping bag with one flaw (the lack of a tie).  I dinged it one star for that, but it is still a sleeping bag I would recommend to a camper.

I have been struggling with dry ends that want to split and break.  I expect most of it is due to using a hair dryer, so I was excited to try this product. I’ve been using it for about a week now and can tell a difference.  I’m not sure if I’m just adding moisture or if it is really shielding my hair from the blow dryer damage, but either way, it is working well.  I was a bit concerned when I first used it because it is kind of an oily consistency, but it absorbed into my hair well and didn’t leave it feeling sticky or weighted down in any way.

I'm very pleased with this. I've been struggling with dry hair, but my hair is also fine and flat a lot of the time. Usually, a conditioner for body means it won't condition well. Not this one!Pros:1. It has a very pleasant scent. Not too overpowering, but just right.2. The conditioner does a great job of conditioning and leaves hair soft.3. It really does help with body.Cons: I haven't found any yet.

I picked this hair dryer up specifically for the conditioning ring. Even though it is summer and crazy humid, I've been struggling with very dry hair. When I first got the dryer, I looked at the ring and it didn't look like much. I'm still not sure how it's supposed to work, but I attached it to the dryer no gave its shot.I've been using the dryer for a few days ad I'm not sure the conditioning ring is doing much. With that said, I really do like the dryer. It blows a ton of air, but isn't nearly as hot as my old dryer (even on the hottest setting).  The thing is, with the increased airflow, my hair dries just as quick as before without the damaging effects of the high heat.I did ding one star since I really don't see the conditioning ring doing anything, but other than that, I really like this dryer.

I was having issues with dry, broken ends of my hair when I decided to try the TRESemme Expert Selection Weightless Silicone Free Conditioner and was very pleased with it.  Based on that, I decided to try the shampoo as well.Pros:1. It definitely cuts through the gunk.  My hair felt very clean.2. The scent is pleasant, but not over powering.Cons:1. It dried my hair out and, even with the new conditioner, my hair was hard to comb and felt dry all day.

I picked up this toaster because the one at home is about 20 years old and doesn’t have a lot of the functionality of this one.Pros:1. The settings seem to be dead on.  When I choose to make toast, I push the button and when it pops, it is perfect.  The same is true with other items.2. It can be adjusted both width and height to fit whatever you’re toasting perfectly.  This is great for someone who is sick of trying to cram a bagel in the toaster or whose Pop Tart is forever falling over in the toaster making it hard to get out.3. It makes toasted sandwiches!  This was the functionality that I liked the most.  I love a toasted turkey sandwich.  Before, I had to toast the bread and microwave the turkey (which I think makes it taste funny).  The basket allows you to make the sandwich, put it in the basket, put the basket in the toaster, and get a perfect sandwich that doesn’t fall apart while toasting.Cons:1. When I received it, my first thought was that it was huge.  It is big enough to put toast or a bagel in side by side which makes it pretty long and it takes up quite a bit of counter space.2. As silly as it sounds, it is complex.  I’m still not sure if I’m supposed to put everything in the basket or if I can put things directly in the toaster.  Depending on the directions you read, it is different.  Maybe you can do either?  If I bought this for my grandma, she would be lost and would go back to her old toaster.3. While it is a nice product, it is WAY overpriced.  It is a toaster.  I can get a toaster for $15.Overall, I like the toaster.  It works just as it claims to.  I did ding a star based on the complexity and the price.

I want to break this review out into different sections since the box comes with so many items.  In the box, you can expect to find one package of newborn diapers, two packages of size 1 diapers, one wipe refill bag, a plastic zippered travel wipe container (with wipes), and coupons.Wipes RefillI love Huggies wipes.  I think they’re better than anything else on the market.  They’re just the right thickness and are soft, but not too soft.  I’ve used them on bottoms, but they are also great for wiping little hands, wiping dirty faces, wiping the counter, and they take off eye makeup better than any eye makeup remover I’ve ever used!Zippered WipesThis is a great idea!  So many times our travel pack of wipes gets mangled.  This is durable and easy to refill with more wipes.  Why has no one done this sooner?DiapersUnfortunately, I’m not as big of a Huggies diaper fan as I am the wipes.  These are a little nicer than the Huggies of the past, but still don’t compare to Pampers.  I will say, I loved the soft inside.  I’ve never really understood the diapers that are soft on the outside since that part isn’t against the baby’s skin.  These are SOOO soft on the inside.  They have a nice elastic waist and a wetness indicator (although I find this gimmicky because it’s not rocket science to tell if a diaper is wet).  The biggest problem I have with these diapers is that they don’t hold urine well.  Too many times, we had wet clothes, but when I removed the diaper, the diaper was barely wet.  I actually joked that it was like they repelled urine.  For me, this is a deal breaker when it comes to diapers.Overall, I’m pleased with the set.  It’s a great assortment of diaper sizes and wipes.  I’m only knocking off one star for the leaky diapers because that is a small part of the set and I know some people don’t have problems with them leaking.  Maybe it’s just the shape of my kids!

I picked up this set because I’ve been trying to add some weight training to my workout, but there are days when I simply can’t get to the gym.  I figured this would be a good substitute.Pros:1. Very easy to use.  Just choose the exercise you want to do, place the bands over a door, and set it to the level indicated on the exercise card.2. I found that most of the exercises had decent resistance.3. Very small and easy to store/transport.4. They seem to be very durable.Cons:1. Limited exercises on the card.  I would have liked to see more.  I realize I can make up my own, but it would be nice to have instructions about position and the level that is recommended on the bands.2. A small carrying bag would have been nice.Overall, these aren’t going to replace weight training in the gym, but is a good substitute for traveling or days when you simply can’t get to the gym.

I have tried numerous products that claim to kill weeds while not killing the grass.  I have yet to find one that is effective.  Usually, the weed wilts a little and then is just fine within a few days.  I was excited to try this product hoping for better results.  When I received it, I went outside and saturated four dandelions and one prickly weed.  A day later, the dandelions had done the usual wilting and the prickly weed was looking a little less green.  The second day, the dandelions hadn’t changed, but the prickly weed was looking pretty dead.  After about five days, I’m pretty sure the prickly weed is dead, but all four dandelions are bouncing back.  I will say, the product didn’t harm the grass at all.Overall, I found this product to be about as effective as any other weed killer that won’t kill the grass.  It seems that none of them are strong enough to kill the dandelions.  I was pleased with how it killed the prickly weed, but since I had one of those in my whole yard and hundreds of dandelions, the weeds I really needed it to kill didn’t die.  So, I’m still on the hunt for a weed killer that is stronger than this one.

I work for a large corporation (over 50,000 employees) and manage one person.  I was interested in this book as a way to evaluate how I’m managed as well as what kind of a manager I am.Pros:1. I think the book is dead on when discussing things like the impact of layoffs and  how a company that is loyal to its employees in hard times will create employees who are loyal right back when times are good and they could easily find other work.  I found myself sitting nodding my head and seeing the shortcomings of my company numerous times2. The 12 rules were perfect.  I really thing the seventh rule, “Don’t Kill the Meaning” was my favorite.  It essentially says that people will be more engaged and happier if they don’t see something they worked hard for destroyed in front of them.  I know my company struggles with this one.  We build applications and immediately replace them or marketing puts together new colors and logos and within two years, they’ve been replaced.  People sit and watch everything they worked for get replaced.  I also really liked “Magnify Their Success”.  This is something I’ve tried to do for awhile.  Something as simple as a pizza party after completing a project makes people feel appreciated.3. Management books can be very boring, but this book was full of stories and examples of good and bad management and was actually a fun, interesting read.Cons: The only con I found was that while the book focused on what to do and what not to do, I didn’t feel like I left understanding how to implement a lot of these things.  For example, one section talked about being cool and how one company allowed employees to wear shorts and flip flops all summer.  That is great, but most of us don’t have the authority to make those decisions.  So many examples of how were shown from a senior management level.  I would have liked to see more ideas on how to implement these things at a lower management level.

I picked this up for my 15 year old daughter and she really likes it. She saw drastically reduced redness after the first application. She's been using it for about a week now and is pleased with the performance. It also didn't dry her shim out the way her prescription Epiduo did. Overall, she's very happy with it and would recommend it to others.

I received this product for free to review.  In my opinion, that makes me about as unbiased as anyone since I’m not angry about having wasted my money (and I would feel that way if I had paid for it).  I was very, very disappointed in this monitor.  When I ready through the description and saw all the bells and whistles, I was very excited, but unfortunately, most of them don’t work well at all.1. I was able to get the handheld device to work, but the app never did.  No matter how many times I installed and uninstalled, it just kept crashing.  I finally gave up.  So, sorry, I can’t rate the quality of the app beyond this.2. The picture quality of the handheld is pretty bad in the day and very bad at night.  For $250, I would expect the camera to be much better quality than this.  Or maybe it’s the handheld.  I don’t know.  I just know it’s bad.  Let’s face it, it’s 2015.  Cheap phone cameras work better.3. As if the video quality weren’t bad enough, there is a lag which is very annoying.4. I like the idea of a thermometer on the device.  I can’t tell you how many times I check on the baby to make sure he isn’t hot or cold.  But, the thermometer is pretty inaccurate so I’m concerned when I shouldn’t be and not concerned when I should be.5. The battery life on the handheld is poor.There were a few nice things about it.  For example, the video feed is secured, you can zoom and pan from the handheld, and it has the ability to add more cameras setup if you have more than one child.In all though, for $250, this should have been a top of the line monitor system and it simply isn’t.  Keep looking.

I’ll admit two things before completing this review.  1. It’s been about 6 years since I bought a high chair, so I’m not completely up to date on all the bells and whistles available by competitors.  2. I picked this up for my nephew to use when he’s at my house which means it isn’t getting daily use.  Therefore, it’s impossible for me to rate how well holds up with continual use.Pros:1. The biggest seller for me was how well it folds and stores.  Since I only get it out for my nephew, I want it out of the way when he’s not here and this high chair fit the bill.2. The cover is relatively easy to clean.  Like all high chairs, you ‘ll need to get into the grooves which is a bit of a pain.3. There is the main tray and then kind of a tray insert.  This is a nice feature for someone who wants to put a child in the chair and then prepare the food.  I never used it this way though.4. The tray comes with a cover.  I like this a lot because I can clean the tray, cover it, store the highchair, and know it will be clean the next time I need it.5. The tray is dishwasher safe.6. The assembly was very simple.7. I got the ecru color and like how it is completely gender neutral8. The height adjustment was great.  My table has kind of a lip and I’ve had problems actually pushing a high chair up to the table because it will hit.  With this one, if it hits, I can just lower it a notch and go on.Cons:1. As with all full sized high chairs, it takes up a lot of floor space when in use.  For daily use, I actually prefer a space saver high chair that attaches to a chair.2. Because the inner tray doesn’t completely cover the sides of the main tray, you end up having to wash both of them with every meal.Overall, I feel that the pros greatly outweigh the cons on this highchair which is why I gave ti all five stars.

I was pleasantly surprised when this barn arrived.  My daughter had had one ages ago and I really expected the quality to have gone down over the years, but if anything, it has gotten better.Pros:1. Finally, a toy that actually comes with enough figures.  We’ve had toy after toy that come with minimal figures (or cars in anything that uses cars) and to fully enjoy the item, the parent needs to buy more.  This barn comes with one farmer, six animals (cow, goat, horse, pig, chicken, sheep), and a bale of hay.  There are enough figures to completely fill the barn, so no need to buy more. The style of the figures is typical Little People and they could easily be used with other sets.2. It is a very good size, but not heavy or awkward for little kids or parents.3. Overall, the barn is very sturdy.  This could take a tumble down the stairs and come out just fine on the other side.  This is very important with toddlers who will do things like use it as a step or sit on it.4. The barn sings, but it isn’t too annoying and can easily be shut off.  It came with batteries.5. After it is latched, it is easy for a small child to open.  There aren’t any latches or tight fits.  It stays closed okay.  Not great, just okay.6. Has a carrying handle which is very nice because it is a decent size.7. The age range is close.  Closer than some other toys, but I can’t imagine a 5 year old would be interested in this.  I would say it’s more like 1-4.  Also, since there aren’t small parts, supervised, I think a child under 1 could play with it.Cons:1.The packaging.  Oh, the packaging.  It took me forever to get all the parts out because everything was zip tied, taped, enclosed in plastic (that was also taped), etc.  About halfway through trying to open it, I caught myself thinking, “Well, this is the first thing I’m putting in this review!”  If you’ve got a toddler who will be waiting for you to get it opened, open it before showing it to him/her.2. It doesn’t come assembled.  You have to remove screws and then reinstall them to put together the two halves.  It isn’t complex, but does require a phillips screwdriver.3. We’re getting ready to go away for a weekend and this is a toy I plan to bring.  I noticed last night that there is nowhere secure to put the figures where they won’t fall out when being carried.  On my daughter’s barn (ages ago) you could put them in the silo and close it.  This one doesn’t have that.Even with the few cons, I really like this barn.  The negative things are minor compared to the things I really like which is why I didn’t ding this item a star.  Once it’s out and together, if you’re not traveling with it, none of the cons apply.

I just started taking this yesterday, and WOW, it kills my appetite. I've been trying to lose weight for years, but the cravings do me in every time.  I found myself thinking, "I really don't care if I ever eat again." and the cravings are gone. I have a 30 day supply and got on the scales today to get a starting weight. I'll update in two weeks and again at the end of the 30 days. Right now, I'm feeling very positive about this product.

So it looks vintage but not weird...  I have an older style chandelier in my kitchen that looks best with these older style bulbs. The chandelier was my last piece in converting my whole house to LED bulbs.  I got this one as a review item but I will be purchasing 5 more to finish off the chandelier.  I can say I am 100% satisfied with the bulb...Just my thoughts,AKFull disclosure, I got this item at a discount specifically to review but the review is based on the full price of the bulb.

Really there is nothing complicated here.  These are fingerless riding gloves.  They have plenty of padding and they are comfortable to wear for longer periods of time. My father uses then when riding his bicycle.  He just wore them on a 430 mile 6 day trip across South Dakota (charity ride) and they held up great.  You can see some wear but nothing unexpected after 6 days of 8-10 hours a day biking...I would recommend these...Just my thoughts,AKFull disclosure,  I got these at a discount specifically to review but the review is based on had I paid full price for them.

At this price point this is one of the better speakers I have found.  It puts out plenty of sound and is pretty crisp.  The bass isn't too bad either.  But keep in mind this is no bose speaker.  It is good sound for what it is.  A small, useful, lower price point speaker.  I would put it right near the top in the sub $50 price range.  Keep in mind if you are looking for audiophile sound then you will not find it under $200.  But this is good enough for daily use and it makes a solid choice.Just my thoughts,AKFull disclosure,  I got this item at a discount specifically to review.  That said I have reviewed it as though I paid full price for it.

Work great and they bypass DRM on keurig 2.0. But this works.  It's something about the color that makes these work.I recommend these fully.Just my thoughts,AKFull disclosure, I got these at a discount specifically to review but my thoughts ate the same as though I paid full price.

I bought the white globes to string in a tree for a little decoration and they work quite well.  I have to solar panel actually in the tree and it still picks up enough light to run these for about 6 hours after dark.  I really do like the glass globes and they give off a nice defused light that adds interest to ordinary string lights.If you are in the market for a string light that runs on solar I would absolutely recommend these to you.I am very satisfied with them.Just my thoughts,AK

This one surprised me.  I was expecting this to be a novelty type item but it turn out it works very well and does what it claims.1st the wine chiller:  This is a stainless steel piece you put in the freezer for a while then screw onto the pour spout.  It gets nice and cold in about 20-30 minutes and holds the temperature of the wine down for about 45 minutes (on a 45 degree white wine) and keeps the heat out of 65 degree red for about an hour when sitting in the shade on an 80 degree evening...  That actually surprised me. Most wine chillers I have used in the past lasted maybe 20 minutes under the same situation.2nd the pour spout:  It is plastic with a rubber stopper.  It works very well and pours wine pretty much exactly the way you would expect.3rd the aerator:This one I'm not overly qualified to talk about but in my limited knowledge of wine aeration it does at least as good as the much higher priced aerating decanter that I own...All in all at the price I would recommend this if you are in the market.  It does exactly as it claims and it looks pretty nice too.  I am considering buying another one so I can have 2 bottles going at the same time...Just my thoughts,AKFull disclosure I received this at a discount specifically so I could review it.  That said the opinions I shared are based as though I bought this at full price.

Good Halogen replacementsThese are in use in my parents art gallery and they work really well and I am very happy with them compared to the halogens they replaced.  I will say that if you are replacing more than 2 bulbs get enough to change all of them out at the same time as there is a slight difference in the "feel" of the light although they are the same warmth factor.Pros:*The light is a white light so it keeps colors more true.*4 LED sections, many only have a single array.*Ballast on these do not heat up. (Older LED Halogen replacements got really hot.)*They are direct fit replacements, they are the same size and same connections.Cons:*The true longevity is unknownThey tend to "flick" on (It is a little distracting sometimes, but only at the instant of turn on)Overall giving the lower cost per bulb these are worth the price and the cons don't cause enough concern to subtract a star.Just my thoughts,AKFull disclosure I received these at a discount specifically to do a review.  That said the opinions I gave are based on if I had paid full price for them.

As far as fruit infusers go this one is a great option.  It has a large capacity since most I see are maybe 20oz.  The infuser is easy to pull apart and add fruit into and it simply screws right back together.  Another feature that makes this bottle stand out to me is that the water has to flow past the fruit in order to get out which adds a bit more flavor (in my opinion).  It is made of a sturdy plastic with what seems to be higher quality seals.  Being such a large water bottle it holds a bunch of fruit too.Overall:  I really like this bottle and the price is very competitive for what it is.Just my thoughts,AKFull disclosure this was sent to me at a reduced price specifically to review.  That said I have reviewed it as though I paid full price for it.

This is a Great Little water bottle...  I now use it as my daily carry around the house water bottle.  I use it primarily for water or flavored water and it works really well and even with flavored water the bottle doesn't pick up color stains.  I am pretty rough on water bottles and they usually only last a short time but this one seems like it will last quite a while for me.  I've dropped it, knocked it over and washed it without any issues.  The only fear I have is that the stopper will degrade and not be secure in the future but at this price point it's not worth deducting a star for.  All in all I am very happy with this bottle....Pros:*It holds just a bit more than a standard 20oz bottle.*The glass is pretty tough, since getting it I have dropped it twice and it shows no sign of damage or deforming.*It comes with a rubber stopper that holds liquid in very well.  I have flipped it on it's side and it hasn't leaked yet.Cons:*The lid does not screw on so there is a potential to have it come loose (This hasn't happened to me yet, just a possibility)Just my Thoughts,AKFull Disclosure I received this item at a reduced price to specifically review.  That said all the opinions I shared are based on if I would have paid full price for the item.

This headlamp  LED is a simple piece of hardware but does the job reliably and has an LED with very good brightness for the size.The headstrong is adjustable and is very stretchy so even when worn tight it is comfortable.It comes with 3 operating modes, right white LED, red solid light and flashing red light.  All 3 modes work without an issue.It uses 3 AAA batteries and even comes with a set to get you started.Based on the price, brightness and quality I would recommend this headlamp without question.Just my Thoughts,AKFull Disclosure I was provided this product at a discount specifically to review.  That said I have reviewed this as though I paid full price.  I stand behind all my reviews whether on ordinary purchases or review items.

As good as can be expected and they do their job without issue...I bought 4 of these to ceiling mount for some speakers and they do the job without issues...Installation is a bit tricky if you are not careful.  you need an exact square hole and you need to measure the box on each as they are all just slightly different in size (I'm assuming this is a manufacturing tolerance) all within 1/8th inch but measure them all and cut specifically for each one I would suggest cutting even just slightly under that size to make these snug in the wall and give enough space to screw it into the wall.  The screws are relatively close together so you need to be careful when cutting and securing them.What I did is use a little liquid nails around the outside and then fitted them into the holes I had cut so that way even if the screws don't hold they stay put.Despite the installation trickiness I would still recommend these as they give a nice finished look without the typical "wallplate" style...Just my thoughts,AK

This seems like a decent Line of the Tamukeyama.  That said I was expecting a bit more from a 2-3 year graft in a gallon pot...  I ordered 2 and both had only a few very small branches.  Granted this was a late March purchase so it could have been I got 2 very young plants...  They packaged things very well and I was overall very happy with these plants. They may be small to start but I am hopeful they will grow nicely since they were put in at the very beginning of the growing season...
