This story doesn't have any of the excitement that book one did.  Once Georgie and Sam are secluded in the safehouse, the story focuses on the couple and their relationship.  The threat to Georgie gets neutralized without any fanfare whatsoever; on that level the story was a bit of a letdown.  Nevertheless, for me, overall it was a very satisfying read.  Besides when it comes to the sex scenes, the ones in this book are way hotter than those in book one!  They are scorching hot, and graphic!  No clean romance here, ladies.  LOL  FYI, this is also the crude language in the story.  Now I'm off to finish book three.  Hoo-ah!HOT PACKAGEThis is the third book in the Hostile Operations Team series.  The series is so fantastic that as soon as I finished one, I started another.  As a matter of fact, I read all three books over two days, and was up until 1:30 a.m. this morning finishing this one!  All the HOT books are interconnected, but each can be read a standalone.  In this book, computer whiz, Billy "The Kid" Blake gets his HEA.  The events of this story take place just a few months after those in book one.In this story, LRH mixes things up a little; unlike the heroes in books one and two, both of whom were convinced that there wasn't any room in their lives for a woman AND their job, Billy is open to the notion of a committed relationship.  As a matter of fact, Billy and his lady love, Livvie, dated for a period of six months, before she upped and walked out of his life, after giving him an ultimatum...either his job at HOT, or her.  Now several months later, Livvie is in a bind, and shows up on Billy's doorstep asking for his help.  Livvie is a public relations expert for a weapons company that is in the middle of a bid for a big government contract.  When she uncovers a dangerous conspiracy; she goes to Billy for help, who in turn enlists the aid of his fellow HOT teammates.When Livvie and Billy first lay eyes on one another, for the first time in months, the sexual tension between the two is palpable.  After Livvie left him, Billy struggled to move on with his life without the woman who had come to mean so much to him.  As for Livvie, she is convinced that she made the right decision for her peace of mind, and her heart, when she preemptively left Billy, even though it was the hardest thing she had ever done.  The book is super short--at around 90 pages, it is the shortest one in the series to date--so the story books at a super quick pace.  Nevertheless, Ms. Harris packs a lot of story in a few pages, and the end result is a very satisfying read.  I loved the fact that H and h had a history together--a fact which has been true for all the HOT stories that I've read so far.  Both Billy and Livvie have issues stemming from their childhood--Billy with abandonment; Livvie with trust.  This story is a nice balance of romance and suspense.  Billy and Livvie have to team up to find the necessary evidence to expose her company's nefarious plot; while working together old feelings are rekindled, and eventually the two achieve their HEA.  When the couple finally confessed their love to one another, I found it totally believable, even though it happened very quickly.  It was pretty obvious that despite their time apart, Billy and Livvie had never stopped loving one another.Overall this was a very satisfying read. The sex scenes are hot and graphic, and, as with the previous two books, crude language is used in the story.  These books are certainly not what one would all clean!  LOL  Anyhow, I can't wait to read book four, but if I don't force myself to take a break from this series, I seriously will not be spending any time with my family over the next few days--not to mention, I won't get anything else done...excepting reading.  So, I'm done with book three, and I don't plan on hitting book four, for at least 24 hours!  But I WILL be reading it and SOON!!  Hoo-ah!

These vacuum cleaner bags are awesome!  They work perfectly with my lightweight Eureka vacuum cleaner.  The bags are well made and sturdy.  Each one lasts me about a month--that's with vacuuming a 1700 sq. ft. area at least once or twice a week.

This is a great puzzle.  Over the years I've purchased a few of them as birthday gifts for various children.  As it typical of most Melissa & Doug products that I've encountered, the puzzle is of superior quality...I love the fact that it's constructed of wood.  The puzzle pieces and board are extremely well made and are very durable.  We've owned ours for over four years now and it is still in excellent condition!  Each puzzle piece is about 3/16 of an inch thick.  The names of the States are printed on the puzzle pieces, while the names of the capitals of each State is printed on the puzzle board.  That way children not only learn the names of the states, and their location within the US, but also the capital of each State.  The puzzle consists of 45 pieces--the smaller New England states, share a puzzle piece.  For example, MA, RI, and CT all share one puzzle piece.  The same is true of a few other north eastern states that are not within NE region.  In any event, this is a wonderful puzzle.  It's educational and fun, providing children with endless hours of entertainment, while increasing their knowledge about their country.  My daughter, who is eight, has one of these puzzles and she loves it.  I bought it back in 2011 when she was only 4.  My husband and I have completed the puzzle with her many times over the years, and now that she's older she's taken it upon herself to do it with her five year old brother.  It's really cute to watch them seriously concentrating while completing the puzzle. :-)

I started using Proactiv several years ago. I loved the way it cleared up my acne and made my skin feel, but didn't love the high price tag that came with it. Upon the recommendation of a friend, I decided to try this Acnefree Clearing System. Alas, after only a couple of weeks usage, my skin started breaking out again. I decided to give it a little more time, but after using it for a full month, I was getting acne breakouts consistently. That's when I decided to return to Proactiv. It's unfortunate because this system is so much cheaper than Proactiv, but it just does not work for me. Maybe it has something to do with one's skin, because I see where a number of people have had success with this product, while others, like myself, did not.

I truly enjoyed this book.  At the heart of the story is a super sweet romance between two people who really love each other.  It's the fourth book in the Charity House series, but after a little investigation I came to the realization that book five of the series, Charity House Courtship, should really be book one.  That's because the events of that story take place prior to the events in this one, and also precedes the events in books one, two, and three.  We do meet the couple from book five in this story, and they are already married and have been for some ten years.  In any event, LAWMAN CLAIMS HIS BRIDE is a good book.  The hero, Logan, is totally and completely devoted to his beloved Megan, and has been for over five years.  Logan fell in love with Megan at first sight, but was convinced by others that Megan was too young for marriage and that he needed to wait.  In the meantime, Logan went off to pursue a career in law enforcement so that he would have the means to provide a good life for Megan when they finally did get married. Now five years later, Logan returns only to discover that Megan has been arrested for the murder of a man who attacked her.  Very quickly Logan dispenses with the ridiculous idea that Megan could be a killer, but there is the concern that Megan could possibly identify the real killer and thus the scepter of danger hangs over her head until that individual is apprehended.  In order to protect her, Logan takes Megan to his family's' ranch.  Most of the story is devoted to the couple's adjustment to one another after a five year separation.  Megan is no longer a girl, but a woman fully grown, and one who is not only independent, but also determined to stand on her own two feet.  Logan has his work cut out learning to deal with this "new" Megan.  LOLThere is a hint of intrigue as Logan tries to uncover the identity of the real killer, and by the time his identity is revealed I had already figured it out...there are a lot of clues provided throughout the story.  FYI, as you might expect with an inspirational romance, this is a clean story; no sex.  Despite the fact that there are no explicit scenes in the book, there is some focus on the intense physical attraction between the couple--especially Logan's attraction to Megan.  I do like the fact that the author brought up the issue physical attraction between the couple, because so often Christian romance novels try to pretend as though there isn't physical love between a husband and wife.  Furthermore, even though the issue is raised in this story, it is by no means crude!  All in all this was a very nice story and one that I happily recommend.  Happy reading!

My five year old son is a HUGE train fanatic.  He has an extensive wooden railway collection with trains, track, bridges, and overpasses, of all different brands, including Thomas the Train, Chuggington, Circo (the Target brand) and Brio.  This Maxim Enterprise Over and Under Tunnel works perfectly with all of those brands.  Furthermore, the circumference of the tunnel is wide enough to accommodate even the Chuggington wooden trains--which are quite a bit bigger than the other brands of wooden trains.  The only train that we've had a problem getting to pass through the tunnel is Thomas Wooden Railway -  Rocky because of his long crane.  Nevertheless, with some maneuvering my son was able to push Rocky through and, to be fair, Rocky has trouble passing under the Thomas the Train bridges!You should be aware that this over/under tunnel does have a pretty big footprint.  When assembled, the overpass is approximately 20 inches wide; it consists of 2 ascending/descending pieces, which are each about 9 inches long, and a small male/female connecting piece that is about 2 inches long.  The tunnel itself is 8 1/2 inches long.  If your little one is going to add this tunnel to his/her masterpiece, make sure they have room enough to build a fairly large track!  LOL  The small male/female connecting piece sits in a groove on top of the tunnel and has two tiny appendages that extend down from underneath and holds the piece in place, thus preventing it from sliding backwards and forwards [see picture #2].  This keeps the overpass securely in place.  It's not perfect, because it does rattle around a tad, but it's never moved out of place while my son is playing with it.The tunnel is very durable.  We've had ours for over four months now and it is still in excellent condition.  My son, unfortunately, is not gentle with his toys, and his tracks usually get tossed around quite a bit.  So far, the over/under tunnel doesn't even have a scratch on it--although my son has used a maker to "decorate" it.  Sigh!This over/under tunnel has been a great addition to my son's wooden railway collection.  He loves with it and plays with it all the time.  When I asked him if he would recommend this to another child he said "yes!  It's super fun!."  LOL  So, there you have it, out of the mouths of babes.  Happy shopping!

While the plot for this book is really very good, the story itself lacked substance.  At least, that is my opinion.  Significant aspects of the story were brushed over or skipped completely and when the book ended I was left feeling like I’d missed out on something great.  Jessie and Sarah are both likeable characters, but I didn't get a chance to know them at all.  Character development is pretty much nonexistent.When the book begins Jessie and Sarah have been corresponding with each other and have already fallen in love.  The story starts with Jessie’s last letter to Sarah asking her to marry him.  The letter is sweet and clearly indicates the deep feelings Jessie has for Sarah and his excitement at the prospect of marrying her.  Sarah is in a bad situation at home.  Her mother died when she was very young; her father is a lazy, ne’er do well, leaving Sarah with the responsibility of caring for her two younger brothers.  Sarah’s father would rather con, scheme, and steal his way through life than earn an honest living.  As soon as Sarah receives Jessie’s marriage proposal, she plots her escape from her father's clutches.  She has to sneak off in order to realize her dream of becoming Mrs. Jessie Kincaid.  Up to the point where the Jessie and Sarah first meet face to face and get married the story is very good.  However, once they do marry and Jessie takes Sarah home to his family’s ranch, it begins to fall apart.The problem is that once Jessie and Sarah arrive at his home the day after their wedding, the story skips over a significant aspect of the plot and takes the reader to one month in the future.  I was astonished when I realized that I was not going to be allowed to read about any of the Jessie and Sarah’s first days together as a married couple.  I didn’t get to see how the love that had developed between them through their written correspondence blossomed during their marriage.  Furthermore, when the story does skip ahead to a month down the road, Sarah’s father attempts a despicable act, gets his just desserts, and then the story ends.  Once again you don’t get to see Jessie and Sarah together as a couple.  I also felt a bit let down because there was so much buildup to what to expect when Jessie’s mother found out about his marriage, but I never got to read about her reaction to the news.  The end result is a story that is somewhat entertaining, but also disappointing.  FYI this is a clean romance.  Happy reading!

This is a great bag!  It's beautiful and functional!  I own the Cricut Create CRV 20001.  It's fits very easily inside this bag, with room to spare.  The bag is exceptionally well made and is extremely durable.  I purchased mine back in 2011, and it's still in like new condition.  The exterior design on the front is stitched in a light olive green color that matches the base of the bag, and is very beautiful.  It's a picture of a bee in a garden.  The handles are sturdy, padded, and comfortable to use.  The shoulder strap is a nice length that is adjustable.  There is a padded piece that rests on the shoulder when using the shoulder strap, which makes it very comfortable to carry the bag using the straps.  Inside, the bag has six pockets.  On one side there are three small zippered pockets towards the top of the bag, with one large open pocket at the bottom.  On the other side there are two zippered pockets towards the top of the bag.  Please see pictures #3 and #4 that I have attached.  On the exterior backside of the bag there is a zippered section; the zipper can be unzipped 180 degrees.  Pictures #1, #2, and #3 depict this section of the bag so you can see exactly what it looks like.  The exterior partition has two interior pockets as well as loops to hold pens, markers, and other arts and crafts tools.  I've owned this bad for over four years now and I'm just as happy with it today as I was when I first bought it.  Happy shopping!

I really enjoyed this book.  It's very obvious that Ms. Cabot is a very talented author; I truly enjoyed her writing style and she has a marvelous flair for storytelling.  As wonderful as the story was; however, IMO it was a little too slow.  Abigail and Ethan meet on the last lap of Abigail's journey from Vermont to Wyoming to visit her older sister Charlotte.  Charlotte is married to an Army officer, and it turns out that Ethan is a friend and fellow officer of Abigail's brother in law.  Because of the close friendship between the two men, Ethan spends a lot of time at the home where Abigail is visiting, and the two get to spend a significant amount of time together.  A friendship quickly develops between the couple and, over the course of several months, gradually blossom into love; this is certainly no rush to love romance, which was nice.Nonetheless, at times it seemed to drag.  Ms. Cabot keeps the romance very true to the times; an era when the mere touching of a woman's hand could signify that a man had very deep feelings for her; kisses between non-engaged/married couples were frowned upon; and it was considered gauche for a young lady to share her feelings with a gentleman before he declared himself.  Ethan and Abigail's romance is therefore hampered by the strictures of their society, as well as by the fact that Abigail is all but promised to a fellow teacher back in Vermont.  This remains the case for most of the story.  So, even when Ethan finally realizes that he has fallen in love with Abigail, he refrains from declaring himself because he believes she is destined for another, and of course SHE cannot declare herself first because that would be most improper!  The end result is that while there is a lot of internal dialogue from the couple's constant thoughts about one another and his/her feelings for the other, there aren't really any overt displays of affection.Despite the slow romance, I thought the story was quite enjoyable.  There are a couple of sub-plots involving a series of unsolved stagecoach robberies, the theft of military arms, and the continuing problem of desertion by the soldiers, all of which add a little bit of intrigue to the plot.  Needless to say, this is a squeaky clean romance.  Other than a kiss or two on the cheek there is no physical intimacy between the couple, until a shared kiss at the end.  Furthermore, there is a Christian aspect that is pervasive throughout the story without being preachy.  Overall this was a very entertaining book and one that I highly recommend.  Happy reading!

I purchased this puzzle for my son a few years ago when he was only a few months old; the recommended age is 6 months - 1 year.  We love the Melissa & Doug products.  IMO they product extremely well made, durable, reliable products.  This puzzle was no exception.  The extra-large knobs are perfect to little hands, making it easy to remove each brightly colored piece.  Under each puzzle piece are matching full-color pictures. This super-sized; solid-wood puzzle with extra-chunky  thick pieces is the perfect first puzzle.  The puzzle includes five pieces; a square, triangle, circle, rectangle, and oval.  Each puzzle piece is a different color, simultaneously teaching little ones about colors and shapes.  My son is five now, so it's been a very long while since he's played with this puzzle.  I recently found it put away in the back of a storage closet.  It's still in perfect condition so I passed it on to a friend who has a 7 month old baby.  She tells me he loves it and plays with it all the time.

OMG I absolutely LOVE this case!!  I got is as a Mother's Day present, along with my new Kindle Paperwhite device!  I was actually torn between this one and another, more expensive case by Marware.  I've owned a few Marware--I see they are MarBlue now--cases before and they have all, without fail, proven to be a superior product.  So, when I had the choice between this one, or the more expensive MarBlue case, I hesitated.  But, after reading several reviews I decided to give this case a chance; after all Amazon has an excellent return policy.  Oh. My. Goodness.  When I opened the package and first lay my eyes on this little case I was totally in love.  I chose the purple color; the shade is a deep eggplant color that is absolutely beautiful.  The case is made of a nice textured, faux leather that looks and feels great.  Furthermore, it is so lightweight it feels like it weighs nothing at all; the extra weight it adds to the Paperwhite is positively negligible.  In addition, it has a magnetic closure that keeps the cover in place when the case is closed, and it also has the auto wake/sleep function with the opening and closing of the cover.  Add to that the fact that it fits the Paperwhite like a dream and what you have is the PERFECT case for the Paperwhite!  Wow!  I was really blown away.  I'm so glad I took a chance on this case and saved myself the extra $15 it would have cost me to buy the MarBlue!  Happy shopping!

I bought this soccer ball for my daughter a few years ago when she was three years old.  She's a huge Tinker Bell fan--still is--so of course she loved it.  We enrolled her in soccer and once she saw this ball she was off and running, kicking the ball all over the place.  LOL  The actual soccer class didn't fare so well--she did one session and decided that was it--but she still had fun playing with this ball.The ball is smaller that than a regular adult soccer ball--it's a perfect size for little children.  I see the product description indicates that it is recommended for children 36 months - 15 years, but I would recommend buying this ball for a teenager; it's not that they couldn't play with it, but really, it's just too small!  My daughter is now almost eight and IMO it is already too small for her; although she still gets a blast kicking it around the yard with her five year old brother.  And yes, our ball is still going strong after almost five years of on and off use by two children.  This is really a great product; extremely well built and durable.  My husband has had to pump air into it a few times to keep it firm, but other than that it has been perfect!  FYI the ball is a size 3; I've noticed other size 3 soccer balls are recommended for children age 3 - 5, so I'm not sure why this one says 15.  Happy shopping!

My seven year old daughter--almost eight--is a voracious reader.  She has systematically worked her way through several series of books, and I find myself constantly looking for new ones to entice her.  To date she's read all of the RAINBOW FAIRIES series, NANCY DREW AND THE CLUE CREW, NANCY CLANCY, EVER AFTER HIGH, and a few others.  So far, every series of books that she's read, she absolutely loves.  To her they have all been five star reads--I know because we have discussed it at length.  LOL  Anyhow, I was very happy when I discovered the GODDESS GIRLS while searching through my local library's digital catalog.  So far my daughter has read three of them; this one, which is book three in the series, and books one and two; Athena the Brain (Goddess Girls Book 1), Persephone the Phony (Goddess Girls Book 2), and Artemis the Brave (Goddess Girls Book 4).  She enjoyed those books as much as she did this one.The Goddess Girls series are stories about the lives of the Greek goddess--you know, Athena, Peresphone, Aphrodite, etc.--during their childhood.  All the stories are set around the Mount Olympus Academy, the school the girl goddesses attend.  Each book focuses on a different goddess.  In this story, Zeus assigns Athena the task of keeping an eye on new kid, Hercules, who expects will be causing trouble at MOA.  Hercules is a bit of a loose screw and keeping the hothead out of trouble isn't an easy task.  Things only get more complicated when Athena decides to help Hercules complete the twelve tasks he has to do in order to be able to become a god and remain at MOA permanently.  My daughter says she had "fun" reading this book.My daughter loves this book.  It's recommended for children ages 8-12, Grades 3-7.  My daughter is currently in Second Grade, and she was able to read this book without assistance.  I should confess, however, that she does read at a fourth grade level.  I read the first book in the series to get a gist of the content, writing, etc....you know, give it the parent once over.  LOL  In any event, as a parent I highly recommend this book, and indeed the entire series.  FYI there are no illustrations included in these books.

My seven year old daughter--almost eight--is a voracious reader.  She has systematically worked her way through several series of books, and I find myself constantly looking for new ones to entice her.  To date she's read all of the RAINBOW FAIRIES series, NANCY DREW AND THE CLUE CREW, NANCY CLANCY, EVER AFTER HIGH, and a few others.  So far, every series of books that she's read, she absolutely loves.  To her they have all been five star reads--I know because we have discussed it at length.  LOL  Anyhow, I was very happy when I discovered the GODDESS GIRLS while searching through my local library's digital catalog.  So far my daughter has read four of them; this one, which is book four in the series, and books one, two, and three; Athena the Brain (Goddess Girls Book 1), Persephone the Phony (Goddess Girls Book 2), and Aphrodite the Beauty (Goddess Girls Book 3).  She enjoyed those three books as much as she did this one.The Goddess Girls series are stories about the lives of the Greek goddess--you know, Athena, Peresphone, Aphrodite, etc.--during their childhood.  All the stories are set around the Mount Olympus Academy, the school the girl goddesses attend.  Each book focuses on a different goddess.  In this story, Artemis, as the goddess of the hunt, isn't usually afraid of anything, but all that changes when a new boy, Orion, starts attending MOA.  All of a sudden Artemis finds herself beset with typical school girl nerves one feels when one has a crush on a cute boy.  LOL  This was a cute story that includes the moral, never judge a book by it's cover.  Poor Artemis tries really hard to get Orion to see her as more than just a friend, but in the end it turns out he wasn't worth all the effort.My daughter loves this book.  It's recommended for children ages 8-12, Grades 3-7.  My daughter is currently in Second Grade, and she was able to read this book without assistance.  I should confess, however, that she does read at a fourth grade level.  I read the first book in the series to get a gist of the content, writing, etc....you know, give it the parent once over.  LOL  In any event, as a parent I highly recommend this book, and indeed the entire series.  FYI there are no illustrations included in these books.

My daughter, who is almost eight, loves these Disney Fairies Chapter books.  I started purchasing them for her when she was only three years old.  She loves Tinker Bell and all the fairies, loved being read to, and could sit still for long periods of time, so I decided to try her with one of these illustrated chapter books.  The first one I bought for her was Fawn and the Mysterious Trickster (Disney Fairies) (A Stepping Stone Book(TM)).  She loved it so much, that very quickly bought her another.  I then bought her another, Rosetta's Daring Day (Disney Fairies) (A Stepping Stone Book(TM)), and after that one came this one.  My husband and I would read her a chapter or two before bed each night, and sometimes she would beg for more.  She is now in Second Grade and recently reread this book.  She loved it just as much as she did the first time around.  According to her it's a 5 star read!  LOLIn this story the ever unruffled Silvermist's calm demeanor is rattled when a so-called unlucky white ladybug lands on her head.  Silvermist's friends tells her that she is now cursed, but Silvermist is not convinced--at least not until a series of bad things start happening to her.  Now she wonders, are her friends correct?  Is she really cursed, or is it merely a coincidence? The book is very well written and includes some beautiful illustrations.  It is recommended for children ages 6-9, Grade level 1-4, but if you have a younger child who loves being read to, and has a love of all things fairies, they too might very well enjoy this story!  We've read a number of other books in this series and loved them all.

My daughter, who is almost eight, loves these Disney Fairies Chapter books.  I started purchasing them for her when she was only three years old.  She loves Tinker Bell and all the fairies, loved being read to, and could sit still for long periods of time, so I decided to try her with one of these illustrated chapter books.  The first one I bought for her was Fawn and the Mysterious Trickster (Disney Fairies) (A Stepping Stone Book(TM)).  She loved it so much, that very quickly bought her another.  I decided on this one because Rosetta is her favorite fairy--next to Tinker Bell and Silvermist, that is.  LOL  My husband and I would read her a chapter or two before bed each night, and sometimes she would beg for more.  She is now in Second Grade and recently reread this book.  She loved it just as much as she did the first time around.  According to her it's a 5 star read!  LOLIn this story Rosetta and Fawn strike a bargain.  Fawn will get all gussied up and attend the queen's fancy dinner, and in exchange Rosetta will spend a day doing whatever Fawn wants to do.  But Fawn's idea of a good time isn't exactly Rosetta's cup of tea!  Reading about the prissy Rosetta racing on the back of a frog was a hoot!  LOL  The book is very well written and includes some beautiful illustrations.  It is recommended for children ages 6-9, Grade level 1-4, but if you have a younger child who loves being read to, and has a love of all things fairies, they too might very well enjoy this story!  We've read a number of other books in this series and loved them all.

My daughter, who is almost eight, loves these Disney Fairies Chapter books.  I started purchasing them for her when she was only three years old.  She loves Tinker Bell and all the fairies, loved being read to, and could sit still for long periods of time, so I decided to try her with one of these illustrated chapter books.  OMG!  She absolutely loved it!  My husband and I would read her a chapter or two before bed each night, and sometimes she would beg for more.  My daughter is now in Second Grade.  Since she's been reading independently, she has reread this story, and loved it just as much as she did the first time around.  She says it deserves a 5 star rating!  LOLIn this story, Fawn is a master trickster; she loves playing tricks on the other fairies and is always doing so.  Finally Beck decides she's going to get Fawn back and plays a trick on Fawn.  Of course Fawn can't just let it go and before you know it Fawn and Beck are playing tricks against each other back and forth.  Finally a trick is played on Fawn that Beck denies doing.  So, who played the trick on Fawn?  This was a fun story and who the other trickster turned out to be was quite a surprise--at least it was for me.  ;-)  The book is very well written and includes some beautiful illustrations.  It is recommended for children ages 6-9, Grade level 1-4, but if you have a younger child who loves being read to, and has a love of all things fairies, they too might very well enjoy this story!  We've read a number of other books in this series and loved them all.

Beauty and the Beast is a classic Disney movie.  I absolutely LOVE it!  My almost 8 year old daughter does too., as well as my 5 year old son.  The story of Beauty and the Beast is a very touching one that includes a lesson about looking below someone's surface to the person they are underneath; in other words, don't judge a book by it's cover!

My daughter absolutely loved this umbrella.  It's beautiful with love pictures of Tinker Bell, Rosetta, and Silvermist portrayed around the perimeter of the umbrella along with the words, "Best Friends Forever."  The best part of the umbrella--at least according to my daughter--is 3D Tinker Bell hand grip.  LOL  The open/close mechanism is super easy to use; just push up to open and down to close.  The umbrella stays open well, despite the fact that it is very easy to close.  It is a perfect size for smaller children.  I purchased this one for my daughter a few years ago, when she was 3; she's almost 8 now.  I recently found the umbrella stuck in the back of her closet; surprisingly it was still in great condition, even though my daughter used to like to play with it like a toy all the time.  I passed it on to her little cousin, who is HUGE Tinker Bell fan.  She too loves the umbrella and plays with it all the time.  LOL

I purchased this set of Hand Grip Forearm Strength Grippers for my husband.  He's no body builder; just a regular guy with medium sized hands, who works out on a regular basis.  Before these grippers, he had tried a couple of other ones, but didn't really care for any of them.  He absolutely loves this set.  He says they fit perfectly in his hands and are so comfortable to use; one of his main complaints about the other ones that he tried is that they hurt his hands whenever he used them.  The set includes all three weights; 30, 40, and 50lb resistance.  We've had them for a couple of years, and my husband still uses them a few times a week.  He says that he still gets a really good workout using the 50lb resistance ones and the 40lb ones are great for a quick, easy workout.  He no longer uses the 30lb ones because it is too easy for him, but I do on occasion.  It's an intense enough workout for me!  LOL  My hubby says that this set of forearm strength grippers are perfect for a super quick, convenient workout, with great results!

This is a fantastic baby carrier; I should know, I went through several before I finally found and tried this one.  It is absolutely fantastic!  I used mine with both my children; I purchased it when my daughter was already a year and a half.  I used it with her and then with my son, from birth until he was about 2--he did not liked to be carried around, while my daughter preferred not to walk.  LOL  When my son was born I purchased the insert that is available to use with younger babies, ERGObaby Original Infant Insert, Grey.  However, if you don't want to go to the expense of buying the insert, a small rolled up towel would do just as well, I think.In any event, this carrier is wonderfully comfortable, both for parent and baby.  It attaches across Mom's shoulders and around her hips.  Youngest babies are carried lying cradled against Mom/Dad's chest, while older babies/toddlers sit cradled against the chest facing Mom/Dad.  My husband, who is a physical therapist, really liked this carrier.  He had a lot of reservations about the Baby BJORN because he said that the position in which that carrier held the baby was not good for their hips.  In his opinion, this carrier is much, much better because it holds baby in a sitting position...baby's weight is on his/her bum.  I used my carrier for over five years.  When I was done with it, it was still in excellent condition; there was only some fading of the fabric--I had the burgundy color.  I was actually able to resell mine, even after over five years of use.  Furthermore, it really does have the capability of carrying larger toddlers.  My husband used it to carry my daughter even when she was almost 40lbs!  I told you she preferred not to walk.  LOL  Anyway, this is a GREAT baby carrier!  You can't go wrong with an ERGO.

I love this gps portable friction mount.  I purchased two of them back in 2012; one for me and one for my hubby.  Since then we've each had two or three different Garmin Nuvi GPS, and every one of them have been compatible with this friction mount.  Currently my husband uses the Nuvi 52 LM; I have a Nuvi 50LM.  Prior to those we each had the Nuvi 2360LMT.  I found this friction mount when I went searching for a method of securing my vehicle gps without using the window mount that was provided with the unit.  I was living in California at the time, and it is against the law there to have anything mounted on your windshield.In any event, when I discovered this friction mount, I admit that I was skeptical.  I didn't think that there was any way it would remain securely in place when the car was in motion, much less if the car made a sudden stop.  As soon I received it I put it to test.  I drove up and down my a nearby empty parking lot going fast and braking suddenly, swerving from side to side and basically being crazy!  LOL  Not once did this friction mount fall off the dashboard.  Shoot, it never even once moved!!!  In the years since I've had it, I can honestly say that it's slid off my dashboard maybe once or twice, and those times were when one or other of my children had moved it too close to the edge of the dash.  This gps mount really is amazing!  I don't know what they did to make it stay in place, but it does.  It STAYS PUT!

This sunglass case is perfect for large sunglasses.  I had to resort to buying them online because I could not find them in the stores!  In any event, I've had this case for over four years now, and it is still in excellent condition.  My sunglasses have changed many times over the years, but I'm still using the same sunglass case.  It's a great size, has a nice textured exterior, and is very attractive.  I got two of them; basic black which is very classy, and the red, which is absolutely beautiful!

I am a HUGE Michael Jackson fan.  I grew up listening to his music.  He truly is the King of Pop.  This CD is a great collection of Jackson's music.  Song titles included are:1. Jam2. Why You Wanna Trip on Me3. In the Closet Michael Jackson 4. She Drives Me Wild5. Remember the Time6. Can't Let Her Get Away7. Heal the World8. Black or White9. Who Is It10. Give in to Me11. Will You Be There12. Keep the Faith13. Gone Too Soon14. Dangerous

First of all I am a HUGE Michael Jackson.  I grew up in love with him and his music.  LOL  In any event, this is a great CD.  Every song included is a delight.  Song titles included on the disc are:1. Don't Stop 'Til You Get Enough2. Rock With You3. Workin' Day And Night4. Get On The Floor5. Off The Wall6. Girlfriend7. She's Out Of My Life8. I Can't Help It9. It's The Falling In Love10. Burn This Disco Out11. Don't Stop 'Til You Get Enough (Michael Jackson's original demo recording)12. Working' Day And Night (Michael Jackson's original demo recording)13. Interview with Quincy Jones and Rod TempertonThis CD is a great addition to any Michael Jackson music collection!

This is a great picnic table for little ones.  It very comfortably seats four children; the product description says it seats six, but while I agree that it can seat six, I don't agree with the claim that it seats them "comfortably" and I'm talking about toddlers, ages 3 and 4.  The table came in the manufacturer's box and was super easy to assemble.  It's very sturdy; it is not wobbly and does not tip.  I have sat on ours many times and while it's not the most comfortable seat for me, it easily takes my weight and does not tip over.  LOL  My children are now almost 8 and 5, and they still use this table.  It's very well made and is extremely sturdy.  It gets no special treatment from us; we keep it outside in the open and periodically I hose it down to keep it clean.My only complaint is that I wish it didn't have the center cupholders.  IMO, the table would have been better without them.  With the way it is, the cupholder pretty much divides the table in half; it's not that big, but because it's right in the middle of the table it ends up restricting each child to his/her side of the table.  If your child is painting/drawing/writing on a large piece of paper that extends from one side of the table to the other, when they try to work on the section of the paper that sits on the area where the cupholders are located, the paper dips.  Years ago, before my son was even born, I ended up cutting a piece of cardboard from a large, sturdy box, which I would put on the tabletop whenever my daughter wanted to do her artwork.  It worked pretty well, but every so often I'd have to find a new piece of cardboard.  I finally got a friend, who works in construction, to get me a thin sheet of cardboard, that he smoothed down, to use instead.  It works great!  I did promise myself, however, that if I ever buy another kids' picnic table, I'd get one sans the cupholders.  LOL

The idea for this product is great; but the product itself is a little disappointing.  This is due to the fact that the tubing that leads from the shower is too short.  My daughter was only two years old when I purchased this and it didn't work well with her height.  For her small size, the shower head needed to be lower.  Of course she loved it so much that she insisted on using it.  Another problem I had is that I could never get it attached to the shower securely enough to prevent leaking.  Consequently, whenever my daughter took a shower, the water would leak out from the top.  In any event, we used this for a few months; it works, but it's not great.  I used it just long enough for my daughter to get over her fascination with it.  I then went ahead and purchased a regular "adult" handheld shower head that worked much, much better.  I should have done that from the very beginning and saved myself a few bucks.  Oh well, you live and you learn!

I purchased this DVD back in 2009 when my daughter was two years old and ready for potty training--well I was ready for her to be potty trained!  LOL  In any event, she didn't really care for this DVD.  I got her to watch it once or twice, and each time was a chore to get her to watch the entire video.  That was pretty surprising as she loves music, singing, and the like, so I was sure she'd like this DVD.  I ended up getting her another DVD, that she loved, Go Potty Go.Although my daughter didn't seem to be particularly impressed with this DVD, it was a favorite of my son's when he was potty training--he's now five years old.  He watched this DVD so many times that he knew all the words and could sing along whenever he watched it.  LOL  The best part is that while watching the DVD he very happily sat on his potty and oftentimes we would get some positive results!I recently passed along this DVD and some others to my cousin who has a toddler aged child.  He is now being potty trained.  My cousin tells me that he LOVES this DVD and has no problems sitting on his potty while he watches.  I guess this DVD is great for some kids, while not so great for others.  Isn't that typical of life?

I purchased this book back when my now almost 8 year old daughter --also a Hannah--was potty training.  She LOVED it.  I read it to her, at her request, over and over, and she was determined to become potty trained, just like the Hannah in the story.  The story is told is a lovely rhyming rhythm which makes is fun to read and listen to.  It's also beautifully illustrated.  It tells the story of a little girl, Hannah, whose parents bought her a present...a brand new potty.  I loved this book; my daughter loved it even more.  She was already two when I bought this for her; she was fully potty trained by the time she was 2 1/2.  This book certainly added to her enthusiasm to become potty trained.

This is a fantastic playhut!  I purchased this for my daughter back in 2009 when she was only 2.  Now at almost 8 years of age, she still loves to play with it with her 5 year old brother.  The two have a blast using this thing!  This thing is pretty huge though; it takes up my entire living room!...it's about 7 feet long with both pieces attached.  You also have the option of playing with only the Thomas the Tank portion or the caboose, if you don't have enough room for the entire playhut.  FYI the playhut does not have a floor; the bottom is completely open.  There are two pieces that are connected using Velcro tabs; the front portion is Thomas, the back portion consists of the cabooses, Annie and Clarabel.  The playhut is made of a thing polyester material that is surprisingly sturdy; we've had ours for almost six years now and so far we've had no mishaps with tears, snags, or anything else of that nature!  As far as storage goes, that is an absolute breeze!  It has that EZ twist technology that makes folding it a breeze; it folds down flat and I keep ours stored behind our couch!  As for set up, it's even easier than folding; all I do is shake it and pops right up...it's similar to those pop up laundry baskets.If space is an issue for you, you should know that Amazon also sells the Thomas the Tank Playhut without the caboose, that is considerably small, yet is still fairly roomy....it is about half the length of this one, Playhut Thomas the Tank Play Vehicle.  Personally, I'd say buy this bigger one, even if you don't have enough space for it indoors, for those times when the kids use it outside.

This Munchkin Deluxe Care Cart is absolutely awesome!  I purchased one for myself when my daughter was a baby--she's now almost 8--and more recently purchased another as a gift for a friend who is a new mom.  This cart is a must have for any parent who  likes to keep things organized.  It's very well made and is surprisingly sturdy...I thought for sure it would wobble a lot, but found that that was not the case.  It was also very easy to assemble.  It's a great addition to any baby nursery; works perfectly to keep baby items in one place and organized!

This is one fantastic toy box.  I purchased mine back in 2008, when my daughter was almost a year old, and it's still going strong!!!  It's made of hard plastic on either end, but the front and back consist of a sturdy, heavy duty canvas-like material.  As depicted in the product picture, along the front end there are three pockets.  The toy box was extremely easy to assemble and once put together there isn't anything else that you have to do with it.  You have the option of keeping the lid on or off; when my children were younger I would remove the lid completely as I was afraid that it would fall down on them while playing.  Now that they are older--almost 8 and age 5--they have continued to do the same thing.  The front pouches are great for keeping smaller items, such as lego pieces, play jewelry, or the like.  I absolutely love this toy box; it's one of the best kid purchases I've made since becoming a mother!

Oh my goodness!  I LOVE these nesting bins!  They are absolutely awesome!  I purchased mine back in 2008, and I kid you not when I say that they are still in perfect condition.  I first purchased mine when my daughter was almost a year old.  Initially I used them to organize baby items...you know, diapers, wipes, baby toiletries, etc.  After both my children past the baby/diaper stage, I started using them to organize books and toys.  They work great!  If that's not enough, they are extremely attractive; the artwork on the outside is par excellence and each bin is painted a beautiful color on the inside.  Add to that the fact that the bins are exceptionally well made and are unbelievably sturdy; all three of my bins are in in excellent condition.  This is true despite the fact that both my children now use them for toy storage.  I love these bins and highly recommend them as an excellent addition to any nursery/playroom/child's room.

I LOVE this rice cooker.  I've owned mine for a couple of years, and it works great!  It makes perfect rice, both white and brown, as well as a whole host of other dishes.  I love the various settings that are included; there are settings for brown rice, quick cook, rinse free, regular, cake, steam, porridge, and sushi.  You also have the option of choosing your own cook time using the timer, rather than one of the predetermined settings.  There is also a "keep warm" setting that is automatically initiated when the cook time expires.  You can also manually select the keep warm option.  Clean up is a breeze...just remove the inner non-stick pot and wipe around the edges of the cooker, and voila!...all clean!  All is all, this rice cooker is just about perfect!

Peanuts Pictures is what I call timeless entertainment.  I grew up watching and loving the "Charlie Brown" movies and now my children are doing the same thing.  Both of them, my daughter who is almost 8, and my son who is 5, love all the Peanuts movies.  This movie "Snoopy, Come Home" is a particular favorite.  In this story, Snoopy receives a letter from his former owner, Lila, a little girl who is now sick and in the hospital.  Lila asks Snoopy to come and visit her.  This letter initiates a series of events that makes for a very heartwarming movie; one that is sure to any child or adult.

This is a great shoe for toddler girls.  It fits great, is very comfortable, and looks awesome!  I purchased this as a gift for my cousin's little girl and she loves it.  My cousin says it's her favorite pair of shoes; she doesn't want to wear anything else.  It's a good thing they live in Florida where you can wear open style shoes all year round.  LOL

The Kindle version of the dictionary sucks, sucks, sucks!  It is impossible to find a word.  I literally have to scroll through page after page after page when looking for a specific word.  There isn't even a way to get directly to a particular letter of the alphabet!!!  It's difficult enough trying to scroll to the specific letter of the alphabet; it's impossible to get directly to a specific word.  The Table of Contents allows you to get directly to a certain section by tapping on the live link.  The problem is that, rather than have the dictionary portion divided up by the individual alphabet, that section of the lumped together; it's listed as "Dictionary A-Z.  When you click on that live link you are taken directly to the beginning of the dictionary section; which means that you are taken the first page in the "A" section.  If you want to look up a word that begins with another letter, then you have to "guess" as to where that letter might be and blindly scroll forward...of course you have to stop constantly to ascertain whether or not you reached the particular letter you if you passed it by.I was looking up the word "neat" for my daughter and I kid you not when I say that it took me almost ten bloody minutes just to find the word.  First I scrolled until I got to the N section; of course you have to do that by total guess work because there is no way to tell when you get to any particular area.  Once I finally found the Ns after trial and error then I tried scrolling to "Ne".  Well let me tell you that that was an exercise in futility!  Sometimes I'd go too far back and end up at No or some other combination; when I tried to scroll back I'd end up at the Ms.  And on and on it went.  A complete disaster!!  I needed to look up another word, but decided that there is no way that I'm using this piece of crap--yes I am seriously ticked off!!  I wish I could give this blasted book ZERO stars because that is exactly what it deserves!!!  The ONLY saving grace is that I purchased it when it was a Kindle Daily Deal special, so I only paid $1.99 for it; and quite frankly it isn't even worth that.  After checking the other dictionaries that came with my kindle device, I can say with confidence that it will be a long, long time before I buy another Kindle dictionary, IF EVER!!!

This is a great guide for parents who want to teach their little ones the basics of Sign Language.  I used it with both my children with great success.!  With my daughter I started using signs when she was about 3 months old; with my son, I started right away.  I found it was so much easier to communicate with them using Sigh Language before they were able to speak.  The book is very easy to use; it lays out a simple straightforward method for teaching babies different signs.

I purchased this VTech V.Smile Baby back in 2007 when my daughter was just a few months old.  She really loved it and played with it all the time.  At first, when she was only a few months old, she'd just play with the activity panel, without using the television, but as she got older she graduated to the games using the television screen.  I love all the games that are included; not only are they educational, but also interactive.  My daughter enjoyed using this so much that I ended up buying her several "smartridges" to use with it; the unit comes with only one.  When my son was a few months old, he too started to play with it.  Now that they are almost 8 and 5, I recently cleaned out some of their old toys, books, etc.  I was surprised to discover that the V.Smile is still in excellent working condition after all this time.  I just passed it along--as well as a bunch of smartridges--to my cousin who has a little boy almost 2 years old; she tells me that he loves it too!

For me this Wet 2 Style Straightener worked okay, but only just.  Maybe it's me; maybe it's my hair, but it just didn't do that good of a job.  I'm biracial and I have really thick curly hair; it's not the easiest to straighten even after blow drying.  I think this tool probably works great for someone with lighter, thinner hair, but if you're like me with really, really curly "black" hair, you might find yourself disappointed with the results.  When I use it, it make my hair a little lighter, but other than loosening my curls a little, there is absolutely not "straightening" effect.

I purchased this as a gift for a friend's son who is a huge baseball fanatic!  He loves it!  My friend tells me that he plays with it all the time; he just can't seem to get enough.  I noticed how much my son--who is 5--enjoyed playing with it whenever they have playdates so I ended up getting a second one for him.  He loves it too.  It's a great toy!  It keeps the kids occupied--and out of their parents' hair--provides them with lots of exercise, and because they play with it outside, they get lots of fresh air too.  You can't beat that.  Furthermore, the set is very well made; it's really sturdy!

This is probably the best doctor's kit out there in terms of what you get for the money.  What I really like about it is the fact that so many medical tools are included; not just a few select pieces.  It even has a cell phone and pager!  Furthermore, there is a nice medical "bag" in which to fit everything and each piece has a designated spot--very neat.  The set is nicely made and seems quite sturdy.  Ours lasted through both our children, now almost 8 and 5.  I first purchased this kit back in 2005 as a gift for a friends' son.  I was so impressed with it that I later purchased one for my daughter when she turned 3; so we've had this kit for almost five years now, and it's still going strong.

I purchased this DVD for a friends' daughter, who is almost five.  She is a HUGE Dora the Explorer fan.  She LOVES this DVD.  I gave it to her as a Christmas present and her mother told me that she's already watched it dozens of times.  FYI only one episode on this DVD include a Christmas theme.

I was recently cleaning out some old toys, books, DVDs, CDs etc from my children's closets and came across this delightful CD.  I purchase it years ago when my daughter--who is now almost 8--was really young, no older than 2...so we've had it a while.  She was a HUGE Elmo fan when she was little.  This particular DVD we watched over and over--and yes, I said WE.  LOL  When my five year old son came along, he proved to be just as big an Elmo fan as his sister.  I've recently passed this DVD along to their baby cousin, who is almost 2, and his mother tells me that he loves it too.  Actually, she complained that she has to keep watching the shows.  Haha  Really, you can't go wrong with anything Sesame Street...and Elmo is Everlasting!

I was recently cleaning out some old toys, books, CDs etc from my children's closets and came across this delightful CD.  I purchase it years ago when my daughter--who is now almost 8--was around a year old...so we've had it a while.  She loved it and so did my son when he came along.  I've now passed it on to their baby cousin, who is almost 2, and his mother tells me that he loves it too.  Really, you can't go wrong with anything Sesame Street...it's timeless entertainment!

I purchased this book for my husband; he used it as a resource tool for a business class that he was taking.  Personally I found the book to be beyond boring.  My husband, however, thought it was fascinating.  He read it cover to cover, and this was after he'd already completed his class project for which he needed the book.  According to him, it's a font of information about the wine industry.  The five star rating is based on my husband's assessment of this book, not mine.  LOL

This is a great play gym for little babies--it's recommended for babies age 1 month and older. I had one that lasted through both my children several years ago. They both loved it; it kept them entertained for many, many precious moments.  LOL  This was such a popular toy with my children that I recently purchased one as a gift for a friend who just had a baby.  The Learning Gym is extremely well made and is quite sturdy.Younger babies can use the gym in a lying position, as depicted in the product picture.  As the baby grows and is able to sit/stand, the gym can be converted into a hands-on learning center that he/she can use in a sitting/standing position.  Some of the activities for older babies include, fun songs, games, counting lessons, introductions to 5 different languages, among others.  This is a wonderful product.  As a parent, I highly recommend it.

This is yet another great KP song.  My almost 8 year old daughter is a huge Katy Perry fan.  She has been for a number of years now.  This is one of her favorite songs.  She thinks it's the perfect 4th of July song.
I'm not a big NM fan, but my kids like her music... A LOT.  This song is actually pretty good...it's got a great beat!

These are really terrific quality/value paper towels.  I wouldn't have thought of switching to this type of towel from rolled paper towels until reading that someone else was doing so.We have a very open floor plan and my kitchen can be seen from living, dining, breakfast and family rooms.  Anything and everything that helps me keep my kitchen tidy and attractive is a plus for me.  I'm keeping these towels by the sink in a basket that holds them perfectly and it is much more aesthetically pleasing than a vertical roll of towels--no matter how nice that holder may be.As to the quality of the towels; they are great.  One towel unfolded all the way is large enough to use as a napkin for a messy toddler or when having BBQ.  They really shine as towels for cleaning and drying.  They are sturdy, can take some serious scrubbing, and one towel can clean a lot of mess.Pricewise, this math nerd compared my normal Bounty Pick-A-Size towels to the C-Folds.  I always compare paper product pricing by cost per square foot because manufacturers have become so deceptive--cardboard rolls get wider and shorter, paper quantity gets smaller every year.  The square footage of paper is the only way to know what you are really buying.The Bounty comes to 2.9 cents/sq ft when I buy the huge roll 12-packs at $28.40.  The Georgia Pacific C-Fold comes to 2.8 cents/sq ft at current amazon price of $31.98.  We will be sticking with the C-Folds because of their durability, versatility and compactness of storage space.  The C-Fold box 00 towels takes up substantially less space than even a 6 pack of rolled towels.

Caring deeply about the health and longevity of my dog; I am always searching for the best food(s) I can afford for her. It has become a source of frustration for me that even the best of dog food manufacturers seem to always be involved in recalls; leaving me unable to trust a) that any have my dogs well-being at heart and b) that they are sourcing from reputable countries/sources and c) that anyone but a molecular biologist who is VERY current on their research can even determine if the ingredients are GOOD for my dog.This food starts off with one BIG star taken off because of the poor reputation of this manufacturer; many recalls in the past; but none recent that I have found so I am believing that they figured out it isn't profitable to kill peoples pets.  Note that I DON'T think they care about our pets which would be the motivation I would like to see.  Given that this company was started by a woman who adores her pets I am really surprised she sourced to this company.I am a bad consumer (don't like spending money :>) and a big big skeptic:  I believe nothing and fact check as much as time allows.  I am not moved by packaging, bogus/meaningless marketing terms, etc.  I tried this product because it was free in exchange for an honest review and it appears to have quality ingredients.  Almost all of the marketing descriptions on this and most packaging are meaningless so you have to dig into the ingredient list and know something about the nutrition you want to provide for your pet.This product is made in the US, but ingredients are sourced from around the world.  It is a relief that they do NOT source from China.  For this price, and it is exorbitant for what you get, I feel like the ingredients should be sourced from the US and/or reputable sources overseas with proven interest in animal health.  As is the trend these days, there seems to be a lot of superfluous ingredients designed to make humans buy the food (various microscopic amounts of fruits, veggies, herbs, vitamins, micronutrients, etc.)Our Libby LuLu is not a picky eater and inhaled this food as it was introduced, and when fed this food solo.  It didn't cause her any transitional/gastric distress.  Because of the manufacturers poor reputation in the past and the crazy high price, this will never be our primary food.  I don't mind it in the rotation of foods we give our girl.We continue our search for the perfect food made by an HONEST, ETHICAL company who is extremely thoughtful about exactly what goes into the food they make and markets this food at a price the average person can afford.  Thus far, we haven't found that company and or food.

This is a very nice pair of tailored looking pants.  Well made, closure lays flat and nice.  Creases clean and sharp and the fabric drapes great.Very comfortable, relatively wrinkle resistant.Unlike so many pants these days, both legs are the exact same length and are the length advertised.My son wears a 33" so sometimes it works out great when 34" aren't as long as advertised.  We don't mind paying to hem a nice pair of pants.

This is a great DHA supplement.  I've used other Viva Labs supplement with good success and felt safe ordering this product as well.The capsules are small and smooth enough to swallow easily, do not cause me gastric distress, and I do NOT have nasty fish burps afterwards.The product is supposedly and hopefully wild caught and is molecularly distilled and fully tested for contaminants and heavy metals.The company provides a certification from the IFOS, but it is for only one batch number.  It would be quite simple to make a single batch and clean it up, get your test and then advertise as if ALL of your product tests the same.  Unfortunately, that is not terribly reassuring to me.  I'd like to see that EVERY batch is tested and proof that it is clean; ESPECIALLY in a prenatal product that needs to protect your vulnerable baby.This is the link to the one test available on IFOS site: http://www.nutrasource.ca/ifos/files/ifos%20viva%20labs%20prenatal%20dha%20lot%20s14j187.pdf

The elastic bands that hold my prior paperwhite easel cover have stretched out.  The cover is no longer made so I had to go searching for a new one.The material of this cover feels very cheap, but then all things considered this was a lower price point.It marks easily which is a negative if you are carrying it in a bag with other items or using it on any less than pristine surface, such as any restaurant table, picnic table, etc.Mostly I am displeased with the bulk and weight of the cover.  when you lie in bed reading, the cover doesn't fold up flat and neat behind the kindle.  It has a triangular wedge shape which is bulky and awkward to hold.  The weight hurts my wrist when reading in bed as well.I bought my husband a different easel type cover that is much better and will be switching to that myself.

I genuinely hate leaving one-star reviews and have to be extremely disappointed to do so.  I don't like crushing an author, and I don't like all the "unhelpful" votes one gets when giving an honest negative review.I don't know if this is a YA Fantasy book gone wrong or what happened; but this book missed almost every mark one needs to hit to have a good piece of fantasy lit.The writing feels embarrassingly juvenile.  It's as if the author reached into a "how to write a fantasy book" grab bag every now and again and grabbed an idea:  include mythical winged creatures, primitive/barbarian cultures, create strange new kingdoms, don't forget the nasty queen and your tragic "Cinderella" character.  How about some magicians or wizards and some spells to go with them.I have no problem with an author reaching into that grab bag as long as the author is able to weave a cohesive story around them.  World building is about much more than coming up with weird new names and basic geography.Speaking of names; as a 40+ year fan of fantasy literature I have read my share of strange names for both characters and kingdoms.  I don't know what the problem was with the naming in this book but I was unable to remember the vast majority of the names.  It's as if some unwritten rule of name creation was violated in the writing of this book.In the end, which comes before the story ends--MAJOR ONE STAR pet peeve of many of us--there really wasn't a story.  Just a collection of sentences, paragraphs and chapters that come to an end with no REAL STORY.  This is yet another author releasing PART of a book and calling it a book.When a book gets one star and you paid nothing for it and feel cheated because it wasn't a whole story that is just bad news all around.A lot of times I can give books like this 3 stars because I can FEEL the good story buried within a new author's writing or find it within editing issues.  That was impossible in this non-story.

Another great Solid Gold Dry dog food.This is one of the best fish formulations we've tried in any brand.  Some of them stink so bad in the bag and in your dog that it makes you kind of queasy.THIS bag of food actually smelled really good when we opened it.  After reading the ingredient list I'm really impressed with the ingredients and the fact that Alaskan Pollock is the FIRST ingredient (not pollock meal--that is second ingredient).  This food is going in our regular rotation for our dog.  I love that she will be getting her omegas from food instead of supplements.The one star ding on this food is due to the poor reputation of the manufacturer--makes it hard to completely trust any product they make.

Of the two Solid Gold dry dog foods we've tried thus far, our dog likes this one the best.I think this is a great quality dog food and only wish it was manufactured by a company with a good reputation for caring for our pets.Unfortunately, it isn't, which leaves me choosing to give them the benefit of the doubt.I like this food enough that we will rotate it throughout the year, no more than 2 or 3 weeks at a time.  I hope that if Diamond produces another bad batch of contaminated food this would protect us from grave harm to our sweet girl.As with all of the Solid Gold dog foods, the price is solid gold as well.  The only way this is remotely affordable is buying in the largest bags possible.

What fun!!!I had modest expectations of this toy...made in china junk is what I really expected.Instead we received a toy that has been a blast to play with for adults AND kids. What a nice surprise.Assembly was quick and easy other than finessing the inevitable stickesr that you have to place for dragon eyes, teeth, etc.I'm mostly surprised that we got three nice quality Hot Wheels Monster Jam trucks (Gravedigger, Reptoid and Firestorm) that are made well enough to withstand the abuse they get with this toy since they are repeatedly catapulted at pretty good clip into various objects.Number one grandson laughs gleefully when the dragon "catches" the car--thinks that is just too wonderful.  He is far more into that action than "winning" by hitting the dragons tail and capturing the golden chalice.  He also loves it when he can send the dragons head flying (it really is fun to watch--it goes quite the distance)His parents and grandparents, on the other hand, are competitive and want that chalice.  It isn't nearly as easy as you would expect to get the chalice (I'm guessing once every 30 or 40 launches at best) so there is high replay value for competitive kids.  I love that even "losing" is entertaining with this toy.Note: you can attach the launcher at two different locations on the set to expand the options for fun.After playing for a while I noticed a much higher chance of success with Gravedigger and that Firestorm got "caught" more often.  I weighed the cars and low and behold, Gravedigger weighs the most and Firestorm the least.  Great educational opportunity for kids if you want to teach about mass and velocity :>).I HIGHLY recommend this toy and think it is well worth its $20 price tag.Oh, and I LOVE the frustration free packaging amazon offers--not pretty to look at for gift recipient, but oh so much better for those having to unpack and assemble the toy.

This could have been a five star product with just a minor tweak.First, it's a great idea and is unlike any books we have for our grandson.  My husband is an engineer and former builder and my son is an automotive tech.  My 18 month old grandson is already showing the family "bent" for taking things apart, making things and understanding how things work.The big challenge with this book is that while it is interactive, the interactive parts are much to flimsy to be used by younger toddlers who haven't yet mastered the art of "GENTLE" handling of more delicate items.  A book made for this age group should have had much sturdier construction (Melissa and Doug line could have executed this really well).For the price I felt like the book should have delivered appropriate construction quality for intended age group.The kind of kids who are going to like this book (the busy bees and future engineers, contractors, mechanical kids etc) are by default going to damage the pieces because they are going to USE them!That said, if you have an older toddler who maybe isn't super "hands on" this would be a good book for their collection.

We are always open to finding new and better dog foods for our little LuLu.We work hard to balance finding high quality preferably organic and grain free foods with the cost of said foods.She is not a picky eater so she scarfed this food as it was introduced with her current food and then as she was fed the food solo.The ingredient list appears to contain good quality ingredients; but as is the trend lately, it sure seems there are a lot of superfluous ingredients.The healthiest dog I ever had was fed raw from beginning to end.  That is more work/time than I have at this point and our current little girl came to us with heart problems so I worry about feeding her "off the grid."She had no digestive issues with this food and didn't act like she was starving (which she has with some foods we've tried which make me think they are missing enough protein or fat for satiety).In the end, this is a very high priced food and we like it, but not as much as we like other comparably priced premium, grain free foods.

I was really pleased to receive this excellent magnesium supplement in exchange for an honest review.  I had only 3 tablets left in my existing bottle so the timing was perfect.I take Magnesium at the advice of my cardiologist to help with pvc's and t-wave abnormalities (my electrical system is evidentally wired wrong!)My gastroenterologist recommended it as I have severe LPRD (like GERD) accompanied by esophageal spasms.My primary care doctor recommended to help me sleep.Needless to say, magnesium is high on my list of "gotta have, gotta take" supplements.I've had good results using "premium" forms of magnesium (i.e. not oxide), but have never tried the bisglycinate chelate form.I'm happy to say that I'm getting very good results with this type of magnesium and hope over a period of a month or so (the norm for me to really see changes/improvements with most supplements) to see even more impressive results.I will post in a month with any changes.In the meantime, this is what I can share:I have a pretty intense gag reflex and these tablets, while chalky, solid and of average to large size go down easy and cause no gagging or sticking to throat as they go down.  This is important because I am taking one in a.m., one in afternoon and two in evening.  I couldn't do four a day of any supplement that was miserable to consume .They cause me ZERO gastric distress.They seem to be particularly effective in the sleep realm, to the point that I can't take two in the a.m.  It's more of a relaxing effect that tired effect so be careful if you are taking these for the first time not to do so before driving or running with scissors.

I had never seen or heard of this particular product when I ordered it via amazon vine program.We have charcoal and gas grills and a Big Green Egg and use them more than our oven.I do a lot of cooking outside in foil packets so I'm excited to say that Reynolds has created a terrific product.The foil used in this bags is heavier than the reynolds heavy duty foil.  It has a different feel and texture as well.It is almost as heavy as the disposable foil pans, but not quite.The seams are nice and sturdy so you can trust these bags with your expensive cuts of meat.I did a beef stew in the bags on the gas grill and it came out great.  I flipped that bag a couple of times during cooking to distribute ingredients and juices.No leaks, no tears.I wish they offered more sizes; smaller for when doing just veggies and larger for doing big cuts of meat.I also think the price is too high (currently $5ish on amazon).  $1/bag is the highest I think they should be.Would also like to have option to purchase in a larger quantity, especially if that brought price per bag down.Lastly, would like to see these available in grocery store!

I really enjoyed Mitch Albom's "Tuesdays with Morrie" and I love music, so there was no way I was passing up this book.This is an enchanting story with the narrator being "Music." Music is a grand and generous persona/spirit.  A sampling of how Albom handles Music's storytelling:"I am Music.  And I am here for the soul of Frankie Presto.  Not all of it, just the rather large part he took from me when he came into this world.  However well used, I am a loan, not a possession.  You give me back on departure.I will gather up Frankie's talent to spread on newborn souls.  And I will do the same with yours one day.  There is a reason you glance up when you hear a melody, or tap your foot to the sound of a drum.All humans are musical.Why else would the Lord give you a beating heart."I was IN the story from that paragraph on page 4 all the way to the end.  I'll warn readers who like a nice calm, linear story that this is NOT that kind of story.  It skitters along and hops back and forth through time.I loved that the story included all kinds of people in the music industry and loved that they came from many backgrounds (Wynton Marsalis made it in--hooray!).Frankie was at Woodstock, Frankie was EVERYWHERE with EVERYONE.This does in fact give the story a "Forrest Gump"-y type vibe (and that was a movie with a great meta story and the music to go along with it) and it weaves quite a spell on the reader.The story ends 400+ pages later with this:"I am Music.  And Music is in the connection of human souls, speaking a language that needs no words.  Everyone joins a band in this life.  And what you play always affects someone.  Sometimes it affects the world.  Frankie's symphony ends.  And so, at last, we rest."If you love music, good storytelling, and can tap into the spirit of what Albom has created; you are going to have a special read with this book.

UPDATE:  Garden of Life responded to my request to find out how much of each strain of probiotic was in this formula saying it was proprietary information that they wouldn't provide.  They did say that just like food products, they've listed the strains in order of highest content to lowest.  I figured that out on my own when I saw the cheaper and more common acidolphilus listed first.So, for all I know they really have shipped a very expensive bottle of acidolphilus with token amounts of the other strains just so they can put it on the label.  I've just knocked off another two stars for the company being either non-transparent or disingenuous...I don't care which it is.  I'm not buying this without knowing what I'm paying for.Props to them for responding fairly quickly even if they didn't provide the needed information.--------------------------------We ordered both the mens and womens formulas of the Garden of Life Probiotics.We have taken probiotics both prophylactically for overall health and wellbeing and more intentionally when travelling to places with questionable food/water/hygiene and during times of medical challenges.This is definitely the most comprehensive probiotic either of has taken with the most active strains.I've taken off one star because of price and the fact that the amount of each individual strain isn't provided for in ingredients. It isn't clear if the quantity of each strain is listed in order of highest proportion either.You could be getting 239 mg of the first strain and 1 mg of each of the other 9 strains for all we know. If the quantity of each strain isn't available in the amount needed to provide benefits, then all those listed strains are just marketing hype.The mens and womens formulas have the same strains listed in different order on the labels. The mens says it is 217 mg and the womens says 248mg.If I find that there are only "token" quantities of most of the strains, this review goes to zero stars. I've written to the company to find out this information and will post if company responds.In the meantime, we continue to take this probiotic on faith that Dr. Perlmutter values his integrity and our health and has created a good quality product.

UPDATE:  Props to both amazon and Fisher Price for prompt and efficient customer service.  Fisher Price went through trouble shooting process with me and offered to send replacement.  Amazon, beat them by an hour (both responded within 24 hours) and sent a replacement.  The replacement works great and we all love this little wagon!NOTE:  If this toy worked as advertised it would be FIVE STARS; however the wagon we received doesn't play music as advertised.  I have written to amazon and FP asking for replacement and will update review when I hear back from them and get a working replacement. I am giving my enthusiastic five star rating in belief they will send me a working toy.In the meantime, here is what's great about this toy:It is very well made.  The wheels roll smoothly, are attached firmly.  The plastic is sturdy and has no sharp edges.  The handle is the perfect size, weight and length for a toddler.Our grandson has recently discovered that arms and hands can be worked in such a way to THROW things.  He has great muscle strength and coordination as we have found.  His new activity has also tested the limits of his toys.He was ear-to-ear grins when we unpacked this toy; and he's not one of those kids that gets all worked up about a new toy.  He does have a real love for balls, blocks and anything with wheels; so this toy met all of his happy requirements.The blocks have balls that roll around inside the blocks with various artwork on the balls.
