I'm not saying it's a weak cable, but it's definitely not as strong as a (usually more expensive) braided cable.Overall, though, it does the job, and for the amount it costs it's really hard to complain all that much. Personally, I really like the braided cables these days - especially when traveling, but that's a personal choice.4 stars out of 5. Recommended.*Sample provided for objective review*

No, it's not a 2-port or 3-port, spangly thing. It's a simple 1-port 2.4A charger for the car. That means it can charge an iPad at full speed without issues, and... it does!What I like about these 1-port chargers is that they can be so small. Personally, I don't care for these things sticking out a mile into my car, so the MYOHO does a great job here, being really tiny. There's also a small blue LED to indicate connectivity, which... depending on how you feel about blue LEDs is either a good thing or a bad thing. Personally I'd prefer a green one as it's less harsh on my eyes at night, but so it goes...Not much else to say about this in the negative, though. It works, charges great, and is small. Good stuff.4.5 out of 5. Recommended.*Sample provided for objective review*

This Contigo Autospout is a great drinks bottle if you're out and about, but it has a few issues. There are plenty of reviews about how good it is, so I'll just point out the things that are an issue.1.) It's quite tall, where I think it could stand to be a little fatter and shorter so it doesn't take up so much vertical space. I have a hard time finding a cabinet to put it in since it's so darn tall for being "only" 24oz. It also may not fit in many dishwasher top-shelf areas due to the height, despite being dishwasher safe. It barely fits in my full-size dishwasher.2.) The noise you make while sucking on the straw is... not exactly subtle.3.) The locking mechanism (not the release button) for the spout is really tough to move, though you don't really *need* to use it. I doubt an elderly person would have the strength or dexterity to shift that without trouble, in any case.4.) The straw comes with this really, really annoying label wrapped around it that was a total pain to remove. I ended up using a pen knife to cut it off, and even then I had to get some residue off that was left on the straw. NOT COOL.Overall, this is a solid, inexpensive 24oz drink holder. It works, doesn't leak, and I like that that the business end is covered and protected from unwanted interactions when not in use.4 stars out of 5. Good stuff.

This works really well with the latest MacBook Pro 13", but if you use e.g. a shell case for your laptop, you may find these cables can be a tad troublesome and not fit all the way in due to the extra case material around the mini-Displayport end. A more "standard"-looking cable fits without issue. Your mileage may vary here, but overall this has been a quality cable in the time I've had it (a little over a year).4.5 stars out of 5. Recommended.

I really, really wanted to like the Ear Force Stealth 450 headset. They tick all the right boxes. PC use, fully wireless, detachable mic, great sound etc.Unfortunately, there's one really glaring problem, and I'll get to that in a bit.Setting up the Ear Force 450 is really simple. Charge it up over any micro USB cable, and then plug in the included USB dongle, switch the headset on, and you're in business. It comes pre-paired. This even works on a Mac (2014 Retina iMac running OS 10.11 El Capitan). I was able to set the output to the Ear Force 450, and the microphone to the mic on the headset. Nope, you can't use the Superhuman hearing gimmick in OS X, but I'm not too bothered by this at all.So how's the sound?Excellent. I'm extremely impressed by the drivers in the Ear Force Stealth 450. No, they're not reference quality cans, but they put out a good sound for what they're designed for. Gaming and music. Listening to some Armin van Buuren through these is extremely impressive, and with the bass boost preset they seriously thump. A surprising amount of bass is available here.And the mic?Also excellent. Tested over Skype and FaceTime audio, I came across crystal clear to everyone I spoke to. I even used a voice recorder on my Mac (built into Quicktime player, if you're interested!), and my voice sounded excellent when played back.But... there are some problems. First, the minor ones. What's with the lights? Both sides of the headset have a white LED behind the logo, and they're both really bright. And the dongle features another - absolutely blinding white LED light. If you're a laptop user for gaming, you may want to put some black tape over the USB dongle. Crazy that it was made to be so bright.Second, there's a bit of audio feedback when adjusting the volume up or down quickly, - some little clicks/feedback. Not a major issue, but worth pointing out.Third, they're quite...plastic. They don't convey a particularly premium feel, that's for sure. This is subjective, but.. yeah. No.And here.. now, is the biggest issue. They are really, - and I mean REALLY - uncomfortable. I don't have a large head in width, and these things just plain HURT. The amount of pressure put on the side of your head is massive. I truly cannot imagine anyone finding these particularly comfortable, unless maybe it's a very young person using them. Sennheister HD598/590s these are NOT.It's actually a real shame, because if it weren't for the comfort issue I'd be using these every day. They sound pretty darn great, and the bass output is stellar. But I cannot wear them longer than 5-10 minutes without wanting to rip them off my head. They're THAT uncomfortable, and the feeling of relief when removing them from my head is beyond compare. I've worn a lot of headphones, and these are by far among the most uncomfortable I've ever worn.3 out of 5. A shame.

The Spigen Apple Watch stand joins an ever-growing bunch of stands for Apple's newest addition. And it does a really great job.Pros:1.) The price. The MSRP is extremely reasonable. Spigen did a very aggressive job marketing this.2.) The area of the stand where the Watch rests is rubbery, so there's no chance of scratching your new Watch.3.) The "puck" of the Apple charger (not included) is very securely held when pressed into the Stand.4.) It looks very smart, matching the iMac/Mac aesthetic excellently.5.) Rubber pads on the underside to prevent scratching your desk/nightstand.Cons:1.) There's no cable hiding, really. You can see where the cable pops out the back. Not a huge deal, especially given the price.2.) It's not an especially heavy dock, despite being a slab of aluminum. It's certainly possible to knock it over if you're clumsy.3.) Early versions of this featured the Spigen logo and "designed in California" etc... information on the top side of the stand. This appears to be resolved (my two stands both came with the information on the underside of the stand - as it should be).Overall, this is a near-perfect Apple Watch stand. My only real issue is I wish it weighed a bit more, but this is easily overshadowed by the excellent price and build quality.4.5 stars out of 5. Highly recommended.

The Samsung T1 Portable 500GB USB 3.0 SSD does so many things right, which is why it's such a shame it does one thing terribly, terribly wrong.But let's start with the good.Pros:1.) It's adorable. I mean really, really adorable. And tiny. It's smaller than you think. At 0.8" thick  x 2.0" long x 0.4" wide (and only 26 grams!), it makes regular 2.5" SSDs in enclosures look and feel absolutely massive.2.) It's based on the 850 EVO with 3D NAND, so it should be very reliable in the longterm.3.) Comes with a dinky little USB 3.0 cable. While the cable design itself is unique to the T1 as far as I'm aware, you can use any USB 3.0 cable out there if you lose the one the T1 comes with.4.) Great speed. I recorded just a hair under 390MB/s writes and another hair over 430MB/s read speeds while connected to my 2014 5K iMac, and similar speeds connected to a 2014 Mac mini.5.) 3-year warranty.Cons:1.) When you plug this drive into a Mac, you're greeted by a small 128MB partition with Windows and Mac installation files. Given that with every external drive I've ever used I would just wipe the drive and start using the disk, I was surprised to see that this doesn't work on the T1. First, you can't format the disk in Disk Utility - it just hangs the application. And second, you have no access to the actual 500GB - it's simply not visible. Uh oh. So, against my better judgment I installed their utility, which put two kexts AND an executable application on my iMac. At that point, I was able to label the disk using Samsung's utility, and set a password if I wanted. As soon as that was done, voila - 500GB available for my usage.But this is simply not acceptable. While I understand the necessity of the software if you want to password-protect the disk, there's no reason to force the software installation for everyone. So, I loaded up the Samsung utility, disabled the password, and then was able to successfully remove the two kext files and the Samsung application from my computer. At that point, the drive was readable on my 5K iMac without any issue, and also readable on the Mac mini (that I had never installed the software on in the first place).So at this point I think it's a great shame that Samsung has forced a software installation that keeps a daemon running in the background on your Mac - when for many of us it will be completely unnecessary.So here's my guide to making this SSD work on your Mac (and subsequently ANY Mac) without any software running - assuming you're not setting a password on the disk:1.) Plug in your new T1 to your Mac (after marveling at how adorable it is).2.) Install the Samsung application.3.) Now your drive should show up fine to read  from and write files to.4.) Open up Terminal (quick way to get to it is hit Command+Space Bar, and then type "Terminal", and hit "Enter")5.) Type or copy the following, one line at a time. (you can also manually do this in Finder if you have the know-how):sudo rm -r /System/Library/Extensions/SATSMARTDriver.kextsudo rm -r /System/Library/Extensions/SATSMARTLib.plugin(This removes two of the three unnecessary files that Samsung installs)6.) Remove the Samsung Application and folder from within ~/Library/Application Support/You can achieve this this by doing the following:a.) Open Finder.b.) In Finder, press CMD+Shift+G.c.) Paste the following: ~/Library/Application Support/d.) Remove the "PortableSSD" folder. This folder should contain only the Samsung application, so the folder is safe to delete in this case.e.) Reboot.7.) You're done!What's really frustrating about what Samsung has done is that they do tell you how to remove the first two files before you install their software, but make no mention of the third file/application that keeps running in the background. I thought about docking this review to 3 stars out of 5 for that alone, but the drive quality "makes up for it" in many ways.Overall, this is a great drive. It's just such a shame that Samsung has shown a lack of professionalism by their underhanded driver installation process (a process that needn't exist for many).PS Samsung - if you're reading this: In future ship this drive "open," i.e. a 500GB SSD with 500GB accessible OUT OF THE BOX. You can put the Samsung application on the SSD (maybe being completely truthful about what this entails...), but this then gives people the OPTION of whether they want your files all over their computer depending on whether they want password protection or not. Don't force it upon absolutely everyone who wants to use this otherwise excellent SSD.4 stars out of 5. Recommended with the above caveat.

Western Digital's Passport Ultra 1TB USB 3.0 is a great little drive. It's really thin, quite adorable, and will work just perfectly with a Mac or a PC.Tested on a 2014 5K iMac over USB 3.0, formatted HFS, it gets about 110MB/s read and the same 110MB/s write, which is quite acceptable for a drive like this.Coupled with a 3-year warranty from Western Digital, it's hard to go wrong here.5 stars out of 5. Highly recommended.

You can always rely on Crucial to provide solid memory for your laptop/desktop, and this memory is no exception. Working perfectly in a 2012 Mac mini, and with Crucial's warranty behind it (lifetime, yay!), I've no complaints.1.) Put memory in computer.2.) Rejoice.There's not much more to it.5 stars out of 5. Highly recommended.

This is an excellent Mini HDMI to HDMI cable from BlueRigger. I'm using it for a Haswell Intel NUC computer, and it's done a great job for about a year now. No video drop-outs - just excellent.The connectors are solid, the cable is sturdy, yep - this is an easy recommendation.5 stars out of 5. Excellent.

The Kindle Voyage is easily Amazon's most premium Kindle yet, but it's not without issues.Pros:1.) Feels absolutely great in the hand.2.) Glass display still looks like paper - no mean feat!3.) Battery life is excellent.4.) The new magnetic Amazon cover you can buy for the Voyage is quirky genius.5.) New high-res display is fantastic.Cons:1.) Expensive!2.) The uniformity of the screen is still an issue... - This is a BIG one. Part of the reason I still tend to gravitate to my aging Kindle Touch is because there's no front-lighting system built in. That means that screen uniformity is excellent. Every Paperwhite and Kindle Voyage I've used unfortunately suffers from an uneven front-lighting system. What this means is that parts of the screen tinge green or pink with the front lighting system on. This isn't generally noticeable outside or under strong ambient lighting. However, in bed or in the dark when reading - this color non-uniformity is frustrating to my eyes, and it's the biggest reason why the Voyage doesn't come close to being a 5-star product. Having used several Voyage devices, it definitely varies from Voyage to Voyage, but I've yet to see one with a perfectly uniform display.I hope the next iteration of Voyage can improve on this issue, because until then, - yes it's the best reading device out there, but I wish it were better!3.75 out of 5. Recommended, with caveats.

This is a really nice sleeve for the MacBook Pro 13" with Retina display!Pros:1.) Easily fits the MacBook Pro 13" with Retina display without squeezing.2.) The added bonus is that even with a Speck polycarbonate case on the MacBook Pro, it still fits into this cover.3.) Velcro keeps the sleeve closed.4.) No odor, even when new.5.) Can double as a "placemat" for your MacBook Pro on your lap/table etc.6.) Protection is great, as the material has a nice substance to it.Cons:1.) The material does tend to pill a little bit over time, but this is a minor complaint.2.) Be careful not to dump soda on it. Oops! :-)Overall, this is an excellent sleeve for your MacBook Pro 13" with Retina display. The material feels really nice, - it's hard not to recommend this highly if you want a soft sleeve for your laptop.4.75 out of 5. Highly recommended.

Yes, other covers are cheaper - but to my mind never better - than Amazon's Paperwhite cover. It's extremely resilient to scratches due to its mottled nature, and the cover stays closed via the magnet, very well.It's a little tricky to remove the Kindle Paperwhite from this cover, but that's only a minor niggle. Quite frankly, - I can't see why you'd ever remove it.The Saddle Brown color is extremely smart, and does not dirty up with use over time.Overall, this is a great case. It protects all edges of the Paperwhite without too much bulk, and it's certainly my number one pick for your favorite reading device!5 stars out of 5.

Like others, I had no idea this sort of thing existed, or that it would be so fast to use.Anyway, straight to the pros/cons, I think!Pros:1.) Shows up in a simple-to-open box (very much like Amazon's frustration-free packaging, except in color!). No tearing anything open or struggling to remove the device.2.) Comes with 2x AAA batteries to power the device. (We'll see how long they last, but for free I'm not expecting much!)3.) Comes with a sturdy pouch for your belt, that detaches with velcro so you don't need to remove your belt to remove the pouch. Very thoughtful.4.) Has a nice, big, backlit, color LCD. No it's not a super high-res display or anything, but it's very readable, and the backlight is extremely useful when you're measuring in dark places (under beds etc).5.) The buttons take just a minute or two to figure out (even with the manual) but once you get it, you GET it.6.) Lets you adjust whether to measure from the front of the device or the back. It defaults to the back always when you power on the unit, so you can place the rear of the casing against a wall and get an accurate reading without having to subtract the length of the case from the measurement. You can switch it to measure from the front if necessary. Again, thoughtful.7.) Does simple length, sq/ft, or cubic feet (or meters) with a single button press to switch between them.8.) Has a memory system to remember the last 10 measurements taken, even if you switch the unit off OR replace the batteries. Very nice.9.) Will auto-off after 3 minutes, or you can hold down the OFF button to switch it off manually. Having both options is good.10) Last but really not least, EXTREMELY accurate. One press to turn the unit on, another to have the laser mark the spot, and another to get a reading instantly. I've found it to be within 1/16 of an inch of my 25-foot physical tape measure.Cons:1.) Quite frankly, I've not found anything to complain about as yet. It's perhaps not the cheapest laser measurer out there, but it's certainly excellent.Overall, this is a great product. While it's certainly geared more toward professional use, I've certainly found it useful for measuring portions of my house for re-flooring.5 stars out of 5. Highly recommended.

This is (at the time of typing) Mediabridge's only reversible USB charger, and it's a good one.Pros:1.) Finally does away with struggling to figure out which way to plug those USB cables.2.) Comes with a detachable figure-8 cable, giving you more flexibility of placement.3.) Easily charges two tablets simultaneously.4.) ETL Certified.5.) 100-240V compatible, so you can just buy a figure-8 end wherever you are, and charge away!Cons:1.) LEDs. Good grief. Each port glows blue. And then there's another bright blue LED near the bottom, too. When you have devices plugged in, it dulls the USB port glow, but still - if you use this in a bedroom you may well be bothered by the amount of light leakage here. This is of course a personal preference, but for me it's a little too much. Because four of the LEDs are in those USB ports, you can't even really cover them with tape otherwise you'd have to mess with tape every time you plug or unplug something. D'oh!That said, this really is an excellent USB charger (if the LEDs don't drive you nuts).4 stars out of 5.*Sample provided for objective review*

While Mediabridge touts this as a 5-Port "Desktop" USB charger, it's actually very much at home at a desk OR by your bedside, ready and willing to charge whatever device you fancy. This thing will easily charge 4x iPads simultaneously for example (2A charge per tablet device), without missing a beat. No, it won't charge 5 iPads simultaneously, but.. somehow this isn't much of an issue for most people.I like that the unit ships with two pieces: the USB main section, and a detachable kettle-plug cord. This is exceptionally handy for traveling, as localized kettle plugs are readily available in most countries, and since the unit is 100-240v compatible you're set basically anywhere in the world without need for a hefty power converter. It also means you can have furniture pushed up against a much lower-profile kettle plug rather than the chunkier USB brick.Two really great things about this Mediabridge are aspects that it DOESN'T have:1.) No audible buzzing sounds from the unit itself, something I've encountered on lesser brands. That noise can be annoying by your bed at night.2.) No distracting LEDs at all to disturb you either at your desk or while you're sleeping.Overall, this is a top-notch USB charger for your devices, and with UL certification, it's an absolute no-brainer and the highest recommendation.5 stars out of 5.*Sample provided for objective review*

I didn't think it was possible to be REALLY impressed with a pair of disposable gloves. I've used many store brands over the years, and not a single brand has stuck out as being better than any others.So it came as a surprise to me that Ammex is onto a winner here, because these gloves are superb. The textured surface is extremely handy for gripping oily tools, and they take an awful lot of effort to rip. I had to yank on them pretty heavily to cause a tear (for science!), and I'm not sure I personally would ever rip a pair doing the things I regularly do - car work, cleaning bathrooms etc.These are an easy, easy recommendation, and more importantly - these are also easily my favorite disposable glove on the market by a wide margin.5 stars out of 5. Top notch.

If you're looking for an adorable (yes, adorable) laptop sleeve for your 13" MacBook Pro with Retina Display, the Inateck MP1323 is it.It provides a very soft padding, and a neat little elastic loop that wraps around a wooden (well, it looks like wood!) button. The button is really, really sewn on there, so I don't see it ripping off unless you REALLY try.On one side, the patterned material is also a pouch, so you can put papers or a small folder in there, or perhaps an iPhone charging cable or two. Included with the case is another, small drawstring bag, designed to fit something like your laptop's charger + other cables. In addition, Inateck provides you with a screen-cleaning cloth (complete with Inateck branding, so you know they tried!).I really like the padding on this case. While not designed to protect against seriously hard drops, it will protect your laptop on its day-to-day journeys to and from work or while business traveling with it in a briefcase/backpack.On a rather random side-note, I really like that there's no "odor" to this sleeve. There's no smell at all. Makes a change from a lot of things I've reviewed in the past. Thank you, Inateck.For the money, this is a great little case for the 13" MacBook Pro with Retina Display.4.5 stars out of 5.*Sample provided for objective review*

While the Playstation 3D Display may not have done so well, being discontinued relatively shortly after release, I'm glad it existed, because it meant lower-price 3D glasses which work on many of Sony's other projectors (The HW30ES, HW40ES, and HW50ES).I use these glasses on both the HW30ES and HW50ES, and they work great. They're very comfortable, much more so than the very expensive glasses that came with my HW50ES, which pinch my nose like there's no tomorrow.Overall, these are great glasses, and are well worth the extremely cheap price they go for these days.

I've had this Spigen Neo Hybrid case since launch date, for my iPhone 6 Plus. Since I was unfortunate enough to receive the first-gen version, Spigen had to send me out some replacement button pads, which wasn't a big deal.Since October 2014 - April 6, 2015 (the time of writing), I've had a really good experience with this case. The buttons are very easy to press, with the only downside being it's a little tricky with larger fingers to be able to access the mute switch in its recessed hole in the case.That said, the case has done a great job thus far at protecting my iPhone 6 Plus without adding too much bulk at all. Aside from the aforementioned mute switch fiddliness, it's an excellent case, with good build quality, and that oh-so-important lip around the screen.Overall, 4.5 stars out of 5. Easily recommended.

There's very little negative to say about the 13.3" MacBook Air. It provides a best-in-class keyboard and trackpad, and Mac OS provides a very stable experience in either the lastest Mavericks update 10.9.5, or the (at the time of writing) 10.10.2 Yosemite update.However, the screen is really due an upgrade. 1440x900 on a 13.3" laptop is simply not good enough by 2015's standards, so hopefully we see some new higher-resolution displays from Apple in the next year.Overall, 4 out of 5. A really, really great experience, a little let down by a screen that cries out for an update.

I'm using this SanDisk Extreme CZ80 64GB USB 3.0 drive to transfer files between a couple of newer Macs (2014 Mac mini and a 2014 5K iMac), and I've been incredibly impressed with the SanDisk's speed. I've been able to reach 259MB/s read, and 204MB/s writes on larger files, which are actually higher numbers than SanDisk claims.This has been a really reliable stick over hundreds of transfers. It really is an SSD in a USB 3.0 stick, so I expect many, many more reliable transfers.Overall, 5 stars out of 5.

The Asus 15-inch X551MAV is a decent laptop, for the price. No, it doesn't have the quality of a MacBook Air, - neither the build, keyboard or trackpad are as solid or "responsive" but again - for the price it's hard to complain. Same goes for the screen, though it does a "fine" job.What it does have is a bevy of ports, including both HDMI, VGA, and USB 3.0.For a starter/basic laptop with a fully licensed copy of Windows 8.1, you'd be hard pressed to find a better deal, and thus it receives the highest recommendation.5 stars out of 5.

Problem: I just received my new Nintendo 3DS XL. I need a larger memory card because.... Xenoblade.Solution: Sony 32GB Class 10 Micro SDHC memory card.The card showed up from Amazon promptly, and after a quick transfer to my new Nintendo 3DS XL, it's been purring along for the last couple of months now without a single issue. No, it's certainly not the fastest card on the planet, but the 3DS XL won't take advantage of the super-high-speed Micro SD cards anyway, so don't waste your money!Bottom line: If you need a new memory card for your 3DS XL, this is a great choice. Reliable, and large enough for most people!5 stars out of 5. Good stuff.

I must admit I'm not much of a neck pillow person, but somehow, this VIVE Health neck pillow has changed my mind.First, it's got really excellent memory foam inside its removable cover. It's solid, without being too hard, and so far has held up very well. I expect years of enjoyment from it. Second, the cover (it zips up) is easily removable for cleaning, and is of very soft, cozy material. Good! And lastly, it's got a little elastic strap which you can stretch around a suitcase handle etc as you roll your luggage around the airport.So what's not to like? Well, it's not especially tiny, so you'll certainly want to take advantage of that elastic strap. Other than that, there's nothing that I've noticed to complain about it. It's just very, very comfortable.5 stars out of 5. An easy recommendation.

So if you're a beginner, and new to the yoga world, this book is for you. I currently took up a yoga as stress reliever for my medical health. My doctor told me to try yoga as it would help a lot. Of course I had no idea how to do yoga the correct way. But I was like how hard could it be? I need a guide and this book was right so I could do yoga from the comfort of my own home.So when I got this book, it seemed pretty simple. It starts out by explaining the basics of yoga and why people do it. Then we get into the yoga poses. Each yoga pose is displayed on the left and to the right of it there is a step by step little mini guide to get you into that pose easily. Including even how to breathe while in that pose.Further into the book it gives you a list of poses to do for each category you are trying to work on. Such as medical Heath, energizing, calming, strong legs, etc.The. The other chapters explain this such as nutrition and mediation. There's a lot of great info in here for beginners and even none beginners. It's a clear guide to help you get on the right path to relaxation and I just love it. Recommended to anyone and everyone.I was so happy to be able to try this not as a sample to give my honest review on it to everyone and if you have any questions at all, just comment below and I will answer those right away for you. I love this little tracker. When it arrived, it was smaller then I expected it to be. It was quite tiny and I pictured it just bigger kind of like a watches size. I actually liked that it was a lot smaller because it's easier to put anywhere on your pants that you like. You can even clip it onto your shoe with no problems.It's very light weight and practically has no weight to it at all, and it's perfect for those trying to get fit. Right now I am very competitive so me and my sister both have one now and at the end of the day we see who walked/exercised the most and who ever did wins what ever we bet that day.This is the perfect thing anybody needs for those wanting to watch their weight or stay fit. It just amazes me how it only works if its like clipped on to your pants or shoe. I tried walking running in place with it in my hand and nothing happened. It's like it know which is pretty neat. You can't lie to it haha It does count your correct steps to. I counted my steps form one side of the house to the other 2 times, and then I looked at the tracker to see if it counted the same as me and it was spot on.Love my new little tracker, and I was happy to be able to try it out as a sample to give my honest review on it to everyone. This one fits me perfectly. I have been trying to find a perfect fitting waist trainer to hold my tummy in They go by china sizes thou so I always have so much difficulty finding one. Luckily this one fit me like it was made for me. I got the 5XL, and I am 4'11 and about 185 pounds. As I went to the products listing again to write my review, I just noticed it was latex! The button hooks are on the front and located under a little piece of fabric you pull to the side that goes back over them so you can't see the hooks once you have it on.I wear a sports bra with it, and I would recommend putting it on first and then the waist trainer. 2:00 MinsThis is the cutest little shirt I have every owned for my babies. It lights up and just looks adorable when they are wearing them. I got a size medium for my miniature poodle and he is short and chubby a little so it's kind of tight under his arms. The batteries come pre-installed in them already but comes with two extras. It literally has a hoodie on the sweater but it does not have ear holes. If it came with ear holes that would be even better but you can always make some if you really want them. My dogs just wear the sweater with no hoodie on their heads... they don't like that haha.It also has a hole on the back where you can hook a harness up to the leash through the hoodie. I have a few different I phone 6 plus cases I switch between, but this one is at the top of my favorites because it's not only mixed with my two favorite colors, but it protects my phone like you wouldn't believe. Now the purple is like a lighter purple in person then in the listing picture, but it still looks amazing.This is like a two-in-one case because there is two parts to it. There is a rubber case, then a hard case. The rubber part is inside and protects your phone and cushions it, while the hard outer case protects from hard drops to the floor. It sticks up above the screen so your screen is safe. I am not even sure why they make cases that don't cover your phone completely including the screen, I don't see the point in that as if your drop your phone, you're out of luck.The rubber and plastic are a perfect combination together. This watch is beautiful. I have never seen a wooden watch like this one before. It's easy to read, and have had no problems with it. To me this could be a woman's watch as well, not just for men. 0:43 MinsThis is a nice projector. In my video, my outlet was to far away from the wall I wanted to project on so I had to put it closer to the wall. So the screen is only covering a small portion of the wall.I used my own HDMI cord to connect it to my computer and play a video. The picture quality is amazing and it's easy to set up. Just make sure you take the lens cap off, plug it into the wall, then into your computer, hit menu on the remote, and I put it to  "HDMI". I was then connected to it and begun my video to play it.I would say you can't be further then 9-10 feet or the video picture comes in a little blurry. At least on my wall. If you are putting it on a projector screen, I think you will be able to move it further away and be able to have it come in clearly with no problems. To adjust the picture clearness, just turn the lens slightly to the left or right for better picture to adjust. Also the movie I am playing in the video, is not HD. It's "HOCUS POCUS" and is just standard.It comes with a little stand, but the stand barley holds the projector up and my projector kept falling over. So I just took the stand off and laid it flat. The stand screws into the bottom to the left side. I think that's the problem. If it was located in the middle and a little stronger, it would be fine. That's the only problem I had thou.This is great for family time to watch a movie, and I am especially using this (Like right now) to watch Halloween movies. The movies look amazing and even scarier like you're at a drive in. Love it. I was so happy to be able to try this projector out at a discounted price so I could give my honest review on it to everyone. 0:45 MinsSo, to start you get tree packages delivered. 2 square boxes with each a bag of foam ball filling for the pillow. Then the other box is the pillow cover. The filling is basically just foam shaped into tiny little balls. You have to put this filling inside the bag that goes into the pillow cover.The pillow cover is not a fabric material. It's like a hard fabric that kind of feels like a tarp material. So you're going to want to put a blanket over top of when laying on it. Now I was confused on the filling. Mine came in two plastic bags, but the bags look differently then some of the other pictures on here. Not sure why they came like that? You have to put the filling inside yourself, and let me tell you, this is the part I hated because the foam just went everywhere. I wish it was a lot easier to put in. But it didn't help any that the bag you're supposed to put it in, only has a small opening. Not sure why they don't make the whole bigger. Would be soooo much easier.  Now maybe mine was harder because of the bags it came in. If it would have came in smaller bags like I see in the pictures, it probably would have been easier to get it the cover.Once I got all the foam inside the the mesh white baggy, I put it inside the actually pillow cover. The pillow cover zips, then Velcro's over so you cannot see the zipper. It's so nice to lay on. It's more like a bean bag pillow then an actual pillow.  It's nice thou.It could be used more then just a pillow. Kids can use it as a chair to watch tv in, or you could even use it for a bigger dog for the floor. It could be used for whatever really. Right now I use mine on my bed to just relax on and watch TV. I throw a blanket over it and it's really comfy.From the pictures you can see how big it is. On a three person couch, it covers about 2/3 quarters of it and still hangs off on the sides. I really love it thou, and was glad I could try it out at a discounted price so I could give my honest review on it to everyone. The reason I'm giving it 4 stars is because of the filling and the difficulty I had getting it in the bag. Definitely a two person job to get it in haha. Besides that, it's a great little bean bag Chair pillow.If you have any questions at all, just comment below and I will try and wander those for you right away. Also if my review helped you in any way, please hit the "YES" button bellow where it asks "Was this review helpful to you" so others can find this review(:

3:22 MinsI am in love with this set. First let me begin by saying that the blue mouse pad that's in the picture/video is not what comes with the set. I misplaced the one that came with so am using my other one. I will post pictures of the one that comes with the set, when I find it(:MOUSE:It is a USB mouse as well as the keyboard. The mouse has a pretty good length of cord to it, but I just keep it bunched up because I don't need to extend it far at all to use it. It changes colors on it's own and smoothes in and out of each color. It's more like about 3 colors at a time that display through the mouse and change to different colors. I would say the colors change about every 5 seconds and go in and out. It's not like a blinking thou, just a light smooth in and out so it's nice. It has a great design to it and you can grip it very well and click with ease. You can also change the DPI (mouse speed of the cursor) by pressing the white button on top. Now in the description it says it has 3 DPI modes,  600/1000/1600. However, It seems like it has 4. So the other DPI speed may be 800. I am not sure of this thou, all I know is I can click it 3 times before it goes back to it's slowest speed (600).Onto the KEYBOARD:This is by far my favorite keyboard I have ever owned. I love all things that glow like gaming headsets, etc. But I have never owned a glowing keyboard before and I should have. At first I thought it only glowed red, but then I actually read the listing and saw the directions. You can change it to 3 different colors. Red, Blue or Purple. You can also change the brightness of the keyboard and even turn the color off all together.*******************************************************************************************************************Directions on changing the keyboard color:Press and hold the "Fn" key + "SL" key (At the top near right corner) at the same time. This will change your colors and you can pick the one you want.Directions on changing the keyboard color to switch in and out of the 3 colors:Press and hold the "Fn" key + "PS" key (Near the "SL" key) at the same time. This will fade in and out of the three colors.Directions on changing the keyboard color to flash the same color:Hold the "Fn" key + "PB" key (Near the "SL" key) at the same time. This will make it flash one color. Now when you first hit the two keys together, it always flashes red. If you want it to flash blue or purple, simple just press the "Fn" and "PB" again or until you are at the color you want to flash.Directions on changing the brightness of color:Press and hold the "Fn" key and then press and release the upper (Higher brightness) or lower (Lower brightness) arrow that are located down by the right corner.  I made a video of it too so hope it helps if you are having trouble with it.*******************************************************************************************************************This keyboard also has a windows key on it and some windows functions like like mail key and so on. It has volume keys to change the volume of your computer while playing music or a video too. They keyboard is easy to use and  makes very little clicking noise which I know can drive most people crazy with the annoying loud clicking. Everything is spaced out perfectly. It's such a cool keyboard especially to use at night sense everything glows. The whole look of it, I just love. It looks like thunder cracking when it's on blue or purple color. So pretty. I was very happy to be able to try this out as a sample so I could give my honest review on it to everyone.If you have any questions at all, just comment below and I will do my best to answer those for you. Also if my review helped you in any way, please hit the "YES" below where it asks "Was this review helpful to you?" so others can find it as well (:

1:18 MinsI think this is seen as more of a couple item to use together, but you can so have fun by using this yourself for solo play.What it comes with:-Hard case to put everything away in-C-Shape Silica Gel Vibrator-Remote-Charger- And a little net baggy to put your toy and remote in to store.The vibrator is very flexible and can be bent each and every way imaginable. The remote runs on 2 AAA batteries that controls the vibrator. The remote has 2 buttons, ON/OFF and 30 button mode. To use this toy both buttons on both items need to be turned on. The remote has to be on the ON (Indicator Will light up red when on), and the vibrator has to be turned on. On the big piece of it, there is a little button you need to hit on (Indicator will light up red when on) so the remote can work.The remote is easy to use and has many different vibration patterns that switches between the two pieces. To change to a different vibration pattern, you just hit the "30" button on the remote and it switches to the next pattern in line.The vibration in it is very strong and powerful. Like I said this does not have to be used with a partner, you can use it by yourself. There is many possibilities how to use this, it all comes down to how you would like to use it really. To charge the vibration part, you just plug the wall charger into the big piece end and you are good to go. So that part runs on the charger, and the remote runs on 2 AAA batteries.This toy is a lot of fun and could so spice up the bedroom with your partner. So recommended to anyone. Nice little night light. I got the white one and it looks perfect in my kitchen and adds just the write look. It has 3 settings on it, SOUND/PHOTO/OFF. Castor oil is great for many uses such as, acne, sunburn,stretch marks, hair, age spots, and many kind of skin conditions. The reason I wanted to try this out was because I have severe eczema. I am rarely ever comfortable and my skin dries out so fast. I am constantly putting lotions and creams on but it's not a fix, just a temporary solution.So I begun to use this castor oil and so far it has been helping me severely. It helps with itching and dry skin the most and my skin has been getting more clear because I have not been scratching so much anymore. I have only been using it for a few weeks, but it has been helping so much where I am upset with myself I have not tried this years ago. I use medicated creams and such and all this time I could have been getting castor oil for a lot less money and it works better... haha go figure.  I guess sometimes cheap is better.It comes sealed and with a different nozzle which I have on it. What's nice about the nozzle is you can twist it. And by twisting it, you can open and close it, but also control how much oil comes out at a time. Like I always just twist mine a little so only a few drops come out at a time. About just 10 drops can cover your whole entire arm. So this does last awhile.It has the feeling of I would say vegetable oil. It's thick at first and feels like vegetable oil, and even looks like it, but when you put it on your skin it thins out and doesn't feel heavy and weird. It does however leave a greasy feel but with my condition, I prefer that so it locks in moisture and keeps my skin hydrated. It doesn't really have a smell to it either which is good.I really am so happy with this and was able to try it out at a discounted price to give my honest review on it to everyone. If anything changes with it I will edit my review but I think it's been long enough to safely say I cannot find anything negative at all with this.If you have any questions at all, just comment below and I will try and answer those right away for you. I opened these up and saw 9 rocks. 3 of the bigger stones were engraved with gold writing which read, "Body", "Relax" and "Soul". Then the other 6 were just plain rocks. I thought to myself, they're just rocks. So I looked up ways on what to do with them. A lot of different things came up.. things that could really help and benefit myself, which I was surprised by.One of the best uses I found that could help me the most was the cooling therapy method which helps with inflammation. I have eczema and my skin becomes inflamed sometimes during breakouts and I usually use ice or something cool because I feel relief from it. The soothing cold feeling of the rocks can help with a lot of things. You can use these for massages and even warm them up if that's what you prefer. It's all up to you and your preference. When the other has, bubbles,starfish, seahorses, and little squids.They're a very light material and not heavy at all which is good because in the summer your baby will not get to warm. In the winter when it's cold you can just wrap the blanket around more then once like a cozy cocoon and make it warm for you little one as well.They are not just for swaddling blankets thou. They could be used for many things such as to just line the crib so your baby can lay on it, or you can use it to put down when you have to change them. The large size can offer many possibilities.The seller is very nice and you can tell cares about her/his customers. They even list their contact E-mail on the back of the packaging if you need anything at all. I love these blankets and I was happy I was able to get it at a discounted price so I could give my honest review on it to everyone.If you have any questions at all, you can comment on my review anytime and I will try and answer those right away for you. Also if my review helped you in any way, please hit the "YES" below where it asks "Was this review helpful to you?" so others can find it(:

0:55 MinsThis is pretty easy to use. Some may be like oh why go through all the trouble of having this machine that just shoots water, when I can just buy some dental floss? Well I'll tell you. For myself I have really sensitive gums. I mean really sensitive, every day when I brush and floss my gums will just bleed like someone knocked me in my mouth. It was really bad. I have been using this and ever sense my gums are not that inflamed anymore. When I brush my teeth they don't bleed as much at all. And when I floss with this machine, my gums are perfectly fine.So let me describe the machine starting from the bottom to the top. At the bottom it has grips so when it is on a counter it is not sliding all over the place. This is also where the power cord connects. Write into the bottom and it will tell you in the manual where.Then we have our middle part. In the middle we have the one button which powers the machine ON/OFF with just one touch. Then we have the piece of course where the attachments connect to. It has different settings, and to change the settings, you just slide it up or down with your thumb while in use. This is connected to a tangle free cord which I was impressed with because when your done with it, the cord automatically goes back to how it was before in circles so there is no cord everywhere.Now to the left we have a little compartment that stores up to 9 attachments. This machine comes with 5 different attachments. 4 of the same one but is different colors along the base so multiple family members can use their own attachment. Then it has a tongue attachment which cleans and washes your tongue.Now the top is the cover for the whole machine but it also converts into the water holder for the machine. You just flip it upside down and fill it with water and then turn your machine on and start washing your mouth.I must say, I could not believe how much this cleaned my mouth. I brushed and flossed my teeth very well like any other morning and the first time I got this and tried it out, I just could not believe. It really does work and it is simply amazing. I felt like I was at the dentist getting professional cleaning. You know the feeling when you're just done getting your teeth brushes, washed, flossed and you just feel so refreshed? That's what I felt like. It can go up to a very high pressure for an even deeper cleaning, but it's still gentle on the gums and feels kind of like it's massaging your gums. After your done you just keep running the machine until all the water is out of it, wipe the machine off because your bound to get some water on it with all the cleaning, (At least I did), then store it away back in the box under the bathroom sink and you're good to go.I simply love this machine and I happy I was able to get this at a discounted price so I could give my honest review on it to everyone.If you have any questions at all, just comment below and I will answer those right away for you. Also if my review helped you in any way, please hit the "YES" below where it asks "Was this review helpful" (:

0:44 MinsThis is just Simpy great in every way. My short haired tabby cat is constantly shedding all over the house, especially because of the warm weather now, the hair she drops off of her can be made into another cat. You wouldn't believe it.This deshedding tool fits in your hand perfectly with a nice curve so your hand is comfortable. The brush part at first, looked very sharp to me. I was hesitant to use it at first so I tried it on myself at first. It did not hurt one bit. So I used it on my cat and she loved it. She purred and just stood there as I brushed her coat out. I gathered up so much hair just by brushing her from the neck down to the tail a few times. Surprisingly, all of it stay locked into the brush and didn't go to the floor.When I was done, I just went over to the garbage can, pushed the button on the back of it that pushed the hair forward on the brush so I could just wipe it right off into the trash can. I love this brush and so does my baby. I am happy I was able to try it out as a sample and give my honest review on it to everyone. Very pleased with it, and especially happy it's not all on my bed anymore where I have to take a lint roller to it! hahaIf you have any questions at all, just comment below and I will answer those right away for you. Also if my review helped you in any way, please hit the "YES" below where it asks "Was this review helpful to you?" so others can find and read this review(:

So these came in the mail, and when I took them out, I thought they were finger rings. Thy are about the size of a soda cap but are very stretchy. These can be worn by adults or children because of the size. They are a bit snug on the wrist, but not like tight where it's going to hurt you at all. I actually like how they feel and how they are snug because I have had wrist bands before and once you put any keys or something on, they weight the wrist band down and it just slips off your wrist easily.So with these, I love how I can put a few rings or keys on them and they stay put on my wrist. I also like how a child could where these as well and won't lose them off their wrists so easily. I guess it all has to do with how big your wrist is. If you are a very big man, then no, I would not suggest these for you. But they are fine for women with thin wrists and children.The colors are very vibrant and colorful and I like that as well. I think the colors you get are all random, but I am pleased with the colors I got and I was happy to be able to try this out as a sample to give my honest review on them to everyone.If you have any questions at all, just comment below and I will answer those right away for you. Also if my review helped you in any way, please hit the "YES" below where it asks "Was this review Helpful?" (:

These are nice little pins for keeping things closed such as chips, cereals, breads, etc. They are a bit smaller then regular sized clothespins, so I would say these are mini ones. You get a total of 40 in the pack. 10 yellow, 10 green, 10 red, and 10 blue.They are not completely that strong, but they do grab and hold pretty well. I just wouldn't say they have the best grasp on them. They work great for keeping foods fresh and sealed thou, like chips which is what I mostly use them for. So for that kind of thing they work great for. For holding and hanging clothes up on a line, I don't think they would be that great for honestly.They are cute thou, I like the colors, and I was happy to be able to  get these at a discounted price to give my honest review on them to everyone.If you have any questions at all, just comment below and I will answer those for you right away. These pans are absolutely gorgeous. They can pretty much match any kitchen and add a beautiful touch to them. They came packages so neatly and when I took them out they were so shiny I did not even want to cook them. I just wanted to put them up on my stove and be like "Hey! Hey! Look how shiny my pots and pans are!" haha.The set includes:10.5-inch Fry pan1.75-quart Sauce pan1.75-quart, 2.25-Quart, 3.25-Quart, 5.75-Quart Casserole with lids.The 10.5-inch Fry pan even has a handle on the side as well which a lot of frying pans don't have. They only have the one handle. All pans and pots come with their own glass lid that is very clear and you can see through while cooking. Each lid has an easy to grab handle and not one of those little tiny knobs like others do that you can barley grab (I'm guilty of having those before). Also each lid has a tiny little hole in it so the steam does not fog up the whole glass lid. This is also very great for gas stove users such as myself because I have had pots/pans before with lids but no holes on the lids, and because of this, it built up so much water on the lids, dripped down the sides and put out the gas flame. That was not good at all. So I really like how these differ from others.The large handles even have thumb indents where your thumb goes when you pick them up. They are just such a beautiful set that are well made. I was very happy to be able to get these as sample to give my honest review on them to everyone and I am very pleased. If I have any problems with them down the line I will update this review as well.If you have any questions, just comment below and I will answer those right away. Length:: 0:48 MinsThis Oximeter seems to work pretty well. I tried it on multiple people in my family, and the results came up about the same how their supposed to.It runs on 2 AAA batteries (Not included) which at first I did not know how to get them in there and was confused. Then I figured it out. On the back part where it says "TPHealth Pulse Oximeter", there is a silver button. Press that in and hold it, then slide the whole thing down and that's how you open the the battery compartment.It is very light weight and easy to use. The manual it comes with basically tells you everything you need to know about it and how to use it. The screen is very clear and the numbers are as well. While you are taking your pulse, you can even click the button on the top by the screen, and change the screen direction to which way it is facing.It also comes with a strap where you can put in on the Oximeter and then be able to wear it around your neck or your wrist so you don't lose it. How ever I was not able to put the strap through the tiny hole so easily. It's located it a tight spot so it's kind of difficult, for me at least. I will keep trying and will use a pin then hopefully I'll get it through. Other then that, I think it's a pretty good finger pulse meter and I was happy to be able to get it at a discounted price to give my honest review on it to everyone.If you have any questions at all, just comment below and I will answer those for you right away. Also if my review helped you in any way, please hit the "YES" where it asks below "Was this review Helpful?"(:

So I got a large size for my toy poodle. He has frequent accidents and likes to lift his leg on this when he is upset or when I go out anywhere. He is very small and only weighs about 5 pounds. His waist is tiny and this fits him perfectly just right and snug. The material is very stretchy and seems very comfy and not at all like a stiff material. I like how these are made very much because the ones I have now I got form Walmart by simple solution I believe, it cuts into their skin because it is very tight around the edges. This wrap by JD Gems is nothing like that thank goodness.Inside it there is a little flap that you can easily put a pad in there. I put a little maxi pad in there for the accidents so I can just change those out frequently instead of washing it every time he goes in them or lifts his leg on anything. It's a cute little design, you just get rando colors. They kind of look like little tutu's haha. But based on how small the large was, I don't think the sizing would be good for any doggy past the size of about a 12 pound poodle, and that's for an XXL I would suggest.I like it for my baby and I ma glad it fits him, I know these sizes tend to run small so I wanted to get a size up. I was happy to be able to have the chance to be able to get this as a sample and give my honest review on it to everyone. I love it, and recommend it to any doggy that likes to lift his leg on things and still has accidents.If you have any questions at all, just comment below and I will answer those right away for you. Also if my review helped you in any way, please hit the "YES" to where it asks below if you have found this review helpful(:

The Lumenata Pro mouse is by far the best mouse I've ever owned. The box has a nice window so you can view the product before opening it. It has a manual and a mini cd that will download the software onto your computer to better customize your mouse to fit your needs. It has a 1.8 heavy duty braided cable that is a 2.0 usb gold plated.It has 5 LED colors indicating different profiles and different characters or games. it weighs 170g so its just the right weight for in my hand and my husbands large hand. This mouse has a insane 12000 FPS rate and 8200 DPI!!! It also has a soft rubber black matte finish on the top and partly on the sides so it feels great in your hand so I had no problem playing with my husband for a couple hours without hurting my hand.This mouse has a omniscroll so it can scroll in 4 different directions. It  also has a programmable X&Y axis and it has 11 buttons on it and 9 are programmable so it helps take my other hand off the keyboard so its very easy to do macro and kiting.My husband has a $100 mouse and we fight over using this bad boy. I catch him using it more then his own, But I'm a nice wife so I let him borrow it lol.I (and my husband apparently) were very happy to receive this mouse at a discount to review! It really is one of the best gaming mice out there for the price.

The Rooted gaming mouse pad comes in a really cool hexagon packaging and is pretty sturdy so it does not get crushed in the mail.It's large which makes it perfect for gaming but we still use it as an everyday mouse pad as well. It is a slick black design with a deep red circuit board look to it in the top right.With a medium friction level pad it is perfect for me doing everyday computer work and my husband and kids playing computer games. My husband loves that his mouse glides across it while hes fully immersed into his games, while the bottom being natural Eco friendly rubber the pad doesn't slip or slide around no matter how vigorously its being used.This mouse pad is able to keep up with my husbands mouse that he plays at 8200 DPI and hasn't given him a single issue. He loves Sentey's gaming products and that is all he uses now.This Sentey gaming mouse pad is amazing! I was thrilled to get this as a sample to give an honest review on it. It's above all other mouse pads I've had before.

Excellent Lab tags. I have had some that are like practically paper and when I go to put them in the dirt the just bend on the end... waste of money.These are very strong and are plastic. They are sharp and curved on the end so they can get into compacted soils with no problems. I did try like a thin pen and then a regular pen to write on these with and it was a no go. You will need like a sharpie marker to write on these.Great label tags and I was happy to be able to get these as a sample to give my honest review on them to everyone. I love this case because I have a tendency to bring my phone in the bathroom to play music every day when I am in the shower. They say this is bad for your phone because of the steam and could get water in your phone. So this made me nervous and I'm glad I got the opportunity to give my honest review on this case to everyone at a discounted price.The case is water proof now from steam drops etc. But thank goodness I did not have to experience dropping it completely under water or anything.  Phew... I don't want to either! I got the pink case and it's just great and protects your phone all over the place, from the plug ports, to the screen, the sides, all over 360 degrees.What I was real impress with was how this case already comes with a screen built into it. BUT I already a REALLY thick screen protector on my phone that was tempered glass and I mean probably the thickest screen protector you can get. So as I was putting on the case I jsut kept thinking to myself, I really hope I don't have to take my screen protector off, because I'm not doing it for this case. I was worries it was going to register my finger when I touched the screen because it basically would have 2 screen protectors that were really thick on top of one another. Thank goodness that was not the case! It works just fine! So no, you do not have to take your screen protector off to use this case.The design is pretty cute (Well for the pink that is) and where the thumb print is, that works perfectly as well with no problems. So it's not just water proof, but it will hold up and protect your screen if it falls on top a hard floor. I know the falling part for sure because I dropped it twice already. Once when I got out of my truck, than again on my kitchen tile floor. My phone was alive still thank god, but no surprise there.It also comes with a little wrist strap which goes on the corner of the case so you can carry around on your wrist, I really needed this for how clumsy I am. Then it comes with two extra port plugs in case you rip your off or something I guess, and a screen cloth. I also like how it is clear on the back side so you can see what color your iPhone actually is. I don't see that with my other cases and now I can. I mean you pick the color you want, to be able to see it right? So get a case where you can.If you have any questions, just comment below and I will answer those right away for you. Also if my review helped you in any way, please hit the "HELPFUL" button so others can find my review(:

0:59 MinsSo I don't read the descriptions very well as you can tell, I was not expecting a hard mouse pad. I have other gaming pads from this company Sentey that I use, and they are all fabric. So I did not know how much I was going to like this one. It's a hard plastic pad that is not bendable nor can you roll it up or anything. It is flat at all times.The bottom of it has the same kind of material that is on the back of a fabric mouse pad, but the top is completely plastic. Now I have never used one of these pads before so I am not use to how it feels when I am gliding my mouse on it yet. It feels like you are using it on a plastic surface which is exactly what it is. Now the real why I like it thou is because, when your mouse is on it, it does have a better performance with it. Your mouse can move a lot better and quicker. Some gamers really need this for the type of game they are playing.So I do like it, I am just no used to the feeling of it yet. I don't like going out of my comfort zone usually and fabric mouse pads are my computer comfort zone haha. I was happy to be able to get this at a discounted price thou and try it out so I could give my honest review on it to everyone.If you have any questions at all, just comment below on my review, and I will answer those for your right away.
