If you're seriously considering these, the first thing you have to ask yourself is "Am I trying to save money or am I looking for convenience?". Understand that with this particular product, you won't get both.With the standard k-cup, you pop it in and dispose of it... no fuss, no mess. The drawback is that they can get costly, and I imagine not very Eco-friendly. With these, you have to fill them, empty them, and clean them. For that, it's almost easier just to get an ordinary coffee maker. On the upside, you save a few bucks every week.As far as the product quality, I found that these had some minor (avoidable) issues. It's not unique to this particular brand or model however. As a general rule of thumb, here are some good guidelines when using re-usable k-cups:- Careful not to overfill the cup. The metal strainer is so fine that the water doesn't flow as fast as with the disposables. Only fill it 1/2 to 2/3 depending how strong you like your coffee, or it might leak!- Avoid fine-ground coffee. It clumps faster, increasing the water blockage with the strainer - which can lead to leaking.- Wait for the grinds to dry before dumping unless you plan to rinse it down the drain (which I advise against). The more wet they are, the more they stick to the mesh.Overall, I didn't mind this product, but I found it to be more of a hassle than anything. It also took a few runs of trial and error before overcoming the leaking issue.I received this product at a reduced price in exchange for my honest opinion.

I've recently been dealing with a lack of sexual desire - mostly attributed to stress and anxiety. My review for this product will be continually updated to track the progress of its effectiveness. I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for my honest opinion, and this is the only way I feel most comfortable doing so.8/5/15 - I noticed a decent boost in energy about an hour after taking. It's only been the first day, so that's exciting. I did eat before taking them (approximately 30 mins before working out), so it's possible it should be taken with a lighter meal or no meal at all. Otherwise, you'll find yourself getting energy AFTER the workout.8/6/15 - Because of the delayed effect yesterday, I decided to take this today on an empty stomach. During the workout, I experienced a more profound boost in energy, though I now have stomach cramps, racing heart, and diarrhea. I'm not sure if this is from the supplement? Will do my next update in a few days to see.8/7/15 - 8/8/15 - I ate approximately an hour before working out, and took half the usual dose before working out (1 pill instead of 2). That small adjustment made a significant improvement to how my body reacted. I no longer have the cramps, racing heart, or diarrhea.8/9/15 - My body has completely adjusted, and I've resumed to the recommended dose of 2 pills 30 mins before working out. No side effects, but not noticing the same energy boost either. Have been urinating A LOT more than usual which is probably part of the "aids in weight loss" claims (mostly water weight, and some calories from the energy that allows me to exercise a little longer). As far as "muscle repair" after working out, it is too early to gauge that. Will do my next update in a week or so (unless there are significant changes).

I would recommend avoiding direct contact with water and perfumes to prolong the life of the necklace.Sample provided w/o any obligations.

Red is my favorite color. But, red in lace? That's my absolute favorite. The dress fits true to size and looks very nice. The lace is soft and doesn't irritate my skin. The dress is thigh length so it appropriate to be worn to school or work. There is a zipper in the back so you can easily get in and out of the dress. The stitching and quality is good as well. You can add a blazer or leather jacket on top and get a very formal/party look.Sample provided without any obligations.

Sporty, padded and racerback design, 3 in 1. Plus its coral in pink! I totally love the bra. Its very Comfortable to wear for long periods of time. The fabric doesn't make me itch if I sweat and is pretty absorbent as well. The cups are padded and provide good coverage and support. The bra didn't lose any color and didn't rub off any onto my skin. The pads can be wiggled around to adjust their position. The fabric is stretchable and well sewn.Sample provided without any obligations.

This shirt is so versatile. You can wear it with leather pants, office pants, skirt, a blazer or plain jeans and it looks great. I wore a black cami underneath and wore it with black leather pants. The stitching is strong and holds the fabric together well. The buttons are sewn in well and do not seem to be loose. You can wash this in the washing machine and it won't cause any problems. You can roll the sleeves up or leave them casually buttoned around the wrists.Sample provided without any obligations.

The shirt fits true to expectations and looks spectacular. The color is just as shown in the picture and the length is pretty accurate as well. It comes with an extra button in case you lose any. There are two pockets on the chest. You can fold or unfold the sleeves. The stitching and fabric are solid so you won't have any problems after washing it. The material is thick enough that you need not wear a cami underneath. You can pair this with blue/white/black pants and sunglasses and you're good to go.Sample provided without any obligations.

I cannot put words to explain how amazing and beautiful this jacket looks. The jacket is lined with fur on the inside and has fur coated hoodie attached to it as well. When I put it on, the jacket just screamed classy and stylish. I have always been impressed by HumbleChic clothing but this just topped the list. The sleeves are full in length and do not look awkward. The hoodie is actually big enough for my head, and the fabric is strong and stitched well. I got it in small and it fits me perfectly. The jacket is not just for show, it keeps me warm and cozy in the crazy weather. The gold accent zippers and belt really add to the look of this jacket. It looks even better than shown in the pictures. Well-fitted and well-suited for cold weather.Sample provided without any obligations.

Nice pack. The washcloths are actually soft and good for a baby's skin. I have used some before but they have some degree of roughness. I absolutely love these because of their texture. They include various colors in the pack. They are super easy to wash and clean as well.Recommended!

For a petite body this is great.  I got it in red and medium. I usually wear a small but medium is the smallest size here. It fits me well around the waist and above the hips but the torso area is a little loose since it is medium not small. I had jo issues with any other part of the jacket.  The fabric is thick and keeps me warm n cozy. There are two zipped pockets for my hands on the front by the belly button area. It also has an added zipper up top for decorum purposes. It has no fabric beneath that zipper. The are three buttons on the neck strap. The color looks the same as the picture. Overall, its a great stylish looking coat. I got this dress in small but it fits more like a medium on me. I prefer dresses that are fitted so it accentuates my figure. This dress looked loose on me so not that flattering. Other than that I have no issues with it.There is a cutout in the back so it's semi-backlesss. The hem is also irregular and asymmetrical and that looks great when you have the dress on.  You can pair this with heels or long boots and it'll look awesome. The leaf flower pattern make it look very fall-sy in my opinion. The stitching and fabric are solid. I have used other cables from ixcc as well. The work fine. The cable is 10 feet in length. Its neither too rigid nor too soft to bend and break. The are no error messages being displayed on my phone and it connects in my SUV as well. So, im happy with it.

Very gentle and absorbs well into the skin. The scent is pleasant as well. I would recommend using atleast once a day. It helps clear and freshen the skin up. The tube contains good amount of product to be easily used for a month.

I got this in orange color. The sweater is adorable and looks exactly as pictured. The color  is orange. I wear a small and I got this in medium and its my perfect fit so order a size up. The material is not thick so it can be worn in summer as well. For winter, it has to be layered accordingly.  Overall, it looks great and fits me well.Sample provided without any obligations.

Sometimes what's tight for works fine for my sisters and vice versa event though we have the same shoe size.Sample provided without any obligations.

This set of earrings is so in-style so i had to get them! The pearls on top are shiny off-white that give a classic, vintage look paired with the gold metallic base. They crawl up your ears making them a bold fashion statement that makes your outfit look hive that oomf we're all looking for! The earrings are very sturdy and for this reasonable price, they are beautiful! I have no complains about it and im very happy to have gotten these! You should too!

This set of earrings with the constellation stars is a very beautiful idea! I love the star stud and it looks very cute. The crawler little dipper set takes a little time to manage but it also looks pretty cute like stars are crawling up your ears. It's very sturdy. You just need to know how to wear it. Overall, i liked this earrings set because its very unique!

1D came a long way as they have recorded their 5 albums...their first album of straight bubble gum boy band was a guilty pleasure.  No shame in that.  But the 5 guys had a surprisingly strong vision for the direction that they wished to take their music, honing their songcraft somewhat and maturing the instrumentation.  Four was actually a very strong album, and one that any pop band should be pleased to put out.  Zayn left, and many felt that this was the death knell for 1D.  I'm pleased to say that Made in the A.M. is probably the strongest album that they have yet made.  "Perfect" is a fantastic gem of an earworm, Love You Goodbye and History both pull at hearstrings pretty well.  Harmonies are tight and impressive, and the entire album comes off like a good time had with friends.  If this turns out to be 1D's last album, it is a good one to end on.  I suspect that this is not the end, however, and that these guys may continue to make music for a long time.  Here's hoping they continue to grow.

I love Ryan Adams.  Against my better judgement, I have come to also love Taylor Swift--and at her best, I think she is a very fine song writer.  I also really love it when talented people cover really good songs in an original manner.  When I heard that Ryan was covering 1989 as if he were covering Nebraska by Springsteen, I knew I wanted a listen.  Damn if he didn't knock it out of the park.  He is in awesome voice, and his instrumentation is neither spare nor overbearing....it really is like he treated all of these songs like his own children,  this album can easily stand up to anything that Ryan has done on his own (and that says a lot) and is a viable alternative to Tay's own outstanding effort.  His version of Blank space is naked, painful, a paean to loneliness.  Style becomes a funky, punky strut.  Shake it off starts with a greasy organ and a rim shot and soon becomes a romp through a haunting nightmare of misunderstanding and isolation.  Amazing.  When the pedal steel kicks in...I got chills.  Listen, if you love Tay and are not scared to see how her songs stand up to reinterpretation, you will love this with good reason.  If you love Ryan, yiu will go nuts for this bad boy, heart on the sleeve love letter to some great songwriting.  Nonstop awesome.  Check it out, give it to your friends.

Under appreciated song....a real highlight not just from this wonderful album but frankly from his entire amazing career.  Beautiful, overwrought yet at its heart a simple tale of those who are doomed to unhappiness, unable to find the right love.  Beautiful.

My 8 year old wets the bed at night pretty frequently, and we were eager to try this.  The device works very well for what it does--it senses even the tiniest drop of wetness and then makes a loud noise.  For that reason, I gave it 5 stars.  It is easy to use, it is small, it is discreet (at least until it makes a noise!).  I think that this is a nice form factor for a useful product.

Easy to use, the birds liked it, but it fell and broke.  Be careful as you set it up that it is nice and stable.  While it was with us, it was great, because hummingbirds make a beautiful addition to the garden.

This book is FANTASTIC.  I absolutely devoured it.  Joe Abercrombie writes a fantastic tale,  but his novels are usually quite graphic.  this one is grim, but never inappropriate for teens.  His writing is wonderful.  I have given copies of it to several of my nephews, who all like it also.  Great fun.  Pick up a copy.

I like these socks.  I've been running with them, and they are good--but are a little less padded than my Thorlo socks.  I got a different pair of wright-socks as well, a thicker pair, and those are better for longer distances.  This is a good intermediate running sock.  They definitely keep my feet cool.

All dry erase markers make dust when you erase them, no big deal, but these seem to make a little more than the usual ones that I use.  The color is bright and easy to see from a distance, and flows smoothly onto the white board.  A solid product.

We go through vacuums pretty quick--we have 3 boys, 6 cats, 3 floors.  Our vacuums are put through a lot of trouble and difficulty.  My major criteria for a vacuum to be a success is to be able to handle all the cat hair, and I;m happy to report that this one does.  The cyclonic bag less format has become my favorite, and this is now my preferred sort of vacuum.  This is light enough that we can get it down and up the stairs pretty easily, and my 9 year old can use it effectively in his room.  The canister is roomy and easy to clean, and I appreciate the generous cord.  A very good vacuum that I am glad to have.

My wife likes this blush, and she now keeps it in her purse.  She has a pinkish skin tone, and this blush smooths and highlights her cheeks nicely, leaving them pearlescent and rosy.  Very flattering.  She says  that it goes on very easily and smoothly, and blends nicely.  I say that she looks very pretty when she wears it.  Good times!

I wanted to wait a while after I got this rug to see how it would stand up to kids and cats before I wrote my review.  I have to say that I'm pretty pleased.  The rug is quite beautiful; we have it in a high traffic kids play area.  The kids have definitely been tough on it, and so far it has stood up to their damage.  We have cats that like to scratch rugs to sharpen their claws, and thus far it has held up to this as well.  We've had a few messes on it (cat hairballs, finger paint) and it has cleaned up well.  I'm pretty pleased with it.

I wasn't sure how a milk treat would go down at my house--I've never used a dairy based treat.  I have 6 cats, 3 of whom are pretty finicky.  Everyone liked these treats, and would come running when I shook the bag.  I guess that's what I'm looking for in a cat treat, and I'll probably buy these in the future again when I am thinking of spoiling my crowd.

This product looks like it would good for moths...to stop them...but that is not what it is.  A Perusal of the fine print reveals that this is meant to tell you if you  have a moth problem.  And for that goal....it works fine.  Don't expect this to trap/eliminate moths.  It won't do that.  But if you think that you might have moths, but aren't sure, then this product might be useful.  Otherwise ,it is a waste of time if you already know that you have moths.  Anyway, good early warning system, not an eliminator.

I ordered the bike over the summer but waited until it cooled off last weekend to put it together. I rode it for 15 minutes and the right gear shift handle broke.  I rigged the handle to keep the gear set at 3 and used the left shift.  I rode the bike for a few more minutes and the left gear handle broke.  I bought a new shift assembly and installed it.  While testing the bike one of the back wheel gears broke in half.  I am now frustrated and sorry I bought the bike.

Easy to use and has increased the breadth of species we see on our back porch.  Needless to say, our cats love this as much as we do, as they spend hours watching the birds flock to this water source.  Great  enjoyment.

I love Brandon Sanderson, but with each new book, I am convinced that he can't do it again....yet, he does...over and over.  The rhythmatist has his classic duo of fantastic protagonist and interesting magic system.  Check this out... Well worth your time.
This feeder--easy to use, easy to enjoy--has been a big hit with the neighborhood blue jays and cardinals.  Definitely a nice addition to our back porch.
Absorbs quickly and nicely into the skin.  The fragrance is not girly at all, and it works great on my really dry feet.  My new favorite lotion.
A really lovely moisturizer...not greasy, easy to use, and with a pleasantly calming fragrance.  We have enjoyed this very much.

This disc is a steal at any price for lovers of the art song.  Lee Hoiby knows how to write a beautiful melody and imbue it with magical accompaniment.  He reminds me of Barber meets Sondheim by way of Ravel, and these songs are wonderful.  Modern music can be harsh, but not here...both the soprano and the baritone sing sweetly without cloying preciousness, and diction is great.  The recording could have been miked a little better, but a little twiddling with your equalizer will likely help you find a setting you can enjoy, and once you dig into this music, you won't want to emerge. Standouts include the clever and fantastic setting of Lewis Carrol's "Jabberwocky", as well as the title tune "Pocket of Time" and the sweet and lovely "The Lamb".  Get this disc, you'll be pleased.

I am an opera snob.  Musically, I prefer the 20th century and beyond, and I get tired of the old repertoire.  But sometimes, even confirmed 12 tone enthusiasts like myself enjoy a little Bellini.  Let's face it...the great masters were, well, masterful.  This dirt cheap collection has eliminated the need for me to pull out individual operas to get just the loveliest arias.  Here the all are, glittering in the sunlight, sung by some of the finest sopranos of the last 40 years.  Sumi Jo's definitive version of the aria for the Queen of the Night from Mozart's Magic Flute is worth the price of admission alone. These arias are instantly familiar to opera buffs, but the casual listener will know many of these, and it is an easy way to bring new converts in to the fold.  Listen, this music is glorious, tuneful, exquisitely sung, and a wonderful way to sip at the chalice of immortal music.  Sound is generally excellent.  The collection would be a bargain at 10x the price, and there is absolutely no reason not to pick this up at the crazy bargain price of $1.  Yes, even you folks who usually prefer Wozzeck. This music is simply stunning.

Amy has been a companion across the years, and I have shared tough times, good times, times when I questioned my faith, times when I exulted in my faith...all with her music.  For me, her high point was the incandescent Lead Me On, especially the heartfelt "Saved by Love" and "1974", followed close on the heels by Behind the Eyes.  This album is definitely in the tradition of those albums--full of genuine faith, full of heartache and joy.  This is not a full on gospel album, and that is fine with me.  What it is is an album by a woman of faith about a life lived in faith, working out the nuts and bolts of life through her faith.  Her voice remains as gentle and husky as ever, sweet and melodic.  After all these years, I know her every turn of phrase, her every melodic trick, and I fall for it every time.  Song wise, I enjoyed the whole album, but really responded to the message of "Don't Try So Hard"--it's message of Christ's all sufficiency to cover over all our sins, all our defects was so timely and helpful for me.  This is music from an old friend, and I am so glad to have it enriching my heart.

I never know what to expect with the Flaming Lips--but I'm always willing to take the ride.  If you are reading this review, I assume you are too...but let me warn you, this ride is not for the faint of heart or the suicide prone.  The Terror plunges the listener into a maelstrom of pulsing sounds, distant and insistent thrumming, humming, drumming--all alienating and somehow fearful.  It seems as if you are setting out into a darkening sea, the cold wind picking up and the knowledge that a storm is just around the corner.  I got a visceral reaction, the bottom of my stomach dropping out at times, especially in the extended soundscapes of "You Lust", where disembodied voices whisper over a droning bass...and I was listening in the middle of the day in a brightly lit office while I was typing.  I had to stop typing for a while and just let the music surround me, fill me up, to surrender to its majesty and fear.  This album is a slow motion, matter of fact presentation of an emotional nakedness, a rough look at a raw soul that is so much in pain that there is no simple way to express the feelings.  Words and music combine in despair and loneliness, but also beauty.  The wild thing is that there is very little in the lyrics that overtly reveals the pain that Wayne expresses so easily with every anguished note.The Flaming Lips have produced a harrowing masterpiece here, an album that will haunt you, teach you, and terrify you.  Remarkable, and a must listen.

I'm wild about Ed Sheeran and his guitar wizardry, his optimistic lyrics, and his sweetly melodic voice.  I was unfamiliar with Yelawolf when I gave this a first spin.  I was impressed by his flexible rhymes, his rapid flow and the thoughtfulness of some of his rhymes; that isn't to say that he is a new Marshall Mathers; he lacks the extreme playfullness and creativity that marks that man's best work.  I also didn't always like his tone, which was fairly monotone snarly. Now, I need to be honest here--I'm not a huge hip-hop/rap fan, and although I've got a couple of Eminem albums in my collection, and I've been known to give old Run DMC and Beastie Boys a spin now and again, I am definitely not the go to guy for rap reviews, so I'll leave it at that.  I came to this album because Ed's name is on it,and I really wanted Ed's presence to be a lot more up front.  When he is there, he is refreshing and talented, but this is not really for Ed's fans, however, as he is mostly just a back up boy for Yelawolf, contributing some guitar and a chorus or two.  If you like underground rap, then this might be more to your taste.  Also, note, the "explicit" label is earned, as the cursing is impressive.  I'd give this 2.5 stars if I could.

I know that I shouldn't be surprised that Bowie is putting out a genuinely great album.  Why would that be surprising?  He's been doing it for 40+ years.  Some might argue that there were a string of duds in the 80's (Tonight, Never Let Me Down), and in the interest of full disclosure, I would tell those folks that they need to go back and re-listen to those albums with fresh ears.  Both of them have some fantastic songwriting and while neither matches "Lodgers", "Heroes", or "Hunky Dory", they both merit affection. But now you know my bias and can hear what I have to say.The Next Day is inevitable.  It is a wonderful album that builds upon all that has come before, by turns nostalgiac and exploratory.  This is an album that does not seek to be the next Bowie album, but rather an album that seeks to be a good album period.  There have been a lot of song by song breakdowns, and I won't do that, but what I will try to convey is the feeling that you get when a great musician puts out a record at the top of his game.  This is one of those records.  The music is urgent and compelling, full of energy and life, mesmerizing.  His voice sounds great still, although it is not as rich as it once might have been, it still has many shades.  There is a sadness, an ache, and a power to provoke wonder as you listen to the record unfold; there is much reflection on love, and a life lived for love, and for change, and identity.  But mostly, it's music that you want to listen to--it's music that is enjoyable with or without the context of David over the last 40 years--music that my kids find compelling and I find wonderful for completely different reasons.I hope that this album triggers a new creative season for David, but if not, this is a fantastic album to have left us.  Pick it up.  5 stars, unreservedly, passionately.

We have 5 cats, and when we leave for a weeks vacation, we always have someone come in every other day to make sure that they have fresh water/food/clean litter.  Even so, I always worry that something will happen while we aren't there and the cats will be out of water.  For that reason, we have 2 previous drinkwell fountains--one small one in our upstairs bathroom, and a 1 gallon number in our kitchen.  The cats like it because they enjoy drinking out of the running water.  This 5 gallon product is essentially the same; it is designed for outdoor use, but we use it indoors in our basement.  Once more, it gives me peace of mind that there is a big quantity of water available for our cats if needed.  This would not be a good choice for outdoor usage in a place where it freezes frequently, but otherwise it is a nice water dish for a medium sized dog or other animal.  Drinkwell fountains have been sturdy for us, working without fail for the last 3 years, pretty good, and no signs of giving up yet.  I hope this one lasts just as long.

I have 3 foam rollers now--a big one with knobs on it (which I LOVE), another full sized one that is smooth (my wife prefers this one), and now the small one from Pro-Tec.  This is a good, small foam roller that I like because I can put it in my gym bag, and use it when I go running, or when I go to the gym.  We use the other two in our home gym, as they are not portable.  If you have never stretched using a foam roller, then you are in for a revolution.  Foam rollers are very painful at first to use, but the more you use them, the more amazing a stretch you get, and now I can't imagine trying to get a good stretch in without one.  The material of this roller is nice and firm, good construction.  A good choice if you are looking for a small foam roller.

If your chief object is to find a "squirrel-proof" feeder, then this is not the feeder for you.  Maybe we just have genius squirrels, I don't know, but our squirrels defeated this little contraption in about 45 seconds.  they would hand from the top upside down and still get the seeds. We were quite impressed by their ingenuity, but maybe our squirrels are just like Honey Badger--they just don't care--they saw food, and nothing was going to stand in their way!That little disclaimer done, we are quite pleased with this feeder.  Birds feed from it easily, and we actually love the squirrels, they are so fun for our cats to watch on the back porch--we call the whole bird/squirrel show "kitty TV" and the cats can't get enough of it.  The feeder is easy to load, holds a good amount of seeds, and is light and easy to hang.  It looks pretty good also, so that is nice.Since I got this one, we have now obtained 2 more of these so that we would have a matched set.  Hope this helps!

I picked this up for my wife.  We are rock hounds, and we love jewelry.  We actually love created stones as, they come in very beautiful colors, and you can get really big stones for a fraction of the cost.  We have a saying in my house when it comes to jewelry--"The only rule is pleasure"--because sometimes the least expensive jewelry brings just as much joy as very expensive pieces.  Anyway, this little piece definitely fits our definition of what constitutes good jewelry, as it immediately delighted my wife, and she put it on and then swanned about the house admiring it in various outfits and with other accessories.  Inexpensive, lovely, and really vivid--hard to improve on that combo.

2007's "Our Ill Wills" marked a high point for me for Scandanavian pop--it was a perfect blend of "Head on the Door" era Cure and Johnny Marr influenced guitar wonder, all put together with a mix of panache and heartbreak.  After that album, I wanted to embrace their follow up "Work", but it was a little more of a glum affair without any relief, and although I enjoyed it, it didn't have the same longevity with me.  I approached Optica with a little more trepidation--would this be more "Work"?  Or something else?  I am happy to report that this has all the sass and sweetness of "Our Ill Wills" but has also gained an even lighter touch with production, never sounding cloying or downtrodden, and by the same token, avoiding an overly precious wrong turn as well.  This album does what well done pop is supposed to do--it gets into your brain and your heart, starts your fingers snapping, and next thing you know you are singing along to songs you have only heard once.  Now, that is not to say that all the lyrics are about bunnies and rainbows--we are still talking about a band that does heartbreak like it should be done--sweet and bitter enough to break your heart all over again.  But somehow, hearing it from these guys makes the pain sweet, the nostalgia for things lost somehow brighter, and the hope to carry on a little easier.  It's a wonderful ride, and a great example of indie pop at its finest.

I've listened to 10,000 Maniacs since "The Wishing Chair" came out, and yes, of course, I love Natalie Merchant.  However, I am not a fair weather fan, and I've stuck with the band through thick and thin, including the enjoyable "Love Among the Ruins", and the dreamy "The Earth Pressed Flat".  I liked both of those albums, and they certainly get time on my turntable when I have a 10,000 Maniac mood, so I am not someone who knocks Ms. Ramsey just because she is not Natalie.  Indeed, Mary's vocals have gotten more comfortable, more assured, and stayed warm and melodic through those albums and remain just as engaging on this outing.And yes, "Music From The Motion Picture" is a very engaging album, full of pleasant, jangly, guitar based music that 10,000 Maniacs does very well--and there is nothing wrong with that.  My criticism here is that the album never rises above "pleasant" or even "nice".  Melodies are certainly hummable, but do not stick with you for long.  The band sounds relaxed and very comfortable with each other, which means that all the songs seem well put together--but nothing sparkles. There is no moment where I sat back and said "ahh, that's what I've been missing, that's what I need".  All of these songs could have come from any of the previous albums, but would have been album tracks there, nothing more.If you adore Mary Ramsey's voice, then this is going to make you happy, as she sings beautifully; but if you are looking for a breath of new life in 10kM, then this is not going to take you very far.  I hope that this album is just another step on the road for these musicians, and I look forward to more music in the future from them, but I think that this album will be one that I turn to less often when I want to hear them shine.

I was intrigued to hear this music, because a) I love Radiohead b)I very much enjoyed The Eraser and c)I was interested to hear what Flea and Nigel Goodrich, not to mention to a combo of electronic and acoustic percussion could do.  As it turns out, for me, this is an album that is greater than the sum of its parts.  I've noted that a number of reviewers have remarked on the almost intellectual and academic merits of this album, but I think that the appeal of different for me.  For me, it is a visceral experience--it's like I've been mainlined into the music in Thom and co's heads/hearts.  I suppose that I could admire those skittery rhythms from a sheer originality of composition point of view, but for me, it's like waking up in a new soundscape, looking around (synesthesia-like) and finding new colors around you--but I'm never afraid because I have Thom's voice leading me deeper in, guiding me towards the light (as it were).  This album is beautiful, fascinating, deeply trippy, and in the same way that New Order used profound sterility (think Blue Monday) to arrive at gut wrenching emotion, Atoms for Peace use electronic manipulation to advance a bewitching music for the heart and mind.  Absolutely fascinating, intense and beautiful.

Yea, I know, the name, right?  Ignore it.  Or better yet, embrace it, because this music wants to embrace you.  Groovy electrofunk that starts and doesn't stop, mixed with swirling guitars and synths out of some acid dream-pop fantasy.  Vocals that remind me of some of the most insistent Maroon 5 choruses, in the best way possible--i.e. catchy beyond belief and a heck of a lot of fun.  Great album for synth lovers from start to finish; infectious groovy fun.

This is a perfectly designed collection of infectious, immaculately produced pop tunes.  These guys evoke the things you love about Coldplay (perfectly tuneful, deeply emotional), Snow Patrol (aching vocals, sweet longing), and even Train (something grander is out there, let's find it together); but they do it in their own way.  Synths are the order of the day, pulsing but never cold, waves of fluid emotions washing over and around.  This is a record to play on road trips and on cloudy days, to share with friends, to dance and to read by.  That's a lot of mandate, but this is a lot of enjoyment.  Check it out.

The Foals continue their hot streak with Holy Fire, perfecting the insistent dance-rock rhythmic magic that makes them so fun--but at the same time, the driving guitars and melodic invention keep the album fresh and more than just a dance album alone.  Yannis Philippakis voice is urgent and smoky, with a lazy slide that invites you in but then won't let you go.  Inhaler is an early standout track, it was a single in the UK and it is absolutely impossible to listen to at anything less than maximum volume.  It begs you to take the floor.  My Number was also an early single from the album, and has a really funky guitar figure and  a relentlessly catchy beat. Overall the album has a sense of busy-ness--there is always something exciting happen, leaving you waiting for what is coming next, knowing that there is no way that they can shock or surprise you again--and then they do.  Holy Fire is my jumping on point for the Foals, and it is one of my favorite new finds.  Pick it up if you like 80's inflected dance funk delivered with creativity, style, and a double dose of attitude.  Big fun.

Curt is being a little coy with the title on this one, and I am happy to report that this album is every bit as fulfilling as Mayfield, perhaps even more so--Seven of Sundays, Halfway Pleased, and Addict easily stand as some of his best work; the album as a whole is very nicely put together--everything fits together smoothly.  Lyrics are a little cryptic, but his vocals are always crystal clear, full of his sweet tone and very emotional.  I was happy that he included a live version of Snow Hill (one of my favorite of his solo songs), and I appreciated the acoustic Version of Seven of Sundays as well.  This is simply a great release by a very talented pop artist; the fact that his voice is an old friend makes it simply better.  TFF fans, rejoice, this is a great release.

I'm not sure why I resisted getting Curt Smith's solo works for so long--I picked up the TFF "Raoul" and "Elemental" sound unheard when they came out and loved them...but really missed Curt's lovely tenor on those records.  I read some non-complimentary reviews of Curt's solo work, and didn't even bother to give him a listen for some reason.  My loss, fortunately now rectified.  I've always loved his flexible vocals, his sweetness and lyricism, and it is clear to me based on Mayfield that he is a first rate song writer on his own.  Each of the tracks is enjoyable, not a dud among them, and the instrumentation is strong and innovative.  If you love TFF, this is a simple decision--give this a listen, you will be glad you did.  Musically, it sits somewhere between Seeds of Love and Happy Ending (which is exactly where it fits chronologically as well), and it is fascinating to see how much Curt contributed to both of those releases; no slight against the magnificently talented Roland, but tales that RO was the creative force behind TFF I think are obviously over-rated.  Curt deserves to be recognized in his own right for his contributions.  Check him out.

We got this book because my 5 year old loves the old "PJ Funnybunny" (It's not Easy Being a Bunny) book.  I know that this is not the same author/story line, but my son was immediately attracted to the bunny subject, and that was a nice entre to get him interested in a new book (sometimes, he just prefers to stick to his favorites and won't try a new one!)  The tales are adorable, pretty easy for my child to read, and he has been requesting it frequently.  Art is very cute and well done.

I have a 5 year old who loves to read, and the other Mercer Meyer books have been a big favorite around our house.  This book is true to his style--whimsical and fun; because the book is "wordless", it is easy; note there are some words in the background.  We have "read" this several times already and it seems to stay "out" as opposed to just "on the bookshelf", so my son is reading it when I am not around.  I get him to tell me the story, which he enjoys.  Hard to complain about a book that makes your kid enjoy books!

I got this for my kids who adore monopoly.  I like the game as well, but wish that it moved faster--this game solves some of the issues that make monopoly a little hard on some players.  You know that point in the game when you are pretty sure you know who will win but you still have to play 3 more hours to fully bankrupt them?  Well, this game changes the rules a little, so you just need to build skyscrapers on a certain number of properties.  You can buy properties before you land on them, which changes the initial strategy somewhat, and speeds up the initial rounds of play.  Because you are playing to build and not to bankrupt your co-players, there are fewer hurt feelings (remember when your old brother made you cry as you landed on Park Place...again?).  Overall, this is a nice overhaul of a classic game to make it a little faster, still strategic, and a little kinder on the little ones.  Good for family game night.

First things first, I am exceedingly pleased with this lock.  I'll go into its features in a moment, but I wanted to get installation discussed first, as this was something that I found intimidating at first.  It isn't really that hard to do, but does require a little time and some faith that you can do it!  If I can do it, you can do it.I am sure that this will come as no surprise to anyone, but you are going to need some tools to install this lock--you will at least need a screwdriver and a little know how to remove your old lock if you have one.  We installed this one in a door that did not previously have a deadbolt, so it was a little more complicated for us.  I had to buy a chisel (to chisel out a receiver space for the locking bolt), and I had to buy a hole saw (it is an attachment for your drill) to drill out a hole for the lock itself in our door.  Because our door has a metal lining, we had to get one that would cut metal. There is a template included in the lock that shows you where and how to make the hole in your door, and where and how to make the receiver hole.  Once the hole in the door was drilled out, the lock went in easily; the screw holes in the two halves of the lock were not perfectly aligned, but with a little jiggling, we were able to get them lined up well enough to screw the lock in securely.  We had a few problems as well with perfect alignment of the dress plate (the shiny metal plate that covers the edges of the receiving hole), but we used a Dremel tool to file this out perfectly so that the bolt would slide smoothly.  I am not a handyman by any stretch of the imagination, and I was able to do this, so if this sounds at all concerning, take a deep breath and know that you can do it.  It is entirely possible that the minor difficulties I had were due to my own imperfect installation skills. None of these things would likely have been a problem if I had been inserting this lock into a door that already had the holes drilled out, so if you are just changing the lock, this will likely be easier.  Even with the extra steps I had to do, this was all accomplished in about an hour.The lock is big and clunky, very satisfyingly solid.  When the bolt slides home in your door, it feels very secrure.  I like that.  The locking mechanism is easy to turn, and easy to tell when it is completely extended.  The lock comes with two keys, which fit perfectly for us and turn the lock smoothly and easily.  Of course, the big features of this lock set are the electronic capabilities.  I am happy to report that these work smoothly also, and are very easy to use.  The set comes with two key fobs that look kind of like car locking mechanisms on your car remote--just a lock and unlock button.  Easy.  You can also program your keypad with a 6 digit code to lock and unlock your door; the code is programmable with a multistep process that requires a "master" code included in your instruction book, so don't lose this documentation.  The process for programming is about 4 steps, and is not difficult but may require a little pre-reading to get everything right, because you have a limited time to complete the full operation.  I succeeded in programming everything on my second try.  Total process took about 4 minutes from start to finish with instruction reading/false start/final success.  Optionally, you can also program the lock to lock itself with a single touch of a lock button.  I think that this is an excellent feature, and while it is not defaulted, it is easy to turn on.  The keypad is sturdy feeling, lights up when you use it (great if you are in the dark), and is easy to see and feel.I am absolutely delighted with this lock.  I now won't worry if I lose my keys (I can just use the keypad!) and I feel a little more secure with this deadbolt on a door that previously didn't have one.

I already have the Mr. Beams under cabinet motion sensitive lights, and we have been delighted with them, so I had high expectations for this set. I have to say that it is better than I hoped it would be.  I hate being in the dark when the power goes out (who doesn't?) and it always seems to be a shuffle to find where the kids have hidden/misplaced the flashlights.  These little lights sense when the power is out (you plug a central switch into a plug, and when the power goes out, the switch sends a signal to the other lights) and they all turn on.  I put the three over head lights in the living room, over the kitchen table, in in the upstairs hall.  I put the three smaller lights in the bathrooms (who likes to use the restroom in the dark :-)?  Not me).  The lights all come with plates that can be used to mount them with screws, but I decided that I would do something a little different and installed them all with industrial strength velcro.  This made installing them securely on the ceiling a snap, and I think it is a great choice also if you don't have tools available.  The sensor switch can also be used to turn all the lights on with a single button, even when the power is functional.  The sensor switch can be unplugged and used as a flashlight, which is kinda nifty.These lights are LED's, so don't use much in the way of battery power.  Also, the light they give is pretty bright, and mounted on the ceiling, they give enough light that we will all be happy to sit around the kitchen table and talk when the power is out.I am very pleased with this system.  I think it is an easy to install, excellent choice if you want some power outage lighting.

I like shrimp, and I like chocolate ice cream.  I don't usually have them together.  So when I heard that there was a bluegrass album of 80's songs, I thought, hmm, chocolate ice cream shrimp.  Nah.  But I couldn't get the idea out of my head, so I gave it a chance.  I am an 80's music fanatic, and a blue-grass picker and singer, so I felt pretty qualified to give this album the dressing down that I was sure it would deserve.  To my surprise and pleasure, this is an album full of talented folk doing blue-grass justice to a bunch of fun 80's songs.  No one here is trying to take themselves too seriously, but everyone is playing songs that they clearly love, and are playing their hearts out.  Standouts include a really creative version of "Take on Me" (I am an a-ha fan, so I was glad that this was given a good version), "Everybody Wants to Rule the World" (great great musicianship, the voice is too one note to get it right but still enjoyable), and a truly fantastic version of "Come On Eileen"--Once more the voice is fine, but the banjo pickin' is absolutely in-freakin-credible.  This album is a good time from beginning to end, none of the songs are unlistenable, although I'm not wild about the comparatively dull version of "Kiss" (gone is the heavily rhythmic funk that made that song so irresistable).  I think that this would have been a great party to attend, as it must have been an absolute party to record!  For the adventurous blue-grass 80's lovers, this is a fun side trip sure to bring a smile!

I wasn't sure where Mark Hollis could go after the classic duo of Spirit of Eden and Laughing Stock.  I sort of think that perhaps he wasn't sure where to go either, because there was no more Talk Talk after those albums, and no more Mark Hollis for 7 years.  This album is simply a revelation.  He is no longer dealing in forms as abstract as those of Laughing Stock, but the songs are just as thoroughly composed and carefully instrumented as those post-rock masterpieces.  The difference here is that his songs seem more intimate than grandiose, lyrics whispered and intoned gently over acoustic instruments--I often can't tell what he is talking about because he sings so softly, but the emotion comes through as clear as day.  This is a singular album, a marvellous achievement, and a crown to Mark Hollis' storied and incredible career; my only sadness is that after this album all we have is...silence.  Mark Hollis, wherefore art thou?

The Colour of Spring is a magnificent piece of 80's songwriting--both of the time, and timeless.  The songs are well constructed, perfectly played, and sung with luminous intensity by the great under-appreciated Mark Hollis, who really must be one of the most accomplished soulful pop vocalists of his time.  This is simply an extraordinary album, and well worth the time to check out.  Talk Talk have turned into a cult band, which is a little unfair--they should be celebrated widely as a treasure--but I'm letting you in on the secret.  Get this as soon as you can, you won't regret it.

I love Talk Talk.  They are an enigma to me--how could a band who put out a competent and well composed but ultimately not especially original album like their first album suddenly make a leap forward like this?  And how did they get from here to their ultimate magnum Opus Spirit of Eden?  (Laughing Stock is amazing, but I don't enjoy it quite as much as SoE).  I'm not sure.  This album still manages to enchant me even after all these years.  Renee is simply searing in its agony, and It's My Life is a classic of the New Wave.  I'm not sure what to make of Dum Dum Girl, but it is infectious enough that I sing it in my head.  Anyway, a great album for fans of the New Wave, but I implore you, if you are investigating Talk Talk, don't give up before you get to the end of their output.  Then check out Mark Hollis' eponymous solo album--also great.

I'm a child of the 80's, but I somehow managed to miss Japan.  I've heard about them for years, because I listen to Dali's Car, and I'm a fan of Duran Duran; Japan always seems to come up in discussion of these artists (for good reason).  Recently, I've become a fan of Ryuichi Sakamoto, and through him of David Sylvian.  That pathway led me finally to this--Gentlemen Take Polaroids.  I'm now incredibly frustrated that I resisted the siren song of Japan for so long, for this album is a masterpiece of the New Romantic--sonically, a fascinating mixture of pulsing 80's synths, suave vocals, insistent beats, and amazing bass work.  Sylvian's voice is different here than it is now--less mannered, less full of vibrato, but still rich and smooth, a perfect counterpoint to the excellent songcraft on display here.  This is simply a perfect encapsulation of all the promise that the late 70's/early 80's cutting edge pop had to offer--danceability, mystery, excitement. Highly recommended for fans of anyone that I have name checked above, and for anyone who enjoys great 80's music.  Masterful.

This looks to be a great album, and in some ways it is, but it has a giant caveat:  you are about to listen to a ton of great music as interpreted by someone different than you are expecting.  These are not the original versions--these are all covers by competent professionals, and the songs are pretty darn good, but unless you have a strange need to hear cover versions of Bond classics, then this is not going to be the album for you.  Essentially, this is well performed karaoke.

My 5 year old read this to me the minute we got it, and had a ball.  He has read it several times to himself.  I was a little put off by the bizarre drawing of the cows nose (it looks like a hot dog) but clearly that was an artistic/stylistic choice.  It certainly didn't bother my kiddo, who was charmed by the otherwise excellent illustrations.  The writing is simple and engaging, and the story was fun.  Good book!

My kindle fit easily into this case, and is very secure.  I like the way the case looks--it is very stylish.  It is cushiony and I think would protect the kindle from a short fall.  The kindle paperwhite is light, and is pretty sturdy on its own. The fact that the case extends a little beyond the border of the device makes me feel that a reasonable bump would not transmit much force to the screen.  The case is light and easy to hold; all in all I like this case very much.

I have 3 dirt devil products--two hand vacs, and now this full size pet vacuum.  First off, I have 5 cats and they shed, so I was excited about this vacuum designed for pet issues.  I couldn't wait to try the little pet hair attachments, and they worked pretty well.  Is this going to be a panacea for pet hair?  Well...no.  But it is at least as good as any other vacuum, and the rubberized attachments do seem to pull hair off couches pretty well; I guess that my cats just shed more than any vacuum can be expected to pick up easily.  I didn't expect magic, so I'm pleased with what I have.There's more to love here also:  the cannister vac is great.  I love not having bags to change, and the suction power is good.  I wish the cannister were a little bigger, but you can't have everything.  The vacuum was pretty easy to assemble, and it is light enough to carry up and down stairs easily.  The motor has a nice zing to it and helps move the device across the floor at a good clip.I like this little vacuum a lot; I dock it one star because of the cannister size and because I'm not sure that it is more than "somewhat better" than my regular vacuum at picking up pet hair, which is its advertised function.  Still, it is powerful, easy to maneuver, light, and simple to use.  A very good little vacuum which I think would be great for a small apartment, or as an accessory vacuum in a big house.

We have some dark areas under counters, like everyone does.  I didn't think that putting a light in the area would make that big a difference, but now that these are installed (very easy in about 2 minutes), I am delighted.  Motion sensors turn the light on when you move near them, and the light is bright and clear.  The lights themselves are thin and can't be seen when they are stuck up under the counter.  I'm gonna pick up a few more of these because they are great.

This case is sort of adequate, in that I believe that my Kindle is probably more secure in it than it would be out of it.  Pros: Sturdy back is lightweight and simple, easy to fit kindle into it.  Cons: There is very little (read: virtually none) protection if you drop your kindle.  This is not a padded/bumpered otterbox style case.  It is designed to be form fitting and not add much to the size factor, and if that is the most important thing to you, then this is fine.  But if you are more interested in protecting your investment, I think that one good drop to the ground from your night stand and I'd be worried about my screen.On the subject of the screen, let's discuss that lid flap.  In a word, virtually useless.  There is no closure to it, so while it does lay flat over your screen while your device is level, if you tilt the device, the screen cover will slide down.  There is an elastic band on the back that you can use to close it, which is fine, but I find my lid slipping a little even with the band in place, exposing the edge of the glass--exactly what I do not want.  The stand feature is a "one size fits all" type--the lid bends up and attaches to a groove in the back of the case. There is only one setting, so I hope that does it for you.I don't care too much about style, but if you are into style, then this takes "simple" to a new level.  There is essentially no additional pizazz added to your device.  That might be important for some, so I mention it.This is a no-frills case.  It is functional, and it is lightweight.  I'm not sure if it is going to do much to really protect my Kindle from a drop, and it certainly won't help with a spill, so I guess I'm going to need to invest in a case for my case.

Fans of quicken will be right at home with the Will maker.  As a dad of 3 kids, I finally decided that it was time to put a will together.  It seems so scary, right?  Well, its not.  Will maker guides you right through it, from beginning to end.  For us it was simple, but I get the impression that you could do complex things with this. Anyway, an inexpensive solution that will make things easier should the unexpected happen.

It never ceases to amaze me how Sufjian can put out as much music as he does at such a high level of creativity and quality--but he does.  Here, I found myself enveloped in a thoughtful, joyful, playful mix of Christmas music all sung sweetly and sincerely by someone who clearly loves Christmas as much as I do.  I love Christmas music, but so often, there is just one more retread of the same songs--you won't really find that here.  The songs you know are new again sung by Sufjian, and the new tunes fit in really well with the old.  The fact that there are 50+ tracks in this set is unreal, and an absolute delight.  I cannot recommend this Christmas set highly enough for anyone who loves Sufjian or Indie pop.  If you are looking for something to set the mood and keep you in the spirit of the season, this is a great set.  Also, check out his other Christmas set--equally good, and that is saying a lot.
more fun than a barrel of very thoughtful monkeys. keeps you sucked in and trying.  i hope more levels are coming!

Either you love that voice or you don't--raspy, gravelly, a little high with a warble and a burr--but if you love it, it can set you free.  Lyrics go for the throat--Sometimes it's just roses dying too young--he chants on the amazing Revelation blues, and sends shivers up my spine.  He changes his sound a little bit on the title track, using a gently melodic piano as a backbone, and somehow, its like a clearing out of the rain:  To see through a fearless eye/And know that danger finally goes away/ Still you're trying/But there's no leaving now.  Listen, Kristian Matsson is simply an incredible lyricist, a gifted melodicist, and completely without guile in his singing.  If you want some honest, confessionally brilliant music, check this out.  It is searing.

So how big a portal fan are you?  If you are like me, pretty big. In fact, if you end up on this page, you are almost certainly a big portal fan, because let's face it, this music is not going to be burning up the top 40 charts any time soon.  So, Mr. or Mrs. Big Fan, here you go--four discs worth of portally goodness to listen to as you are testing (or doing anything else you want).  There's all the tunes you know and love, including some tracks from Portal 1, and some vocals from GLaDOS (you murdering fiend).  Please be aware that many of these tracks are available for free from the Official Portal site, but if you need to have a physical copy, then this will suit you just fine.  I give it five stars because I admire the obsessive completion that lets it span four discs, and the composition is all top notch--but you knew that, because you've played the game 15 times already.  Haven't you? Well haven't you?  SO, in summary, the music is good, and the cake is a lie.

I'm finding myself in the Christmas spirit already due to a pair of albums just released.  Katharine Jenkins just released a Christmas album that is lovely and traditional, with a big orchestra and an elegant feel.  That album is a wonderful accompaniement to night time, but I'm gonna need something peppier to listen to as I decorate the tree with the kids, and Holidays Rule fits that bill perfectly.  Starting off with a really fun (I know, I went there) rendition of Sleigh Ride by (you guessed it) Fun., the album is full of original and delightful versions of Christmas classics.  McCartney's "The Christmas Song" is such a pleasure--his voice sounds 30 years younger.  "Green Grows the Holly" is done by Calexico (one of my fave bands), and Holly Golightly reminds us again why she is so incredible with her perfect rendition of "That's What I Want for Christmas".  If you want to enjoy Christmas tunes you know in some delightful arrangements (including the marvellous "Wonderful Christmastime" by the Shins), then pick this album up.  Great fun, good spirit.  Simply having a Wonderful Christmastime.

Katherine Jenkins is in magnificent voice for these beautiful and traditional interpretations of Christmas favorites.  Her lovely rounded mezzo is clear and pure, and the orchestra is full and warm.  Together, they envelop you in a holiday feeling suitable for cozy evenings by the fire with a cup of hot chocolate and a good book.  Her O Come O Come Emmanuel is especially lovely, and I was delighted to see the John Rutter piece "I Wish You Christmas" included.  All in all, a very enjoyable experience, recommended for lovers of neo-classical Christmas music.

I lost on the way my original soft cover of my Theta S, and finally they have this one back in stock , it is hard case fit the Theta S exactly and nice tight protecting it while traveling , you can also attach the cover case to a string and wear on the neck (string not included )It looks like leather outside with a soft fabric material inside like suede , but not sure if it is 100% leather, any way they should change the description to hard case as it protect well .
working excellent but the cable is very stiff it easy fall off from my device for that reason 4 stars,
I loosed my original screw and it was good replacement ! fit as needed
bags ok, love the smell ! what else to say ..
fantastic mini mic, working great, it have 2 settings on high and low to pick up everything or compress the sound for voice over .. also great with skype and PC or laptop , did not expected
I am getting artificial after taste .. not my favorite too much flavoring
my favorite minerals, better than bare minerals, it does not dry out my skin and I look the same hours after, very well made and long lasting
beautiful , soft and light gray color just what I needed !
to much yellow undertone :( and covering ? no more than regular minerals of the same company
very slim cable and elastic .. used with my mini projector and tablet !
we got some flea invasion in the backyard and I tried everything, but this product worked like a charm, 2 times used and fleas was gone ! really recommended !
shipped really fast from Hong Kong , the size is true , I ordered L and it was roomy US L as I want layered style , the material is nice not so tinreally love it
great staple, used it in my summer project doing small wood frames, really easy to use and strong ! love my little helpers

It is a great silicone pan, especially working great with Halogen Oven , it was so good that a mouse shredded it in the cabinet .. she was cached and punished by banning her from the castle forever .. time to order new one again

It worked well however I still have weird taste after, I run 24 cups of clean water after and after I drink coffee I still have weird taste in my mouth for that reason 3 stars . There is no smell .. but weird like citric acid after taste .

I am tall I wear M-L , ordered XL and it is a nice normal US L 10-12 but very long almost like mini dress than tunic still I like it , the WT573 is 100% cotton , feel like organic cotton .. less processed not so high end fabricif that was mix with spandex I could go for size smaller L = 8-10 US

great sneaker boots, very compy, the size was true to size and got 2 colors of the strings black and white .. really nicepurchased 2 colors black and redif your strings are too short use them the way I do and you will have double length left ..

It is horrible , dry out the skin forming wrinkle in 10 min , is that a real deal here or fake product , I used primer as well but after 20 min I feel like after face lift  my skin got so tight .. I use everyday mineral foundation but this product is so wrong and clumpy zero coverage  .. also I believe is expired ..waste of money

Ordered XL , normal M or L depends of clothing as I am tall , but I wanted to have cozy oversize look so I can wear something under, and it is just perfect and looks exactly as in the picture, long covering all my low back and bellow, soft and semi heavy fabric so great for all seasons.really like the fabric and how it was made with nice finish and does not look cheap .Ordered another 2 colors as I really enjoying this unit .it is size smaller than the charts XL= US L  = 10-12

I ordered XL as normal I wear M or L and it fit just perfect not too lose or too tight , it is not too long on me but just cover my back enough, but I am also tall , the arms fits just perfect too, really comfortable tunic however it has a short torso , the material is not so light so great for the colder months however I would prefer  more fall  off material , if you have big hips, skip it as it add visual volume making them bigger due to the folding material .

0:07 MinsI purchased the silver one with mini SD , I own 2800 Lumens DLP 3D projector but too heavy to take on and off on the way, I was so surprised that this little thing generate the brightness with just 100 lumens  , how possible ! love it even with ambient light (not total darkness ) with 8 feet distance I got 100" screen resolution but is minder bright but still , very powerful, easy to use simple and really small . the build in battery is 2100 mAh that allow you to play without charger for around 2 hours , you still can use the charger and play movies or play games for longer than that , the 2 hours is just for the battery , make sure you don't cover the fan vents as it cool off the projector . The best , I have dyed middle golden blonde hair , after shampoo 2 min and conditioner for 5 min my hair become light ash blonde , I tried other products without success , the hair are nice after the conditioner , so if you use your own shampoo the conditioner will be enough as the pigment is more strong than in the shampoo  my nail polish was gray from white so wear gloves .. the skin was ok .The shampoo did nothing to my hair as there was not change in color at all .Don't use the product straight after bleaching to a pale yellow or white as you hair can turn purple-bluish , the hair after bleach are very absorbing , mix half- half with your regular conditioner unless you hair turn golden blonde or have orange tone you can go for max power as well as it will tone them nice down to middle ash blond .This product is so much better than dye hair toner that damage bleached hair even more , my hair are long to my lower back bleached to dead, but soft , shiny and looks healthy and don't break down .. nice product and recommendedI have only one negative comments about what is the smell , it remind me of cheap Brazilian perfume , my hands smell 2 days after wash and wash not to mention the hair , too intensive and my boyfriend don't like it , but hey, better smelly beautiful hair than bald head lol you can't have everything ! always paying for something back  right ?but seriously , if Clairol changed the smell it would be number one stuff, but due to the smell of the pigment it is hard to mask with other perfume.ah and one more thing, after using this product don't use acidic product like lemon or fruit based shampoos .. it will make the hair less pretty and hard to manage , I read that the pigment can react with high acidic chemicals in bad way

Author Andreas Clenow has done an outstanding job writing a landmark book for readers interested in systematic trend following of futures. He gives basic systematic trend following strategies with entry and exit parameters, position sizing, and shows the watch list for futures markets needed for proper diversification. He explains systems based on breakouts and moving average crossovers. It's amazing how his backtested returns correlate closely to the returns of some of the top managed futures trend following firms in the industry.The trend following system examples are a great place for a trader to start to develop their own system that fits their risk tolerance levels and return goals. The book does a great job taking the reader through a year by year breakdown of the system's performance, and explains the emotions that would be experienced trading the system in real-time. The book does an outstanding job explaining the needed discipline and proper position sizing that must go side by side with the entry and exit signals to make the system work.The key lessons are that the leverage of futures provide the opportunity for out-sized returns for relatively small position sizes. The money not needed for futures positions can be used to gain interest in bonds to increase earnings. From a money managers perspective, you have to communicate to your investors and explain the system to help avoid withdrawals during drawdowns. Trend following works primarily through the diversification available through the futures markets, and profitability comes from large trends that pay for all the small losses.This book does the best job I have ever seen explaining the principles of trend following with managed futures. This is a great book for anyone interested in creating their own trend following system for their personal account, or even aspiring to be a money manager in the industry. Andreas Clenow does a wonderful job explaining the process step-by-step, as well as the pitfalls and rewards available in the industry.

Andreas Clenow’s new book takes the reader through creating a mechanical trend following system using momentum ranking for stocks in the S&P 500 index. This is an outstanding trading book because it shows the reader year by year performance, and explains the emotions that a trader goes through during drawdowns in trading capital. Mr. Clenow does an amazing job of explaining the realities of trading, including how an equity curve can cause traders to abandon long term winning systems due to short term losses.I like that he emphasizes that you will only be profitable by focusing on your trading principles for risk management and capturing stocks that are moving with momentum, and not a magical optimization of a system with historical data, or finding the perfect indicators.He uses a 200 day simple moving average on the S&P 500 index as his primary going to a cash position for his momentum stocks. This is the same one I use as my major trend indicator, and it can cut your drawdowns in half during corrections and bear markets, and his system proves this. He explains the difficulty of trend trading downtrends through selling short, because the stock market tends to be more volatile and often rallies during bear markets. This makes it more difficult to capture downside momentum and trends.He illustrates the necessity of learning coding if you want to create thoroughly backtested mechanical trading systems at a professional level.This book is a must have for every trading library. His concepts, warnings, advice, and systematic quantified trading approach are important for any trader. It is one of the best trading books I have read because it brings together all the important trading principles and concepts and explains how they can be implemented in the real world.

This is a sturdy and durable iron that heats up quickly and irons smoothly and quickly. I appreciate Mark Ritchie sending me a review copy of this book. I have the utmost respect Mr. Ritchie's market successes and interview in Jack Schwager's "Market Wizards" book.This book is much different than other trading books you will read as the author begins with a warning that trading is probably not for you and your time could be best spent in a pursuit of an easier path in life. Mr. Ritchie warns sternly that the pursuit of profitable trading can be a brutal path filled with pain that few can handle. He even spends the first chapter discussing all the people that he knows were financially ruined by trading and the dangers of suicide in our business. The reasons for these dangers is why I always discuss the importance of risk management and managing of the risk of ruin in my own trading books and blog.After reading hundreds of trading books this book still stood out as one of the best explanations on how hard it was to trade through a long term equity curve and the mental and emotional pain of drawdowns in capital during losing streaks. I also found his explanation of how impossible it was to mathematically be a profitable trader for any length of time if you are risking too much on any one trade very concise. Mr. Ritchie shows with mathematical examples how the results of a string of wins and losses is affected by percent of capital at risk per trade.His approach for explaining drawdowns through a sequence of wins and losses and not just losses in a row was one of the most important perspectives that a trader can gain in understanding the importance of position sizing and stop losses. One of the best explanations I have ever heard.The book also directs the reader to Ritchie's app that simulates an equity curve based on capital at risk and a trader's win/loss ratio.It is like a future test for your own systems equity curve.Ritchie is a devout Christian and writes about trading through a biblical perspective and about the hypocrisy of many in the Christian world. The book also dives into Christian Apologetics and gives answers for his faith.This is one of those books that explains the realities of trading, the good, the bad, and the ugly. It can help take a trader to the next level that reads it and really takes it to heart. The risk per trade, the dangers, and the rewards are all there for those who are disciplined and focused enough to follow the right path.

This book is truly a map to the human pursuit of happiness. This book shows the reader how to pursue and find harmony within our self and on our journey through life's circumstances. The author brings to life the ancient wisdom of Lao Tzu for modern readers that relates well to our current world and circumstances. One key is the understanding between physical pain and mental suffering and that we are the cause of most of our mental pain through living a life of imbalance. The book suggests the path to a quality life with serenity flow from balance. Excess and indulgence is shown to be the path to unhappiness and frustration. The keys to life balance are found in quietism, self restraint, and meditation. The power of Tao lies within us. Its exercise does not depend on any external being. While Buddhist are focused on alleviating suffering the Taoist are dedicated to sustaining the personal harmony that overshadows suffering and avoids it in the first place. The books takes the reader through the how to use the Tao through all areas of life step by step. The definition of what soul mates truly are by fulfilling all four meanings of love from the ancient Greek meanings. This is a landmark book and one of the few life maps you will really need to guide you to a life of harmony and happiness. One of my top recommendations.

This replacement for sugar is natural unlike most other sugar substitutes and is extracted from birch trees that are pesticide free. It has a nice mild and sweet taste and is not as overwhelmingly sweet like regular sugar. It can be measured out and used in equal portions to sugar which makes it convenient for drinks and recipes. It has less than 10 calories and 4 grams of carbohydrates per teaspoon which is 40% less calories and 75% less carbohydrates than sugar. Xylitol does not cause tooth decay, is low glycemic, and has zero aftertaste. It is a more healthy alternative to regular sugar. I would also try stevia it is another all natural fill in for artificial sweeteners and sugar. Xylitol islight a healthier version of sugar like it is "sugar light".

It is amazing the depth of knowledge contained in the this book and the simplicity of the explanations that accompany complex topics. The book covers all the basics explaining how all markets function from forex, options, and the stock market to futures contracts. The  author takes the time to explain money management and the step by step process for building a trading system. I am very impressed with the authors depth and comprehensive coverage of all things that can lead to a traders success. Bravo! I highly recommend this book as a great place to start for the aspiring new trader to get a complete understanding of important market concepts that will lead to their success.

I first read the original version of this book over eight years ago and it was the book that finally gave me the overall structure I needed to understand all the dynamics of my trading. I have read hundreds of trading books and this one still stands head and shoulders above the rest for its handling of the dynamics of managing the risk to your money, the trader's mind, and the developing and following of a trading method.I really like the clarity of the charts in this new edition using charts from the StockCharts website that I use daily,If you read and follow the principles in this book you will make enough money on your trades to pay for this book many times over. I have been an active participate in the markets for over 20 years as both a trader and investor and I agree with Dr. Elder completely having lived out the greed, fear, and mistakes he talks about through out the book.Read this book and save yourself a lot of unnecessary losses of both financial and mental capital.The first section of this book teaches you the psychology of successful trading:1). You must be committed to being a trader for the long haul.2). Learn all that you can, but be skeptical, go with what works.3). Develop a method for analyzing the market.4). Develop a money management plan.5). Do not get greedy and rush into trades.6). Understand that you can be your own worst enemy through greed, fear, and emotions.7). You must change to be a profitable trader .Dr. Elder explains his own trading tactics and methodology.In the Risk Management section he covers the most important strategy of when to exit? He suggests setting a stop-loss on every trade so you keep losses small and the importance of protecting profits with trailing stops.He also suggests never risking more than 2% of your account on any one trade, and never losing more than 6-8% of your account in any one month.He makes a great point that all true professionals in any field do not count their money daily. Traders should focus on their trading not their daily paper profits. Traders should focus on following their trading plan and let the profits take care of themselves.Buy this book, you will profit from it, whether you are a beginner or an advanced trader, it will make you more professional and logical. It will show you that traders are only profitable by trading a winning method using risk management with discipline by managing their own thoughts and emotions.Dr. Elders background in psychology really makes him perfect to be the one that wrote one of the most all encompassing trading books on the market today.
