According to the authors, we need to copy the typical steps of a successful entrepreneur in what they call the ALBR process:• Act: Work out what you want to do, and act by quickly taking a small step towards your goal using whatever means you have at hand.• Learn: After taking the small step, stop to see what you have learned.• Build: Use what you have learned as a foundation for your next steps.• Repeat: Keep following these steps until you are happy with the result or you decide you don’t want or can’t afford to continue.I suspect that a typical non-entrepreneur who reads the book won’t take a lot of comfort in the ALBR formula. The authors are obviously a lot more comfortable with uncertainty than the typical non-entrepreneur. The book still doesn’t tell you where you should go or where safety can be found, because there is very little safety in a rapidly changing business environment. But if your ship is sinking you are much more likely to survive if you are generating options for action rather than living in denial.

Leadership requires crafting an agenda, working in a deeply political world and working closely with other people. Schools do not teach this. Business school fails dismally to teach this, and most corporate training swings wildly between technical training (accounting and systems) and tree hugging, raft building and team building on the other side, according to Jo Owen in this book.The book aims to provide a framework for observing and learning from leadership experiences, by briefly describing a large number of different leadership skills. The skills are grouped into mindset skills, career skills, people skills, moment of truth skills, daily skills, organization skills, and values and behaviours.While reading the book it seemed to me as if the author had overlooked a number of important leadership skills, but after making my own list and re-reading the book I am satisfied that the book does cover almost every skill I could think of, although not in the terms I would have used. The author’s forthright and sometimes Machiavellian advice includes:• “The received wisdom about (the Myers-Briggs Type Indicator) is that there is no ‘bad’ category. This is a fiction used by facilitators who want an easy time with the groups they lead.”• “Managers use numbers the way drunks use lamp posts: for support, not illumination.”• “(To motivate people) try to figure out how to appeal to fear, greed and idleness.”• “An effective leader needs to be unreasonable, selectively. In setting expectations the leader learns to be selectively deaf: you will not hear all the excuses about rising input costs, increasing competition and demanding customers.”I found the book entertaining to read, but I am still uncertain how valuable it is within the context of leadership development. It provides a useful checklist of skills, but the few pages devoted to each skill are insufficient to give a full understanding. As the author says, leaders learn from experience, not from courses. Perhaps the book helps you to recognise a mistake once you have made it.

Whether you are starting out in professional life or have been part of it for some time, you have a boss and a responsibility to manage him of her like the other resources for which you’re responsible, according to William Smullen in this book. The author has had 50 years of experience in managing others, most notably as chief of staff to former US Secretary of State Colin Powell.Managing Up means different things to different people. In most work environments it means working out how to overcome the weaknesses and over-sized egos of people who hold senior positions in the organization in order to get things done. It is usually about trade-offs, politics, persuasion, and ensuring that credit gets appropriately misallocated. However, this book is about a different type of “managing up”. It is about how to be an executive assistant and maximize your contribution to the success of a boss whom you admire and believe in.Indeed, the first chapter is entitled “Believe in Your Boss or Find Another”. The difficulty with this advice is that it really is a rare thing to find a great boss. Moreover, the vast majority of jobs are not chief-of-staff or executive assistant type jobs in which the primary job responsibility is to help the boss. In most jobs the primary responsibility is to serve customers or perform tasks, and keeping the boss happy is only a small part of the job.Nevertheless, the author’s advice will be useful to anyone who has a boss who needs to be kept happy. Key pieces of advice include:• Don’t hesitate to tell the boss he or she is wrong• Anticipate what the boss wants or needs• Never allow your boss to be surprised• Bullying is bad for business• It’s the deed, not the credit

Living within and loving God’s church requires an experience with God and his amazing grace, but it also requires an intentional decision to forgive and love people who are less than loveable, according to Rob Bentz in this book. It demands faithfulness and commitment to God, but it also demands faithfulness and commitment to his people.Some of the wisdom contained in the book:• The fact that God would call out a special group of people to love, draw to himself, call his own, shower with unspeakable grace, and then entrust with special roles and responsibilities in his kingdom work is quite astonishing.• Without a clear recognition of God’s payment on behalf of his people, you and I will not see each other accurately. I won’t see you as God’s sees you—redeemed by the blood of his Son, Jesus.• The church that Jesus is building is an eclectic, intriguing, quirky, diverse mess of humanity. That’s God’s way.• Love is the one primary thing that God gave us to represent him. That’s why it’s nothing short of a tragedy when we do it so poorly.• Genuine biblical encouragement is among the most frequently undervalued and over-assumed experiences of the Christ followers’ journey.• Service is simply not about me, my happiness, my joy, my status, or my ability to cultivate a heartwarming story that I might one day tell others. At its core, service is about whom I am serving.• Unity is the result of a great deal of heart-wrenching, God-seeking, others-forgiving effort. Jesus calls us to this immense personal and corporate challenge.The church has become increasingly marginalized and seen as an irrelevant and outdated institution, even by followers of Jesus. The author makes a passionate defence of the church not as an idealized abstract idea but as the imperfect, complicated, difficult collection of people that it currently is. The book is reasonably short and interesting, but I am not sure how many readers will be willing to step up to the challenge of difficult unity when disposable relationships are so much easier.

Leadership might not be the first thing you think of when you hear Billy Graham’s name, but his role as a leader of leaders has been central to his ministry. Billy Graham’s lifetime of vigorous leadership invites every leader to engage with the same spirit, to consider his example, and to dig, as he did, into the rich resources of leadership literature that resonate with biblical examples, according to Matt Woodley in this book.So what sorts of leadership lessons can we learn from Billy Graham? The author looks at five different aspects of leadership:• The character of a leader: Early in his ministry, Billy and his team created a written covenant, the Modesto Manifesto, detailing how they were going to deal with temptations.• The mission of an organization: Billy’s clear focus on his calling has led him to reject good opportunities which were not directly aligned with his mission.• The importance of teamwork: By finding the right chemistry, Billy led a team which stayed together for decades.• Common challenges faced by leaders: By offering his critics kindness rather than vengeance, Billy won some powerful allies.• How faith in God has shaped Billy’s life as a leader: Humble openness made Billy a lifelong learner on the Christian journey.There is something awkward about books which lionize individual Christians, and I was also slightly uncomfortable about the way the book speaks of Billy Graham in the past tense rather than the present. Nonetheless, the book is filled with many interesting stories from Billy’s life, and there is a great deal of wisdom to be learnt from his experiences.

For most people the Epicurean view, that God is a long way away and stays out of touch, is reality, according to Tom Wright in this book. The Epicurean worldview, which sees the divine as being entirely separate from the practicalities of everyday life, such that God and the world don’t mix, has been enshrined in the American Constitution with the separation of church and state. Unsurprisingly Christians sound unconvincing when they submit to the presupposition that God does not intervene in everyday life.Even more insidiously, Christians are often firm believers in the American dream that if you get up and go you will succeed, and the fittest will survive the economic jungle. There is a gut-level reaction against any kind of health-care proposal: after all, if these folks were fit to survive, they’d be out there earning a living! The unexamined presupposition behind this is simply social Darwinism. The great irony is that often those who are most opposed to Darwin when it comes to reading Genesis 1 are in fact most deeply in thrall to him, or to the wider application of his theories, when it comes to social and international policy.The book contains a number of interesting and challenging essays, each providing extensive scriptural support for a position that many will find controversial. People who are of a more conservative bent are unlikely to appreciate the book, and many readers will find some of the arguments a bit heavy going. However, people who like to have their preconceptions challenged – or who like to challenge the views of others – will thoroughly enjoy the book.

Why do you go to work every day, and why travel somewhere at all? Is it necessarily the best place to perform the tasks your organization requires of you? What is the best way to design a workplace? How can flexible and work-from-home arrangements be effective for an organization? These and many similar questions are addressed by Guy Clapperton and Philip Vanhoutte in this book.The authors discuss in some detail the differing needs for work space zones for focused individual work, group discussions and presentations, contemplation, and face-to-face communication. Acoustic design is a very important although frequently neglected consideration. There are many work space types to choose from, including quiet rooms, quiet areas, collaboration areas, social hubs, inspiring spaces, neutral ground, transition spaces, and home or hotel rooms.Although some organizations have adopted a virtual model of working, some form of physical workspace is, in the opinion of the authors, crucial for most businesses. Home-working has been made increasingly possible by broadband networks and technology, but technology alone is not sufficient to enable an effective virtual organization; some complex human re-engineering is also required.Most managers would prefer to leave issues of workplace design to architects, and get on with running their businesses. However, management is about managing people, and workplace design, particularly in the context of telecommuting and flexible work arrangements, is increasingly a key people issue. In my view this book, although it is not as neatly structured as I would have liked, is a very useful resource.

It turns out that becoming a leader and doing something amazing with your life hinge on what makes you different, not what makes you the same as everyone else, according to Sylvia Hewlett in this book. Executive presence is a measure of image rather than performance; it is the manner in which you signal to others that you “have what it takes” to be star material.So, what is it that coworkers and bosses look for when they evaluate an employee’s executive presence? The author and her research team at the Center for Talent Innovation used a survey and focus groups to discover the answer, and they found that executive presence rests on three pillars:• How you act (gravitas)• How you speak (communication)• How you look (appearance)Of these three ingredients, gravitas is said by senior leaders to be by far the most important, followed by communication and then by appearance. However, appearance and communication tend to be significant factors in assessing a person’s gravitas. Projecting confidence, displaying “grace under fire”, tone of voice, body language and eye contact are all important ingredients of gravitas.A tall, well-built, white male has an unfair advantage in establishing gravitas when compared with women, people who are overweight, people of other ethnicities, and members of other minority groups. Much of the book is taken up in discussing how these cultural prejudices can be overcome. The author is of the view that the best results are achieved by accentuating the strengths that make you different from the white alpha male, rather than by trying to pretend to be a white alpha male.This book is useful for anyone who feels that they would like to enhance their executive presence, but it is also useful for managers and leaders who need to have their preconceptions challenged so that their workplaces can experience the benefits of greater diversity.

The idea that the more power one individual leader wields, the more we should be impressed by that leader is an illusion. Where corners are cut because one leader is sure he knows best, problems follow, and they can be on a disastrous scale, according to Archie Brown in this book. The book examines the leadership styles of a large range of political leaders including dictators and democratic leaders.The author’s essential thesis is that it is unhelpful to rate political leaders on a single strong-weak scale given that there are so many different dimensions to effective leadership, and indeed leaders who are unconstrained by others in making their decisions tend to make significantly poorer decisions. Mao Zedong was a better leader in the early days of the Chinese Communist Party than when he acquired a position of absolute power. Tony Blair made his poorest decisions when he made them without adequate discussion with others.The book tells interesting stories about a very large number of political leaders from the past century. The author has a great deal of personal knowledge of many of those leaders, and the book is an excellent history book. However, it is hard to read the book without observing that the best leaders are rarely the ones who float to the top of the political process, whether in democracies or in dictatorships. The author has provided extensive material to demonstrate the dangers of the “strong” political leader, but the stories do not coalesce into a neat description of the characteristics of a “good” political leader.

Even well-thought-out incentives lose effectiveness over time, and traditional practices of rewards programs often feel mechanical, manipulative and bureaucratic, according to George Langelett in this book. Employees are influenced by emotions as well as logic in their decision-making, so managers need to develop their empathy skills to help employees make sound decisions and to influence long-term motivation.So how do you go about developing your empathy skills? According to the author, you need to practise intersubjective experiences, which are occasions on which two people share the same emotional response to an event. The five steps to a manager sharing an intersubjective experience with an employee are:• Comprehend the employee’s experience• Respond with empathy, understanding and acceptance• Investigate the causes of the event• Respond again with empathy, understanding and acceptance• Co-create new meaning to the incident and find resolutionThis process enables the manager to assist the employee into a well-considered response to a crisis event, and it enables a manager to confront inappropriate attitudes or actions in an emotionally safe manner. The author provides numerous empathetic responses which managers can make in response to various different employee emotions. After learning and practising these responses, managers can be ready for any situation with an appropriate response.This is a short and very interesting book, well worth the read for anyone who has managerial or supervisory responsibilities.

We have the wrong brain and the wrong education to get people decisions right, according to Claudio Fernández-Aráoz in this book. We distrust people who are not similar to us, but to succeed in a globally minded environment we need to surround ourselves with people who have diverse backgrounds and complementary skills. And the vast majority of managers have not received proper training on assessing others and helping them reach their highest potential.To complicate matters, we tend to assume that the difference in productivity between employees is normally distributed, so that the difference between an above-average performer and a below-average performer is not that much. However, in skilled occupations such as software development the productivity difference between a standout programmer and an average programmer can be as much as 1,200 percent. It really is important to try to recruit the star performers.So, what are some of the key things you need to do when interviewing a job candidate?• Carefully check for self-awareness and humility• Reduce the social pressure for overly positive self-assessments• Give the candidate a realistic idea of the required skills and behaviours and the expected challenges• Tell the candidate to discuss the potential role and his or her readiness for it with close friends and colleagues• Conduct smart reference checksThe book is filled with wisdom on topics associated with personnel recruitment including how many candidates you should interview, the benefits and pitfalls of using consultants, how to ensure that new hires fit into your organisation, how to support their integration, how to deal with compensation, and how to create teams that thrive.This is an outstanding book, entertaining and informative in equal parts. I highly recommend it to anyone who is responsible for personnel decisions.

Because I was given a discount on these in exchange for an honest review...I wasn't expecting much from these as I had never heard of the brand before and the price is very low.  But, compared to other headphones I have tested in this price range I now realize these are much better than the others I have tested.They have a nice carrying case that zips shut.  Nothing about the case or the headphones feels cheap.  Everything feels really well made and solid.  Sometimes the cheap ones feel so flimsy you worry that if you even look at them wrong they will break.  Not, these.  They feel extremely sturdy.  They fit tight on my ears and don't let sound out or in.  The cord is a nice braided type which should be less likely to tangle.  Basically the whole overall build quality is just incredibly impressive to me for the price (as of the time of this review).Now let's get to the sound.  I expected cheap sound with no low frequencies at all.  So, I'm not into rap, but to test this I listened to a rap song.  Now I don't have any expensive $200 headphones to compare these to, as I only use ear buds normally... but wow... they actually boomed the bass out! I was floored, I didn't expect to hear any low frequencies on these.  The overall sound quality for this price range is amazing.  This is no high end $200 headphone, but wow... much better than I expected!The Microphone is handy for accepting calls and the sound quality seems good with the limited testing I did.  There is a button you can use to mute the call, or hold it down to hang up.  I tested it and the button worked great.Really the only thing I would like added to this is a volume button so I can control the volume from the headphone unit that dangles from the cord.  That isn't a deal breaker though as I can adjust the volume on my phone or computer. It would just be nice.I'm actually so happy with this I'm going to give them as a gift and I wouldn't do that if they weren't good.  I wish I could keep them for myself but xmas is coming.  You can't go wrong with these as long as they stay in the low price range.  They are really nice for a budget headphone!PS.  I decided not to take a pic of these as so many people have already done so, I don't feel like my pics would add anything to what is already out there.

As of the time of this review, the price is very reasonable for what you get.  Not only do you get the hammock itself, but you also get a matching bag for carrying it around.  This is a soft and comfortable material which I like.  This is not a real heavy duty fabric type that you would want to keep up in your yard year around.  But, the material is plenty strong for the price range and more than strong enough to hold me.  I find this hammock most useful for taking to the park and hooking up between trees for an outing.  It is very portable with the included bag.  I also have a bag of portable hammock straps, so I can easily and quickly hook this up to a tree in a park without damaging the tree or dealing with ropes and knots.  This works great for that use as it is not too bulky or heavy and is very portable.  I received this hammock at a discount in exchange for a fair and honest review, but that did not affect my review in any way.  If you have any questions let me know and I'll do my best to answer them for you!

I feel 'inflamed' pretty much all the time and have terrible brain fog.  I've been tested for allergies and try to reduce those things but still have problems.  So, I knew something else must be going on.  I was researching brain fog and stumbled across information regarding histamine intolerance.  These DAO pills seem to help me, but they are spendy if you take them with every meal.So, I decided to try something else.  I found for me I can mask the symptoms by using the right antihistamine.  Most make me drowsy and don't work for me as a result.  But I have had good luck with generic over the counter Fexofenadine.  I have decided instead of using DAO... to save money, I'll just use Fexofenadine.  That antihistamine doesn't make me drowsy and solves my brain fog problem.  I take them in the morning as they can amp me up a bit. I get 120 tablets (1 a day) for around $35. So, this is a very cheap work around compared to DAO.  This work around may not work for all of you, but it does work for me so I thought I'd share it with you in case it helps at least a few of you.So, in my opinion is that this DAO is a good product and will help many of you with histamine intolerance as it did me. But, if you don't feel that you can afford these pills long term, you could try playing around with Fexofenadine to see if that helps you as well.  Good luck with your journey to good health and feeling better!

This is way nicer than I expected.  It feels really heavy and substantial.  I like that the knob on the back is metal.  I have had some in the past that were plastic and they invariably break off with time if they are only made from plastic.  The grip is comfortable and not slippery.  It also has a clip like most do so you can force the handle to always stay on.The spray pattern gives a wide variety of settings from a powerful stream, all the way to a nice mist for watering starts.  My wife picked this up and said "Oh, my this is really nice and well made", with no prompting from me which was a nice surprise.  I was given a discount on this unit in exchange for a fair and honest review, but that did not affect my review in any way.  If I found any problems or thought it felt cheap I would let you know.  Feel free to ask me if you have any questions and I'll do my best to answer them for you.

The things I like about these are that they are foldable and have a braided type cord which should make the cord last longer and be less likely to tangle. I also like that it has a mute button and mic. They also seem to made fairly well for a budget pair of headphones.In terms of sound quality the volume goes plenty high.  And I don't hear any hissing which is good.  The high sounds and mid sounds sound ok, but the lows are a bit disappointing.  Don't get these if you like your bass to boom.I also wish they fit tighter together so they would cup my ears tighter.  I feel like the seal isn't good and a lot of environmental sound can still get through.But, if you are looking for a budget pair of headphones that won't break the bank and are of reasonable quality for the price range these ones are definitely worth considering.

Let me point out that all of my testing was done on an Android phone, and I only used bluetooth.  Perhaps things might work differently is you set yours up differently or are using a different type of phone.  But, for me I want it to work exclusively on bluetooth and I need to have it work on my Android phone.If you just want to use this for listening to music it is great.  I first tested this by pairing it and then making sure the fm station on my car was the same as the one I had set on the device.  The music from my phone sounded good with the bluetooth paired and I didn't have any issues.  You just have to adjust the volume on your stereo and on your phone/or on this device.  The sounds was rich and I could crank it up loud enough so I could hear the music great.I also tested the charging ports and they seemed to be able to charge my phone without a problem.But, the main thing I want to use this for is hands free bluetooth calls and it didn't work right for me.  To test this I called my work voicemail several times.  My welcome message on my voicemail played great through the speakers of my car, just like the music did.  I then recorded my voicemail that was several sentences long just as a test.  And I hung up.  I thought everything worked great, but then I went in and listened to the voicemail that was recorded and it cut in and out so much that I couldn't hear the voicemail at all.  I could only hear a fraction of a word or two out of the several sentences that I recorded.  I figured that must be a fluke, so I tried rebooting my phone and unplugging the device and trying it again.  Second time same result, it was impossible to properly hear the audio that was generated from this device.I give this two stars because if all you want to do is listen to music via bluetooth in an old car that doesn't have bluetooth.  Or if you want to charge your phone it works great.  But the main thing I wanted to use it for was bluetooth hands free calling in my car that has no bluetooth capabilities.  That however was a big bummer as it didn't work without cutting out terribly.  Perhaps I got a bad device with a bad microphone, so maybe you will get lucky.  All I know is my unit didn't work properly, at least not with my phone.Luckily I got this unit free in exchange for a fair and honest review.  So, I didn't spend any money on this.  But, if you are thinking about buying this I'd recommend waiting until more reviews come in to see if other people are experiencing the same problem I did.  I'm bummed out, I really wanted this one to work.  If only the microphone worked properly it would have been the perfect device.EDIT: 11/6/15 The company sent me a replacement unit, but it does the same thing.  I did finally realize though that I could get the microphone to pickup my voice if I moved my head about 2 inches from the unit.  Then it would pick up my voice just fine on the phone call.  But as soon as I move back to sit in my car seat normally it can't pickup my voice.  Of course I can't drive with my head two inches from this unit as I couldn't see the road.  So, this unit simply doesn't work properly for hands free calls, but does play music great!  I'm not sure why other people claimed it worked unless they didn't test all of the features, and perhaps didn't actually try to talk to someone with the device hands free through bluetooth.  Two units definitely have microphone problems, it just doesn't pick up sound properly.

This is a nice brush.  The thing I like the most about it, would be how it has a curved head.  Makes sense, I don't know why they don't make all brushes that way.  But, anyhow I gave it to my daughter and she loves it.  The bristles are set pretty far apart so it works great for people with alot of hair.  The quality seems fine to me, it feels plenty sturdy and I'd expect her to get many years of use out of it.  I didn't take any pics of it because many reviewers already uploaded pics of it, and really... how many pics of a hair brush does one need?:)  I was given this brush in exchange for a fair and honest reviews, but that did not affect my review.  I would let you know it was low quality or fell apart.  So, far it appears to be plenty sturdy and it does what a brush should do, it can brush hair!

I had not heard of this brand of watch before so I wasn't too sure how well I would like it.  But, once it came I was quite impressed with the quality.  It comes with a nice gift box and gift bag.  The watch band is genuine leather and seems to be slightly padded which makes it more comfortable.  The watch also claims to be water resistant but I did not test that claim.In terms of looks, it looks very nice and well made.  It isn't too flashy, but isn't too plain either.  It also displays the day of the week and the date which is a nice bonus.The only thing I wish was that it had some numbers on the dial, but that is only my personal preference.  Some people don't want numbers, as a watch usually looks more dressy without the numbers.I have only had it a day, but so far it seems to keep time well.  I'll come back and edit this post if I have problems with it keeping time.  If you don't see a new edit on here then that means it is still keeping time satisfactorily.At the current posted 'sale price' at the time of this review... I feel like this watch is a steal and is an excellent watch for the price.  I was given a discount on this watch in exchange for fair and honest review.  But, that did not affect my review in any way.  I have posted a few pics for you as well.  If you have any questions about this watch feel free to contact me and I'll answer them as best as I can!

These are different than the standard white or black kitchen bags I normally purchase in the store.  They aren't that stretchy type of plastic.  This type of plastic has less stretch to it, but that is just fine for my use.  They actually remind me of the types of liners that I used to be given by my bosses back in the day when I used to do janitorial work.  They appear very thin, yet are surprisingly strong.  I really like these so far and they fit my kitchen trash can great.  Really the only thing I don't like is that they don't have a drawstring, but that is because these are more of a liner and less of a traditional kitchen drawstring bag.  I can tie the top, so not having a drawstring isn't a deal breaker for me.I was given a discount on these bags in exchange for a fair and honest review.  But, that did not affect my review in any way.  Since I was given a discount my review is only of the bags themselves not regarding the price.  You will want to look at the cost per bag yourself to determine if you think these are a good deal for you or not.  But, if you are looking for a lightweight, yet surprisingly strong liner these are really nice, so far I have been very happy with them.

We walk the dogs or run often in the early mornings when it is pitch dark.  We have various reflective jackets etc, but the problem is we don't have reflective gear for every weather condition.  For example we each have a nice bright yellow, reflective jacket.  But, it isn't really rain proof, and it isn't warm enough when winter comes.  The thing I like about having a belt is that you can put it over any jacket, coat, shirt etc.  So, this ends up being much cheaper than buying reflective gear for any weather situation.In terms of the quality I couldn't be happier.  This is really wide, and the buckle is incredibly large and heavy duty.  The material is nice an stretchy, and it is easy to adjust how tight you want it.  I did receive a discount on this belt in exchange for a fair and honest review.  But, that did not affect my review in any way.  In fact, I'm so happy with this I'll but a second one at full price so both myself and my wife have one.  If you have any questions just let me know and I'll be happy to answer them as best as I can.

This is my first insulated mug and so far I am quite happy!  I'm not a fan of the saying on the side but that is just a personal preference and that doesn't detract from it's usefulness.  It's not too shiny of a black paint, so it isn't too slippery which is nice.  It also fits great in my standard size car cup holders.  Some people may prefer one with a handle, but I prefer to not have a handle... but that's just my personal preference.The lid screws on tight and doesn't leak which is of course very important.  It also has a white filter so that ice doesn't hit your teeth, but I also like to use that when drinking coffee out of it as I think that makes it less likely I will spill on myself.  It is nice because hot or cold liquids don't hurt your hand since it is insulated.I definitely like that this isn't a plastic thermos, it is stainless steel on the inside.  Of course the lid is plastic of some type but that is unavoidable.  All in all I am very happy with this so far.  I did receive a discount on this item in exchange for a fair and honest review, but that did not affect my review in any way.  If you have any questions for me regarding this just let me know and I'll answer them as best as I can.  I also included a few pics for you!

Being a college IT instructor I have to keep my flash drive with me at all times at work.  So, I keep my flash drive on a lanyard.  These lanyards are better than my old lanyard for a couple of reasons.  First I like that you can attach both a flash drive and an ID badge to it since it has a clip for each.  The small black loop is for looping into the flash drive and the metal clip is for attaching keys or badges.  Second I like that you can use the black plastic buckle to remove the flash drive to use without having to take the entire lanyard off of your neck if you don't want to.I have not tested this with heavy keys because I only need a flash drive and an ID badge on my lanyard.  Some people complained these weren't strong enough, but they are as strong or stronger than my old lanyard, so I am happy so far for my needs.Really my only complaint so far is that these lanyards are longer than my old lanyard so they hit down at my belt buckle which is a bit low for my preference.  But, I still like these better than my old lanyard and am happy so far.  I did receive a discount on these in exchange for a fair and honest review, but that has not affected my review in anyway.  I also included a few pics for you as well.  If you have any questions feel free to let me know and I'll answer them as best as I can for you!

This is a well made flash light.  It has the CREE LED bulb which I have read is one of the best manufacturer's of LED bulbs.  So, that is a big bonus.  It may not be the latest model of CREE bulbs but it is still plenty bright for the money.  I have no way to know if the stated brightness of 900 lumens is correct or not.  But, I can say from comparing this with other flashlights that I own makes me believe that this likely does produce around 900 lumens.  I included a pic in the bathroom with all other lights off, it was pitch black in there and you can see how well the flashlight illuminates that room.I have another Outlite flash light, it is really good too and has a slightly bigger head for dispersing the light.  But, this one still manages to disperse the light well.  It does not however have a user adjustable beam from what I could tell.  The advantage to this model is that it comes with a second rechargeable battery.  So, you can leave one on the charger and one in the flashlight and always be prepared.  To, me that is a big advantage.It also claims to be water resistant which is important if it's raining.  But, I don't believe it is designed to be submerged.  This also has different modes, for high, low, strobe, and SOS.I have had some LED flashlights in the past that were made pretty lightweight and felt shoddy.  With time they would short out and the light would come off and on from the vibrations as you walked.  I haven't had this very long yet, but this one feels solid, with tight connections and no hint yet of future problems.  I'll come back and edit my post if it starts to act up, but if you don't see any edits then it is still working well for me.I did receive a discount on this light in exchange for a fair and honest review.  That did not sway my review in any way.  If you have questions feel free to ask me and I'll do my best to answer them for you.

I uploaded not only product pics, but a pic in our bathroom with it completely pitch black and only the flashlight on.  You can see this does a great job of lighting the bathroom.  I have no way of knowing if it meets the 900 Lumen claim, but I feel like the brightness seems about right compared to my other flashlights.  This does have a CREE LED bulb which I understand is one of the best manufacturer's out there for the bulbs.One of the things I really like about this is that it has a wide head.  So, not only do you get a very bright center beam, but the light reflects out nicely.Please note however that the beam can not be focused yourself, but I feel like this is set at a pretty good focus so that isn't a huge down side in my book.  It would be nice though if it had that feature.  However, at the current time of this review the sale price is so good on this it is still an excellent deal even if it doesn't have a user beam focus feature.This has multiple settings for strobe, etc which is a nice touch.This comes with a rechargeable Lithium Ion user removable battery.  You can use the included charger to charge the battery.  If the battery fails with age you can easily purchase a new one.I was given a discount on this product in exchange for a fair and honest review.  But, that did not affect my review or opinion.  It looks like the main flashlight normally comes with a small mini flashlight for your keychain, but my review sample didn't seem to include that one so I couldn't review that, only the main flashlight.  If you have questions feel free to ask me and I'll do my best to answer them for you.

This thing feels very sturdy to me.  It has a nice rubber coating that should help protect it if dropped.  And of course being IPX6 certified it should also be dust proof and water resistant.  I didn't actually want to test that feature by pouring dust/water all over it, so I'll just take their word for it!One thing that I like about this is that if you are familiar with how to pair a bluetooth device with your phone or tablet this is incredibly easy to pair.  I didn't even crack the owners manual on this, it is very intuitive to control and to pair.In terms of the sound quality it is pretty good for the size of speaker it is.  The highs and mids sound good, of course you will not get any booming bass in this price range/size, but it still sounds good overall.  The volume goes up plenty high,  and I can hear it throughout my 1200sqft house without issue.  I thought I heard a mild hiss at first, but then I decided it was just the song that I was streaming, the next song sounded fine.The bluetooth is very reliable, it doesn't cut in or out and gives a solid music stream without interruption.  If I put this in the middle of my house I can move my tablet away from it and still keep the bluetooth going without issue throughout the house.I did get a discount on this device in exchange for a fair and honest review.  But, that did not affect my review in any way.  If you have questions feel free to ask and I'll do my best to answer it.

I was a bit concerned that a decorative collar wouldn't be strong.  But, I'm quite happy with the quality so far.  The stitching seems strong, and it has a metal ring for connecting a leash.  The fastener is made of plastic, but most collars are now a days.  The fasteners click tight together and feel sturdy to me.Ok, so enough of the practical stuff... lets get on to the aesthetics.  This thing is really cute and looks much cuter in person than what the pictures can do justice with.  The one that we ordered has some really nice shiny gold stitching that really pops nice.  We are going to keep this clean and not used daily until the season comes, we are looking forward to using this during the holidays! This is constructed very well.  I was surprised by how heavy and dense this thing is!  It is clearly constructed to last, the stitching seemed solid as well.  I really like the feel of the fabric that is used, it feels soft, yet appears strong enough to last for quite some time as well.  I noticed on the label that the inside fill material is recycled material which is nice from an environmental stand point.  I assumed the large would work for our labs, but its a little tight for them.  Our labs are between 87-89 pounds.  So like the product description states, make sure to measure how your dog is currently sleeping.  Also notice that they state the inside and outside dimensions, with the inside ones being the most important for the size of your dog.This also makes a nice cat bed, it's a bit too tight for our labs... however our cat is happy to have it!Edit: I thought this cover couldn't be removed but I finally found the zippers.  They are so well hidden I couldn't find them at first.  But, they are there in the cracks between the cushion and sides.  Which makes washing a breeze!I was given a discount on this bed in exchange for a fair and honest review.  That did not however influence my review in anyway.  Feel free to ask me in questions you may have and I'll do my best to answer them for you.  I also attached a few pics of the bed as well as well as some with the tape measure so you can verify the inside measurements.

I like how this rolls up nicely and snaps together when it is not in use. It fits my lab pretty good, (I got the XL).  I wish it had a little more size adjustment built in to it but it works as you can do some adjustment with the velcro.  His problem is his hips, so I can put this towards his backend and help him out when he needs it.  I use it mainly to help him get into the car, he can get his front body in himself but not his back part.  So, this really helps to assist him in getting into the car.  Really the main con that I see, is it has a small velcro handle that you can use to wrap the two handles together.  But, it isn't sewn into one of the handles.  It is just left totally loose.  So, there is a pretty good chance that I will lose that handle wrap with time.  I was given this at a discount in exchange for a product review, but that did not influence my review.  I also attached a few pics for you as well.

This is nice and long which I prefer for walking our dogs.  Being made out of leather it feels more solid and strong than nylon type leashes.  The clasp seems plenty strong.  I also like that they use a rivet at the handle and clasp side.  Also the stitching seems plenty strong.  The only thing is that I'm spoiled by having a padded handle.  This one does not have a padded handle, but that isn't really a big deal for most people.  What is more important to me is that the leash is strong, will not break and that it is long enough.  This leash does all three of those.  I was given a discount on this leash in exchange for a fair and honest review, but that did not affect my review in any way. This case is not bad for an inexpensive waterproof case, but you do have to be a little careful. I tested it in a bowl of water with a papertowl in it so I could check for moisture. The first time I didn't quite have it clicked together perfectly so it leaked a bit. I then dried it off and tried again, this time resealing it better. And, I submerged in the bowl for about 10 minutes and things appeared dry inside afterwards. So, just be very, very careful that you have it properly clicked together and all of the ports closed properly. It would be easy to think you have everything snapped together properly only to find out your phone got wet. So, take plenty of time putting it on the phone.It's not very bulky for a waterproof case which is really nice. Using the buttons can be a little difficult, but that is the case with many water proof cases.My main complaint was it was really hard to take it apart after the test. Once I finally pried it open, if I had a phone in there instead of a paper towel it would have gone flying across the room. So, I knocked off a star for that. Be very careful getting the case off.It does do the job if you are careful getting your phone in and out of it. I was given a discount on this case in exchange for a fair and honest review. However, that did not influence my review. I have also attached a few photos for you as well.

I'm pleasantly surprised with this charger.  It gives you 2.4amps per port.  I have been burned in the past with chargers that claim to be 2.4a but clearly aren't because they are painfully slow.  But, I can say that this one is as advertised.  On my phone if it is a true 2.4a charger I can gain battery when charging at the rate of about 1% per minute.  I tested this charger and I was getting that speed, so it appears to be as it claims.  I also tested my tablet and it charged quickly as well.  And, I individually tested each port and they all worked well.  One thing that I did not get a chance to test was actually trying to charge 3 high amp devices at once.  But, according to the literature it sounds like that shouldn't be a problem or slow it down.We all know some chargers can be very hollow and cheap feeling, but not this one.  This one feels very substantial and well made.  A nice touch is that the outside has a type of rubbery finish on it which makes it less likely to slip out of your hand when you are unplugging it.  The inside of the USB ports lights up as well, to tell you it has power and to make it easy to find the port in the dark, which is another very nice feature.  I did receive a discount on this product in exchange for a fair and honest review but that did not affect my review in any way.  I like this so much I'm going to give it to my mom for her bday, she is pretty picky.  So, if I feel like I can give it to her that means I'm really happy with it and can recommend it.

I was skeptical that this would be made very well because the packaging on the box was kind of plain, and it isn't a big brand name.  But, once I took it out of the box I was pleasantly surprised.  I was able to easily figure out how to assemble it without having to read any directions, that is a huge plus in my book.  The other thing I noticed is that after you take apart the wingnut for placing it on the handlebars there are three notched settings so you can adjust it for really small or really large handle bars. I used the middle setting for my mountain bike.The clasp and rubber mesh makes it so that your phone does not vibrate excessively so if you are using the gps this will work well.  I was given a discount on this product in exchange for a fair and honest review but that did not affect my review in any way.  I hope to get many years of use out of this and am excited to finally be able to use my phones gps easily while riding.  I have included a few pics for you as well so you can see how it looks once attached to my bike.  If you have questions feel free to ask and I'll answer them as best as I can!

This unit does function, so I gave it a few stars for that.  However, the sound is really low even though I turned up the sound all of the way on my radio and on my phone.  And, because I have to crank my stereo sound so high you get a lot of humming type noises.  Sometimes the blue tooth cuts in and out, so at times so the music occasionally cuts in and out.  To be honest, I think I'll just stick with using an audio aux cable instead of messing with bluetooth, the sound it much better that way if you have a good cord.I did receive a discount on this product in exchange for a fair and honest review, but that did not affect my review in any way.

The thing I like about this cell phone vent holder is that it fits small round vents like the one in my pt cruiser without an issue.  The one for my wife's car, only works on long rectangular vents, where this one should really fit just about any vent type.  IT clamps on to the phone quite well and should fit most types of phones ok.Unfortunately, the reason it fits in any vent even a small round one is because it only attaches to one vent blade and doesn't have a lower supporting arm like my wife's holder does.  So, this means it is incredibly easy to clip on to most any type of vent, but it has less support.  So, when you hit bumps it will vibrate pretty bad.But, it may not be perfect however it does fit my small vents so I plan to continue to use it even though it vibrates a bit.  It is still way better than trying to use the gps with my phone sliding around in the seat next to me.  So, it isn't perfect but since it works with my type of vents I'm still happy enough with it to continue using it.  I was given a discount on this product in exchange for my fair and honest review, but that did not affect my review at all.  I have also included a few pictures so you can see how nicely it attaches to my cars vents.

I tested this on my Android based phone and it worked great.  I tested all three ports and all of the ports charged without issue on my phone.  It charged my phone pretty fast, I have a really nice wall charger that does rapid charge a bit faster than this one.  But, for the price I feel like this charges plenty fast.  It has an LED light to let you know it is receiving power from the cigarette lighter port in your car.  It does not feel cheap or flimsy.  One thing I did not test was how well it does with three separate items plugged into it at once.  It may or may not slow down the charge to accomplish that but I'm not sure as I don't have three devices to plug in and test it with. This case is of course a little larger than a standard case because it is waterproof.  But, that is to be expected I would say.  So, I would probably only recommend using this if you are hiking, or kayaking etc.  Then I would use a non waterproof case the rest of the time.  The case is easy to get the phone in and out of with the latching clips for the clam shell type design.  So, the main thing you are probably concerned with... will this keep my phone dry.  As you can see from the picture I took in a bowl of water, I actually tested in in water.  I left it in the bowl for 20 minutes.  Then I took it out and thoroughly dried the outside of it.  I opened it up expecting to find some dampness inside but I could find none. It was completely dry.  Since it passed my test, I give it 5 stars!  I was given this product at a discount in exchange for a fair and honest review but that did not affect my review in any way.

This cable is built really nice.  I like how the braided cables don't tangle as bad and don't wear out as fast.  This braided one still manages to feel soft and pliable even though it is a braided one.  The aluminium connectors feel really solid if not premium.  I tested in on my good charger and it actually charged my phone a tad a faster compared to one cable I have that is rated for 2amp charges and is thicker.  So, this isn't a cheap cable that will slow down your charges, it actually sped mine up a tad.  The only minor complaint I have is it doesn't feel like the Micro usb port clicks in very good to my phone compared to my other premium cable.  However, I don't think I can fault this cable as all of my cables except one doesn't seem to fit very good in my phone.  So, I think there is something wrong with my phone's port.  All in all I'm quite happy with this cable.  I was given a discount on this cable in exchange for a fair and honest review.  But, that didn't influence my review in any way. I needed a fast charger and this fits the bill.  First let me say that I payed full price for this item and did not get a discount on this in exchange for a review.  That wouldn't affect my review one way or another but some people question discounted reviews and sometimes I do those.  Anyhow, back to the product, the build quality on this is amazing.  It feels very well made, it has some heft to it and doesn't feel too light like some of the cheap ones.  My old generic USB charger was a piece of junk and slowed my charge time down considerably even though it claimed to be 2.4amp but there is no way it was.  This charger literally sped my charge time up so it was 2-3 times faster than the junky one I was using before.  Finally I didn't need 6 hours to charge my phone from 5% to 100%.  With this charger I can charge it at the rate of about 1% per minute give or take.  So, it takes approximately 95-120 minutes to fully charge my phone, that is so much more reasonable!  I also got a really nice 20w dual port charger in exchange for a review, and that one is very fast too, but it was only 20w and this is 24w, so this is about 13 minutes faster than that one for a full charge.I like how the LED light changes to let you know if it's doing a full charge or scaled back down to a trickle charge.  And I like how it has two ports that can charge simultaneously at full speed for both.  It is also pretty neat how it uses intelligence to tailor the charge to the kind of device and cable you have.There isn't much more I can say about this except just get it!  I'm going to get an additional one and give it to my daughter for xmas.  I made the mistake of giving her the same cheap generic one I had so she has the same slow charge problem I had until now.  This is a really fast and solid product.

I got the 500ml unit and am extremely happy with it so far. There are a lot of pros for this unit and not any major cons. I love that it holds more volume than many of the other ones do. I also really like the LED light and how it changes to different colors, it is relaxing and fun. But, of course if you don't want the light on you can turn it off. The other really cool feature is that it has a timer, so it can either be completely on or timed for one, three or six hours.The only minor issue I see is that the button on the right is for toggling between low mist or a higher mist. I believe though that it first defaults to a low setting so if you press it just once it should take you to the high setting. But, an indication light would be a nice touch. The dogs love them!  In fact I included a pic of one of my dogs guarding it from the other dog, even though the other dog had her own.  They are twisted nicely together and are nice and thick, which is great for our larger dogs.  I knocked off one star simply because they stink a bit.  I didn't notice more smell than normal from their 12 inch straight bully sticks that I got earlier.  But, these ones definitely have a bit more stink to them and I'm not sure why.  But, hey... that doesn't really matter much as long as the dogs love them, which they do.  So, the dogs give them a thumbs up!  I was given a discount on this product in exchange for my fair and honest review, that that didn't affect my review.

I wasn't sure how well I would like this until I got it.  Once I opened the box, I realized it was made well and didn't look cheap.  To me, when it comes to electronics... part of what draws me to a device is whether I can figure it out without reading the instructions.  This was simple to figure out, I plugged it into a usb port for awhile to charge it.  I noticed there was an option to set the time for time stamps of your recording files, but I don't care about that so I did not bother with setting the time on the device.  There is a physical switch that you simply slide to start recording, when you are done slide it back and it stops.  It doesn't get any easier than that.  Then the .wav file shows up on the flash drive under a folder.In terms of the audio quality I was impressed.  I walked 20 feet away in a room and it could still pick up my voice fine in normal conversation tones.  Of course it was even louder when I was closer but it works well in a room.  I'm a college instructor and wish my students would use a device like this to record my class discussions.  It is so simple to use and the sound quality is plenty good for covering a room.I couldn't find what speed of USB drive it was, so I assume it is USB 2 not USB 3.  But, it is compatible with USB 3 ports as well, you just won't get the USB 3 speed.  The speed was plenty fast either way though, the sound didn't stutter at all when I played it back.It currently doesn't list Windows 10 as a compatible OS.  However since it is just a Flash drive with recording capabilities it worked fine on my Windows 10 machine.  You will be able to see the recorded files just fine.  However, in Windows 10 my default music player was set as the Groove Music Player, so when I browsed to the file I recorded and double clicked it, that app said it wasn't compatible with the file type.  So, I used the Windows 10 search box and searched for the old Media Player program, and opened that.  Then I drag and dropped the file into the windows Media Player software and it started playing fine.  So, hopefully that helps a few of you if you have Windows 10.I received this product in exchange for a fair and honest review of the product, but that did not influence my rating.  I also have included a few pics for you as well.

The main thing I look for when I shop for cables on Amazon, is do they actually work according to the reviews.  I tested this and plugged it into the Aux input on a bluetooth speaker I have and connected my phone.  The bluetooth speaker immediately recognized there was an audio cable plugged in.  The music sounded great and very clear.  I also like how it is a braided exterior.  I received this product in exchange for a fair and honest review, but I did test it and it worked great.  I'll include a few pics for you as well.

I got two of these cables from the same manufacturer.  One was the blue 10ft model, the other is the 5ft black one.  They both performed the same so I'll post the same review with different pictures for each.  These are very hefty and have the nice braided exterior.  The packaging was great on the ends, not only did they have the slip on plastic protectors but also had the foam wrap around them to keep them safe.  I do not have a 4k device yet (or one with ethernet) so I couldn't test that, but I tested each of these cables on my 1080p TV and streamed a 1080p movie.  It looked very sharp with no ghosting, stuttering or jumping.  So, even if you have older equipment but need a new cable you may as well get one that supports 4k Ultra that way when you do upgrade you won't have to run out and buy new cables, you will already have some.  I did receive these for a discount in exchange for a fair and honest review but that did not affect my rating.  I will include some pics as well.

I got two of these cables from the same manufacturer.  One was the blue 10ft model, the other is the 5ft black one.  They both performed the same so I'll post the same review with different pictures for each.  These are very hefty and have the nice braided exterior.
