In short, this backpack is nothing short of wonderful, and is my favorite laptop case by far.If you've not yet had the pleasure of owning a Targus backpack, you might not be familiar with the high level of craftsmanship that goes into these wonders of design, nor how long these backpacks last. Though they are made from the same materials as other backpacks, Targus backpacks for some reason last longer under equal wear, tear, and weight conditions. They're just made to last, and they do that while looking fabulous the whole time.This rolling Targus backpack is especially wonderful for air travelers who wish to carry more than just a purse on the flight, but find they are subject to flight restrictions on carryon baggage. Currently, this bag works as carryon on most flights, and hopefully that will remain true, because I just love this backpack!

This rat trap worked great the very first day! Having said that, I also wish to point out that I live in a liberal community full of animal rights activists, and I fully respect that making a decision to kill rather than reform wild rats is an important decision everyone should carefully consider. Once one has exhausted all other methods for clearing wild rats out of places one doesn't wish to cohabit with them, it's then important to consider long-term results from the extermination method itself. The good thing about the old-fashioned rat trap like this one is that the rat does not experience a prolonged period of suffering as might occur with other methods (sticky traps and poisons), nor does it go on to possibly sicken or kill other creatures who might eat it's poisoned body. So once you've come to the point where a rat trap seems necessary, I can confirm that this one does the job.This trap is made of plastic, which has held up for the first week of use, and looks like it will last for a while, provided it's not exposed to destructive acids or strong UV. It should do just fine placed in dark areas, which are more likely to be where you'd be placing it anyway.

This device must be one of the best-kept secrets of body builders and athletes everywhere. The versatility of the various components make this an outstanding tool for physical therapy, without need for a multitude of various other bands, belts, balls and what-not. Essentially, this full-range fitness training system provides people with the tools, videos, charts and information with which a motivated individual can increase strength, flexibility, and stamina at home in relatively simple exercise programs that literally just take minutes a day.Whether you wish to develop muscles, establish a six-pack, reduce shoulder or hip or back pain, or get one of the best all-over body workouts you can imagine from the comfort of home, I can't recommend Bullworker highly enough. I've simply not seen anything that provides anywhere near as much benefit for relatively little pain or suffering--when you use the device according to directions.Highly recommended!

This lemon juice is wonderfully refreshing as an addition to water, and is remarkably useful when cooking. The flavor is just right, and almost as good as fresh squeezed. Perfect for those times when you don't have fresh lemons available!

I truly adore these CZ earrings, since they're just the right size, cut, brilliance and shape to add elegant sparkle to just about any outfit I wear. These are the classic types of earrings you really can wear from day to dusk, that make the perfect transition from work to a night out on the town. The color of these stones I got are deep sapphire blue, and they complement the color of my eyes quite well.In addition to the 18k White Gold Plated round CZs in blue, I also got these in yellow gold plated with sapphire, and in 18k white gold plated with white diamond color stones. All three of these are completely stunning additions to any outfit, since the simple elegance of their design does not clash or conflict in any way.The velvet boxes these earrings arrive in make outstanding gift cases, should you wish to give them as gifts--but it is worth noting that just as with any cardboard box, the presentation for gift-giving will be best when not snapping the box open and shut several times before giving it as a gift.The truth is that these earrings are so nice you likely won't want to give them as gifts, since they truly are fashion accessories you'll look for again and again. And if you do give them as gifts, be forewarned that you're likely at some future date to wonder, "What happened to those gorgeous CZ earrings?"I love the length of the earring posts, and the hypoallergenic materials they're made from. The net result is that I can put these earrings on quickly and easily, and wear them for hours without experiencing allergic reactions I usually suffer from with non hypoallergenic earrings from other sources.A complementary sample of these earrings was received in exchange for an honest review.

This gorgeous steampunk style corset helps create a marvelous costume--all you need add is just the right skirt or pants and accessories, and Voila! You've got one of the coolest costumes around! I'm a larger-sized woman, so I made sure to order the very largest version of this corset, which turned out to be a good decision, since even with the adjustable laces let all the way out, I still needed to skip the last two grommets in the back in order to get the lacing just right. And you needn't worry about having someone on hand every time you put this on, since there's a handy side zipper that makes it possible (if not entirely easy) to dress yourself. I'd recommend allowing a little extra time to get your corset adjusted just right in advance of the first time you wear it, since some re-lacing might be required.The pouches, buckles, and snaps really add a lot of pizzazz to this as a costume piece, as does the little mini-jacket with the choker-style snap-on necklace. It's these little details that set this bustier apart as a truly cool fashion find, helping ensure you'll be fairly unique when you show up anywhere in this! The pouches are strong and large enough to hold small things, such as loose change, credit cards, some money, lipstick, and your car keys, which is a nice feature if you don't have other pockets with  you and want to stay in character as your steampunk persona.The side zipper did run into a bit of a problem where it came all the way free between zipper pull and zipper tracks, but it's a standard kind of zipper problem that can happen--so just make sure you have a little extra time to deal with that as well as making sure your laces fit you, and this is one sweet costume piece!All-in-all, this costume is tough enough to wear on more than one occasion, and comfortable enough to wear for hours--or even an entire day. It is a corset, which means it reduces flexibility to the point you likely won't be wearing to to yoga class any time soon--but it's a small price to pay for being a steampunk goddess!I received a discounted item in exchange for an honest review.

I love this zipper! I needed to install a sturdier zipper than the one that came on a duvet cover for my bed, and this one really does a great job of zipping and unzipping quickly whenever needed, without jamming or getting stuck. I love the glide action, and the high-quality materials this zipper is made from.

On rainy days and occasions when I spent a lot of time outdoors, I am grateful to have Argan oil hair treatment as part of my regular hair care regimen--keeping my hair smooth and beautiful and minimizing risk of dispiriting 'bad hair' days. This oil has a pleasantly mild fragrance, and goes on without adding excessive gooeyness or stickiness--it's just the right amount of oil to smooth my hair perfectly. This oil is a blend of Argan Oil, Almond Oil & Olive Oil, and they seem to work together harmoniously. I enjoy adding a small amount of this oil after each shampoo and conditioning, and it's also wonderful as a touch-up on rainy or humid days. I've found a little bit of this goes a long, long way, giving my hair a beautiful shine.Highly recommended!I received a complementary sample of this argan oil hair treatment in exchange for an honest review.

This sports bra provides good shock absorption that can work well for large-chested women (D cup and above) engaged in moderate activity, low-impact sports. This Miny bra is indeed comfortable, and it works great for me while walking, light jogging, and doing some martial arts. I like the way the inserted pads can be easily removed through side slits, since I don't need padding in a bra. I love the comfort of the material, and the width of the straps, so the bra doesn't cut into my shoulders. The fit worked beautifully, which was great to discover, since many sports bras I've tried are too small and completely inadequate for even the most moderate exercise--which was not true of the Miny bra.While large-chested women interested in running, jumping, and extremely vigorous sports might prefer something with greater support, I find the Miny comfort cross movement one-piece to be a marvelous addition to my sports bras that is just right for most all my low to moderate workout routines.Highly recommended!I received a complementary sample of this sports bra in return for an honest review.

At least three essential basics I wish I'd learned early in life are included in Becoming a Supple Leopard (BASL): how to stand, how to sit, and how to breathe. While some of us were fortunate enough to have parents and teachers advise us to sit up straight, stand up straight, and breathe deeply from the diaphragm, true clarity and specifics are seldom provided to such a degree that decades later, pain and injury is prevented and/or easily remedied through return to optimal body positioning. Instead, all too often I hear from friends and colleagues seeking a return of mobility and a reduction in pain that even when they get surgeries and take time off from movement, they still continue suffering from mobility issues.The three basic principles in BASL are: (1) if something's not in the right place, put it in the right place, (2) if something is not moving, get it moving, and (3) Work upstream and downstream of the problem. I love how more than one third of BASL is dedicated to helping people put these principles to work exactly where we need them most in our own lives with mobilization techniques. If you flip to the very last pages in this book, you'll find joint and body prescriptions for addressing a variety of aches, pains, tweaks and other assorted "lagging indicators" that it's time to address position and mobility of a specific area, such as: headache, shoulder pain, carpal tunnel syndrome, foot pain, hip pain, shin splints, or back pain.The idea from the title of this book comes from the notion that leopards stay in a steady state in which they are consistently prepared for movement, thanks to being naturally supple--and humans can attain a state of suppleness from learning correct movement and positioning. Most of us don't notice something is wrong with our bodies until we feel pain--what the authors call "lagging indicators." Sometimes by the time we notice something is wrong, it's really gone spectacularly wrong, to the point that we experience a good deal of pain and often serious reduction in flexibility, strength, stamina, and movement. The authors point out that many of our daily habits--including the way we sit, stand up, and stand--can contribute to injury without our knowledge.As a middle-aged athlete, I have discovered how much strain can occur to my body when I move in ways that are less than optimal. I also know lots of people who are experiencing reduction in mobility, pain, and injury. I felt inspired to spend a few hours reading specific treatment plans addressing many of the most common types of problems people tend to encounter, and I felt immediate improvement and reduction of pain by following along with the illustrations and exercises designed to retune my body positions and movements for optimal functionality.I love how this book is written in such a way that it's easy to immediately test the basic principles of maintaining neutral posture and correct torque on hips and shoulders. Not only are the principles clear and easy to understand, but some of the mysterious tips athletes have been hearing finally start to make sense, such as why weight lifters are instructed to "break the bar," and what's really going on when you "screw your feet into the ground." The essential idea in the case of ball-and-socket joints like hips and shoulders is that it's important to take up slack that naturally occurs in those designs.BASL truly shines in providing techniques for working with painfully knotted tissues with a "smash and floss" method of providing targeted pressure together with movement to restore normal range of motion to short and stiff tissues, benefiting multiple tissue systems.The organization and structure of this book is great for quickly looking something up in the index when dealing with an immediate question or concern, or browsing through the sections that include: midline stabilization and spinal mechanics, moving joints from a braced neutral position, maintaining optimal torque, categories of movement, mobilization techniques and target areas, and mobility prescriptions.This book is an excellent addition to any athlete's shelf, and is especially good for people who'd like to learn how to work with their body with its current issues and shortcomings. Highly recommended!

Laurie shares unexpected heartbreaks and joys on her courageous and exotic journey, making Road to Shine a page-turning, spiritually nourishing delight. She begins her journey as so many westerners do, following the well-intentioned guidance of family and mentors. Somewhere along the way, after graduating from Harvard and working on the front lines of education and with education reform, Laurie discovers that she's consistently happiest, healthiest, and most prosperous when following the beat of her own drum, even when that leads her to far-off places and destinations as yet unknown.It's not often you come across such a down-to-Earth, laugh-out-loud funny spiritual book that helps you feel like you're side-by-side with the author, climbing dangerous mountain passes during lightning storms, diving headfirst down into a deadly white-water whirlpool, bedding down for a good night's sleep high in a jungle tree house, or deciding whether or not to accept a piece of fresh-cooked guinea pig.I love the way Laurie shares high points from many of the soul-searching workshops, classes, and adventures she's enjoyed. Road to Shine is the perfect vicarious spiritual journey through stone chakra clearing, intuitive readings, Outward Bound experiences, and desert vision quests from the safety and comfort of your favorite reading chair, as Laurie shares her path from approval-seeking Harvard graduate to heart-centered spiritual seeker and wise woman.Road to Shine has the bitingly fresh insights and achingly raw emotion of a personal memoir, with lots of healing belly laughs throughout, that reads something like Outward Bound meets Eat, Pray, Love.Road to Shine is a delight for spiritual seekers as well as anyone simply curious about what the fuss about personal growth is all about, and is a joy to read from cover-to-cover.Highly recommended!

Yampolskiy summarizes the Singularity Paradox (SP) as "superintelligent machines are feared to be too dumb to possess common sense." Put in even more simple terms, there is a growing concern about dangers of Artificial Intelligence (AI) amongst some of the world's best-educated and most well-respected scientific leaders, such as Stephen Hawking, Elon Musk, and Bill Gates. The hazards of AI containment are discussed in some detail in Artificial Superintelligence, yet in language easily understandable to the layman.In Artificial Superintelligence, Yampolskiy argues for addressing AI potential dangers with a safety engineering approach, rather than with loosely defined ethics, since human values are inconsistent and dynamic. Yampolskiy points out that "fully autonomous machines cannot ever be assumed to be safe," and going so far as adding, "... and so should not be constructed." (p 186)Yampolskiy acknowledges the concern of AI escaping confines, and takes the reader on a tour of AI taxonomies with a general overview of the field of Intelligence, showing a Venn type diagram (p 30) in which 'human minds' and 'human designed AI' occupy adjacent real estate on this nonlinear terrain of 'minds in general' in multidimensional super space. 'Self-improving minds' are envisioned which improve upon 'human designed AI,' and at this very juncture arises the potential for 'universal intelligence,' and the Singularity Paradox (SP) problem.Yampolskiy proposes initiation of an AI hazard symbol, which could prove useful for constraining AI to designated containment areas, in J.A.I.L. or 'Just for A.I. Location.' Part of Yampolskiy's proposed solution to the AI Confinement Problem includes asking 'safe questions' (p 137). Yampolskiy includes other solutions proposed by Drexler (confine transhuman machines), Bostrom (utilize AI only for answering questions in Oracle mode), Chalmers (confine AI to 'leakproof' virtual worlds), and argues for creation of committees designated to oversea AI security.Emphasizing the scale and scope of what needs to be accomplished in order to help ensure safety of AI are points such as Yudkowskiy having "performed AI-box 'experiments' in which he demonstrated that even human-level intelligence is sufficient to escape from an AI-box," and even Chalmers "correctly observes that a truly leakproof system in which NO information is allowed to leak out from the simulated world into our environment is impossible, or at least pointless." (p 111)Since one of the fundamental tenets in information security is that it is impossible to ever prove any system is 100% secure, it's easy to see why there is such strong and growing concern regarding the safety to mankind of AI. And if there is no way to safely confine AI, then like any parents, humanity will certainly find itself hoping that we'll have done such an excellent job raising AI to maturity, that it will comport itself kindly toward its elders. Yampolskiy points out "In general, ethics for superintelligent machines is one of the most fruitful areas of research in the field of singularity research, with numerous publications appearing every year." (p 114)For those hoping that teaching AI to simply follow the rules will be enough, Yampolskiy replies that law-abiding is not enough. AI could still keep humans safe 'for their own good,' increasingly limiting human free choice in a sped-up kind of way, that superintelligent AI will be able to do.For readers intrigued in what safe variety of AI might be possible, the section of Artificial Superintelligence early in the book will be of great interest. Yampolskiy describes five taxonomies of minds (pp 31-34). Returning to re-read this section after having completed the rest of the book can be quite beneficial, as at this point readers can more fully understand how AI that is Quantum and Flexibly Embodied according to Goetzel taxonomy (p 31) with Ethics Self-Monitoring (p 122) might help ensure development of safe AI. If such AI systems include error-checking, with firmware (un-erasable) dedication to preserving others and constantly checking to seek and resonate with highest-order intelligence with quantum levels of sensing through time-reversible logic gates (in accordance with quantum deductive logic), one can begin to breathe a sigh of relief that there might just be a way to ensure safe AI will prevail. While the deepest pockets of government funding are unlikely to ever make plans to develop such a system that would not be controlled by anything less than the greatest intelligence seekable by AI (such as God), it is conceivable that humanitarian philanthropists will step forward to fund such a project in time that all of us will be eternally grateful that its highest-order-seeking AI will prevail.I highly recommend Artificial Superintelligence to all readers, as this subject will absolutely impact everyone's lives.I received a complementary review copy of this book for a fair and honest review.

Right out of the package, this headlamp sets itself apart from other headlamps, as it features a red LED switch in addition to the usual white. The red LEDs provide the option of illumination without losing one's night vision--which is perfect for use outdoors at night, or in locations where bright light would be irritating or hazardous for others.What truly sets this headlamp head and shoulders above the rest (pardon the pun) is that it's "bright" setting actually is bright. It's on par with flashlights of much larger size, such as we keep on hand for roadside use in our car. The fact that such a tiny flashlight can literally light up an entire room, with 160 lumens of AAA-powered illuminative ferocity is truly a thing to behold. The bright light setting is full yet focused, and so bright that people nearby can read by it with no problem.Headlamps are clearly superior to flashlights any time illumination is required, yet hands need to be kept free, and the LuxoLite design makes it easy to switch between various levels of white light illumination, red light, and SOS flashing mode with easy-to-access switches up on top.Warnings are provided on the packaging, indicating it's important not to look directly into the LED, and also a warning against children using this headlamp without adult supervision---because it really is that bright!This is truly the brightest, best, most versatile headlamp I've yet encountered anywhere.Highly recommended!I received a complementary headlamp in exchange for an honest review.

This is a wonderful serum that helps create a healthy glow.  I used this product together with Elique Naturals Collagen-pm Night Creme over the course of a couple of weeks, and enjoyed the way these two products work together. There is a kind of natural synergy between this anti-wrinkle serum and the hydroxy acid with vitamin E that really works well.I am in my 50's and I have sensitive skin, so I appreciate the all-natural ingredients that Elrique Naturals so consistently utilizes in all of their products I've tried so far. I realized that this serum works best when used together with some kind of moisturizer, and I recommend doing just that, rather than risking experiencing a drying effect which could occur if this product is used only by itself.Wrinkles definitely seem reduced, and my face looks brighter and feels wonderfully recharged after each night's prior application.I received a complementary sample of this product in exchange for an honest review.

This is a marvelous moisturizing restorative cream that goes on smoothly, and leaves my skin feeling renewed and refreshed. I used this product together with Elique Naturals Stem Cell Anti-Aging over the course of a couple of weeks, and enjoyed the way these two products work together. There is a kind of natural synergy between the anti-wrinkle serum and this hydroxy acid with vitamin E.A little goes a long way, and one pump on the applicator is all it takes to get a good sized portion that covers the entire face. I was delighted to find that this is an excellent moisturizer for oily skin with no adverse skin reactions on my (very sensitive) skin.Wrinkles definitely seem reduced, and my face feels wonderfully recharged after each night's prior application.I received a complementary sample of this product in exchange for an honest review.

I haven't been taking this supplement regularly enough to know for sure how effective it can be at appetite suppression and weight loss, but it does seem to be a fully natural supplement that helps regulate feelings of appetite in a safe manner.The mechanism by which Forskolin, aka Coleus forskohlii, works is that it stimulates the production of a molecule called cyclic AMP (cAMP), and cAMP instructs cells in the body to increase an enzyme called hormone sensitive lipase, that burns fat. In a small-scale study of 30 men, it seems that Forskolin helped prevent people from gaining weight, more than losing weight.I certainly noticed no negative effects during the time I've taken it on-again, off-again. I did notice while taking this supplement that my snack-time cravings were reduced, though I didn't notice much weight (but also wasn't taking it regularly). I recommend if you get this supplement, do take it regularly each day for best results--AND, be sure to check with your physician if you're taking medications, to make sure there are no adverse complications.I love the way PCNL provides free ebooks with their supplements, and the way the supplements are made of natural ingredients, and are easy to swallow.I received a complementary review sample of this product in exchange for an honest review.

This is an awesome supplement! First of all, it really is true that these supplements are easy to swallow. This is the 'muscle mass formula,' meaning that it helps improve blood flow in the body, thanks to the way this amino acid converts itself into nitric acid that aids the body by stimulating release of insulin, dilating blood vessels, and getting rid of excess ammonia. This supplement is thus a great pick-me-up that can help keep you active and moving.I didn't notice any abrupt changes with this supplement, but rather a steady overall improvement in energy levels and recovery after workouts and strenuous activity. There's a marvelous improvement in overall feeling of satisfaction and wellbeing with this supplement, that makes it a great boost when handling increased periods of stress in daily life.There is a free ebook available with this product at the Miracle-Molecule website, where a great deal more information is available about the benefits to the body of L-Arginine.Highly recommended!I received this L-Arginine supplement in exchange for an honest review.

This knee sleeve noticeably reduced pain in my right knee when I put it on immediately prior to doing a 90 minute martial arts class. I'd been experiencing a moderate degree of knee pain before putting the sleeve on, and I felt dramatic improvement in pain-free mobility--with no loss of flexibility--within minutes of wearing it. I am truly impressed!The sizing for this product was as I expected, and fit as snugly as need be for excellent results. As advertised, this sleeve is odor-free after wearing, even after having been worn during a strenuous, sweaty workout.I currently don't require a full brace, so this very thin material that fits snugly is just perfect for giving me the flexibility to do the rapid movements required for my martial arts practice with full flexibility and range of motion. Some knee braces are rather restrictive, making it difficult to do correct crane stances and black belt jump kicks easily, for example--but this knee brace is so sturdy yet thin that all knee movements can be made easily.I'm very impressed with the way even after taking the sleeve off, my knee feels wonderful! Some knee braces feel great when they're on, but as soon as they come off, my knee can return to feeling less-than-terrific, but this Copper Action knee sleeve seems to work its magic during the workout in such a way that lasts and lasts!I am glad to see that this knee sleeve is easy to either hand wash or machine wash in cold water, though it really does seem to have antimicrobial properties (with no smell) after the sweatiest workout.

What a treat to read a book about one of the most gifted remote viewers the world has ever known, from the vantage point of a dear friend of his, Raul daSilva. Seldom do biographies capture the true sense and spirit of the depth and breadth of a person as well as this compassionate short memoir manages to do, and I especially love the "little things," such as descriptions of the walks and talks Ingo and Raul frequently enjoyed over the years in New York.This book is a fast read, so it's not overwhelming or exhausting, but instead can be read and reread many times. It's the kind of book that sinks in over time, in which the reader notices upon subsequent readings juicy tidbits and deeper significance of relevant details.Highly recommended for all spiritual and metaphysical seekers, and everyone interested in the subject of remote viewing.

Deepak Chopra writes in "The Future of God", "Faith must be saved for everyone's sake. From faith springs a passion for the eternal, which is even stronger than love. Many of us have lost that passion or have never known it." Chopra's "The Future of God" is a soulful, brilliantly researched, eloquently written response to proponents of material realism and militant atheism.I love the way Deepak explains in pure, simple terms, "You are whatever your faith is." Chopra explains that skepticism is a good first step to exploring and finding our faith, as he points out the important differences between bad faith--which we can identify by the way it opposes spiritual growth. Faith can be either a guide to spiritual growth, or an obstacle. It is possible to consider oneself an atheist and have faith, and it can be possible to have good faith--that improves one's experience of life, or bad faith--which can be recognized by the effect it has in the world. Faith exists in us as the core ideas and beliefs we live by, and these inner beliefs direct and inspire our every thought, word, and action. When we come to know that we ARE our faith, as Deepak points out, "It then becomes vitally important to know good faith from bad."Every generation faces questions of "Who are we?" and "Where did we come from?" In modern times, we find 'postmodern' themes questioning our identity in popular culture and movies, which invite us to more deeply question the connection between who we think we are and what we think we know of reality. Many are struggling with what they consider to be an absence of faith, without noticing that atheism can be viewed as a particular kind of faith. Non-spiritual scientists can be as faith-based as religious believers, to the point that they can suppress thinking and research in directions that don't conform to conventional guidelines. When scientists become close-minded in their beliefs, they can often unknowingly become believers in a faith of scientism--the belief that one day the scientific method will solve all problems. Proponents of scientism can be every bit as arrogant, self-righteous, dogmatic and intolerant as religious fundamentalists, which are indicators alerting us to the presence of bad faith.Chopra points out that while proponents of material realism and militant atheism such as Richard Dawkins, Daniel Dennett, Christoph Hitchens and Sam Harris profess to be voices of logic and reason, their prejudice in discrediting religions and spirituality is evident in their use of such derogatory terms as: 'superstition,' 'false consolation,' 'mind-fogged manacles of servility, 'pseudo-science,' and 'the God delusion.'What Chopra calls for, in order that God may have a future in modern human society is a new way of living spiritually, thanks to a total rethinking of reality. Chopra invites us to realize that, "when you challenge God, you challenge reality itself." "The Future of God" is designed to show you "how to reconnect with God so that he becomes as real as a loaf of bread and as reliable as a sunrise."The heartfelt message of "The Future of God" is that faith can feel like a cry from the heart for each and every one of us. Faith in itself may not deliver God, but it makes God possible for us to feel and know a greater sense of connection, meaning, and purpose in our lives. Ultimately, "The Future of God" is a call to finding the path to God--the nondual God without borders--that is beyond description, words and definition. Chopra apples the same standards to God that are typically applied to reality, and then invites us to walk the path to God first through the material world, then through the subtle world, and finally to the transcendent world of source, oneness and unity. This path to God can seem un-mappable, because these three worlds overlap and because we "walk" them through our inner awareness, rather than any measurable path or road we can clearly chart.Where "The Future of God" truly shines for me is when it describes the wisdom agenda and the proposition that faith--good faith--makes life better. Wisdom in action can be found in the perennial teachings that encourage us to look deeper than the surface of situations, where we can find and know meaning, purpose, and the greatest gifts self-awareness can bring.What I love most about "The Future of God" is the way it shows how each of us can make spirituality a rewarding and beneficial way of life, no matter how skeptical or hopeless we may initially feel. I love how Chopra describes how the spiritual path changes you as you feel less isolated, more connected, service-oriented, safe, balanced, peaceful, and guided. And I love to envision a world filled with people who feel less isolated, more connected, service-oriented, safe, balanced, peaceful, and guided."The Future of God" includes a seven day process of exercises designed to bring comfort with the inner subtle world, and the presence of the transcendent in daily life. Chopra's description of God in the transcendent world applies to consciousness and how it operates as: pure awareness, pure intelligence, pure creativity, infinite potential, unbounded opportunities, bliss, self-organization, infinite correlation, and all matter and energy in a virtual state. Chopra explains that we find God when any of these aspects of the transcendent world begins to expand--and "when you fully remember who you are, you become one with God."Highly recommended!

These socks are warm, comfortable, and provide just the right amount of padding to keep feet in top form for most any adventure. I was looking for athletic style socks that are sturdy enough to stand the test of time in good condition, and I'm very pleased so far with the quality of these socks, which clearly incorporated endurance in the design criteria right from the start.One of the most important qualities I look for in a sports sock is breathability, which these socks provide superbly. Breathability, comfort and fit help prevent skin-related foot injuries, and I consider these socks to be my finest workout and walking socks that go the distance in comfort and style.

These insoles return a set of boots to like-new condition, with a degree of comfort beyond what I'd expected. These are truly first rate insoles, made of such soft sheepskin that each time I put my boots on I luxuriate in the sensation of soft, fluffy bliss. Sheepskin wicks moisture away from the feet, so not only do these insoles feel great right from the first moment you put your boots on, but they stay enjoyably soft, comfortable and dry even after hours of wear. Highly recommended!

My initial fascination with reading David Meltzer's book is his connection with Jerry Maguire, the real-life sports agent featured in the movie by the same name starring Tom Cruise. I loved the scene in the movie in which Jerry Maguire had an epiphany that he shared at his place of work regarding practicing positive ideals in life and daily business dealings. Maguire lost his job and most of his clients for "growing a conscience," yet in real life and in the film, he found a way to succeed while following a higher path.Like Maguire, Meltzer had an epiphany in which he realized it is possible to succeed while helping others and doing good deeds in the world. Success in business does not require that one claw one's way to the top, striving to "win" at all costs. Meltzer shares success tips in a series of short, easy-to-read, down-to-Earth tips demonstrating ways that we can develop effective positive habits.Meltzer repeatedly emphasizes the importance of knowing ourselves and what truly satisfies us deeply in lasting ways, in order that we avoid choosing options that stroke our egos without actually addressing our deeper needs. He shares an example of how he manifested a golf course at a time when he felt a need for being recognized as having a property named as one of the best eight golf courses in the county by Golf Digest, rather than focusing on what he actually desired, which was building a truly spiritual place that many could enjoy.Meltzer's enthusiasm as a salesman comes through brilliantly with his example of how, in less than a minute, he can sell you a plastic pen for a million dollars, even though it appears to be the same pen you can buy at Walmart for 39 cents. I won't reveal the genius behind his sales pitch, other than emphasize his point that when people recognize value, they feel motivated to sign on the dotted line and close a deal.Many of the principles found in CONNECTED TO GOODNESS emphasize spiritual principles found in perennial wisdom traditions, which readers are encouraged to try out and practice in everyday life. Such simple things as remembering to feel and express gratitude every day, and remembering to get and stay connected to goodness can build a solid foundation for every aspect of life.I recommend CONNECTED TO GOODNESS to anyone wondering if there is some other way to succeed than "selling out," taking advantage of people, and ending up feeling empty inside. Like Jerry Maguire, Meltzer is living proof that it is possible to bounce back up after having hit rock bottom, and Meltzer shares the tips he's found most effective at experiencing success while strengthening ethical principles that provide our lives with meaning and purpose.

Higher education is urgently in need of reform, ex-Yale-professor Deresiewicz explains in EXCELLENT SHEEP. America's elite universities, including Yale, Harvard, and Stanford, are no longer the places of inner transformation they once used to be, but instead have become primarily concerned with their school rankings in US News & World Report. Now that universities are as concerned with their ranking as college-bound students have been with SAT scores, rather unfortunate trends toward grade-inflation, and admissions rejection inflation have become the norm.What Deresiewicz points out with clarity and wit is the growing gulf between student needs for genuine growth and discovery and the kind of factory processing that now occurs. A large number of elite university students, graduates, professors and administrative staff mock those who express interest in pursuing something other than the four areas of power majors comprising the majority of elite university courses of: Finance, Consulting, Medicine, and Law. Students at elite universities are so accustomed to running on an academic treadmill prior to university in order to attain the stratospheric GPAs and extra-curriculars required that they continue mindless momentum through college, often missing out on exploring opportunities to richly and deeply explore who they truly are.Deresiewicz suggests that we, collectively as a society, embrace the concept of the Academy as a learning institution dedicated to educate, inspire, and transform, free from the grips of corporatocracy. The specific details are left to readers to decide, as EXCELLENT SHEEP is written as a discussion piece designed to inspire conversations, rather than a cure for one or two specific problems. It seems clear that the problems illustrated in this book have more than one unique cause, such that the surrounding conditions must also be considered when contemplating a cure.I love Deresiewicz's passion and prose in EXCELLENT SHEEP, as well as the way he sounds a clarion call for institutions of true teaching and learning, in which thinking is respected, encouraged, and appreciated in instructors, students, and administrative staff.I recommend EXCELLENT SHEEP for students and parents investigating higher education options, as well as for teachers and academic administrators interested in improving the system of higher education.

What a brilliantly useful and innovative flashlight this is! I love the DE 2600 Flashlight/Charger that is small enough to go everywhere you go, and sturdy enough to last. Measuring almost one inch by 4.5 inches, this device fits neatly in pockets, purses, handbags, backpacks, and glove compartments alike.Don't be misled the words "lipstick style" in the product description; it's black metal case and 5 ounce heft with high-tech styling make it the perfect gift for men as well as women.The two built-in charging ports for USB cable and micro cable are easy to access, and simple to use. Next to those ports is a very small button by which this flashlight can be switched through its various modes (bright, dim, flashing strobe light, and off). The light from this flashlight rivals the best flashlights I've owned, which is remarkable for its small size. The strobe light function is useful for parties (place it in an overhead "disco" ball) and roadside emergencies, and the bright light is bright enough to illuminate large areas.I love how well the charger works, and I appreciate having such a useful device whose batteries are rechargeable, and that can share its battery power with USB devices.The only thing I found slightly unusual was the location and size of the on/off switch, as I've not before had a flashlight that operates by manipulation of such a small button recessed all the way in the back of the light (I need to really press on it with a fingernail to get the button to respond), but this is something I can adjust to. The flashlight beam cannot be "tightened" to various focus lengths, yet it's preset to a focal range that works for both reading something in hand, as well as illuminating the road ahead.I received this flashlight / charger in exchange for an unbiased review.

We tested this water-resistant lantern outdoors in a rainstorm this winter, and it came through like a champ, projecting light beautifully in all directions. The handle of the AYL StarLight lantern is easy to grasp, and it does double-duty for hanging in an easily accessible closet space, ready to leap into service in the event of power failures.This lantern does not come with the three D size batteries required for its operation, which is worth making note of when giving it as a gift, or when expecting to put it to use immediately.This is an easy lantern to learn to operate, since clicking one button moves it through all modes (low, high, flashing strobe, and off).I love the feeling of durability this lantern exudes. It's made of higher quality materials that feel like something that will last for a while and withstand life's occasional knocks, bumps, and falls.My other favorite feature about this flashlight is that it's billed as being able to last for up to six days if need be on one set of batteries--it's very efficient!I received this lantern in exchange for an unbiased review.

This little gem of a book playfully invites readers to "Take a look!" with its luscious cover photographs, and then--what a joyful surprise--there are more gorgeous photos inside! Even more delightful is the way poetry graces the pages accompanying corresponding photographs.This is a book that can be savored by either flipping through randomly, or reading systematically cover to cover. The poetry delves into spiritual territory, gently inviting us to contemplate deeper meaning in every moment. Some poems remind us that we are not alone, and that our family is much bigger than we typically realize. Others invite us to consider a new way of seeing ourselves and others in this world.This book is the perfect gift for the person who 'has everything,' yet can appreciate natural beauty in Nature and the still, quiet voice inside each and every one of us.Highly recommended!

The PERFECT GRILL GLOVES won't catch fire, most likely, because they are made from a blend of Kevlar and Nomex--found in race car driver suits--with cotton lining designed to wick moisture away from hands.These gloves are good for cooking in iron skillets, where the handles get uncomfortable, and this design covering and protecting individual fingers makes for greater cooking comfort.The fit of these gloves is great for me, which I really appreciate, since I have large hands and long fingers. I also love the interchangeability of these gloves (can be worn on either hand), and their ability to withstand heat up to 662 degrees!There is an important manufacturer's warning that these gloves do not handle hot liquids well, which is due to their woven fabric design. They are excellent for handling dry heat, such as may be found changing hot lightbulbs, but care should be taken when worn near hot liquids that might splatter.I received these gloves in exchange for an unbiased review.

These red silicone AYL grill gloves provide moisture and heat-resistance capable of handling most small to medium size jobs. Their ability to protect one's hands from grease splatter is greatly appreciated, as is how easy they are to clean.We got these gloves soon after a family member was burned by hot grease at Thanksgiving, and I am especially pleased to have a set of oven mitts designed to keep hot grease and liquids away. I've found these gloves to be outstanding for most baking and frying jobs.Larger jobs, such as is required for carrying a very hot 24 pound turkey in a roasting pan out of a 500 degree Fahrenheit oven present more of a challenge. These gloves were fine for the few seconds between resting on the oven rack and moving out of the oven door, but weren't quite up to this particular job, so thicker oven mitts were employed in between.The AYL Silicone Grill Gloves take getting used to for putting on and taking off, as they fit a bit tightly in some places, and a little too big in others--but at least they resist spills and splatters, and work wonderfully when used as hot pads.I received these gloves in exchange for an unbiased review.

One Magisterium provides extraordinary insights into the current state of consciousness research presented by Foundations of Mind conference organizer, Seán Ó Nualláin. One Magisterium is an ambitious and complex book that goes beyond merely reporting on some of the most exciting scientific findings to directing our attention toward the importance of establishing a "noetic language" for each dimension of reality that we humans experience. Packed with frequent references to Ó Nualláin's previous writing and the works of many of the world's greatest philosophers and scientists, One Magisterium is a feast of big ideas as they come together in extraordinarily creative new ways at the frontiers of science where physics, philosophy, neuroscience, cognitive science, linguistics and biology intersect.Ó Nualláin is a visionary and academia survivor who makes the salient point that it is time to rethink the "magisterium"--the area of teaching authority to address the way scientific and religious truth have been dichotomized. It's all well and good to separate scientific facts from morality--up until the point that we see society and ecosystems unraveling from the damage from such schizophrenic double-think. Humanity needs a story describing the facts of existence that also includes a sense of morality and meaning. When meaning is divorced from knowledge, terrible things can--and do--occur. At this time when many of the world's finest institutions of higher learning are in danger of being detrimentally influenced by corporate and other types of controlling interests, many destructive category errors are being made as science attempts to cover higher achievements of subjective human experience.Rather than allowing the academy of higher education to continue sliding into various forms of disarray, Ó Nualláin suggests we consider a nobler goal of placing higher education in the care of those we entrust to do more than simply inculcate knowledge, but with those who improve our capacity to learn. Ó Nualláin explains, "Historically, both of these processes have occurred in a religious environment; it is not unfair to say that we have yet to work out how to frame the drive for understanding in a purely secular context." The framework of such a Magisterium thus provides a framework from whence noetic action, morality, and aesthetics reflect a hierarchy of value emanating from a Divine Source.Ó Nualláin calls for a new paradigm with the foundation of what he calls Bionetics, envisioned as being "the study of how we as biological organisms can come to know, including coming to know about the cosmos in the most abstract, mathematical sense." By examining the Mind as manifest in the context of interacting between organism, populations, and species with the environment through space and time, a harmonious creative fusion becomes possible. Who we are and how we connect with and communicate with other aspects of creation is becoming such an important matter that its study deserves better care than to be caught amidst the pointless battles between evolutionists and creationists, for example.There is sheer genius evident in One Magisterium's premise that the time has arrived for us to take heed of all we have learned and recognize the importance of levels of being; humanity's future depends on it.

It's not your fault if you've been religiously following long-established dietary and exercise regimens, only to find yourself gaining weight and body fat each year, no matter what you do. According to diet and fitness coach Mike Sheridan, lots of baby boomers have been unknowingly suffering from trusting the advice they were taught as children. As it turns out, eating according to the food pyramid can lead to increased fat, weight, and inflammation, which in turn can contribute to a number of unnecessary and debilitating diseases.Mike Sheridan's "Live It, Not Diet!" plan is designed to reset your habits, while you slowly but surely make progress toward a diet in keeping with its long-term strategy. This plan requires your involvement--because only you know what foods you are and aren't allergic to. I love how Sheridan provides marvelous guidance that can help you avoid making such common mistakes such as over-eating nut grains that your body is not designed to digest, and I respect the way more participation is required by the reader than simply following recipes included in the text.I love Sheridan's inclusion of a "Feast Day" that helps make it possible to actually make progress in moving toward a diet devoid of all junk and fast food whatsoever. Few of us are saints when it comes to following the diets we know are best for us, so it really does help to know we're not quitting all our favorite snacks cold turkey just yet."Live It, Not Diet!" is so packed with technical facts and information that it took me weeks to read, and it's one of those books I want to keep handy after reading so I can revisit sections later when more associated pieces of the plan suddenly make sense in delightful "Aha!" moments.

Is it possible that much of the American serious health crisis can be attributed to out-dated advice about diet and exercise? Nutrition and fitness expert Mike Sheridan explains that not only is this possible, but he can show you exactly how and why our commonly accepted views need to change.The cover photo and title of "Eat Meat and Stop Jogging" can act as a bellwether to quickly sort out believers from the open-minded, serving to open conversations with people whose beliefs aren't so fixed that they're unable to think about facts they might find disturbing.I love this book with the contentious title that shares results from cutting-edge studies showing such facts as meat-eating women live 32% longer. This kind of fact is not common knowledge in my west coast college town that is famous for the quantity and quality of its vegetarian cuisine--which leaves me wondering why such information is not yet popularly understood.Sheridan debunks dozens of myths that are currently damaging peoples' health, citing numerous scientific studies that explain such things as the dangers of calorie restriction, and the hazards of reliance upon toxic substances such as soy as a dominant protein source.With regard to 'jogging,' Sheridan describes the benefits of building up muscles through shorter, more intense workouts, rather than through aerobic training, which must increase in intensity and duration in order for people to experience continuing benefits.Sheridan notes that "... the biggest issue with moderate-to-high intensity aerobic exercise is that it results in an overabundance of free radicals," citing research showing how problems arise associated with extremely high long (2 hour), or extremely frequent runs or aerobic exercise sessions.Much of what Sheridan reports is information I've seen corroborated by independent researchers such as Dr. Beverly Rubik, so I can attest to the cutting-edge nature of the content in this book, and give it my highest recommendation.

"Dying to Know You" is a beautifully written, easy-to-read guide to the near-death experience that is highly recommended for anyone curious about death and the near-death experience. This book includes numerous noteworthy near-death experiences, presented by three-time near-death experiencer and near-death experience researcher and expert, PMH Atwater. There's a delicious simplicity in this elegant overview of life, death, and the near-death experience fueled by Atwater's quest to discover what we can learn from those who have experienced death for minutes, hours, or days--and come back transformed by their experiences.Atwater explains that there are two equally significant aspects to every near-death experience: the experience, and the aftereffects. The near-death experience might feel like arriving in Heaven, or it might feel deeply unsettling and more like visiting Hell... but regardless of how joyful or upsetting the experience, adult and child experiencers report going to places where they resonate energetically, based on vibratory frequency. The near-death experience after-effects include physical and psychological changes including such things as: light and sound sensitivity, comfort with silence, highly intuitive, vivid dreams, acutely aware of injustice, magnetically attractive to animals and birds, electrical sensitive, sensitive to pharmaceuticals, lowered blood pressure, smarter, sensitive to smells, allergies, affinity with Nature, more loving, wakes up around 3 or 4 am. While the near-death experience is typically over within minutes, hours, or days, the aftereffects can go on for years, decades, or the rest of the experiencer's life.My favorite part of this book is the section summarizing "Children's Version of the Big Picture," which includes such gems as, "God exists. It doesn't matter what God is called, God is still God. And we are each part of God, always. We only think we can be separated from God. Really, we can't." The rest of this section is written just as simply and down-to-Earth as this, so any child can understand it--which makes a whole lot of sense, since it was written by a near-death experiencer and researcher who has spoken with thousands of near-death experiencing children. There is another summary section for adults, but the children's version was absolutely my favorite, which might be due to the fact that I am a childhood near-death experiencer myself.I love the brevity, clarity, heart-centeredness and intensity of Dying to Know You. This is a small book that succeeds at packing a lot of light and love into a few pages, brilliantly conveying the quintessential perennial wisdom transforming the lives of millions of near-death experiencers worldwide. Highly recommended!

I love this Carbon Skincare serum! I've been applying this product twice daily for a couple of weeks now, and am truly amazed at what a difference in hydration it makes for my skin. I love how this product is 100% organic and free from the dyes and extra chemical additives that my skin abhores, so all I experience are the wonderfully pleasing results from this very pure 1% Hyaluronic Acid solution.In just a few days of twice daily use, I saw tremendous improvement in my face, which looked beautifully radiant and fresh.This serum is applied with a pump applicator atop the beautiful blue bottle, and I found that one squirt of serum covered by entire face, with two providing enough to cover my face, neck, and upper decolletage. The serum feels a bit thick, reminding me a bit of natural aloe vera plant extract, with a scent so subtle I barely noticed it, and dries leaving little sign it is there.I found it helpful to apply this serum while my skin was still damp from cleansing, since apparently the extra water makes a difference in ensuring full hydration. I also applied a moisturizer afterward at night, and a sunscreen by day, and found the results to be absolutely excellent.I highly recommend this serum to anyone who has chemically-sensitive skin, as I do, since it is 100% natural, in accordance with the quality that Carbon Skincare is known for.This review was written based on a complementary product sample I received in exchange for an honest review.

What a joy it is to use this facial peel! I'm relatively new to facial peels, and greatly appreciate how easy it is to apply this product to my skin with the squeeze dropper. I could see visibly fresher skin immediately after using this lactic acid face peel, with much softer skin and a noticeable reduction in fine lines. There is a lovely radiance to my face after using this peel, and the glow lasts for days!I appreciate how this product is gentle enough to use regularly, with no irritation to my skin whatsoever. This facial peel is a wonderful part of my regular skin care regimen, and I highly recommend it to anyone interested in such an easy-to-use, effective product!This review was written based on a complementary product sample I received in exchange for an honest review.

I tried a friend's Barmah hat, and when I discovered it instantly felt like it belonged on my head in a way I've never before experienced with any other hat I've tried or owned, I ordered my own. I took a chance on ordering a slightly different style of Barmah hat than the one I tried, based on the photo, and I'm so glad I chose this one.What a joy this hat is to wear! It's without a doubt the best all-around all-weather hat I've yet owned. I ordered my hat in Autumn, and have now had the pleasure of wearing it in all kinds of weather. I've worn it on sunny days, misty days, windy days, rainy days, and foggy days--and in every kind of weather condition, this hat performs like a champ. Moisture seems to run right off it, without it getting the least bit soggy or losing its beautiful shape.I love to wear this hat when out on a long walk, or when puttering in the garden. The brim is an optimal size for providing protection from the sun and elements, and the fit is perfectly snug so even without a drawstring, this hat stays on my head when gusts of wind take me by surprise.I've never before had a hat that fit my head so well, nor one that did such an outstanding job of fitting snugly without messing up my hair or making an impression on my forehead as this hat.

I enjoy taking Omega-3 vitamin supplements, which I find are helpful for my heart, joint strength and mobility, and cognitive functioning--but this is the first Omega-3 supplement I've yet seen that is sourced from wild-caught fish that have been processed in such a way to remove heavy metals, dioxins, and PCBs.Such care has gone into creating these NutriGold Omega-3 supplements that they not only meet but actually exceed the international fish oil standards for purity, potency and freshness. These capsules are free from GMOs, fillers, binders, artificial ingredients, Stearates, Laurates, Sulfates, Dioxides, egg, gluten, milk, peanut and shellfish.These are definitely the highest quality Omega-3 supplements I've ever tried--and in a powerfully potent 750 mg dose of the essential EPA and DHA fatty acids in every capsule. And best of all, there is absolutely no fishy taste or after-taste! Just pure fish oil goodness.I received a complimentary sample of this product in exchange for this honest review.

It's been said "a rising tide lifts all boats," and that's the uplifting sense I got while reading Miriam Knight and Julie Clayton's marvelous anthology of inspirational short autobiographical essays. This is the perfect book for anyone experiencing or contemplating experiencing life-changing transformations in their lives, who is feeling somewhat skeptical. Healthy skepticism is a wonderful tool for rational comprehension, and while it's perfectly natural to balk at some of the more extraordinary experiences reported by those interviewed in this book, their established qualifications as scientists, medical doctors, and well-respected professionals bolster their credibility.I loved reading about Dr. Larry Dossey's knowledge of medical events before they unfolded in spontaneously precognitive dreams, and how he struggled to make sense of how he could possibly be accessing information that "violated common sense and every ounce of my medical training." Receipt of such non-local information challenged Dossey to make sense of these experiences, and inspired him to study and write about nonlocal mind.I loved physicist Peter Russell's insight that "the people who were really interested in consciousness were the people who looked at consciousness firsthand." As a lifelong meditator, Russell recognized the unique insights possible on a personal level that spiritual adepts, yogis, and mystics knew, and that somehow evaded attempts by neurologists with electrodes placed near peoples' brains to know what is really going on. Russell noticed that "all the problems we were facing--from personal to social to ecological problems--all come back to human consciousness one way or another." Thanks to his personal meditative practice, Russell know understands that consciousness is always there, is the one thing none of us can doubt, and appears to be the true nature of the universe.Many other authors including: Anita Moorjani, Cyndi Dale, Bernie Siegel, Gregg Braden, Eva Herr, Foster Gamble, Georgina Cannon, Jack Rourke, Julia Assante, Kingsley Dennis, Meg Blackburn Losey, Penney Peirce, Paul Chappell and Paul Von Ward share their personal stories, messages, and insights in this delightful book. Since each chapter is just a few pages long, this book is a quick read, like a Reader's Digest of Conscious Experiences designed for easy reading on the bus or train, at the beach, or in a waiting room.At the dawn of this new Quantum Age when the word "consciousness" is increasingly becoming more popular, if not better understood, "What Wags the World" is a welcome beacon of light held by dozens of those who encourage us to dip our toes into the water of mindful awareness. Jump right in, the water's fine!

There's something magical about the healing quality of this rejuvenating serum, that must have something to do with the combination of Vitamins C and E with Jojoba. Coincidentally, at the exact time I was starting my trial of this product, I received two accidental facial abrasions. I decided to go ahead with my product trial anyway, and I'm so glad I did! Rather than endure the typical slow healing cycle of waiting to see facial cuts scabbing and possibly leaving scars, I witnessed a most remarkable high-speed healing of these minor facial lacerations. Mind you, this product is not advertised as a healing serum, so I tried it cautiously at first, waiting to see if any negative reaction would occur--but to my surprise, not only was there no negative reaction, but the fastest healing I've yet seen for any facial injuries.This serum is easily applied with the dropper, which I found to be the perfect applicator. Only a few small drops go a long way, and I enjoyed using the dropper applicator both as a dropper and also as a spreading applicator, using it to smooth the extremely fluid serum quickly in the areas I wish it to be applied before it has a chance to run or drip off the face.I enjoyed good results with this serum both when applied after washing my face with cold water and cleanser and just leaving the serum as is, and also when applying a follow-up moisturizing lotion afterward. It's a credit to the quality of this serum that it doesn't seem to require a moisturizer afterward, and can stand on its own.After several weeks of using this serum, I couldn't be happier with the results! Wrinkles and fine lines are diminished, my skin is visibly brighter, and as mentioned earlier, any incidental cuts and abrasions healed amazingly fast, with no signs they were ever there.Highly recommended!I wrote this review for a complimentary review bottle of this serum I received in exchange for my honest review.

This Super C Serum does a super job repairing sun-damaged and mature skin. I noticed that even during a time when I was increasing my sun exposure as I tried this product out (which I received in exchange for a fair review), wrinkles and blemishes didn't get a chance to get worse. Ideally, I do my best to minimize and avoid sun exposure, but this summer that wasn't an option, so I was very grateful my trial of Super C Serum coincided with added solar exposure, so my face and neck looked progressively smoother, brighter, and clearer week after week.I have sensitive skin and am unable to wear many name brand products, but thanks to the excellent ingredients utilized in this serum, I had no issues whatsoever, even when regularly applying the product twice a day for over a month.This Super C Serum goes on smoothly, but it is surprisingly thick compared to other serums. It has a strong, tangy, lemony scent which is due to the ingredients, and I began to find it pleasant and relaxing as I associated it with my twice daily facial treatments. Because this serum is so thick, I initially applied much more than necessary, which I corrected as I became familiar with just how small an application truly provides excellent results.Highly recommended!

Andrew Cusick takes readers on a tour of the world, savoring the ups, downs, and oddities of experiencing his WWOOFing (World Wide Opportunities on Organic Farms) and youth hostel adventures through Australia, New Zealand, Fiji, and Los Angeles. What makes this young man's journal so riveting for me is the unique way he weaves nitty-gritty personal experiences into and around global issues that can so often feel overwhelming.Cusick's twenty months of traveling the world combined with the keen acuity of perception gifted him thanks to qigong and meditative practices provide him with a writer's voice that is simultaneously unpretentious, yet very wise. Andy was away from his comfortable life in Scotland long enough to make friends, fall in love, and experience very different ways of living in different social and environmental climes... and come to a deeper appreciation of how we can all help to save the world without feeling too guilty, resentful, or judgmental along the way.The first two thirds of "Take the Red Pill" feels like reading a friend's travel diary. Written in journal diary format, it's interspersed with short informational sections summarizing interconnected facts about economics, ecology, global warming, aboriginal thinking, spirituality, and philosophy. The factual sections are written in much the same journalistic style of writing as the personal diary entries, and are short and packed with interesting charts and graphics. The last third of the book delves more fully into the author's philosophical point of view, and provides the reader with a kind of Reader's Digest encyclopedia of how and why we can change our way of thinking. Cusick reassures readers that we need not fall into the trap of ecoparalysis, since inaction is not the solution now. Inner awareness is absolutely essential, as is the understanding that we are inextricably interconnected with everything "out there" in the world.I especially love the inclusion of the eastern concept of Sunyata, with the notion of reality being comprised of much more than thinking things must either be true or false--since actually, most things really fall into two other categories: not-true-not-false, and true-and-false.This is a book that encourages you to FEEL its intent while you think your way through its concepts, and it does an outstanding job of reminding readers of their heart, spirit, and physicality... and the importance of being authentic, integrated, and real. Highly recommended!
