The way this started out I thought this was going to be just smexy times, but when the pair get caught up in the curse things get a bit more interesting.Amanda Bonilla - Waerd Awakenings - I liked this alot despite the instalove. Some how it worked because of a symbiotic mental connection that add an emotional intensity to the pair's meeting and hook up. There was also enough of the world built that I wouldn't mind more from Bonilla.

Wounded warriors are at the heart of this series, the Lost and Found agency is populated with vets who paid a physical price while serving their country. There isn't much in the way of detecting going on in this episode, which has a quiet scarred hero who suffers from traumatic the after effects of traumatic brain injury and has speech issues as well. But his heroine sees beyond the scars, even as she had to convince him that she sees the strong noble sexy man behind those scars.I really enjoyed this both of the leads were wonderful and the story was sexy and satisfying -even if the time period was really short for the I love yous and HEA. This still worked for me because the characters just felt like they meshed so well and since I read a lot of fantastical Romance, my ability to suspend disbelief is pretty good.One thing that is also interesting about this series is that the author touches upon issues faced by our returning service persons and the information is eye opening.Bottom line is that I enjoyed this quick romance - which works fine as a standalone but definitely will have me pulling the previous book off the pile.

This was okay. I like the trope of finally getting the chance to with the man I'd you're long ago dreams, and I like firefighters - they're a go to non supernatural hero favorite for me - but this pretty much just went through the numbers for me and since this was a Bliss imprint there's no steamy payoff either.

3.5 stars - Socially impaired Annie Catrel is a Wiz at repairing the social media image of the rich and famous and in her secret online life she is the famous blogger Socialmedialite poking fun at the pretentious and fashion challenged using her sparkling wit. Bad boy and suspended Irish rugby star is her most recent blog target and her newest image doctoring project and the sexy pushy Ronan - who somehow sees Annie behind her protective camouflage - is suddenly making it hard for Annie to live her anonymous real life.The characters in this were just great- with author Reid writing the brilliant but damaged Annie and author Coswell the gorgeous foul mouthed Ronan, who has his own issues. And I really liked  everything about the Hooker and the Hermit except for the actual sex scenes. Ronan's kink just didn't work for me - especially seat belts used in bondage? No. Just no. I didn't realize this was dom/sub themed, which is really just not my cup of tea. And in some ways I just couldn't see how that type of  relationship would work for Annie who had such a need for control in her life.But everything else worked for me.  The great use of Annie's blog, the way that Annie and her boss managed Ronan's ex, Annie's creative cussing, Annie's online pal, all the great back and forth between Ronan and Annie, and Ronan himself - on the whole he matures nicely over the course of the story.So bottom line? A bit of a mixed read for me (I didn't know what I was getting into, even so, it dropped this a star for me) but I did think that the collaboration between the co-authors worked well.

Holly Fawkes, whose family has been outed after years of hiding from the Sentinels, is sent to wolf alpha, Lannie, whose talent is turning outsiders into pack. But Holly is furious about being dragged from the life and business she'd built for herself and has no desire to acknowledge her Sentinel otherself.I really liked Alpha Rising. Both of the leads were strong: Holly, railing against the loss of her old life, yet stepping up when she's the only one who can fight the evil invading the area around Lannie's property, and Lannie with his quite strength, who gives so much of himself that he fears there won't be anything left, but still does it because of his innate Alpha need to protect his pack -I really loved Lannie, he's one of the best kinds of heroes.Alpha Rising was one of my favorites in this series which I've been following since 2009. This series has only improved over time, the bad guys aren't as over the top (or as cheesy as they've been on occasion), the 'initiation' piece was handled better, and there are good conflicts on the way to the romantic HEA and in the background plot. Plus, there's a nice cameo for the previous starring pair, Regan and Kai, (which included a reunion between Holly and her brother Kai) and there's a nice little set of supporting characters in Lannie's pack as well.So all in all Alpha Rising was a very satisfying trek back to the world of Durgan's Sentinels -I'll be keeping an eye out for more.ARC via Netgalley -Release date 2/1/15

I really like this series, after four books I've really settled into the universe and Alex has made connections and settled into a much less lonely life. Of course since things are going so smoothly is time for his past to come back and demand payment for his sins.This episode was especially action packed and we finally get to see what really happened to Alex, Shareem and Rachel in their dark apprentice days. All of that was very interesting and the making of Dellio explorer need so much. Plus Alex's struggles to be a better person make me love him more as a charcater and Arachne's advice to him when he questions his choices are a nice wrap up. I finished this and immediatelt went and spent a credit on the next book (this is a big deal because I am a credit boarder and normally wait for the sales.)So Chosen was another great story and Gildart Jackson again does a great job of bringing Alex Verus' world to life

The kidnapping of his unacknowledged mate, Shay, just adds to all that Knight McQueen and his people have suffered at the hands of the psycho hybrid sisters, and he will do whatever is necessary to get Shay back. But even as Shay is almost forced to the brink of madness with her wolf time approaching and her captors refusing to allow her to shift, Shay uncovers more of the truth about the Magus' role in the hybrid's creation and struggles to get herself free and back to Knight.I still really like the idea of the white, black and gray wolves and I still really love the McQueen brother's chess inspired names: Rook, Knight and Bishop. I came into this story having read the first book and not the second, by this still worked for me.The final McQueen brother's story was well done and everything in the series - the threat to the packs and Brynn's vision that kicked off the first book - wrapped up satisfactorily, and with a a nice HEA for all the brothers and their mates. Both Knight and Shay had some pretty traumatic things happen to them over the course of the series and the author actually had them work through them instead of glossing things over. The past starting couples get some good screen time as well.There are a couple odd moments in the leadup to the physical part of the relationship because Shay's wolf is the dominant wolf alpha and Knight's is the white wolf empath - it feels gender role reverse-y here when Knight hasn't really felt 'less' in before and his special power makes him important to the pack.Still that was a nit and I enjoyed the two books that I read, and still plan to go back and read Bishop's book at some point.Complementary copy  Via Netgalley

Quick little friends to lovers romance. Kate and Aaron have a 14 year foundation for their best-friend-ship, which helps to make this work when they take it to the next level. I love friends to lovers.

A giant monster heading to destroy Tokyo, and a giant robot in need of a gravity spiker. The enemy of my enemy is my friend, so  Joe Sullivan  (son of Jake ) is called to help the Imperium now lead by Toru Tokigawa.I was happy to get to revisit the universe of the Grimnoir Chronicles, I just finished chomping my way though the trilogy and was going through withdrawals.  It was a bit odd to have Jake's son in the lead, but this was satisfactorily action packed.Even though I can't imagine where Correia could take us next, Tokyo Raider gives me hope for Grimnoir the next generation.

3 stars- not bad, just ok. I really wanted to like this more than I did, I like the idea of fairytale characters being transported into this world and having an agency that polices them. And maybe I would have liked it more if I hadn't read a few other stories from other series that made better use of of the fairytale foundation - and if I'd have been able to connect just a bit better to the characters. I would have also liked it if the characters' original fairytales had been a bit more integral to the stories or had inspired their personalities - instead every introduction of a new one felt like cutesy name dropping.I might have also been a little bit better off if leading lady Red had worked better for me. I am exceedingly charactercentric and for UF-y stories like this I really need to like the protagonist. Red with her brashness and lack of anger management skills - plus the fact that more than half of the male characters were in love with her -  was just a bit too generic. Add to that the fact that there were a couple times when events in the story should have had lasting emotional fallout for Red that she quickly leaves behind and this results in her feeling a bit flat as a character as well.I did finish this, but I actually set it aside a couple times to read other things in between. Don't know if I'll pick up anymore of these.

There's sort of a Romeo and Juliet trope in this short. Zachary's an shape shifting lion Ameveo who has sworn to kill the Caedo - members of her family. And Annabelle is fleeing her cultlike family, who suspect her dreams have been tainted by an Amoveo and the kill anyone who had anything to do with the Amoveo.Much of the connection between the pair is through the Amoveo shared mate dreams. With the big secret of her heritage between them, which is a pretty decent conflict, this really could have been a much longer story. But she's sweet and he's smitten, so I just went with it.

I am so sorry to have finished this trilogy, but the ending was epic. I love the characters and am going to have a hard time leaving them behind. My timing for reading this series couldn't have been more perfect though, since there are two little audio shorts to ease my withdrawal pains. And the one with a member of the next generation gives me hope that maybe we'll get a little more from this fabulous world that is a mash up of alternate history, magic, sci if, and detective noir, wrapped up in some unexpected heroes and made even more awesome by the vocal stylings of the amazing Bronson Pinchot.I'll be keeping an eye out for more by him and author Correia - together and separately.

I was pleasantly surprised by A Hint of Frost which came off the dusty part of my TBR pile as part of one of my 2015 challenges . One reason it's been there for so long it's that I was under the impression that the Aranae were spider people and truthfully that didn't sound all that appealing. They actually do have silk spinnerets on their fingertips and most have a venomous bite both of which play a part in life bonding and courtship, but no multiple eyes of legs -phew.I thought that the world was well done and I liked both the leads, Lourdes and  Rhys, the warrior she must wed to get miltary aid from his mercenary tribe in order to protect her people when her former guards turn treasonous.  The story is sort of a fantasy romance but there is enough going on in the background to hold off the consummation until the end.I did have minor nits with Lourdes, who is the new matrirach to her people, insisting on rushing into danger. And I was sad about the fate of the leading couple from the prequel novella Heart of Ice.Still I liked it enough that I will be continuing with the rest of the series.
I think that License to Date was my favorite of the books in the series so far. This was short but it still writes worked for me.  The bartender/concierge leading man Paul was sigh-worthy:)

We're relative newcomers to the world of aromatherapy and are really enjoying the endeavor. We now have a couple of diffusers in order to enjoy the vapors in different parts of our house, and were pleased to add this Apriller ultrasonic device. It looks just like the product photo, and the small pictures on the left show you all the variety of colors the internal light will cycle through -- or which you can select individually if you like. You can also turn the light off if you plan to use this while sleeping, for instance.The diffuser comes with a little plastic jug with which to fill the device -- a nice touch. If you're new to this kind of appliance, one thing to remember is that you shouldn't tip it while you twist the top off to refill with water or add more essential oil drops. You don't want to spill, or get water into the lower electrical compartment. So hold it down by the base with one hand, on your counter-top or wherever you have it, and gently twist the top, then lift. There are small arrows on the top and bottom which you can line up to make it easy. There are two buttons which do a variety of things, but you can think of them as the light button on the left, and the power button on the right. A quick push does one thing, a "hold down push," another. When you push this power button briefly after the machine is on, it will cycle through 4 different time settings: 1 hr, 2 hrs, 4 hrs, and simply "on." You'll notice little lights behind the plastic for each interval, although you have to look for them and may not see them at first.A couple of warnings: as with all such diffusers, they tend to splash a little -- both when you're filling, and then, if you turn it on without the top yet attached to the base. Best not to put it on a wooden table that can be water damaged. If you want this on a night table by the bed, and it's wood, you will want to put the diffuser on a plate or tray.We generally open the top and use the little supplied jug to fill the diffuser tank (two jugs full) with filtered water. Then we take a bottle of essential oil (like this one Good Night Essential Oil Blend 10ml (Comparable to Doterra Serenity Calming Blend and Young Living Peace & Calming Blend) 100% Natural Pure and Undiluted Premium Quality for Aromatherapy and Scents) and tap in anywhere from 3 to 6 drops of the essence. Put the diffuser top back on (line up the arrows and give a little twist). Turn the unit on. We like to use the straight "on" setting, not the timed intervals. The other button (left) will let you set the internal light to cycle through all the colors of the spectrum -- or you can quick push it to 1) hold whatever light color and intensity are on at the instant, and 2) cycle through each color on bright or dim mode, or 3) turn the light function off.The Apriller product is a useful and versatile essential oil diffuser. We've been running it daily for a month and it does a consistently good job.Recommended!

This bag provides a convenient way to protect your laptop or tablet. There's the main bag which fits our HP notebook perfectly -- it is 13" wide by 9" (see photo). The bag would not fit our larger Toshiba laptop, so you'll want to measure carefully if you need a particular product to go inside. The bag is well made, with attention to detail. There's another smaller pouch included with your $30 purchase. You could use this for a number of purposes, and we use it to carry the charger/AC adapter, so the wires and plug don't scratch the notebook itself.The bag has casual good looks, and you'd look good carrying this to a meeting at a client's office, or to class at your college.We live in a wilderness area and do most of our shopping online, purchasing thousands of products and writing many reviews. Sometimes we get offered products at a discount or free in return for trying them out. This is one of those.Recommended!

This comes from the female side of the family. We live in a wilderness area and do a lot of shopping online, so we buy  thousands of products this way and write a lot of reviews. Sometimes we get offered free products, including from Amazon, in exchange for an honest assessment. That said, I'd think carefully before I bought this product, because at nearly $80, it is not inexpensive. For that price, it had better work. My experiences is that it does and I'm happy with it!I've now been using this Beauty & Truth Erase/Repair product for a month and I'm impressed. I'm in my early 60s, so just entering the "3rd Act" of life, and somewhat dismayed by the increasing wrinkles and face lines. I'm not overly vain, but I've always had nice moist skin, and I've taken care of it. I often get compliments on how plump my facial skin is and how youthful I look. BUT I haven't felt much like it in the last couple of years.So I welcomed the opportunity to try this Anti-Aging cream. First, I'm a fan of Hyaluronic Acid. This is a component of all healthy bodies, especially your skin and cartilage and other connective tissue. It is also a scavenger of damaging free radicals, a good thing in an anti-aging product. It is known to promote healing of skin and is a component of some treatments for skin infections. It will help slough off any dry or damaged skin. Another reviewer felt a tingling in her skin and didn't like it. However, this is simply Hyaluronic Acid ("HA") at work. Some sensation in the skin of the face and neck is a normal and even necessary thing.I have found that you can't apply this product and then put a moisturizer over it -- the moisturizer will tend to bead up. I apply about a pea-size amount to my neck and face morning and evening, and the back of my hands which have some sun/age damage as well. That's enough to get an even coat. I wipe it on my neck upwards, and then on my face the same way. When worried about wrinkles, you don't want to give gravity any unnecessary help! I find that my skin is moisturized sufficiently with this cream.After a month, I notice a lessening of wrinkles, lines seem softer, and the skin itself looks healthier. My husband and friends have noticed a more youthful glow and look as well.I would be happier if I knew all the ingredients were organic and non-chemical, but many of them are unknown to me. Digging deeper into the list, I find good things including shea butter, vitamin E and vegetable collagen. From what I can discover, most of the other ingredients are blenders and binders -- things that make the main ingredients form a fine cream, and keep them from separating.Bottom line -- I am enjoying the results I see in the mirror.Recommended!

We live in a wilderness area and buy thousands of products online. We count on reviews, so we write them as well. We have written thousands of reviews and sometimes we get offered samples at a discount or free in order to test them. This is one of those.Muscle Relief essentially provides a blend of ingredients that have some common elements with liniment. You could blend with an oil and rub it on, but we use it in our vaporizers. A good one is Apriller @ 300ml Ultrasonic Aromatherapy Essential Oil Diffuser: Up to 10 Hours,4 Timer Settings,7 Color Changing Light, Automated Mist Timer, 1-year Warranty which we also bought on Amazon.Prime Cosmetics produces a number of high quality, organic, pure essential oils that compare favorably to much more expensive blends. We've tried over a period of time and recommend Breathe Essential Oil Blend 10ml (Comparable to Doterra Breathe Respiratory Blend and Young Living Raven Essential Oil) 100% Natural Pure and Undiluted Premium Quality for Aromatherapy and Scents, Thief Essential Oil Blend 10ml (Our Version Of Thieves Essential Oil By Young Living & On Guard Essential Oil By Doterra) 100% Natural Pure and Undiluted Premium Quality for Aromatherapy and Scents, and Good Night Essential Oil Blend 10ml (Comparable to Doterra Serenity Calming Blend and Young Living Peace & Calming Blend) 100% Natural Pure and Undiluted Premium Quality for Aromatherapy and Scents.Recommended.

From the male side of the family -- this worked great for my older Ford F150 truck. I wanted to mount the spare tire in the pickup bed (on the frame, against the cab window). I had to drill a few holes in the sheet-metal, and work things around a bit to get it to fit. I was able to bolt it down firmly and get the tire and rim bolted on.The carrier is strongly made and works well. You might have to do a little finagling to get it to fit your vehicle.Recommended!

This is well made and a lot of fun! This is a combo of badminton and paddle-ball. Everything you need is in the package. The paddles are well made, as are the birdies or shuttlecocks -- a lot of value for under 10 bucks. We are a couple in our 60s, but that doesn't mean we're not in good shape and don't enjoy a game that improves hand-eye coordination. Our family room area is big enough to play -- with the slower birdie. There are two of them -- one that floats more, and the other that zooms faster. We can also step outside and enjoy a half hour of fun and conversation. In addition, we have kids and grandkids who come to visit and we always like to have several activities like this to help entertain.Recommended!

The Otterbox Symmetry series is attractive -- and eminently practical! This iPhone case is sleek. It feels tough and super lightweight in the hand. There's a built-in clear window for your camera. It provides both "button on button" for some functions, or cutaways in the molded form to access the various ports.I won't comment on the color so much, as there are many choices on the product page.What you really want, if you're like us, is something that gives ample protection to your expensive phone, while not detracting from the looks -- especially when you have a pocket device as large as the new iPhone 6 series. Meticulous planning went into this, There's a raised edge to protect your touch screen from scrapes, and advanced internal material that acts as a cushion and shock-absorber (for those -- shall we say inevitable?- drops). The tough exterior one-piece is polycarbon -- wipe-able both in and out.Recommended!

Let me begin by saying that I'm a Burberry Fan. Burberry London cologne is my "go to" fragrance. They describe it as "oriental," but I think that's the exotic floral top notes. It's not overpowering, and yet has a distinct fragrance -- high, middle and low notes. It's masculine, and all there, without the nose-knockout of some colognes. In fact, my wife won't let me wear anything else without protest!So I welcomed the opportunity to test this Weekend "eau de toilette" -- meaning, a fragrance that is not as strong as cologne. In fact, the literal translation from the French is awful: toilet water. Yeeech! Of course, that's not what it means. It's just an old fashion way to say "men's light perfume." And it is French-made, like many great perfumes and colognes.As you'd expect, "Weekend" it is a casual, lighter fragrance. There are top citrussy notes, quite sweet, and the man of the family is not a huge fan of many lemon-heavy fragrances. However, after only a few minutes, the fresh lemon, grapefruit and sweet tangerine fade somewhat into the appealing mid-and lower-notes. We can't do better than quote Burberry's own description: "heart notes of oak moss, ivy leaves and sandalwood. A radiant warmth of honey, amber and musk composes the base notes in this elegant, luminous scent." Luscious!What we both admire about Burberry (the man who wears it and the woman who must inhale it) is that the perfumiers manage to create floral scents that are always masculine and virile at the same time. A note to my younger friends just switching from drug store scents to real cologne: don't drench yourself in it. Less is more! Use something else for deodorant -- hopefully something that does not compete (even unscented), and certainly for your health, something that does not have pore-clogging aluminum in it. Then, with a well made fine mist sprayer like this, aim one full spray and one only on the chest/base of throat. That's it!One more thing: Burberry also manages the important job of presentation -- the bottle, top and packaging are as attractive and casually elegant as the fragrance itself.Recommended!

This is a useful cooking thermometer, both for stove-top and oven cooking. Knowing the internal temperature of something you're cooking, from meat to candy to a frozen entree you're reheating, is not only useful, it protects your health. A word of caution by the way -- I contacted Chef Rimer and got this information. Do NOT leave the thermometer in the oven while cooking! You'll roast it as well. You simply insert it, get your reading, and remove it again. There are 3 buttons -- on/off, selection of F or C scales, and "hold." This one, we couldn't figure out: why do you want to "hold" the reading? Chef Rimer explained: you may not want to put your face too close to the heat. So you insert the probe into whatever you're cooking, allow time for it to heat up so you get an accurate reading, and then press the hold button. Extract the probe, bring the unit out where you can see it clearly, and there you go.The range this digital thermometer measures goes far beyond anything you'll ever likely to need. We compared it to a similar one we purchased, and then, to the oven readings on our new range, and it is accurate.We live in a rural area and do most of our shopping online. We count on honest reviews and write hundreds ourselves. Sometimes we get offered products at a discount or free in exchange for trying them out and reviewing. This is one of those.Recommended.

We live in a wilderness area and do most of our shopping online. We buy thousands of products from Amazon and always read the reviews, so we've written hundreds ourselves. Sometimes we get offered samples at a discount or free in exchange for testing and review, and this is one of those.This 10-pack of emergency mylar "blankets" or body pouches is a good deal at just over $1 each. This is a "prepper" item -- something you carry for emergencies, but hopefully will never have to use. We split up the 10-pack, put some with our camping gear, and 6 in our vehicle. If, heaven forbid, we were ever in an accident -- or came across others in that situation -- we're ready to help. Same while hiking. If someone fell or was injured, or somehow got stranded, a couple of these in the day-pack could make a huge difference. When a person goes into shock, one of the most important things you can do is help them conserve body heat.That's exactly what these mylar "blankets" are for. Without being too dramatic, it could even mean the difference between life and death.We think everyone should have a pack of these. Put them in the car, take them when you go hiking or camping. They are small, super light weight -- and just could make a huge difference in a clutch situation.Recommended!

From the male side of the family: these are comfortable, easy to trim the toes to fit, and provide good support. My ankles tend to pronate (or turn) in, so I need good arch support in an orthotic or insole. Most "come-with" insoles provided by sneaker and other shoe-makers just don't do the job. In the past, I've had custom-made orthotics at a price of $75 and up per pair. In more recent times, I've found a variety of improved orthotic inserts available at shoe stores and online, for about $30/pair.So these Profoot Dura-Sole inserts at $9/pair, are a good deal. The main issues for me are; 1) arch support. These provide decent arch support, although in my particular case, it could have been a touch more aggressive. 2) cushioning for both the heel and ball of the foot. The dense gel pads (color orange/red) on these do the job. I've had these in a pair of walking shoes for weeks now, and they continue to provide foot support and shock-absorb each step.At this price, and with Prime free shipping for members...Recommended.

Argan oil is wonderful stuff -- so good, it's an edible product where it grows -- only in and around Morocco! Lusetta's brand smells wonderful -- almost good enough to eat. Both the shampoo and the conditioner work well, leaving your hair clean, shiny, and silky-smooth.In addition, and this is important with products like this -- the bottles and pump dispensers are well done -- salon quality. You could put these in a guest bathroom, or give as gifts, and feel good about it.We buy thousands of products online and frequently review health and beauty items. Sometimes we are offered discounted or free products for review, and this is one of those.We think you'll like it! Recommended!

This review comes from the male side of the family. This is a big, manly, handsome timepiece. As a collector of Invicta watches, I love it. With a face 50 mm in diameter (about 2 inches), this is the largest one I have (see photos below). However, like other Vine reviewers, I did not get the watch pictured (as you'll see from my photos). Mine did come in the black Invicta Signature (impressive) box, with a lens cleaning cloth. I won't tell you the uses of the various dials on the (also) analog display, as if you order the watch pictured, you will presumably get the gold diver's watch with the black rubber-like band (mine is silver and stainless steel).Another reviewer said their bezel did not turn. This would be silly on a diver's watch, especially one that says it's "pro." The purpose of the turning bezel is so you can keep accurate track of your underwater time on a dive. The bezel on the watch I received is stiff and you might not think at first try that it will mobr, but if you twist firmly in an anticlockwise direction, it does turn. While scuba diving (and I have more than 5,000 dives to my credit), just after you put your regulator (tank air) in your mouth and prepare to go under, you turn the bezel so the "0" or "60" mark lines up with the minute hand on the watch, wherever it happens to be pointing. This way, you don't have to remember "we went under at 12 minutes after...". A simple glance at the bezel will show you you've been down for, say, 15 minutes or whatever. As a sports diver, most dives you will ever do will be under an hour, so that's why this is an effective feature.All that said, even if you don't dive (and actually, I use a computer on my dives that tells me a lot more than elapsed time), the bezel can come in handy. For example, if you work out, hike, or ride a bike, this is a handy way to measure elapsed time.So, since you're ordering the model in the product photol and not the one I was sent, let me tell you about the Company and why I collect Invicta watches. "Invicta" is Latin for "Invincible." The Company was founded more than a century ago, in 1837 in Switzerland. Just about knocked out by the quartz watch revolution, Invicta reinvented itself about 15 years ago by embracing the technology. Since then, it has focused on creating several lines of these iconic oversize timepieces. I didn't realize that many women were wearing these chunky watches until I went to the Company's webside, invictawatches. What you'll find there will open your eyes! Not only do they make an incredible array of watches, but also, jewelry, sunglasses and even upscale pens.I was attracted to my first Invicta several years ago because of its rugged good looks. I own quite a few now and I've never been disappointed. The other thing I like is the pricing: although often listed at $400 to $800 and up, you can usually find them on various sites, marked down to something reasonable -- such as the one you're considering for under $100.I'm a fan.Recommended!

As frequent reviewers of home and kitchen products, we received a free or discounted sample for review. We put it through its paces -- cutting on this "board" with sharp knives. It is highly resistant to cut marks -- as good as other quality plastic boards, and better than most wood.Let's talk about the things that make this different from other boards: it's silicone, of course, food grade, which means it's 100% benign material that won't impart chemicals to your food. It is dishwasher safe, making cleanup easy. It is flexible, unlike most cutting boards. For storage, it can be hung by either end. The bright blue color we got adds a cheery note to our kitchen -- we enjoy bright colors. It is tough and durable and we expect it to last for many years.Recommended!

We live in a wilderness area and do most of our shopping online. We purchase thousands of products and we count on your reviews, so we write hundreds ourselves. As frequent reviewers of products for an active outdoor lifestyle, we sometimes get offered samples free or at a discount. This is one of those.First, the brand, iPOw: we have quite a few iPow products, including phone and Garmin holders for our vehicles and they do a great job. We also are avid mountain bikers, so accepted the opportunity to try this bike-mount cell phone holder. Like the car mounts, it goes together easily -- the ball joint pushes into the socket on the back and you tighten it down. The handlebar mount is easy to install -- takes a few seconds. The holder is on a spring, so your cell phone is held snugly in place. In addition, the phone comes with two stretchy rubber-like nets that go over the back and hook over each corner of the phone.Believe me, we put this through its paces. Our trails are gravel and rock, and rough, and we do a lot of bouncing. Having a phone worth hundreds of dollars come flying off in mid-ride would not be acceptable! This mount held our phone in place. By the way, it's up to you of course, but we don't take phone calls while we ride. Why go to the trouble of getting out in the wilderness, only to carry the world with you?? We use the phone for GPS view of the trails we ride and how far and fast we go -- and of course, it's there for emergencies as well.The only way to view GPS maps while riding is with a phone holder like this.Recommended!

Aging is not all it's cracked up to be! Joint pains and some sleep-interrupted nights are part of the price *sigh*. Two products that both members of the family already take are glucosamine (join repair) and melatonin (a sleep aid among other things). SO it's helpful and convenient to find both of these in the "Move Free" nighttime product. In addition, there's another supplement, chondroitin, that we haven't yet added to the arsenal. A quick bit of research shows that it is often recommended for osteoarthritis, and it is a substance found in the joints -- and therefore, presumably lacking as you get older.You get 80 pills for about 21 cents apiece, which seems reasonable.We've only been testing this product for a month, so cannot yet give you a definitive answer on its efficacy -- but so far, based on what you get in one smallish tablet which is easy to take...Recommended!Recommended

This is a beautifully made white dress shirt from Oxford New York. Close inspection shows that the seams are finely sewn, and straight. The material is 60% cotton, 40% polyester, which means it is both comfortable, absorbent, and holds its shape. It fits as per measurements, so that's good to know when ordering online. The collar is what is called "spread" to allow for a fairly large tie knot (or simply for the way it looks, which is why I like it).The price is right as well for a well-made men's dress shirt.Recommended!

This is a great edible product, derived from the seeds of the much-maligned hemp plant. If you want to read about a real conspiracy, search online about how the US came to ban this crop, which was grown around the world without issue for thousands of years. You'll remember that hemp makes great rope, for example, and would be an excellent replacement crop in the forest industry for fiber -- if only growing it wasn't still banned along with it's drug-potent cousin. However, hemp contains no drug and you could smoke a ton of it and only get a sore throat for your trouble. All of which explains why this hemp must be imported from Canada, which has a much more enlightened view of the crop.All that said, this is 100% organic edible hemp, milled from the seeds. It makes a great addition to your baking flour. We don't really like it on its own, except as a "dusting" flour for cooking fish and chicken. We've also used it successfully to thicken recipes, including soup and stews. Best to whisk it well in warm water, then add it to your pot with the other ingredients, stirring as you go.To bake, we usually mix it about 50-50 with either non-gluten flour, or low-gluten varieties such as "spelt" (from a particular kind of ancient wheat). It makes really tasty cookies this way."Organic" is the final important touch -- who wants to eat chemicals??Recommended.

Well, really, what are you going to say about dishcloths? They either do the job, bear up after several go-rounds through the washing machine -- or they don't. That said (this from the female side of the family), I really like dishcloths and have a hard time passing by a sale of nice-looking ones. Don't hold that against me! These are 100% cotton and really attractive. I like the wine color, either in contrast to the white stripes, or vice versa. I got these to go with DII Kitchen Millennium Cleaning, Washing, Drying, Ultra Absorbent, Microfiber Dish Towel, Set of 6, Eggplant, and although the eggplant is not exactly the same color as "wine," they make an attractive combo in my kitchen. Very pleased!Recommended.

Gorgeous color -- rich and attractive (we got the eggplant set). These dishcloths do wipe streak-free and absorb a lot of moisture before they need to be allowed to dry. They clean up nicely in the washer as well, and do not retain bad odors, as some dishtowels do. They are microfiber -- which is mostly polyester -- the only place we like that particular material! We got these with DII's DII Everyday Kitchen Basic Windowpane Combo Dish Cloth Set of 6, Wine, which are not exactly the same color, but make a good looking combo. The dish cloths are 100% cotton, by the way.Recommended!

Wow! I'm not exactly a bike mechanic, but I figured it wouldn't be too hard to replace my old brake pads. I needed an allen wrench for the bolts -- found the right one by trial and error. I watched the configuration of washers and spacers on the old ones as I took them off, then more or less copied that as I replaced those old, hard, squeaking pads, with these new ones.These are asymmetrical, unlike the old ones that came off. There were no instructions that said so, but I figured the shorter end should go towards the back -- that is, towards the metal rim of the tire that would be turning their way during a ride. If you think about it, you'll figure it out. Then the longer "tail" would provide extra drag on the rim to help make you stop. At least, that's the way I did it, and it's working well. That horrible squealing and lack of ability to stop my mountain bike? A thing of the past! The price of these, and the fact I did the work myself, saved me a bundle.Recommended!

This is a great price for pure DMSO. Sure, they say it's for pets -- but then, DMSO is still somewhat controversial. Since it is 99% pure, we use this for topical application. It helps relieve arthritic pain in the hands, that's for sure. In addition, mixed 50-50 with iodide (and in other cases, iodine), it is an extremely effective antibiotic for cuts and scrapes -- and skin eruptions. It'll kill a pimple pretty much overnight! By the way, when you put it on the skin, it may itch for 5-10 minutes, especially around the neck etc. This is normal. Don't get in in your eyes! And when you mix it with iodide or iodine, the bottle will warm up -- also normal. I now count on both these reactions to tell me the stuff is working.Another issue: some people taste a peculiar kind of "chemically" taste in the back of the throat when they first apply DMSO. Also normal. If this is so in your case, consider applying it just before you go to bed, and by morning, it will be long gone.DMSO has long be used to ease joint pain in horses. It is a product of the forest industry, derived from lignum. As a further refined product -- MSM -- it's the hot new powder that is taken internally, mixed in water, to ease joint pain, said to aid the health of the internal organs, improve the quality of skin -- and it certainly makes your hair and nails grow faster and stronger.This is a great price for pure DMSO.Recommended!

I was attaching heavy poly fencing to T-posts. In the past, I've tried cable ties, but after a year or two, they became brittle in the arid, hot Arizona sun, and just fell apart. So this time, I went for something better. These MightyTies are just that -- thick and strong. I used about a hundred of them to fasten the fencing in place, and have had them there for many months now. I just inspected them a couple of days ago, and they are in great shape -- still doing the job, with no signs of "plastic fatigue."I don't want to have to do all that work again, so I'm counting on these MightyTies!Recommended.

I have very rugged mountain trails I ride -- lots of gravel, sharp rocks and cactus with long thorns. I've had many a flat, both on my bike, and on various equipment I run here. So when I was changing my mountain bike tires (for wide Kendra aggressive tread tires, also available on Amazon), I wanted something other than standard tubes. (I put slime in my old tubes, but they were only standard thickness).These thorn resistant "5 times thicker" Slime tubes did the trick! Sure they cost a few dollars, but the peace of mind on a long mountain ride, and the way they've already protected me in some iffy situations, is well worth it.Recommended!

I got a great price from Amazon "open box" warehouse deals on this heavy duty two-leg bicycle stand. I put it on my heavy Currie electic-assist mountain bike. There was only a single leg kickstand on it before, and it was impossible to do any work on the bike with that. Plus, because it made the bike list over to the side, it took up a lot of extra storage room.I read a lot of other reviews before I bought this. The biggest complaint was that the stand, when "up" for riding, is on an angle and still points down at an angle -- too close to the ground for many riders. Another reviewer said he cut the stops that determine where the stand folds to -- so I'm a DIYer and was ready to do this. I determined that the stand was going to ride too low, especially for a mountain bike, where catching on a rock or root might send me head-over-keister. So I put a little cutting wheel on my Dremel and cut slots in the bent metal stops, 1/8 of an inch from the end. Then I took a heavy vice-grip pliers and broke these tabs off. That was all the customization I needed to do.I was able to remove the kickstand and then mounted this two-legger in exactly the same spot -- being careful to check before finally tightening down, that the legs did NOT touch the back wheel!That was it. I now have a heavy duty two-legged stand on my mountain bike, and have been grateful for it several times -- not the least of which was when I had to stop on the trail and adjust the new brake pads I'd installed.This is a generic one-size-fits-all stand, so you may have to do a few adjustments to get it to work on your bike. If you're not handy with tools, you may need to get a friend who is -- or take it to a bike shop for final installation.Did a great job for me. Recommended!

This is a great price for a mountain bike tire! I got this one for the front tire on my Currie electric-assist mountain bike. I wanted a wide tire that would grip in gravel, and support 200 lbs of rider. This does a fine job! I paired this with the Kenda K816 Aggressive MTB Wire Bead Bicycle Tire, Blackskin, 26-Inch x 2.10-Inch on the rear -- also via Prime so shipping was free. And to make it all work, I got two extra thick Slime tubes Slime 26" SV Thorn Resistant Thick Smart tube  26 x 1.75-2.125 (Schrader Valve).I was a little concerned at first because the Kenda tires were heavy duty on the tread portion, but the sidewalls seemed thin. However, I counted on the thick tubes to help out with this. Since mounting both tires, I've put the bike through the real test -- gravel and cactus-covered trails in the AZ mountains. They give me grip, both uphill, downhill with both brakes applied in a 2-wheel skid -- and side-to-side.By the way, when mounting these yourself, a trick taught me by a repair-guy at my local bike shop might help. Get your old tires off, of course. Put just a little air in the new tube(s) -- and on slime tubes, turn so the stem is at the top, so you don't get any goop leaking out. The air will give the tube some shape. Put some dish-soap in warm water in an old bowl. Dip the tube in, bit by bit, until it's all wet. This will let it slide inside the tire if you need to do any adjusting. Put the tube inside the tire. Now take the slippery soapy water in hand and wet the tire on both outer sides where it will met the metal rim. Now start to lever the tire onto the rim -- starting with the tube stem placed through the hole in the metal. Get the whole inner bead on the far side (away from you) seated inside the wheel. If you need to, push and pull a little to make sure the stem is still lined up -- you don't want it bent in any way. I managed to do the next bit all by hand, but if you need help, you can use a big blunt flathead screwdriver to help you pry. Just don't pinch the tube! Lever the tire onto the wheel rim. Once in place, inflate the tire. Now you're ready to mount it on the bike.Buying this tire (and the other, plus tubes) and doing the work myself, saved me somewhere between $50 and $100.Recommended!

This is a great price for a mountain bike tire! I got this one for the rear tire on my Currie electric-assist mountain bike. I wanted a wide tire that would grip in gravel, and support 200 lbs of rider. This does a fine job! I paired this with the Kenda K850 Aggressive MTB Wire Bead Bicycle Tire, Blackskin, 26-Inch x 1.95-Inch on the front -- also via Prime so shipping was free. And to make it all work, I got two extra thick Slime tubes Slime 26" SV Thorn Resistant Thick Smart tube  26 x 1.75-2.125 (Schrader Valve).I was a little concerned at first because the Kenda tires were heavy duty on the tread portion, but the sidewalls seemed thin. However, I counted on the thick tubes to help out with this. Since mounting both tires, I've put the bike through the real test -- gravel and cactus-covered trails in the AZ mountains.
